PART I [I]0-i IT rose for [them]322-their -- [their]322-their honey - moon -- over [the waters of [a lake]324-a lake]323-the waters of a lake so famed as [the scene of romantic raptures]325-the scene of romantic raptures that [they]322-their were rather proud of not having been afraid to choose [it]324-a lake as the setting of [their]322-their own . “ It required a total lack of humour , or as great a gift for it as [ours]322-their , to risk the experiment , ”[159-susy] [Susy Lansing]159-susy opined , as [they]322-their hung over the inevitable marble balustrade and watched [their]322-their tutelary orb roll its magic carpet across [the waters]326-the waters to [their]322-their feet . “ Yes -- or the loan of [[Strefford]267-strefford ’s villa]2176-strefford ’s villa , ”[327-her husband] [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband emended , glancing upward through the branches at a long low patch of paleness to which the moonlight was beginning to give the form of [a white house - front]328-a white house - front . “ Oh , come when [we]322-their ’d five to choose from . At least if [you]327-her husband count the [Chicago]1-chicago flat . ”[327-her husband] “ So [we]322-their had -- [you]327-her husband wonder ! ”[327-her husband] [He]327-her husband laid [his]327-her husband hand on [hers]159-susy , and [his]327-her husband touch renewed the sense of marvelling exultation which the deliberate survey of [their]322-their adventure always roused in [her]159-susy .... It was characteristic that [she]159-susy merely added , in [her]159-susy steady laughing tone : “ Or , not counting the flat -- for [I]159-susy hate to brag -- just consider the others : [[Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose ’s place at [Versailles]2-versailles]2177-violet melrose ’s place at versailles , [[[your]327-her husband aunt]2178-your aunt ’s villa at [Monte Carlo]3-monte carlo]2179-your aunt ’s villa at monte carlo -- and [a moor]2180-a moor ! ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy was conscious of throwing in the moor tentatively , and yet with a somewhat exaggerated emphasis , as if to make sure that [he]327-her husband should n’t accuse [her]159-susy of slurring it over . But [he]327-her husband seemed to have no desire to do so . “ [Poor old Fred]162-the gillows ! ”[327-her husband] [he]327-her husband merely remarked ; and [she]159-susy breathed out carelessly : “ Oh , well-- ”[159-susy] [His]327-her husband hand still lay on [hers]159-susy , and for a long interval , while [they]329-we stood silent in the enveloping loveliness of the night , [she]159-susy was aware only of the warm current running from palm to palm , as the moonlight below [them]329-we drew its line of magic from [shore]330-shore to [shore]330-shore . [Nick Lansing]163-lansing spoke at last . “ [Versailles]2-versailles in May would have been impossible : all [[our]329-we [Paris]4-paris crowd]2181-our paris crowd would have run [us]329-we down within twenty - four hours . And [Monte Carlo]3-monte carlo is ruled out because it ’s exactly [the kind of place [everybody]2183-everybody expected [us]329-we to go]2182-the kind of place everybody expected us to go . So -- with all respect to [you]332-his wife -- it was n’t much of a mental strain to decide on [Como]5-como . ”[163-lansing] [[His]327-her husband wife]332-his wife instantly challenged this belittling of [her]332-his wife capacity . “ It took a good deal of argument to convince [you]327-her husband that [we]329-we could face the ridicule of [Como]5-como ! ”[332-his wife] “ Well , [I]332-his wife should have preferred something in a lower key ; at least [I]332-his wife thought [I]332-his wife should till [we]329-we got [here]2184-here . Now [I]332-his wife see that [this place]2185-this place is idiotic unless [one]2186-one is perfectly happy ; and that then it’s -- as good as any other . ”[332-his wife] [She]332-his wife sighed out a blissful assent . “ And [I]332-his wife must say that [Streffy]164-streffy has done things to a turn . Even the cigars -- who do [you]327-her husband suppose gave [him]164-streffy those cigars ? ”[332-his wife] [She]332-his wife added thoughtfully : “ [You]327-her husband ’ll miss them when [we]329-we have to go . ”[332-his wife] “ Oh , [I]332-his wife say , do n’t let ’s talk to - night about going . Are n’t [we]329-we outside of time and space ... ? Smell that guinea - a - bottle stuff over there : what is it ? [Stephanotis]165-stephanotis ? ”[332-his wife] “ Y -- yes .... [I]333-they suppose so . Or gardenias .... Oh , the fire - flies ! Look ... there , against that splash of moonlight on the water . Apples of silver in a net - work of gold .... ”[333-they] [They]333-they leaned together , one flesh from shoulder to finger - tips , [their]333-they eyes held by the snared glitter of the ripples . “ [I]163-lansing could bear , ”[163-lansing] [Lansing]163-lansing remarked , “ even [a nightingale]2187-a nightingale at this moment .... ”[163-lansing] A faint gurgle shook the magnolias behind [them]333-they , and a long liquid whisper answered it from the thicket of laurel above [their]333-they heads . “ It ’s a little late in the year for [them]333-they : [they]333-they ’re ending just as [we]329-we begin . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy laughed . “ [I]159-susy hope when [our]329-we turn comes [we]329-we shall say good - bye to [each other]2188-each other as sweetly . ”[159-susy] It was in [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s mind to answer : “ [They]333-they ’re not saying good - bye , but only settling down to [family]2189-family cares . ”[159-susy] But as this did not happen to be in [his]327-her husband plan , or in [Susy]159-susy ’s , [he]327-her husband merely echoed [her]159-susy laugh and pressed [her]159-susy closer . The spring night drew [them]333-they into its deepening embrace . The ripples of [the lake]335-the lake had gradually widened and faded into a silken smoothness , and high above [the mountains]336-the mountains the moon was turning from gold to white in a sky powdered with vanishing stars . Across [the lake]335-the lake the lights of [a little town]338-a little town went out , one after another , and [the distant shore]339-the distant shore became a floating blackness . A breeze that rose and sank brushed [their]333-they faces with the scents of [the garden]340-the garden ; once it blew out over the water a great white moth like a drifting magnolia petal . [The nightingales]341-the nightingales had paused and the trickle of the fountain behind [the house]342-the house grew suddenly insistent . When [Susy]159-susy spoke it was in a voice languid with visions . “ [I]159-susy have been thinking , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy said , “ that [we]333-they ought to be able to make it last at least a year longer . ”[159-susy] [[Her]159-susy husband]327-her husband received the remark without any sign of surprise or disapprobation ; [his]327-her husband answer showed that [he]327-her husband not only understood [her]159-susy , but had been inwardly following the same train of thought . “ [You]159-susy mean , ”[327-her husband] [he]327-her husband enquired after a pause , “ without counting [[your]159-susy grandmother]2190-your grandmother ’s pearls ? ”[327-her husband] “ Yes -- without the pearls . ”[327-her husband] [He]327-her husband pondered a while , and then rejoined in a tender whisper : “ Tell [me]327-her husband again just how . ”[327-her husband] “ Let [’s]2191-’s sit down , then . No , [I]327-her husband like the cushions best . ”[327-her husband] [He]327-her husband stretched [himself]327-her husband in a long willow chair , and [she]159-susy curled up on a heap of boat - cushions and leaned [her]159-susy head against [his]327-her husband knee . Just above [her]159-susy , when [she]159-susy lifted [her]159-susy lids , [she]159-susy saw bits of moon - flooded sky incrusted like silver in a sharp black patterning of plane - boughs . All about [them]344-them breathed of peace and beauty and stability , and [her]159-susy happiness was so acute that it was almost a relief to remember the stormy background of bills and borrowing against which [its]345-its frail structure had been reared . “ People with a balance ca n’t be as happy as all this , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy mused , letting the moonlight filter through [her]159-susy lazy lashes . [People with a balance]346-people with a balance had always been [[Susy Branch]159-susy ’s bugbear]347-susy branch ’s bugbear ; [they]346-people with a balance were still , and more dangerously , to be [Susy Lansing]159-susy ’s . [She]159-susy detested [them]346-people with a balance , detested [them]346-people with a balance doubly , as [the natural enemies of mankind]348-the natural enemies of mankind and as [the people one always had to put [one]2186-one ’s self]349-the people one always had to put one ’s self out for . The greater part of [her]159-susy life having been passed among [them]346-people with a balance , [she]159-susy knew nearly all that there was to know about [them]346-people with a balance , and judged [them]346-people with a balance with the contemptuous lucidity of nearly twenty years of dependence . But at the present moment [her]159-susy animosity was diminished not only by the softening effect of love but by the fact that [she]159-susy had got out of [those very people]351-those very people more -- yes , ever so much more -- than [she]159-susy and [Nick]163-lansing , in [their]352-their hours of most reckless planning , had ever dared to hope for . “ After all , [we]352-their owe [them]351-those very people this ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy mused . [[Her]159-susy husband]327-her husband , lost in the drowsy beatitude of the hour , had not repeated [his]327-her husband question ; but [she]159-susy was still on the trail of the thought [he]327-her husband had started . A year -- yes , [she]159-susy was sure now that with a little management [they]352-their could have a whole year of it ! “ It ”[159-susy] was [their]352-their marriage , [their]352-their being together , and away from bores and bothers , in a comradeship of which both of [them]352-their had long ago guessed the immediate pleasure , but [she]159-susy at least had never imagined the deeper harmony . It was at one of [their]352-their earliest meetings -- at one of the heterogeneous dinners that [the Fred Gillows]162-the gillows tried to think “ literary”--that[162-the gillows] [the young man who chanced to sit next to [her]159-susy , and of whom it was vaguely rumoured that [he]162-the gillows had “ written , ”]2192-the young man who chanced to sit next to her , and of whom it was vaguely rumoured that he had “ written , ”[162-the gillows] had presented [himself]162-the gillows to [her]159-susy imagination as the sort of luxury to which [Susy Branch]159-susy , [heiress]354-heiress , might conceivably have treated [herself]159-susy as a crowning folly . [Susy Branch]159-susy , [pauper]355-pauper , was fond of picturing how [this fancied double]356-this fancied double would employ [her]159-susy millions : it was one of [her]159-susy chief grievances against [[her]159-susy rich friends]357-her rich friends that [they]357-her rich friends disposed of [theirs]357-her rich friends so unimaginatively . “ [I]159-susy ’d rather have [a husband like that]2193-a husband like that than [a steam - yacht]2194-a steam - yacht ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy had thought at the end of [her]159-susy talk with [the young man who had written , and as to whom it had at once been clear]358-the young man who had written , and as to whom it had at once been clear to [her]159-susy that nothing [his]356-this fancied double pen had produced , or might hereafter set down , would put [him]356-this fancied double in a position to offer [[his]356-this fancied double wife]332-his wife anything more costly than [a row - boat]360-a row - boat . “ [[His]356-this fancied double wife]332-his wife ! As if [he]356-this fancied double could ever have [one]2186-one ! For [he]356-this fancied double ’s not the kind to marry for [a yacht]2197-a yacht either . ”[159-susy] In spite of [her]159-susy past , [Susy]159-susy had preserved enough inner independence to detect the latent signs of it in others , and also to ascribe it impulsively to [those of the opposite sex]361-those of the opposite sex who happened to interest [her]159-susy . [She]159-susy had a natural contempt for [people who gloried in what [they]362-people who gloried in what they need only have endured need only have endured]362-people who gloried in what they need only have endured . [She]159-susy [herself]159-susy meant eventually to marry , because [one]2186-one could n’t forever hang on to [rich people]364-rich people ; but [she]159-susy was going to wait till [she]159-susy found [some one who combined the maximum of wealth with at least a minimum of companionableness]365-some one who combined the maximum of wealth with at least a minimum of companionableness . [She]159-susy had at once perceived young [Lansing]163-lansing ’s case to be exactly the opposite : [he]163-lansing was as poor as [he]163-lansing could be , and as companionable as it was possible to imagine . [She]159-susy therefore decided to see as much of [him]163-lansing as [her]159-susy hurried and entangled life permitted ; and this , thanks to a series of adroit adjustments , turned out to be a good deal . [They]366-they met frequently all the rest of that winter ; so frequently that [Mrs. Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow one day abruptly and sharply gave [Susy]159-susy to understand that [she]159-susy was “ making [herself]159-susy ridiculous . ”[167-fred gillow] “ Ah-- ”[159-susy] said [Susy]159-susy with a long breath , looking [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend and patroness straight in the painted eyes . “ Yes , ”[168-ursula] cried [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula in a sob , “ before [you]159-susy interfered [Nick]163-lansing liked [me]168-ursula awfully ... and , of course , [I]168-ursula do n’t want to reproach [you]159-susy ... but when [I]168-ursula think .... ”[168-ursula] [Susy]159-susy made no answer . How could [she]159-susy , when [she]159-susy thought ? The dress [she]159-susy had on had been given [her]159-susy by [Ursula]168-ursula ; [Ursula]168-ursula ’s motor had carried [her]159-susy to the feast from which [they]368-they were both returning . [She]159-susy counted on spending the following August with [the Gillows]162-the gillows at [Newport]6-newport ... and the only alternative was to go to [California]7-california with [the Bockheimers]169-the bockheimers , whom [she]159-susy had hitherto refused even to dine with . “ Of course , what [you]168-ursula fancy is perfect nonsense , [Ursula]168-ursula ; and as to [my]159-susy interfering-- ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy hesitated , and then murmured : “ But if it will make [you]168-ursula any happier [I]159-susy ’ll arrange to see [him]170-nick less often .... ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy sounded the lowest depths of subservience in returning [Ursula]168-ursula ’s tearful kiss .... [Susy Branch]159-susy had a masculine respect for [her]159-susy word ; and the next day [she]159-susy put on [her]159-susy most becoming hat and sought out [young Mr. Lansing]170-nick in [[his]170-nick lodgings]369-his lodgings . [She]159-susy was determined to keep [her]159-susy promise to [Ursula]168-ursula ; but [she]159-susy meant to look [her]159-susy best when [she]159-susy did it . [She]159-susy knew at what time [the young man]370-the young man was likely to be found , for [he]370-the young man was doing a dreary job on a popular encyclopaedia ( V to X ) , and had told [her]159-susy what hours were dedicated to the hateful task . “ Oh , if only it were a novel ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought as [she]159-susy mounted [his]370-the young man dingy stairs ; but immediately reflected that , if it were the kind that [she]159-susy could bear to read , it probably would n’t bring [him]370-the young man in much more than [his]370-the young man encyclopaedia . [Miss Branch]171-miss branch had [her]171-miss branch standards in literature .... [The apartment to which [Mr. Lansing]170-nick admitted [her]159-susy]371-the apartment to which mr. lansing admitted her was a good deal cleaner , but hardly less dingy , than [[his]370-the young man staircase]372-his staircase . [Susy]159-susy , knowing [him]370-the young man to be addicted to Oriental archaeology , had pictured [him]370-the young man in [a bare room]373-a bare room adorned by a single Chinese bronze of flawless shape , or by some precious fragment of Asiatic pottery . But such redeeming features were conspicuously absent , and no attempt had been made to disguise the decent indigence of the bed - sitting - room . [Lansing]170-nick welcomed [[his]170-nick visitor]374-his visitor with every sign of pleasure , and with apparent indifference as to what [she]159-susy thought of [his]370-the young man furniture . [He]170-nick seemed to be conscious only of [his]170-nick luck in seeing [her]159-susy on a day when [they]375-they had not expected to meet . This made [Susy]159-susy all the sorrier to execute [her]159-susy promise , and the gladder that [she]159-susy had put on [her]159-susy prettiest hat ; and for a moment or two [she]159-susy looked at [him]170-nick in silence from under its conniving brim . Warm as [their]375-they mutual liking was , [Lansing]170-nick had never said a word of love to [her]159-susy ; but this was no deterrent to [[his]170-nick visitor]374-his visitor , whose habit it was to speak [her]159-susy meaning clearly when there were no reasons , worldly or pecuniary , for its concealment . After a moment , therefore , [she]159-susy told [him]170-nick why [she]159-susy had come ; it was a nuisance , of course , but [he]170-nick would understand . [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula was jealous , and [they]375-they would have to give up seeing [each other]2188-each other . [The young man]370-the young man ’s burst of laughter was music to [her]159-susy ; for , after all , [she]159-susy had been rather afraid that being devoted to [Ursula]168-ursula might be as much in [his]170-nick day ’s work as doing the encyclopaedia . “ But [I]170-nick give [you]159-susy [my]170-nick word it ’s a raving - mad mistake ! And [I]170-nick do n’t believe [she]168-ursula ever meant [me]170-nick , to begin with-- ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick protested ; but [Susy]159-susy , [her]159-susy common - sense returning with [her]159-susy reassurance , promptly cut short [his]170-nick denial . “ [You]170-nick can trust [Ursula]168-ursula to make [herself]168-ursula clear on such occasions . And it does n’t make any difference what [you]170-nick think . All that matters is what [she]168-ursula believes . ”[159-susy] “ Oh , come ! [I]159-susy ’ve got a word to say about that too , have n’t [I]159-susy ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy looked slowly and consideringly about [the room]379-the room . There was nothing in it , absolutely nothing , to show that [he]170-nick had ever possessed a spare dollar -- or accepted a present . “ Not as far as [I]159-susy ’m concerned , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy finally pronounced . “ How do [you]170-nick mean ? If [I]159-susy ’m as free as [air--]172-air-- ? ”[159-susy] “ [I]170-nick ’m not . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick grew thoughtful . “ Oh , then , of course-- . It only seems a little odd , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick added drily , “ that in that case , the protest should have come from [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow . ”[170-nick] “ Instead of coming from [[my]159-susy millionaire bridegroom]2198-my millionaire bridegroom , Oh , [I]159-susy have n’t any ; in that respect [I]159-susy ’m as free as [you]170-nick . ”[159-susy] “ Well , then-- ? Have n’t [we]2199-we only got to stay free ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy drew [her]159-susy brows together anxiously . It was going to be rather more difficult than [she]159-susy had supposed . “ [I]159-susy said [I]159-susy was as free in that respect . [I]159-susy ’m not going to marry -- and [I]159-susy do n’t suppose [you]170-nick are ? ”[159-susy] “ God , no ! ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick ejaculated fervently . “ But that does n’t always imply complete freedom .... ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick stood just above [her]159-susy , leaning [his]170-nick elbow against the hideous black marble arch that framed [his]170-nick fireless grate . As [she]159-susy glanced up [she]159-susy saw [his]170-nick face harden , and the colour flew to [hers]159-susy . “ Was that what [you]159-susy came to tell [me]170-nick ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick asked . “ Oh , [you]159-susy do n’t understand -- and [I]170-nick do n’t see why [you]170-nick do n’t , since [we]2200-we ’ve knocked about so long among exactly the same kind of people . ”[170-nick] [She]159-susy stood up impulsively and laid [her]159-susy hand on [his]170-nick arm . “ [I]170-nick do wish [you]170-nick ’d help [me--]170-nick ! ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick remained motionless , letting the hand lie untouched . “ Help [you]170-nick to tell [me]159-susy that poor [Ursula]168-ursula was a pretext , but that there IS someone who -- for one reason or another -- really has a right to object to [your]170-nick seeing [me]159-susy too often ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy laughed impatiently . “ [You]170-nick talk like [the hero of a novel]2201-the hero of a novel -- the kind [[my]159-susy governess]2202-my governess used to read . In the first place [I]159-susy should never recognize that kind of right , as [you]170-nick call it -- never ! ”[159-susy] “ Then what kind do [you]159-susy ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick asked with a clearing brow . “ Why -- the kind [I]170-nick suppose [you]170-nick recognize on the part of [[your]170-nick publisher]2203-your publisher . ”[170-nick] This evoked a hollow laugh from [him]170-nick . “ A business claim , call it , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy pursued . “ [Ursula]168-ursula does a lot for [me]159-susy : [I]159-susy live on [her]168-ursula for half the year . This dress [I]159-susy ’ve got on now is one [she]168-ursula gave [me]159-susy . [Her]168-ursula motor is going to take [me]159-susy to a dinner to - night . [I]159-susy ’m going to spend next summer with [her]168-ursula at [[Newport]6-newport ....]2204-newport .... If [I]159-susy do n’t , [I]159-susy ’ve got to go to [California]7-california with [the Bockheimers]169-the bockheimers -- so good - bye . ”[159-susy] Suddenly in tears , [she]159-susy was out of the door and down [his]170-nick steep three flights before [he]170-nick could stop [her]159-susy -- though , in thinking it over , [she]159-susy did n’t even remember if [he]170-nick had tried to . [She]159-susy only recalled having stood a long time on [the corner of [Fifth Avenue]8-fifth avenue]380-the corner of fifth avenue , in the harsh winter radiance , waiting till a break in the torrent of motors laden with [fashionable women]381-fashionable women should let [her]159-susy cross , and saying to [herself]159-susy : “ After all , [I]159-susy might have promised [Ursula]168-ursula ... and kept on seeing [him]170-nick .... ”[159-susy] Instead of which , when [Lansing]170-nick wrote the next day entreating a word with [her]159-susy , [she]159-susy had sent back a friendly but firm refusal ; and had managed soon afterward to get taken to [Canada]9-canada for a fortnight ’s ski - ing , and then to [Florida]10-florida for six weeks in [a house - boat]382-a house - boat .... As [she]159-susy reached this point in [her]159-susy retrospect the remembrance of [Florida]10-florida called up a vision of [moonlit waters]383-moonlit waters , magnolia fragrance and balmy airs ; merging with the circumambient sweetness , it laid a drowsy spell upon [her]159-susy lids . Yes , there had been a bad moment : but it was over ; and [she]159-susy was [here]2184-here , safe and blissful , and with [Nick]170-nick ; and this was [his]170-nick knee [her]159-susy head rested on , and [they]385-they had a year ahead of [them]385-they ... a whole year .... “ Not counting the pearls , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy murmured , shutting [her]159-susy eyes .... II . [LANSING]170-nick threw the end of [Strefford]267-strefford ’s expensive cigar into [the lake]335-the lake , and bent over [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife . [Poor child]388-poor child ! [She]332-his wife had fallen asleep .... [He]170-nick leaned back and stared up again at the silver - flooded sky . How queer -- how inexpressibly queer -- it was to think that that light was shed by [his]170-nick honey - moon ! A year ago , if [anyone]389-anyone had predicted [his]170-nick risking such an adventure , [he]170-nick would have replied by asking to be locked up at the first symptoms .... There was still no doubt in [his]170-nick mind that the adventure was a mad one . It was all very well for [Susy]159-susy to remind [him]170-nick twenty times a day that [they]385-they had pulled it off -- and so why should [he]170-nick worry ? Even in the light of [her]159-susy far - seeing cleverness , and of [his]170-nick own present bliss , [he]170-nick knew the future would not bear the examination of sober thought . And as [he]170-nick sat there in the summer moonlight , with [her]159-susy head on [his]170-nick knee , [he]170-nick tried to recapitulate the successive steps that had landed [them]385-they on [Streffy]164-streffy ’s lake - front . On [Lansing]170-nick ’s side , no doubt , it dated back to [his]170-nick leaving [Harvard]173-harvard with the large resolve not to miss anything . There stood the evergreen Tree of Life , [the Four Rivers]11-the four rivers flowing from its foot ; and on every one of the four currents [he]170-nick meant to launch [his]170-nick little skiff . On two of them [he]170-nick had not gone very far , on the third [he]170-nick had nearly stuck in the mud ; but the fourth had carried [him]170-nick to the very heart of wonder . It was the stream of [his]170-nick lively imagination , of [his]170-nick inexhaustible interest in every form of beauty and strangeness and folly . On [this stream]390-this stream , sitting in the stout little craft of [his]170-nick poverty , [his]170-nick insignificance and [his]170-nick independence , [he]170-nick had made some notable voyages .... And so , when [Susy Branch]159-susy , whom [he]170-nick had sought out through a [New York]12-new york season as [the prettiest and most amusing girl in sight]391-the prettiest and most amusing girl in sight , had surprised [him]170-nick with the contradictory revelation of [her]159-susy modern sense of expediency and [her]159-susy old - fashioned standard of good faith , [he]170-nick had felt an irresistible desire to put off on one more cruise into the unknown . It was of the essence of the adventure that , after [her]159-susy one brief visit to [[his]170-nick lodgings]369-his lodgings , [he]170-nick should have kept [his]170-nick promise and not tried to see [her]159-susy again . Even if [her]159-susy straightforwardness had not roused [his]170-nick emulation , [his]170-nick understanding of [her]159-susy difficulties would have moved [his]170-nick pity . [He]170-nick knew on how frail a thread the popularity of the penniless hangs , and how miserably [a girl like [Susy]159-susy]393-a girl like susy was the sport of [other people]394-other people ’s moods and whims . It was a part of [his]170-nick difficulty and of [hers]159-susy that to get what [they]395-they liked [they]395-they so often had to do what [they]395-they disliked . But the keeping of [his]170-nick promise was a greater bore than [he]170-nick had expected . [Susy Branch]159-susy had become a delightful habit in a life where most of the fixed things were dull , and [her]159-susy disappearance had made it suddenly clear to [him]170-nick that [his]170-nick resources were growing more and more limited . Much that had once amused [him]170-nick hugely now amused [him]170-nick less , or not at all : a good part of [his]170-nick world of wonder had shrunk to a village peep - show . And the things which had kept [their]395-they stimulating power -- distant journeys , the enjoyment of art , the contact with new scenes and strange societies -- were becoming less and less attainable . [Lansing]170-nick had never had more than a pittance ; [he]170-nick had spent rather too much of it in [his]170-nick first plunge into life , and the best [he]170-nick could look forward to was a middle - age of poorly - paid hack - work , mitigated by brief and frugal holidays . [He]170-nick knew that [he]170-nick was more intelligent than the average , but [he]170-nick had long since concluded that [his]170-nick talents were not marketable . Of the thin volume of sonnets which [a friendly publisher]396-a friendly publisher had launched for [him]170-nick , just seventy copies had been sold ; and though [his]170-nick essay on “ Chinese Influences in Greek Art ”[170-nick] had created a passing stir , it had resulted in controversial correspondence and dinner invitations rather than in more substantial benefits . There seemed , in short , no prospect of [his]170-nick ever earning money , and [his]170-nick restricted future made [him]170-nick attach an increasing value to the kind of friendship that [Susy Branch]159-susy had given [him]170-nick . Apart from the pleasure of looking at [her]159-susy and listening to [her]159-susy -- of enjoying in [her]159-susy what [others]397-others less discriminatingly but as liberally appreciated -- [he]170-nick had the sense , between [himself]170-nick and [her]159-susy , of a kind of free - masonry of precocious tolerance and irony . [They]398-they had both , in early youth , taken the measure of the world [they]398-they happened to live in : [they]398-they knew just what it was worth to [them]398-they and for what reasons , and [the community of these reasons]399-the community of these reasons lent to [their]398-they intimacy its last exquisite touch . And now , because of some jealous whim of [a dissatisfied fool of a woman]400-a dissatisfied fool of a woman , as to whom [he]170-nick felt [himself]170-nick no more to blame than [any young man who has paid for good dinners by good manners]401-any young man who has paid for good dinners by good manners , [he]170-nick was to be deprived of the one complete companionship [he]170-nick had ever known .... [His]170-nick thoughts travelled on . [He]170-nick recalled the long dull spring in [New York]12-new york after [his]170-nick break with [Susy]159-susy , the weary grind on [his]170-nick last articles , [his]170-nick listless speculations as to the cheapest and least boring way of disposing of the summer ; and then the amazing luck of going , reluctantly and at the last minute , to spend a Sunday with [the poor [Nat Fulmers]174-nat , in [the wilds of [New Hampshire]13-new hampshire]403-the wilds of new hampshire]402-the poor nat fulmers , in the wilds of new hampshire , and of finding [Susy]159-susy there -- [Susy]159-susy , whom [he]170-nick had never even suspected of knowing [anybody]404-anybody in [the Fulmers]174-nat ’ set ! [She]159-susy had behaved perfectly -- and so had [he]170-nick -- but [they]405-their were obviously much too glad to see [each other]2188-each other . And then it was unsettling to be with [her]159-susy in [such a house as [the Fulmers]174-nat ’]407-such a house as the fulmers ’ , away from [the large setting of luxury [they]405-their were both used to]408-the large setting of luxury they were both used to , in [the cramped cottage where [[their]405-their host]410-their host had [[his]410-their host studio in [the verandah]412-the verandah]411-his studio in the verandah]409-the cramped cottage where their host had his studio in the verandah , [[their]405-their hostess]413-their hostess practiced [her]413-their hostess violin in [the dining - room]414-the dining - room , and [five ubiquitous children]415-five ubiquitous children sprawled and shouted and blew trumpets and put tadpoles in the water - jugs , and the mid - day dinner was two hours late -- and proportionately bad -- because [the Italian cook]416-the italian cook was posing for [Fulmer]175-grace . [Lansing]170-nick ’s first thought had been that meeting [Susy]159-susy in such circumstances would be the quickest way to cure [them]405-their both of [their]405-their regrets . The case of [the Fulmers]174-nat was an awful object - lesson in what happened to [[young people]417-young people who lost [their]417-young people heads]418-young people who lost their heads ; [poor [Nat]176-nat , whose pictures [nobody bought]419-nobody bought , had gone to seed so terribly -- and [Grace]176-nat , at twenty - nine]176-nat , would never again be anything but [the woman of whom [people]421-people]420-the woman of whom people say , “ [I]420-the woman of whom people can remember [her]176-nat when [she]176-nat was lovely . ”[420-the woman of whom people] But the devil of it was that [Nat]176-nat had never been such good company , or [Grace]176-nat so free from care and so full of music ; and that , in spite of [their]405-their disorder and dishevelment , and the bad food and general crazy discomfort , there was more amusement to be got out of [their]405-their society than out of the most opulently staged house - party through which [Susy]159-susy and [Lansing]170-nick had ever yawned [their]405-their way . It was almost a relief to [the young man]370-the young man when , on the second afternoon , [Miss Branch]171-miss branch drew [him]370-the young man into [the narrow hall]423-the narrow hall to say : “ [I]171-miss branch really ca n’t stand the combination of [Grace]176-nat ’s violin and [little Nat]176-nat ’s motor - horn any longer . Do let [us]405-their slip out till the duet is over . ”[171-miss branch] “ How do [they]405-their stand it , [I]370-the young man wonder ? ”[370-the young man] [he]370-the young man basely echoed , as [he]370-the young man followed [her]171-miss branch up [the wooded path behind [the house]342-the house]424-the wooded path behind the house . “ It might be worth finding out , ”[171-miss branch] [she]171-miss branch rejoined with a musing smile . But [he]370-the young man remained resolutely skeptical . “ Oh , give [them]405-their a year or two more and [they]405-their ’ll collapse-- ! [His]370-the young man pictures will never sell , [you]370-the young man know . [He]370-the young man ’ll never even get them into a show . ”[370-the young man] “ [I]426-they suppose not . And [she]171-miss branch ’ll never have time to do anything worth while with [her]171-miss branch music . ”[426-they] [They]426-they had reached [a piny knoll high above the ledge on which [the house]342-the house was perched]427-a piny knoll high above the ledge on which the house was perched . All about [them]426-they stretched [an empty landscape of endless featureless [wooded hills]430-wooded hills]429-an empty landscape of endless featureless wooded hills . “ Think of sticking here all the year round ! ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick groaned . “ [I]170-nick know . But then think of wandering over [the world]2205-the world with [some people]2206-some people ! ”[170-nick] “ Oh , [Lord]2207-lord , yes . For instance , [my]170-nick trip to [India]14-india with [the Mortimer Hickses]177-the hickses . But it was [my]170-nick only chance and what [the deuce]2208-the deuce is one to do ? ”[170-nick] “ [I]431-i wish [I]431-i knew ! ”[431-i] [she]431-i sighed , thinking of [the Bockheimers]169-the bockheimers ; and [he]170-nick turned and looked at [her]431-i . “ Knew what ? ”[170-nick] “ The answer to [your]431-i question . What is one to do -- when one sees both sides of the problem ? Or every possible side of it , indeed ? ”[426-they] [They]426-they had seated [themselves]426-they on [a commanding rock under the pines]432-a commanding rock under the pines , but [Lansing]170-nick could not see the view at [their]426-they feet for the stir of the brown lashes on [her]431-i cheek . “ [You]170-nick mean : [Nat]176-nat and [Grace]176-nat may after all be having the best of it ? ”[170-nick] “ How can [I]159-susy say , when [I]159-susy ’ve told [you]170-nick [I]159-susy see all the sides ? Of course , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy added hastily , “ [I]159-susy could n’t live as [they]426-they do for a week . But it ’s wonderful how little it ’s dimmed [them]426-they . ”[159-susy] “ Certainly [Nat]176-nat was never more coruscating . And [she]176-nat keeps it up even better . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick reflected . “ [We]433-they do [them]426-they good , [I]170-nick daresay . ”[170-nick] “ Yes -- or [they]426-they [us]433-they . [I]170-nick wonder which ? ”[170-nick] After that , [he]170-nick seemed to remember that [they]433-they sat a long time silent , and that [his]170-nick next utterance was a boyish outburst against the tyranny of the existing order of things , abruptly followed by the passionate query why , since [he]170-nick and [she]159-susy could n’t alter it , and since [they]433-they both had the habit of looking at facts as [they]433-they were , [they]433-they would n’t be [utter fools]434-utter fools not to take [their]433-they chance of being happy in the only way that was open to [them]433-they , To this challenge [he]170-nick did not recall [Susy]159-susy ’s making any definite answer ; but after another interval , in which all [the world]2205-the world seemed framed in a sudden kiss , [he]170-nick heard [her]159-susy murmur to [herself]159-susy in a brooding tone : “ [I]159-susy do n’t suppose it ’s ever been tried before ; but [we]433-they might-- . ”[159-susy] And then and there [she]159-susy had laid before [him]170-nick the very experiment [they]433-they had since hazarded . [She]159-susy would have none of surreptitious bliss , [she]159-susy began by declaring ; and [she]159-susy set forth [her]159-susy reasons with [her]159-susy usual lucid impartiality . In the first place , [she]159-susy should have to marry some day , and when [she]159-susy made the bargain [she]159-susy meant it to be an honest one ; and secondly , in the matter of love , [she]159-susy would never give [herself]159-susy to anyone [she]159-susy did not really care for , and if such happiness ever came to [her]159-susy [she]159-susy did not want it shorn of half its brightness by the need of fibbing and plotting and dodging . “ [I]159-susy ’ve seen too much of that kind of thing . [Half the women [I]159-susy know who ’ve had [lovers]2210-lovers]2209-half the women i know who ’ve had lovers have had [them]2209-half the women i know who ’ve had lovers for the fun of sneaking and lying about it ; but [the other half]2211-the other half have been miserable . And [I]159-susy should be miserable . ”[159-susy] It was at this point that [she]159-susy unfolded [her]159-susy plan . Why should n’t [they]436-we marry ; belong to [each other]2188-each other openly and honourably , if for ever so short a time , and with the definite understanding that whenever either of [them]436-we got the chance to do better [he]438-he or [she]439-she should be immediately released ? The law of [[their]436-we country]440-their country facilitated such exchanges , and [society]441-society was beginning to view [them]436-we as indulgently as the law . As [Susy]159-susy talked , [she]159-susy warmed to [her]159-susy theme and began to develop its endless possibilities . “ [We]436-we should really , in a way , help more than [we]436-we should hamper [each other]2188-each other , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy ardently explained . “ [We]436-we both know the ropes so well ; what one of [us]436-we did n’t see the other might -- in the way of opportunities , [I]159-susy mean . And then [we]436-we should be a novelty as [married people]2213-married people . [We]436-we ’re both rather unusually popular -- why not be frank!--and it ’s such a blessing for [dinner - givers]2214-dinner - givers to be able to count on [a couple of whom neither one]2215-a couple of whom neither one is a blank . Yes , [I]159-susy really believe [we]436-we should be more than twice the success [we]436-we are now ; at least , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy added with a smile , “ if there ’s that amount of room for improvement . [I]159-susy do n’t know how [you]442-he feel ; [a man]2216-a man ’s popularity is so much less precarious than [a girl’s]2217-a girl’s -- but [I]159-susy know it would furbish [me]159-susy up tremendously to reappear as [a married woman]2218-a married woman . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy glanced away from [him]442-he down [the long valley]443-the long valley at [their]444-their feet , and added in a lower tone : “ And [I]159-susy should like , just for a little while , to feel [I]159-susy had something in life of [my]159-susy very own -- something that [nobody]2219-nobody had lent [me]159-susy , like a fancy - dress or a motor or an opera cloak . ”[159-susy] The suggestion , at first , had seemed to [Lansing]170-nick as mad as it was enchanting : it had thoroughly frightened [him]442-he . But [Susy]159-susy ’s arguments were irrefutable , [her]159-susy ingenuities inexhaustible . Had [he]442-he ever thought it all out ? [She]159-susy asked . No . Well , [she]159-susy had ; and would [he]442-he kindly not interrupt ? In the first place , there would be all the wedding - presents . Jewels , and a motor , and a silver dinner service , did [she]159-susy mean ? Not a bit of it ! [She]159-susy could see [he]442-he ’d never given the question proper thought . [Cheques]178-cheques , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear , nothing but cheques -- [she]159-susy undertook to manage that on [her]159-susy side : [she]159-susy really thought [she]159-susy could count on about fifty , and [she]159-susy supposed [he]442-he could rake up a few more ? Well , all that would simply represent pocket - money ! For [they]446-they would have plenty of [houses to live in]447-houses to live in : [he]442-he ’d see . [People]421-people were always glad to lend [[their]421-people house]449-their house to [a newly - married couple]450-a newly - married couple . It was such fun to pop down and see [them]421-people : it made [one]2186-one feel romantic and jolly . All [they]446-they need do was to accept [the houses]452-the houses in turn : go on honey - mooning for a year ! What was [he]442-he afraid of ? Did n’t [he]442-he think [they]446-they ’d be happy enough to want to keep it up ? And why not at least try -- get engaged , and then see what would happen ? Even if [she]159-susy was all wrong , and [her]159-susy plan failed , would n’t it have been rather nice , just for a month or two , to fancy [they]446-they were going to be happy ? “ [I]159-susy ’ve often fancied it all by [myself]159-susy , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy concluded ; “ but fancying it with [you]170-nick would somehow be so awfully different .... ”[159-susy] That was how it began : and this lakeside dream was what it had led up to . Fantastically improbable as they had seemed , all [her]159-susy previsions had come true . If there were certain links in the chain that [Lansing]170-nick had never been able to put [his]170-nick hand on , certain arrangements and contrivances that still needed further elucidation , why , [he]170-nick was lazily resolved to clear them up with [her]159-susy some day ; and meanwhile it was worth all the past might have cost , and every penalty the future might exact of [him]170-nick , just to be sitting here in the silence and sweetness , [her]159-susy sleeping head on [his]170-nick knee , clasped in [his]170-nick joy as the hushed world was clasped in moonlight . [He]170-nick stooped down and kissed [her]159-susy . “ Wake up , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick whispered , “ it ’s bed - time . ”[170-nick] III . [THEIR]446-they month of Como was within a few hours of ending . Till the last moment [they]446-they had hoped for a reprieve ; but [the accommodating Streffy]453-the accommodating streffy had been unable to put [the villa]454-the villa at [their]446-they disposal for a longer time , since [he]170-nick had had the luck to let it for a thumping price to [some beastly bouncers who insisted on taking possession at the date agreed on]455-some beastly bouncers who insisted on taking possession at the date agreed on . [Lansing]170-nick , leaving [Susy]159-susy ’s side at dawn , had gone down to [the lake]335-the lake for a last plunge ; and swimming homeward through the crystal light [he]170-nick looked up at [the garden brimming with flowers]457-the garden brimming with flowers , [the long low house with the cypress wood above [it]458-the long low house with the cypress wood above it]458-the long low house with the cypress wood above it , and the window behind which [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife still slept . The month had been exquisite , and [their]446-they happiness as rare , as fantastically complete , as the scene before [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick sank [his]170-nick chin into the sunlit ripples and sighed for sheer content .... It was a bore to be leaving the scene of such complete well - being , but the next stage in [their]446-they progress promised to be hardly less delightful . [Susy]159-susy was [a magician]460-a magician : everything [she]159-susy predicted came true . [Houses]461-houses were being showered on [them]446-they ; on all sides [he]170-nick seemed to see beneficent spirits winging toward [them]446-they , laden with everything from a piano nobile in [Venice]15-venice to [a camp in [the Adirondacks]16-the adirondacks]462-a camp in the adirondacks . For the present , [they]446-they had decided on the former . Other considerations apart , [they]446-they dared not risk the expense of a journey across [the Atlantic]17-the atlantic ; so [they]446-they were heading instead for [the Nelson Vanderlyns ’ palace on [the Giudecca]18-the giudecca]463-the nelson vanderlyns ’ palace on the giudecca . [They]446-they were agreed that , for reasons of expediency , it might be wise to return to [New York]12-new york for the coming winter . It would keep [them]446-they in view , and probably lead to fresh opportunities ; indeed , [Susy]159-susy already had in mind the convenient flat that [she]159-susy was sure [a migratory cousin]464-a migratory cousin ( if tactfully handled , and assured that [they]446-they would not overwork [[her]159-susy cook]465-her cook ) could certainly be induced to lend [them]446-they . Meanwhile the need of making plans was still remote ; and if there was one art in which [young Lansing]170-nick ’s twenty - eight years of existence had perfected [him]170-nick it was that of living completely and unconcernedly in the present .... If of late [he]170-nick had tried to look into the future more insistently than was [his]170-nick habit , it was only because of [Susy]159-susy . [He]170-nick had meant , when [they]446-they married , to be as philosophic for [her]159-susy as for [himself]170-nick ; and [he]170-nick knew [she]159-susy would have resented above everything [his]170-nick regarding [their]446-they partnership as a reason for anxious thought . But since [they]446-they had been together [she]159-susy had given [him]170-nick glimpses of [her]159-susy past that made [him]170-nick angrily long to shelter and defend [her]159-susy future . It was intolerable that a spirit as fine as [hers]159-susy should be ever so little dulled or diminished by the kind of compromises out of which [their]446-they wretched lives were made . For [himself]170-nick , [he]170-nick did n’t care a hang : [he]170-nick had composed for [his]170-nick own guidance a rough - and - ready code , a short set of “ mays ”[170-nick] and “ mustn’ts ”[170-nick] which immensely simplified [his]170-nick course . There were things [a fellow put up with for the sake of certain definite and otherwise unattainable advantages]466-a fellow put up with for the sake of certain definite and otherwise unattainable advantages ; there were other things [he]170-nick would n’t traffic with at any price . But for [a woman]467-a woman , [he]170-nick began to see , it might be different . The temptations might be greater , the cost considerably higher , the dividing line between the “ mays ”[469-a weak wastrel of a father] and “ mustn’ts ”[469-a weak wastrel of a father] more fluctuating and less sharply drawn . [Susy]159-susy , thrown on [the world]2205-the world at seventeen , with only [a weak wastrel of [a father]470-a father]469-a weak wastrel of a father to define that treacherous line for [her]159-susy , and with every circumstance soliciting [her]159-susy to overstep it , seemed to have been preserved chiefly by an innate scorn of most of the objects of human folly . “ Such trash as [he]170-nick went to pieces for , ”[159-susy] was [her]159-susy curt comment on [[her]159-susy parent]471-her parent ’s premature demise : as though [she]159-susy accepted in advance the necessity of ruining [one]2186-one ’s self for something , but was resolved to discriminate firmly between what was worth it and what was n’t . This philosophy had at first enchanted [Lansing]170-nick ; but now it began to rouse vague fears . The fine armour of [her]159-susy fastidiousness had preserved [her]159-susy from the kind of risks [she]159-susy had hitherto been exposed to ; but what if [others , more subtle]473-others , more subtle , found a joint in it ? Was there , among [her]159-susy delicate discriminations , any equivalent to [his]170-nick own rules ? Might not [her]159-susy taste for the best and rarest be the very instrument of [her]159-susy undoing ; and if something that was n’t “ trash ”[159-susy] came [her]159-susy way , would [she]159-susy hesitate a second to go to pieces for it ? [He]170-nick was determined to stick to the compact that [they]474-they should do nothing to interfere with what each referred to as [the other]475-the other ’s “ chance ”[159-susy] ; but what if , when [hers]159-susy came , [he]170-nick could n’t agree with [her]159-susy in recognizing it ? [He]170-nick wanted for [her]159-susy , oh , so passionately , the best ; but [his]170-nick conception of that best had so insensibly , so subtly been transformed in the light of [their]474-they first month together ! [His]170-nick lazy strokes were carrying [him]170-nick slowly shoreward ; but the hour was so exquisite that a few yards from [the landing]476-the landing [he]170-nick laid hold of the mooring rope of [[Streffy]164-streffy ’s boat]477-streffy ’s boat and floated there , following [his]170-nick dream .... It was a bore to be leaving ; no doubt that was what made [him]170-nick turn things inside - out so uselessly . [Venice]15-venice would be delicious , of course ; but nothing would ever again be as sweet as this . And then [they]474-they had only a year of security before [them]474-they ; and of that year a month was gone . Reluctantly [he]170-nick swam ashore , walked up to [the house]342-the house , and pushed open a window of [the cool painted drawing - room]479-the cool painted drawing - room . Signs of departure were already visible . There were trunks in [the hall]480-the hall , tennis rackets on the stairs ; on [the landing]476-the landing , [the cook [Giulietta]180-giulietta]482-the cook giulietta had both arms around a slippery hold - all that refused to let itself be strapped . It all gave [him]170-nick a chill sense of unreality , as if the past month had been an act on the stage , and its setting were being folded away and rolled into the wings to make room for another play in which [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy had no part . By the time [he]170-nick came down again , dressed and hungry , to [the terrace where coffee awaited [him]170-nick]483-the terrace where coffee awaited him , [he]170-nick had recovered [his]170-nick usual pleasant sense of security . [Susy]159-susy was there , fresh and gay , a rose in [her]159-susy breast and the sun in [her]159-susy hair : [her]159-susy head was bowed over [Bradshaw]181-bradshaw , but [she]159-susy waved a fond hand across the breakfast things , and presently looked up to say : “ Yes , [I]159-susy believe [we]2220-we can just manage it . ”[159-susy] “ Manage what ? ”[159-susy] “ To catch [the train]2221-the train at [Milan]19-milan -- if [we]2220-we start in [the motor]2222-the motor at ten sharp . ”[159-susy] [He]170-nick stared . “ The motor ? [What motor]2223-what motor ? ”[159-susy] “ Why , [the new people’s]2224-the new people’s -- [[Streffy]164-streffy ’s tenants]2225-streffy ’s tenants . [He]164-streffy ’s never told [me]484-she [their]2224-the new people’s name , and [the chauffeur]2226-the chauffeur says [he]164-streffy ca n’t pronounce it . [The chauffeur]2226-the chauffeur ’s is [Ottaviano]182-ottaviano , anyhow ; [I]484-she ’ve been making friends with [him]164-streffy . [He]164-streffy arrived last night , and [he]164-streffy says [they]2224-the new people’s ’re not due at [Como]5-como till this evening . [He]164-streffy simply jumped at the idea of running [us]2224-the new people’s over to [Milan]19-milan . ”[484-she] “ Good Lord-- ”[170-nick] said [Lansing]170-nick , when [she]484-she stopped . [She]484-she sprang up from the table with a laugh . “ It will be a scramble ; but [I]484-she ’ll manage it , if [you]170-nick ’ll go up at once and pitch the last things into [your]170-nick trunk . ”[484-she] “ Yes ; but look here -- have [you]170-nick any idea what it ’s going to cost ? ”[484-she] [She]484-she raised [her]484-she eyebrows gaily . “ Why , a good deal less than [our]2224-the new people’s railway tickets . [Ottaviano]182-ottaviano ’s got [a sweetheart in [Milan]19-milan]2228-a sweetheart in milan , and has n’t seen [her]2228-a sweetheart in milan for six months . When [I]484-she found that out [I]484-she knew [he]182-ottaviano ’d be going [there]2229-there anyhow . ”[484-she] It was clever of [her]484-she , and [he]170-nick laughed . But why was it that [he]170-nick had grown to shrink from even such harmless evidence of [her]484-she always knowing how to “ manage ”[484-she] ? “ Oh , well , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said to [himself]170-nick , “ [she]484-she ’s right : [the fellow]2230-the fellow would be sure to be going to [Milan]19-milan . ”[170-nick] [Upstairs]485-upstairs , on the way to [[his]170-nick dressing room]486-his dressing room , [he]170-nick found [her]484-she in a cloud of finery which [her]484-she skilful hands were forcibly compressing into a last portmanteau . [He]170-nick had never seen [anyone]389-anyone pack as cleverly as [Susy]159-susy : the way [she]484-she coaxed reluctant things into a trunk was a symbol of the way [she]484-she fitted discordant facts into [her]484-she life . “ When [I]484-she ’m rich , ”[484-she] [she]484-she often said , “ the thing [I]484-she shall hate most will be to see [an idiot maid]2231-an idiot maid at [[my]484-she trunks]2232-my trunks . ”[484-she] As [he]170-nick passed , [she]484-she glanced over [her]484-she shoulder , [her]484-she face pink with the struggle , and drew a cigar - box from the depths . “ [Dearest]2233-dearest , do put a couple of cigars into [your]170-nick pocket as a tip for [Ottaviano]182-ottaviano . ”[484-she] [Lansing]170-nick stared . “ Why , what on earth are [you]484-she doing with [Streffy]164-streffy ’s cigars ? ”[484-she] “ Packing them , of course .... [You]484-she do n’t suppose [he]164-streffy meant them for [those other people]2234-those other people ? ”[484-she] [She]484-she gave [him]170-nick a look of honest wonder . “ [I]484-she do n’t know whom [he]164-streffy meant [them]2232-my trunks for -- but they ’re not [ours]2235-ours .... ”[484-she] [She]484-she continued to look at [him]170-nick wonderingly . “ [I]484-she do n’t see what there is to be solemn about . The cigars are not [Streffy]164-streffy ’s either ... [you]170-nick may be sure [he]164-streffy got them out of some bounder . And there ’s nothing [he]164-streffy ’d hate more than to have them passed on to another . ”[484-she] “ Nonsense . If [they]2232-my trunks ’re not [Streffy]164-streffy ’s they ’re much less [mine]484-she . Hand them over , please , [dear]2236-dear . ”[484-she] “ Just as [you]484-she like . But it does seem a waste ; and , of course , [the other people]2237-the other people will never have one of [them]2232-my trunks .... [The gardener]2238-the gardener and [[Giulietta]180-giulietta ’s lover]2239-giulietta ’s lover will see to that ! ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick looked away from [her]484-she at the waves of lace and muslin from which [she]484-she emerged like [a rosy Nereid]488-a rosy nereid . “ How many boxes of them are left ? ”[484-she] “ Only four . ”[170-nick] “ Unpack them , please . ”[484-she] Before [she]484-she moved there was a pause so full of challenge that [Lansing]170-nick had time for an exasperated sense of the disproportion between [his]170-nick anger and its cause . And this made [him]170-nick still angrier . [She]484-she held out a box . “ The others are in [[your]170-nick suitcase [downstairs]2241-downstairs]2240-your suitcase downstairs . It ’s locked and strapped . ”[484-she] “ Give [me]484-she the key , then . ”[484-she] “ [We]2242-we might send [them]2243-them back from [Venice]15-venice , might n’t [we]2242-we ? That lock is so nasty : it will take [you]170-nick half an hour . ”[484-she] “ Give [me]484-she the key , please . ”[484-she] [She]484-she gave it . [He]170-nick went [downstairs]2241-downstairs and battled with the lock , for the allotted half - hour , under the puzzled eyes of [Giulietta]180-giulietta and the sardonic grin of [the chauffeur]2226-the chauffeur , who now and then , from the threshold , politely reminded [him]170-nick how long it would take to get to [Milan]19-milan . Finally the key turned , and [Lansing]170-nick , broken - nailed and perspiring , extracted the cigars and stalked with [them]491-them into [the deserted drawing room]492-the deserted drawing room . The great bunches of golden roses that [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy had gathered the day before were dropping [their]491-them petals on the marble embroidery of the floor , pale camellias floated in the alabaster tazzas between the windows , haunting scents of [the garden]340-the garden blew in on [him]170-nick with the breeze from [the lake]335-the lake . Never had [[Streffy]164-streffy ’s little house]495-streffy ’s little house seemed so like a nest of pleasures . [Lansing]170-nick laid the cigar boxes on a console and ran [upstairs]485-upstairs to collect [his]170-nick last possessions . When [he]170-nick came down again , [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife , [her]332-his wife eyes brilliant with achievement , was seated in [[their]498-their borrowed chariot]499-their borrowed chariot , the luggage cleverly stowed away , and [Giulietta]180-giulietta and [the gardener]2238-the gardener kissing [her]332-his wife hand and weeping out inconsolable farewells . “ [I]170-nick wonder what [she]332-his wife ’s given [them]498-their ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick thought , as [he]170-nick jumped in beside [her]332-his wife and the motor whirled [them]498-their through the nightingale - thickets to the gate . [IV]20-iv . [CHARLIE STREFFORD]267-strefford [’S villa]501-’s villa was like a nest in a rose - bush ; [the Nelson Vanderlyns ’ palace]502-the nelson vanderlyns ’ palace called for loftier analogies . [Its]502-the nelson vanderlyns ’ palace vastness and splendour seemed , in comparison , oppressive to [Susy]159-susy . [[Their]498-their landing]503-their landing , after dark , at the foot of [the great shadowy staircase]504-the great shadowy staircase , [their]498-their dinner at a dimly - lit table under a ceiling weighed down with Olympians , [their]498-their chilly evening in [a corner of [a drawing room]506-a drawing room where minuets should have been danced before a throne]505-a corner of a drawing room where minuets should have been danced before a throne , contrasted with the happy intimacies of [Como]5-como as [their]498-their sudden sense of disaccord contrasted with the mutual confidence of the day before . The journey had been particularly jolly : both [Susy]159-susy and [Lansing]170-nick had had too long a discipline in the art of smoothing things over not to make a special effort to hide from [each other]2188-each other the ravages of [their]498-their first disagreement . But , deep down and invisible , the disagreement remained ; and compunction for having been its cause gnawed at [Susy]159-susy ’s bosom as [she]159-susy sat in [[her]159-susy tapestried and vaulted bedroom]508-her tapestried and vaulted bedroom , brushing [her]159-susy hair before a tarnished mirror . “ [I]159-susy thought [I]159-susy liked grandeur ; but [this place]2185-this place is really out of scale , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy mused , watching the reflection of a pale hand move back and forward in the dim recesses of the mirror . “ And yet , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy continued , “ [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s hardly half an inch taller than [I]159-susy am ; and [she]184-ellie certainly is n’t a bit more dignified .... [I]159-susy wonder if it ’s because [I]159-susy feel so horribly small to - night that [the place]2245-the place seems so horribly big . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy loved luxury : splendid things always made [her]159-susy feel handsome and high ceilings arrogant ; [she]159-susy did not remember having ever before been oppressed by the evidences of wealth . [She]159-susy laid down the brush and leaned [her]159-susy chin on [her]159-susy clasped hands .... Even now [she]159-susy could not understand what had made [her]159-susy take the cigars . [She]159-susy had always been alive to the value of [her]159-susy inherited scruples : [her]159-susy reasoned opinions were unusually free , but with regard to the things one could n’t reason about [she]159-susy was oddly tenacious . And yet [she]159-susy had taken [Streffy]164-streffy ’s cigars ! [She]159-susy had taken them -- yes , that was the point -- [she]159-susy had taken them for [Nick]170-nick , because the desire to please [him]170-nick , to make the smallest details of [his]170-nick life easy and agreeable and luxurious , had become [her]159-susy absorbing preoccupation . [She]159-susy had committed , for [him]170-nick , precisely the kind of little baseness [she]159-susy would most have scorned to commit for [herself]159-susy ; and , since [he]170-nick had n’t instantly felt the difference , [she]159-susy would never be able to explain it to [him]170-nick . [She]159-susy stood up with a sigh , shook out [her]159-susy loosened hair , and glanced around [the great frescoed room]509-the great frescoed room . [The maid - servant]510-the maid - servant had said something about [the Signora]185-the signora ’s having left a letter for [her]159-susy ; and there it lay on the writing - table , with [her]159-susy mail and [Nick]170-nick ’s ; a thick envelope addressed in [Ellie]184-ellie ’s childish scrawl , with a glaring “ Private ”[159-susy] dashed across the corner . “ What on earth can [she]185-the signora have to say , when [she]185-the signora hates writing so , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy mused . [She]159-susy broke open the envelope , and four or five stamped and sealed letters fell from it . All were addressed , in [Ellie]184-ellie ’s hand , to [Nelson Vanderlyn Esqre]222-nelson ; and in the corner of each was faintly pencilled a number and a date : one , two , three , four -- with a week ’s interval between the dates . “ Goodness-- ”[159-susy] gasped [Susy]159-susy , understanding . [She]159-susy had dropped into an armchair near the table , and for a long time [she]159-susy sat staring at the numbered letters . A sheet of paper covered with [Ellie]184-ellie ’s writing had fluttered out among them , but [she]159-susy let it lie ; [she]159-susy knew so well what it would say ! [She]159-susy knew all about [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend , of course ; except [poor old [Nelson]222-nelson , who did n’t , But [she]159-susy]222-nelson had never imagined that [Ellie]184-ellie would dare to use [her]367-her friend in this way . It was unbelievable ... [she]159-susy had never pictured anything so vile .... The blood rushed to [her]159-susy face , and [she]159-susy sprang up angrily , half minded to tear the letters in bits and throw them all into the fire . [She]159-susy heard [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s knock on the door between [[their]513-their rooms]514-their rooms , and swept the dangerous packet under the blotting - book . “ Oh , go away , please , there ’s [a dear]2246-a dear , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy called out ; “ [I]159-susy have n’t finished unpacking , and everything ’s in such a mess . ”[159-susy] Gathering up [Nick]170-nick ’s papers and letters , [she]159-susy ran across [the room]379-the room and thrust them through the door . “ Here ’s something to keep [you]170-nick quiet , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy laughed , shining in on [him]170-nick an instant from the threshold . [She]159-susy turned back feeling weak with shame . [Ellie]184-ellie ’s letter lay on the floor : reluctantly [she]159-susy stooped to pick it up , and one by one the expected phrases sprang out at [her]159-susy . “ One good turn deserves another .... Of course [you]170-nick and [Nick]170-nick are welcome to stay all summer .... There wo n’t be a particle of expense for [you]170-nick -- [the servants]2247-the servants have orders .... If [you]170-nick ’ll just be [an angel]2248-an angel and post these letters [yourself]170-nick .... It ’s been [my]159-susy only chance for such an age ; when [we]2249-we meet [I]159-susy ’ll explain everything . And in a month at latest [I]159-susy ’ll be back to fetch [Clarissa]187-clarissa .... ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy lifted the letter to the lamp to be sure [she]159-susy had read aright . To fetch [Clarissa]187-clarissa ! Then [[Ellie]184-ellie ’s child]516-ellie ’s child was [here]2184-here ? Here , under the roof with [them]518-them , left to [their]518-them care ? [She]159-susy read on , raging . “ [She]516-ellie ’s child ’s so delighted , [poor darling]2250-poor darling , to know [you]170-nick ’re coming . [I]159-susy ’ve had to sack [[her]516-ellie ’s child beastly governess]2251-her beastly governess for impertinence , and if it were n’t for [you]170-nick [she]516-ellie ’s child ’d be all alone with [a lot of [servants]2253-servants]2252-a lot of servants [I]159-susy do n’t much trust . So for pity ’s sake be good to [[my]159-susy child]2254-my child , and forgive [me]159-susy for leaving [her]516-ellie ’s child . [She]516-ellie ’s child thinks [I]159-susy ’ve gone to take a cure ; and [she]516-ellie ’s child knows [she]516-ellie ’s child ’s not to tell [[her]516-ellie ’s child Daddy]2255-her daddy that [I]159-susy ’m away , because it would only worry [him]2255-her daddy if [he]2255-her daddy thought [I]159-susy was ill . [She]516-ellie ’s child ’s perfectly to be trusted ; [you]170-nick ’ll see what [a clever angel]2256-a clever angel [she]516-ellie ’s child is .... ”[159-susy] And then , at the bottom of the page , in a last slanting postscript : “ [Susy]159-susy darling , if [you]159-susy ’ve ever owed [me]159-susy anything in the way of kindness , [you]159-susy wo n’t , on [your]159-susy sacred honour , say a word of this to [any one]2257-any one , even to [Nick]170-nick . And [I]159-susy know [I]159-susy can count on [you]159-susy to rub out the numbers . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy sprang up and tossed [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s letter into the fire : then [she]159-susy came slowly back to the chair . There , at [her]159-susy elbow , lay the four fatal envelopes ; and [her]159-susy next affair was to make up [her]159-susy mind what to do with them . To destroy them on the spot had seemed , at first thought , inevitable : it might be saving [Ellie]184-ellie as well as [herself]159-susy . But such a step seemed to [Susy]159-susy to involve departure on the morrow , and this in turn involved notifying [Ellie]184-ellie , whose letter [she]159-susy had vainly scanned for an address . Well -- perhaps [[Clarissa]187-clarissa ’s nurse]519-clarissa ’s nurse would know where [one]2186-one could write to [[her]2186-one mother]521-her mother ; it was unlikely that even [Ellie]184-ellie would go off without assuring some means of communication with [[her]159-susy child]522-her child . At any rate , there was nothing to be done that night : nothing but to work out the details of [their]523-their flight on the morrow , and rack [her]159-susy brains to find a substitute for the hospitality [they]523-their were rejecting . [Susy]159-susy did not disguise from [herself]159-susy how much [she]159-susy had counted on [the Vanderlyn apartment]524-the vanderlyn apartment for the summer : to be able to do so had singularly simplified the future . [She]159-susy knew [Ellie]184-ellie ’s largeness of hand , and had been sure in advance that as long as [they]523-their were [[her]159-susy guests]525-her guests [their]523-their only expense would be an occasional present to [the servants]2247-the servants . And what would the alternative be ? [She]159-susy and [Lansing]170-nick , in [their]523-their endless talks , had so lived [themselves]523-their into the vision of indolent summer days on [the lagoon]527-the lagoon , of flaming hours on [the beach of [the Lido]34-the lido]528-the beach of the lido , and evenings of music and dreams on [[their]523-their broad balcony above [the Giudecca]18-the giudecca]529-their broad balcony above the giudecca , that the idea of having to renounce these joys , and deprive [her]159-susy [Nick]170-nick of them , filled [Susy]159-susy with a wrath intensified by [his]170-nick having confided in [her]159-susy that when [they]523-their were quietly settled in [Venice]15-venice [he]170-nick “ meant to write . ”[170-nick] Already nascent in [her]159-susy breast was the fierce resolve of [[the author]530-the author ’s wife]531-the author ’s wife to defend [[her]531-the author ’s wife husband]327-her husband ’s privacy and facilitate [his]170-nick encounters with [the Muse]533-the muse . It was abominable , simply abominable , that [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie should have drawn [her]159-susy into such a trap ! Well -- there was nothing for it but to make a clean breast of the whole thing to [Nick]170-nick . The trivial incident of the cigars -- how trivial it now seemed!--showed [her]159-susy the kind of stand [he]170-nick would take , and communicated to [her]159-susy something of [his]170-nick own uncompromising energy . [She]159-susy would tell [him]170-nick the whole story in the morning , and try to find a way out with [him]170-nick : [Susy]159-susy ’s faith in [her]159-susy power of finding a way out was inexhaustible . But suddenly [she]159-susy remembered the adjuration at the end of [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s letter : “ If [you]170-nick ’re ever owed [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn anything in the way of kindness , [you]170-nick wo n’t , on [your]170-nick sacred honour , say a word to [Nick]170-nick .... ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] It was , of course , exactly what [no one]534-no one had the right to ask of [her]159-susy : if indeed the word “ right ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] , could be used in any conceivable relation to this coil of wrongs . But the fact remained that , in the way of kindness , [she]159-susy did owe much to [Ellie]184-ellie ; and that this was the first payment [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend had ever exacted . [She]159-susy found [herself]159-susy , in fact , in exactly the same position as when [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula , using the same argument , had appealed to [her]159-susy to give up [Nick Lansing]170-nick . Yes , [Susy]159-susy reflected ; but then [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson had been kind to [her]159-susy too ; and the money [Ellie]184-ellie had been so kind with was [Nelson]222-nelson ’s .... The queer edifice of [Susy]159-susy ’s standards tottered on its base [she]159-susy honestly did n’t know where fairness lay , as between so much that was foul . The very depth of [her]159-susy perplexity puzzled [her]159-susy . [She]159-susy had been in “ tight places ”[222-nelson] before ; had indeed been in so few that were not , in one way or another , constricting ! As [she]159-susy looked back on [her]159-susy past it lay before [her]159-susy as a very network of perpetual concessions and contrivings . But never before had [she]159-susy had such a sense of being tripped up , gagged and pinioned . The little misery of the cigars still galled [her]159-susy , and now this big humiliation superposed itself on the raw wound . Decidedly , the second month of [their]536-their honey - moon was beginning cloudily .... [She]159-susy glanced at the enamel led travelling - clock on [her]159-susy dressing table -- one of the few wedding - presents [she]159-susy had consented to accept in kind -- and was startled at the lateness of the hour . In a moment [Nick]170-nick would be coming ; and an uncomfortable sensation in [her]159-susy throat warned [her]159-susy that through sheer nervousness and exasperation [she]159-susy might blurt out something ill - advised . The old habit of being always on [her]159-susy guard made [her]159-susy turn once more to the looking - glass . [Her]159-susy face was pale and haggard ; and having , by a swift and skilful application of cosmetics , increased its appearance of fatigue , [she]159-susy crossed [the room]379-the room and softly opened [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s door . [He]327-her husband too sat by a lamp , reading a letter which [he]327-her husband put aside as [she]159-susy entered . [His]327-her husband face was grave , and [she]159-susy said to [herself]159-susy that [he]327-her husband was certainly still thinking about the cigars . “ [I]159-susy ’m very tired , [dearest]2233-dearest , and [my]159-susy head aches so horribly that [I]159-susy ’ve come to bid [you]2233-dearest good - night . ”[159-susy] Bending over the back of [his]327-her husband chair , [she]159-susy laid [her]159-susy arms on [his]327-her husband shoulders . [He]327-her husband lifted [his]327-her husband hands to clasp [hers]159-susy , but , as [he]327-her husband threw [his]327-her husband head back to smile up at [her]159-susy [she]159-susy noticed that [his]327-her husband look was still serious , almost remote . It was as if , for the first time , a faint veil hung between [his]327-her husband eyes and [hers]159-susy . “ [I]327-her husband ’m so sorry : it ’s been a long day for [you]159-susy , ”[327-her husband] [he]327-her husband said absently , pressing [his]327-her husband lips to [her]159-susy hands [She]159-susy felt the dreaded twitch in [her]159-susy throat . “ [Nick]170-nick ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy burst out , tightening [her]159-susy embrace , “ before [I]159-susy go , [you]170-nick ’ve got to swear to [me]159-susy on [your]170-nick honour that [you]170-nick know [I]159-susy should never have taken those cigars for [myself]159-susy ! ”[159-susy] For a moment [he]327-her husband stared at [her]159-susy , and [she]159-susy stared back at [him]327-her husband with equal gravity ; then the same irresistible mirth welled up in both , and [Susy]159-susy ’s compunctions were swept away on a gale of laughter . When [she]159-susy woke the next morning the sun was pouring in between [her]159-susy curtains of old brocade , and its refraction from the ripples of [the Canal]22-the canal was drawing a network of golden scales across the vaulted ceiling . [The maid]539-the maid had just placed a tray on a slim marquetry table near the bed , and over the edge of the tray [Susy]159-susy discovered the small serious face of [Clarissa Vanderlyn]187-clarissa . At the sight of [the little girl]540-the little girl all [her]159-susy dormant qualms awoke . [Clarissa]187-clarissa was just eight , and small for [her]187-clarissa age : [her]187-clarissa little round chin was barely on a level with the tea - service , and [her]187-clarissa clear brown eyes gazed at [Susy]159-susy between the ribs of the toast - rack and the single tea - rose in an old Murano glass . [Susy]159-susy had not seen [her]187-clarissa for two years , and [she]187-clarissa seemed , in the interval , to have passed from a thoughtful infancy to complete ripeness of feminine experience . [She]159-susy was looking with approval at [[her]159-susy mother]521-her mother ’s guest . “ [I]159-susy ’m so glad [you]159-susy ’ve come , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy said in a small sweet voice . “ [I]159-susy like [you]159-susy so very much . [I]159-susy know [I]159-susy ’m not to be often with [you]159-susy ; but at least [you]159-susy ’ll have an eye on [me]159-susy , wo n’t [you]159-susy ? ”[159-susy] “ An eye on [you]159-susy ! [I]159-susy shall never want to have it off [you]159-susy , if [you]159-susy say such nice things to [me]159-susy ! ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy laughed , leaning from [her]159-susy pillows to draw [the little girl]540-the little girl up to [her]159-susy side . [Clarissa]187-clarissa smiled and settled [herself]187-clarissa down comfortably on the silken bedspread . “ Oh , [I]187-clarissa know [I]187-clarissa ’m not to be always about , because [you]159-susy ’re just married ; but could [you]159-susy see to it that [I]187-clarissa have [my]187-clarissa meals regularly ? ”[187-clarissa] “ Why , [[you]159-susy poor darling]2259-you poor darling ! Do n’t [you]159-susy always ? ”[159-susy] “ Not when [mother]2260-mother ’s away on these cures . [The servants]2247-the servants do n’t always obey [me]159-susy : [you]159-susy see [I]159-susy ’m so little for [my]159-susy age . In a few years , of course , [they]2247-the servants ’ll have to -- even if [I]159-susy do n’t grow much , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy added judiciously . [She]159-susy put out [her]159-susy hand and touched the string of pearls about [Susy]159-susy ’s throat . “ They ’re small , but they ’re very good . [I]159-susy suppose [you]159-susy do n’t take [the others]2262-the others when [you]159-susy travel ? ”[159-susy] “ [The others]2262-the others ? Bless [you]159-susy ! [I]159-susy have n’t [any others]2264-any others -- and never shall have , probably . ”[159-susy] “ No other pearls ? ”[159-susy] “ No other jewels at all . ”[187-clarissa] [Clarissa]187-clarissa stared . “ Is that really true ? ”[187-clarissa] [she]187-clarissa asked , as if in the presence of [the unprecedented]543-the unprecedented . “ Awfully true , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy confessed . “ But [I]159-susy think [I]159-susy can make [the servants]2247-the servants obey [me]159-susy all the same . ”[159-susy] This point seemed to have lost its interest for [Clarissa]187-clarissa , who was still gravely scrutinizing [[her]187-clarissa companion]544-her companion . After a while [she]187-clarissa brought forth another question . “ Did [you]159-susy have to give up all [your]159-susy jewels when [you]159-susy were divorced ? ”[187-clarissa] “ [Divorced--]2266-divorced-- ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy threw [her]159-susy head back against the pillows and laughed . “ Why , what are [you]159-susy thinking of ? Do n’t [you]159-susy remember that [I]159-susy was n’t even married the last time [you]159-susy saw [me]159-susy ? ”[159-susy] “ Yes ; [I]540-the little girl do . But that was two years ago . ”[540-the little girl] [The little girl]540-the little girl wound [her]540-the little girl arms about [Susy]159-susy ’s neck and leaned against [her]159-susy caressingly . “ Are [you]159-susy going to be soon , then ? [I]540-the little girl ’ll promise not to tell if [you]159-susy do n’t want [me]540-the little girl to . ”[540-the little girl] “ Going to be divorced ? Of course not ! What in [the world]2205-the world made [you]159-susy think so ? ”[540-the little girl] “ Because [you]159-susy look so awfully happy , ”[187-clarissa] said [Clarissa Vanderlyn]187-clarissa simply .
