[They]177-the hickses presented a formidable front , not only because of [their]177-the hickses mere physical bulk -- [Mr.]641-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick were equally and majestically three - dimensional -- but because [they]177-the hickses never moved abroad without the escort of [two private secretaries]642-two private secretaries ( [one for the foreign languages]643-one for the foreign languages ) , [[Mr. Hicks]170-nick ’s doctor]644-mr. hicks ’s doctor , [a maiden lady known as [Eldoradder Tooker]204-eldoradder tooker , who was [[Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s cousin]646-mrs. hicks ’s cousin and stenographer]645-a maiden lady known as eldoradder tooker , who was mrs. hicks ’s cousin and stenographer , and finally [[their]177-the hickses daughter]647-their daughter , [Coral Hicks]197-coral hicks . [Coral Hicks]197-coral hicks , when [Susy]159-susy had last encountered [the party]648-the party , had been [a fat spectacled school - girl]649-a fat spectacled school - girl , always lagging behind [[her]197-coral hicks parents]650-her parents , with a reluctant poodle in [her]197-coral hicks wake . Now [the poodle]651-the poodle had gone , and [[his]170-nick mistress]652-his mistress led [the procession]653-the procession . [The fat school - girl]654-the fat school - girl had changed into [a young lady of compact if not graceful outline]655-a young lady of compact if not graceful outline ; a long - handled eyeglass had replaced the spectacles , and through it , instead of a sullen glare , [Miss Coral Hicks]196-coral projected on [the world]2205-the world a glance at once confident and critical . [She]196-coral looked so strong and so assured that [Susy]159-susy , taking [her]159-susy measure in a flash , saw that [her]159-susy position at the head of [the procession]653-the procession was not fortuitous , and murmured inwardly : “ Thank goodness [she]196-coral ’s not pretty too ! ”[159-susy] If [she]196-coral was not pretty , [she]196-coral was well - dressed ; and if [she]196-coral was overeducated , [she]196-coral seemed capable , as [Strefford]267-strefford had suggested , of carrying off even this crowning disadvantage . At any rate , [she]196-coral was above disguising it ; and before [the whole party]658-the whole party had been seated five minutes in front of a fresh supply of ices ( with [Eldorada]205-eldorada and the secretaries at a table slightly in the background ) [she]196-coral had taken up with [Nick]170-nick the question of exploration in [Mesopotamia]39-mesopotamia . “ [Queer child]2315-queer child , [Coral]196-coral , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said to [Susy]159-susy that night as [they]659-they smoked a last cigarette on [[their]659-they balcony]660-their balcony . “ [She]196-coral told [me]170-nick this afternoon that [she]196-coral ’d remembered lots of things [she]196-coral heard [me]170-nick say in [India]14-india . [I]170-nick thought at the time that [she]196-coral cared only for caramels and picture - puzzles , but it seems [she]196-coral was listening to everything , and reading all the books [she]196-coral could lay [her]196-coral hands on ; and [she]196-coral got so bitten with Oriental archaeology that [she]196-coral took a course last year at [Bryn Mawr]40-bryn mawr . [She]196-coral means to go to [Bagdad]41-bagdad next spring , and back by [the Persian plateau]2316-the persian plateau and [Turkestan]42-turkestan . ”[170-nick] [Susy]159-susy laughed luxuriously : [she]159-susy was sitting with [her]159-susy hand in [Nick]170-nick ’s , while the late moon -- [theirs]661-theirs again -- rounded its orange - coloured glory above [the belfry of [San Giorgio]43-san giorgio]662-the belfry of san giorgio . “ [Poor Coral]197-coral hicks ! How dreary-- ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy murmured “ [Dreary]206-dreary ? Why ? A trip like that is about as well worth doing as anything [I]159-susy know . ”[159-susy] “ Oh , [I]159-susy meant : dreary to do it without [you]170-nick or [me]159-susy , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy laughed , getting up lazily to go [indoors]663-indoors . A broad band of moonlight , dividing [[her]159-susy room]664-her room onto two shadowy halves , lay on the painted Venetian bed with [its]665-its folded - back sheet , [its]665-its old damask coverlet and lace - edged pillows . [She]159-susy felt the warmth of [Nick]170-nick ’s enfolding arm and lifted [her]159-susy face to [his]170-nick . [The Hickses]177-the hickses retained the most tender memory of [Nick]170-nick ’s sojourn on [the Ibis]170-nick , and [Susy]159-susy , moved by [their]177-the hickses artless pleasure in meeting [him]170-nick again , was glad [he]170-nick had not followed [her]159-susy advice and tried to elude [them]177-the hickses . [She]159-susy had always admired [Strefford]267-strefford ’s ruthless talent for using and discarding the human material in [his]267-strefford path , but now [she]159-susy began to hope that [Nick]170-nick would not remember [her]159-susy suggestion that [he]170-nick should mete out that measure to [the Hickses]177-the hickses . Even if it had been less pleasant to have [a big yacht]666-a big yacht at [their]177-the hickses door during the long golden days and the nights of silver fire , [the Hickses]177-the hickses ’ admiration for [Nick]170-nick would have made [Susy]159-susy suffer [them]177-the hickses gladly . [She]159-susy even began to be aware of a growing liking for [them]177-the hickses , a liking inspired by the very characteristics that would once have provoked [her]159-susy disapproval . [Susy]159-susy had had plenty of training in liking [common people with big purses]667-common people with big purses ; in such cases [her]159-susy stock of allowances and extenuations was inexhaustible . But [they]177-the hickses had to be [successful common people]668-successful common people ; and the trouble was that [the Hickses]669-the hickses , judged by [her]159-susy standards , were failures . It was not only that [they]669-the hickses were ridiculous ; so , heaven knew , were [many of [[their]669-the hickses rivals]671-their rivals]670-many of their rivals . But [the Hickses]177-the hickses were both ridiculous and unsuccessful . [They]669-the hickses had consistently resisted the efforts of [the experienced advisers who had first descried [them]669-the hickses on the horizon and tried to help [them]669-the hickses upward]672-the experienced advisers who had first descried them on the horizon and tried to help them upward . [They]669-the hickses were always taking up [the wrong people]673-the wrong people , giving the wrong kind of party , and spending millions on things that [nobody who mattered]674-nobody who mattered cared about . [They]669-the hickses all believed passionately in “ movements ”[669-the hickses] and “ causes ”[669-the hickses] and “ ideals , ”[669-the hickses] and were always attended by [the exponents of [their]669-the hickses latest beliefs]675-the exponents of their latest beliefs , always asking [you]676-you to hear lectures by [haggard women in peplums]677-haggard women in peplums , and having [their]669-the hickses portraits painted by [wild people who never turned out to be the fashion]678-wild people who never turned out to be the fashion . All this would formerly have increased [Susy]159-susy ’s contempt ; now [she]159-susy found [herself]159-susy liking [the Hickses]669-the hickses most for [their]669-the hickses failings . [She]159-susy was touched by [their]669-the hickses simple good faith , [their]669-the hickses isolation in the midst of all [[their]669-the hickses queer apostles]680-their queer apostles and parasites , [their]669-the hickses way of drifting about [an alien and indifferent world]681-an alien and indifferent world in [a compactly clinging group of which [Eldorada Tooker]205-eldorada]682-a compactly clinging group of which eldorada tooker , [the doctor]683-the doctor and [the two secretaries]684-the two secretaries formed the outer fringe , and by [their]669-the hickses view of [themselves]669-the hickses as a kind of collective re - incarnation of some past state of [princely culture]685-princely culture , symbolised for [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick in what [she]159-susy called “ [the court of the Renaissance]2317-the court of the renaissance . ”[159-susy] [Eldorada]205-eldorada , of course , was [[their]669-the hickses chief prophetess]686-their chief prophetess ; but even [the intensely “ bright ”[159-susy] and modern young secretaries]687-the intensely “ bright ” and modern young secretaries , [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck and [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles , showed a touching tendency to share [her]159-susy view , and spoke of [Mr. Hicks]170-nick as “ promoting art , ”[170-nick] in the spirit of [Pandolfino]209-pandolfino celebrating the munificence of [the Medicis]688-the medicis . “ [I]159-susy ’m getting really fond of [the Hickses]177-the hickses ; [I]159-susy believe [I]159-susy should be nice to [them]177-the hickses even if [they]177-the hickses were staying at [Danieli ’s]44-danieli ’s , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy said to [Strefford]267-strefford . “ And even if [you]159-susy owned [the yacht]2318-the yacht ? ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford answered ; and for once [his]267-strefford banter struck [her]159-susy as beside the point . [The Ibis]170-nick carried [them]689-they , during the endless June days , far and wide along [the enchanted shores]690-the enchanted shores ; [they]689-they roamed among [the Euganeans]210-the euganeans , [they]689-they saw [Aquileia]38-aquileia and [Pomposa]45-pomposa and [Ravenna]46-ravenna . [[Their]689-they hosts]691-their hosts would gladly have taken [them]689-they farther , across [the Adriatic]47-the adriatic and on into [the golden network of [the Ægean]48-the ægean]692-the golden network of the ægean ; but [Susy]159-susy resisted this infraction of [Nick]170-nick ’s rules , and [he]170-nick [himself]170-nick preferred to stick to [his]170-nick task . Only now [he]170-nick wrote in the early mornings , so that on most days [they]689-they could set out before noon and steam back late to the low fringe of lights on [the lagoon]527-the lagoon . [His]170-nick work continued to progress , and as page was added to page [Susy]159-susy obscurely but surely perceived that [each one]694-each one corresponded with a hidden secretion of energy , the gradual forming within [him]170-nick of something that might eventually alter both [their]689-they lives . In what sense [she]159-susy could not conjecture : [she]159-susy merely felt that the fact of [his]170-nick having chosen a job and stuck to it , if only through a few rosy summer weeks , had already given [him]170-nick a new way of saying “ Yes ”[159-susy] and “ No . ”[159-susy] VII . OF some new ferment at work in [him]170-nick [Nick Lansing]170-nick [himself]170-nick was equally aware . [He]170-nick was a better judge of the book [he]170-nick was trying to write than either [Susy]159-susy or [Strefford]267-strefford ; [he]170-nick knew its weaknesses , [its]695-its treacheries , its tendency to slip through [his]170-nick fingers just as [he]170-nick thought [his]170-nick grasp tightest ; but [he]170-nick knew also that at the very moment when it seemed to have failed [him]170-nick it would suddenly be back , beating its loud wings in [his]170-nick face . [He]170-nick had no delusions as to its commercial value , and had winced more than [he]170-nick triumphed when [Susy]159-susy produced [her]159-susy allusion to [Marius]192-marius . [His]170-nick book was to be called The Pageant of [Alexander]211-alexander . [His]170-nick imagination had been enchanted by the idea of picturing [the young conqueror]696-the young conqueror ’s advance through [the fabulous landscapes of [Asia]49-asia]697-the fabulous landscapes of asia : [he]170-nick liked writing descriptions , and vaguely felt that under the guise of fiction [he]170-nick could develop [his]170-nick theory of Oriental influences in Western art at the expense of less learning than if [he]170-nick had tried to put [his]170-nick ideas into an essay . [He]170-nick knew enough of [his]170-nick subject to know that [he]170-nick did not know enough to write about it ; but [he]170-nick consoled [himself]170-nick by remembering that [Wilhelm Meister]212-wilhelm meister has survived many weighty volumes on aesthetics ; and between [his]170-nick moments of self - disgust [he]170-nick took [himself]170-nick at [Susy]159-susy ’s valuation , and found an unmixed joy in [his]170-nick task . Never -- no , never!--had [he]170-nick been so boundlessly , so confidently happy . [His]170-nick hack - work had given [him]170-nick the habit of application , and now habit wore the glow of inspiration . [His]170-nick previous literary ventures had been timid and tentative : if [this one]698-this one was growing and strengthening on [his]170-nick hands , it must be because the conditions were so different . [He]170-nick was at ease , [he]170-nick was secure , [he]170-nick was satisfied ; and [he]170-nick had also , for the first time since [his]170-nick early youth , before [[his]170-nick mother]699-his mother ’s death , the sense of having [some one to look after]700-some one to look after , [some one who was [his]170-nick own particular care , and to whom [he]170-nick was answerable for [himself]170-nick and [his]170-nick actions]701-some one who was his own particular care , and to whom he was answerable for himself and his actions , as [he]170-nick had never felt [himself]170-nick answerable to [the hurried and indifferent people among whom [he]170-nick had chosen to live]702-the hurried and indifferent people among whom he had chosen to live . [Susy]159-susy had the same standards as [these people]703-these people : [she]159-susy spoke [their]703-these people language , though [she]159-susy understood [others]397-others , [she]159-susy required [their]703-these people pleasures if [she]159-susy did not revere [[their]703-these people gods]705-their gods . But from the moment that [she]159-susy had become [his]170-nick property [he]170-nick had built up in [himself]170-nick a conception of [her]159-susy answering to some deep - seated need of veneration . [She]159-susy was [his]170-nick , [he]170-nick had chosen [her]159-susy , [she]159-susy had taken [her]159-susy place in the long line of [Lansing women who had been loved , honoured , and probably deceived , by [bygone Lansing men]707-bygone lansing men]706-lansing women who had been loved , honoured , and probably deceived , by bygone lansing men . [He]170-nick did n’t pretend to understand the logic of it ; but the fact that [she]159-susy was [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife gave purpose and continuity to [his]170-nick scattered impulses , and a mysterious glow of consecration to [his]170-nick task . Once or twice , in the first days of [his]170-nick marriage , [he]170-nick had asked [himself]170-nick with a slight shiver what would happen if [Susy]159-susy should begin to bore [him]170-nick . The thing had happened to [him]170-nick with other women as to whom [his]170-nick first emotions had not differed in intensity from those [she]159-susy inspired . The part [he]170-nick had played in [his]170-nick previous love - affairs might indeed have been summed up in the memorable line : “ [I]170-nick am [the hunter]2319-the hunter and the prey , ”[170-nick] for [he]170-nick had invariably ceased to be the first only to regard [himself]170-nick as the second . This experience had never ceased to cause [him]170-nick the liveliest pain , since [his]170-nick sympathy for [[his]170-nick pursuer]709-his pursuer was only less keen than [his]170-nick commiseration for [himself]170-nick ; but as [he]170-nick was always a little sorrier for [himself]170-nick , [he]170-nick had always ended by distancing [the pursuer]710-the pursuer . All these pre - natal experiences now seemed utterly inapplicable to [the new man [he]170-nick had become]711-the new man he had become . [He]170-nick could not imagine being bored by [Susy]159-susy -- or trying to escape from [her]159-susy if [he]170-nick were . [He]170-nick could not think of [her]159-susy as [an enemy]712-an enemy , or even as [an accomplice]713-an accomplice , since [accomplices]714-accomplices are [potential enemies]715-potential enemies : [she]159-susy was [some one with whom , by some unheard - of miracle , joys above the joys of friendship were to be tasted , but who , even through these fleeting ecstasies]716-some one with whom , by some unheard - of miracle , joys above the joys of friendship were to be tasted , but who , even through these fleeting ecstasies , remained simply and securely [[his]170-nick friend]717-his friend . These new feelings did not affect [his]170-nick general attitude toward life : they merely confirmed [his]170-nick faith in its ultimate “ jolliness . ”[170-nick] Never had [he]170-nick more thoroughly enjoyed the things [he]170-nick had always enjoyed . A good dinner had never been as good to [him]170-nick , a beautiful sunset as beautiful ; [he]170-nick still rejoiced in the fact that [he]170-nick appreciated both with an equal acuity . [He]170-nick was as proud as ever of [Susy]159-susy ’s cleverness and freedom from prejudice : [she]159-susy could n’t be too “ modern ”[159-susy] for [him]170-nick now that [she]159-susy was [his]170-nick . [He]170-nick shared to the full [her]159-susy passionate enjoyment of the present , and all [her]159-susy feverish eagerness to make it last . [He]170-nick knew when [she]159-susy was thinking of ways of extending [their]718-their golden opportunity , and [he]170-nick secretly thought with [her]159-susy , wondering what new means [they]718-their could devise . [He]170-nick was thankful that [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie was still absent , and began to hope [they]718-their might have [the palace]613-the palace to [themselves]718-their for the remainder of the summer . If [they]718-their did , [he]170-nick would have time to finish [his]170-nick book , and [Susy]159-susy to lay up a little interest on [their]718-their wedding cheques ; and thus [their]718-their enchanted year might conceivably be prolonged to two . Late as the season was , [their]718-their presence and [Strefford]267-strefford ’s in [Venice]15-venice had already drawn thither [several wandering members of [their]718-their set]720-several wandering members of their set . It was characteristic of [these indifferent but agglutinative people]721-these indifferent but agglutinative people that [they]721-these indifferent but agglutinative people could never remain long parted from each other without a dim sense of uneasiness . [Lansing]170-nick was familiar with the feeling . [He]170-nick had known slight twinges of it [himself]170-nick , and had often ministered to its qualms in [others]397-others . It was hardly stronger than the faint gnawing which recalls the tea - hour to one who has lunched well and is sure of dining as abundantly ; but it gave a purpose to the purposeless , and helped many hesitating spirits over the annual difficulty of deciding between [Deauville]33-deauville and [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz , [Biarritz]50-biarritz and [Capri]31-capri . [Nick]170-nick was not surprised to learn that it was becoming the fashion , that summer , to pop down to [Venice]15-venice and take a look at [the Lansings]200-nick . [Streffy]164-streffy had set the example , and [Streffy]164-streffy ’s example was always followed . And then [Susy]159-susy ’s marriage was still a subject of sympathetic speculation . [People]421-people knew the story of the wedding cheques , and were interested in seeing how long [they]721-these indifferent but agglutinative people could be made to last . It was going to be the thing , that year , to help prolong the honey - moon by pressing houses on [the adventurous couple]724-the adventurous couple . Before [June]214-june was over [a band of [friends]726-friends]725-a band of friends were basking with [the Lansings]200-nick on [the Lido]34-the lido . [Nick]200-nick found [himself]200-nick unexpectedly disturbed by [their]725-a band of friends arrival . To avoid comment and banter [he]200-nick put [his]200-nick book aside and forbade [Susy]159-susy to speak of it , explaining to [her]159-susy that [he]200-nick needed an interval of rest . [[His]200-nick wife]332-his wife instantly and exaggeratedly adopted this view , guarding [him]200-nick from the temptation to work as jealously as [she]332-his wife had discouraged [him]200-nick from idling ; and [he]200-nick was careful not to let [her]332-his wife find out that the change in [his]200-nick habits coincided with [his]200-nick having reached a difficult point in [his]200-nick book . But though [he]200-nick was not sorry to stop writing [he]200-nick found [himself]200-nick unexpectedly oppressed by the weight of [his]200-nick leisure . For the first time [communal dawdling]215-communal dawdling had lost its charm for [him]200-nick ; not because [[his]200-nick fellow dawdlers]728-his fellow dawdlers were less congenial than of old , but because in the interval [he]200-nick had known something so immeasurably better . [He]200-nick had always felt [himself]200-nick to be [the superior of [[his]200-nick habitual associates]730-his habitual associates]729-the superior of his habitual associates , but now the advantage was too great : really , in a sense , it was hardly fair to [them]730-his habitual associates . [He]200-nick had flattered [himself]200-nick that [Susy]159-susy would share this feeling ; but [he]200-nick perceived with annoyance that the arrival of [[their]731-their friends]629-their friends heightened [her]159-susy animation . It was as if the inward glow which had given [her]159-susy a new beauty were now refracted upon [her]159-susy by the presence of [the very people [they]731-their had come to [Venice]15-venice to avoid]733-the very people they had come to venice to avoid . [Lansing]170-nick was vaguely irritated ; and when [he]170-nick asked [her]159-susy how [she]159-susy liked being with [[their]731-their old crowd]734-their old crowd again [his]170-nick irritation was increased by [her]159-susy answering with a laugh that [she]159-susy only hoped [the poor dears]735-the poor dears did n’t see too plainly how [they]735-the poor dears bored [her]159-susy . The patent insincerity of the reply was a shock to [Lansing]170-nick . [He]170-nick knew that [Susy]159-susy was not really bored , and [he]170-nick understood that [she]159-susy had simply guessed [his]170-nick feelings and instinctively adopted them : that henceforth [she]159-susy was always going to think as [he]170-nick thought . To confirm this fear [he]170-nick said carelessly : “ Oh , all the same , it ’s rather jolly knocking about with [them]735-the poor dears again for a bit ; ”[170-nick] and [she]159-susy answered at once , and with equal conviction : “ Yes , is n’t it ? [The old darlings]2320-the old darlings -- all the same ! ”[159-susy] A fear of the future again laid its cold touch on [Lansing]170-nick . [Susy]159-susy ’s independence and self - sufficiency had been among [her]159-susy chief attractions ; if [she]159-susy were to turn into an echo [their]736-their delicious duet ran the risk of becoming the dullest of monologues . [He]170-nick forgot that five minutes earlier [he]170-nick had resented [her]159-susy being glad to see [[their]736-their friends]629-their friends , and for a moment [he]170-nick found [himself]170-nick leaning dizzily over that insoluble riddle of the sentimental life : that to be differed with is exasperating , and to be agreed with monotonous . Once more [he]170-nick began to wonder if [he]170-nick were not fundamentally unfitted for the married state ; and was saved from despair only by remembering that [Susy]159-susy ’s subjection to [his]170-nick moods was not likely to last . But even then it never occurred to [him]170-nick to reflect that [his]170-nick apprehensions were superfluous , since [their]736-their tie was avowedly a temporary one . Of the special understanding on which [their]736-their marriage had been based not a trace remained in [his]170-nick thoughts of [her]159-susy ; the idea that [he]738-he or [she]739-she might ever renounce [each other]2188-each other for [their]736-their mutual good had long since dwindled to the ghost of an old joke . It was borne in on [him]170-nick , after a week or two of unbroken sociability , that of all [[his]170-nick old friends]741-his old friends it was [the Mortimer Hickses who bored [him]170-nick the least]177-the hickses . [The Hickses]669-the hickses had left [the Ibis]170-nick for [an apartment in [a vast dilapidated palace near [the Canareggio]51-the canareggio]744-a vast dilapidated palace near the canareggio]743-an apartment in a vast dilapidated palace near the canareggio . [They]669-the hickses had hired [the apartment]745-the apartment from [a painter]746-a painter ( one of [their]669-the hickses newest discoveries ) , and [they]669-the hickses put up philosophically with the absence of modern conveniences in order to secure the inestimable advantage of “ atmosphere . ”[746-a painter] In this privileged air [they]669-the hickses gathered about [them]669-the hickses [[their]669-the hickses usual mixed company of [quiet studious people]748-quiet studious people]747-their usual mixed company of quiet studious people and [noisy exponents of new theories]749-noisy exponents of new theories , [themselves]669-the hickses totally unconscious of the disparity between [[their]669-the hickses different guests]750-their different guests , and beamingly convinced that at last [they]669-the hickses were seated at the source of wisdom . In old days [Lansing]170-nick would have got half an hour ’s amusement , followed by a long evening of boredom , from the sight of [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick , vast and jewelled , seated between [a quiet - looking professor of archaeology]751-a quiet - looking professor of archaeology and [a large - browed composer]752-a large - browed composer , or [the high priest of a new dance - step]753-the high priest of a new dance - step , while [Mr. Hicks]170-nick , beaming above [his]170-nick vast white waistcoat , saw to it that the champagne flowed more abundantly than the talk , and [the bright young secretaries]754-the bright young secretaries industriously “ kept up ”[754-the bright young secretaries] with the dizzy cross - current of prophecy and erudition . But a change had come over [Lansing]170-nick . Hitherto it was in contrast to [[his]170-nick own friends]755-his own friends that [the Hickses]177-the hickses had seemed most insufferable ; now it was as an escape from [these same friends]756-these same friends that [they]177-the hickses had become not only sympathetic but even interesting . It was something , after all , to be with people who did not regard [Venice]15-venice simply as affording exceptional opportunities for bathing and adultery , but who were reverently if confusedly aware that [they]669-the hickses were in the presence of something unique and ineffable , and determined to make the utmost of [their]669-the hickses privilege . “ After all , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said to [himself]170-nick one evening , as [his]170-nick eyes wandered , with somewhat of a convalescent ’s simple joy , from one to another of [their]177-the hickses large confiding faces , “ after all , [they]177-the hickses ’ve got a religion .... ”[170-nick] The phrase struck [him]170-nick , in the moment of using it , as indicating a new element in [his]170-nick own state of mind , and as being , in fact , the key to [his]170-nick new feeling about [the Hickses]669-the hickses . [Their]177-the hickses muddled ardour for great things was related to [his]170-nick own new view of [the universe]758-the universe : [the people who felt , however dimly , the wonder and weight of life]759-the people who felt , however dimly , the wonder and weight of life must ever after be nearer to [him]170-nick than [those to whom it was estimated solely by one]760-those to whom it was estimated solely by one ’s balance at the bank . [He]170-nick supposed , on reflexion , that that was what [he]170-nick meant when [he]170-nick thought of [the Hickses]669-the hickses as having “ a religion ”[170-nick] .... A few days later , [his]170-nick well - being was unexpectedly disturbed by the arrival of [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow . [Lansing]170-nick had always felt a tolerant liking for [Gillow]167-fred gillow , [a large smiling silent young man]762-a large smiling silent young man with an intense and serious desire to miss nothing attainable by one of [his]170-nick fortune and standing . What use [he]170-nick made of [his]170-nick experiences , [Lansing]170-nick , who had always gone into [his]170-nick own modest adventures rather thoroughly , had never been able to guess ; but [he]170-nick had always suspected [the prodigal Fred]763-the prodigal fred of being no more than [a well - disguised looker - on]764-a well - disguised looker - on . Now for the first time [he]170-nick began to view [him]763-the prodigal fred with another eye . [The Gillows]162-the gillows were , in fact , the one uneasy point in [Nick]170-nick ’s conscience . [He]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy from the first , had talked of [them]669-the hickses less than of [any other members of [[their]669-the hickses group]766-their group]765-any other members of their group : [they]669-the hickses had tacitly avoided the name from the day on which [Susy]159-susy had come to [[Lansing]170-nick ’s lodgings]767-lansing ’s lodgings to say that [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula had asked [her]168-ursula to renounce [him]170-nick , till that other day , just before [their]669-the hickses marriage , when [she]168-ursula had met [him]170-nick with the rapturous cry : “ Here ’s [our]669-the hickses first wedding present ! Such a thumping big cheque from [Fred]162-the gillows and [Ursula]168-ursula ! ”[168-ursula] [Plenty of sympathizing people]768-plenty of sympathizing people were ready , [Lansing]170-nick knew , to tell [him]170-nick just what had happened in the interval between those two dates ; but [he]170-nick had taken care not to ask . [He]170-nick had even affected an initiation so complete that [the friends who burned to enlighten [him]170-nick]769-the friends who burned to enlighten him were discouraged by [his]170-nick so obviously knowing more than [they]769-the friends who burned to enlighten him ; and gradually [he]170-nick had worked [himself]170-nick around to [their]769-the friends who burned to enlighten him view , and had taken it for granted that [he]170-nick really did . Now [he]170-nick perceived that [he]170-nick knew nothing at all , and that the “ Hullo , [old Fred]162-the gillows ! ”[159-susy] with which [Susy]159-susy hailed [Gillow]168-ursula ’s arrival might be either the usual tribal welcome -- since [they]769-the friends who burned to enlighten him were all “ old , ”[769-the friends who burned to enlighten him] and all nicknamed , in [their]769-the friends who burned to enlighten him private jargon -- or a greeting that concealed inscrutable depths of complicity . [Susy]159-susy was visibly glad to see [Gillow]168-ursula ; but [she]159-susy was glad of everything just then , and so glad to show [her]159-susy gladness ! The fact disarmed [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband and made [him]327-her husband ashamed of [his]327-her husband uneasiness . “ [You]327-her husband ought to have thought this all out sooner , or else [you]327-her husband ought to chuck thinking of it at all , ”[327-her husband] was the sound but ineffectual advice [he]327-her husband gave [himself]327-her husband on the day after [Gillow]168-ursula ’s arrival ; and immediately set to work to rethink the whole matter . [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow showed no consciousness of disturbing [any one]2257-any one ’s peace of mind . Day after day [he]327-her husband sprawled for hours on [the Lido sands]772-the lido sands , [his]327-her husband arms folded under [his]327-her husband head , listening to [Streffy]164-streffy ’s nonsense and watching [Susy]159-susy between sleepy lids ; but [he]327-her husband betrayed no desire to see [her]159-susy alone , or to draw [her]159-susy into talk apart from [the others]2262-the others . More than ever [he]327-her husband seemed content to be [the gratified spectator of a costly show]774-the gratified spectator of a costly show got up for [his]327-her husband private entertainment . It was not until [he]327-her husband heard [her]159-susy , one morning , grumble a little at the increasing heat and the menace of mosquitoes , that [he]327-her husband said , quite as if [they]775-they had talked the matter over long before , and finally settled it : “ [The moor]2321-the moor will be ready any time after the first of August . ”[327-her husband] [Nick]170-nick fancied that [Susy]159-susy coloured a little , and drew [herself]159-susy up more defiantly than usual as [she]159-susy sent a pebble skimming across the dying ripples at [their]775-they feet . “ [You]159-susy ’ll be a lot cooler in [Scotland]30-scotland , ”[167-fred gillow] [Fred]167-fred gillow added , with what , for [him]327-her husband , was an unusual effort at explicitness . “ Oh , shall [we]775-they ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy retorted gaily ; and added with an air of mystery and importance , pivoting about on [her]159-susy high heels : “ [Nick]170-nick ’s got work to do [here]2184-here . It will probably keep [us]775-they all summer . ”[159-susy] “ Work ? Rot ! [You]159-susy ’ll die of the smells . ”[167-fred gillow] [Gillow]167-fred gillow stared perplexedly skyward from under [his]327-her husband tilted hat - brim ; and then brought out , as from the depth of a rankling grievance : “ [I]167-fred gillow thought it was all understood . ”[167-fred gillow] “ Why , ”[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick asked [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife that night , as [they]775-they re - entered [[Ellie]184-ellie ’s cool drawing - room]777-ellie ’s cool drawing - room after a late dinner at [the Lido]34-the lido , “ did [Gillow]167-fred gillow think it was understood that [we]775-they were going to [[his]170-nick moor]2323-his moor in August ? ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick was conscious of the oddness of speaking of [[their]775-they friend]778-their friend by [his]327-her husband surname , and reddened at [his]170-nick blunder . [Susy]159-susy had let [her]159-susy lace cloak slide to [her]159-susy feet , and stood before [him]170-nick in [the faintly - lit room]779-the faintly - lit room , slim and shimmering - white through black transparencies . [She]159-susy raised [her]159-susy eyebrows carelessly . “ [I]159-susy told [you]170-nick long ago [he]170-nick ’d asked [us]775-they [there]2229-there for August . ”[159-susy] “ [You]170-nick did n’t tell [me]159-susy [you]170-nick ’d accepted . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy smiled as if [he]170-nick had said something as simple as [Fred]167-fred gillow . “ [I]159-susy accepted everything -- from [everybody]2183-everybody ! ”[159-susy] What could [he]170-nick answer ? It was the very principle on which [their]780-their bargain had been struck . And if [he]170-nick were to say : “ Ah , but this is different , because [I]170-nick ’m jealous of [Gillow]167-fred gillow , ”[170-nick] what light would such an answer shed on [his]170-nick past ? The time for being jealous -- if so antiquated an attitude were on any ground defensible -- would have been before [his]170-nick marriage , and before the acceptance of the bounties which had helped to make it possible . [He]170-nick wondered a little now that in those days such scruples had not troubled [him]170-nick . [His]170-nick inconsistency irritated [him]170-nick , and increased [his]170-nick irritation against [Gillow]167-fred gillow . “ [I]170-nick suppose [he]170-nick thinks [he]170-nick owns [us]2326-us ! ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick grumbled inwardly . [He]170-nick had thrown [himself]170-nick into an armchair , and [Susy]159-susy , advancing across the shining arabesques of the floor , slid down at [his]170-nick feet , pressed [her]159-susy slender length against [him]170-nick , and whispered with lifted face and lips close to [his]170-nick : “ [We]2326-us need n’t ever go anywhere [you]170-nick do n’t want to . ”[159-susy] For once [her]159-susy submission was sweet , and folding [her]159-susy close [he]170-nick whispered back through [his]170-nick kiss : “ Not there , then . ”[170-nick] In [her]159-susy response to [his]170-nick embrace [he]170-nick felt the acquiescence of [her]159-susy whole happy self in whatever future [he]170-nick decided on , if only it gave [them]781-them enough of such moments as this ; and as [they]781-them held each other fast in silence [his]170-nick doubts and distrust began to seem like a silly injustice . “ Let [us]2326-us stay [here]2184-here as long as ever [Ellie]184-ellie will let [us]2326-us , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said , as if the shadowy walls and shining floors were a magic boundary drawn about [his]170-nick happiness . [She]159-susy murmured [her]159-susy assent and stood up , stretching [her]159-susy sleepy arm above [her]159-susy shoulders . “ How dreadfully late it is .... Will [you]170-nick unhook [me]159-susy ? ... Oh , there ’s a telegram . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy picked it up from the table , and tearing it open stared a moment at the message . “ It ’s from [Ellie]184-ellie . [She]184-ellie ’s coming to - morrow . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy turned to the window and strayed out onto [the balcony]554-the balcony . [Nick]170-nick followed [her]159-susy with enlacing arm . [The canal below [them]784-them]783-the canal below them lay in moonless shadow , barred with a few lingering lights . A last snatch of gondola - music came from far off , carried upward on a sultry gust . “ [Dear old Ellie]184-ellie . All the same ... [I]159-susy wish all this belonged to [you]184-ellie and [me]159-susy . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy sighed . [VIII]216-viii . IT was not [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s fault if , after [her]159-susy arrival , [[her]159-susy palace]785-her palace seemed to belong any less to [the Lansings]200-nick . [She]159-susy arrived in a mood of such general benevolence that it was impossible for [Susy]159-susy , when [they]784-them finally found [themselves]784-them alone , to make [her]159-susy view even [her]159-susy own recent conduct in any but the most benevolent light . “ [I]159-susy knew [you]159-susy ’d be [the veriest angel about it all]2328-the veriest angel about it all , [darling]2329-darling , because [I]159-susy knew [you]159-susy ’d understand [me]159-susy -- especially now , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy declared , [her]159-susy slim hands in [Susy]159-susy ’s , [her]159-susy big eyes ( so like [Clarissa]187-clarissa ’s ) resplendent with past pleasures and future plans . The expression of [her]159-susy confidence was unexpectedly distasteful to [Susy Lansing]159-susy , who had never lent so cold an ear to [such warm avowals]786-such warm avowals . [She]159-susy had always imagined that being [happy one]787-happy one ’s self made one -- as [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn appeared to assume -- more tolerant of the happiness of others , of however doubtful elements composed ; and [she]159-susy was almost ashamed of responding so languidly to [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s outpourings . But [she]159-susy [herself]159-susy had no desire to confide [her]159-susy bliss to [Ellie]184-ellie ; and why should not [Ellie]184-ellie observe a similar reticence ? “ It was all so perfect -- [you]159-susy see , [dearest]2233-dearest , [I]568-that lady was meant to be happy , ”[568-that lady] [that lady]568-that lady continued , as if the possession of so unusual a characteristic singled [her]568-that lady out for special privileges . [Susy]159-susy , with a certain sharpness , responded that [she]159-susy had always supposed [we]790-we all were . “ Oh , no , [dearest]2233-dearest : not [governesses]2332-governesses and [mothers]2333-mothers - in - law and [companions]2334-companions , and [that sort of people]2335-that sort of people . [They]2335-that sort of people would n’t know how if [they]2335-that sort of people tried . But [you]159-susy and [I]159-susy , [darling--]2336-darling-- ”[159-susy] “ Oh , [I]159-susy do n’t consider [myself]159-susy in any way exceptional , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy intervened . [She]159-susy longed to add : “ Not in [your]159-susy way , at any rate-- ”[159-susy] but a few minutes earlier [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn had told [her]159-susy that [the palace]613-the palace was at [her]159-susy disposal for the rest of the summer , and that [she]159-susy [herself]159-susy was only going to perch there -- if [they]792-they ’d let her!--long enough to gather up [her]159-susy things and start for [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz . The memory of this announcement had the effect of curbing [Susy]159-susy ’s irony , and of making [her]159-susy shift the conversation to the safer if scarcely less absorbing topic of the number of day and evening dresses required for a season at [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz . As [she]159-susy listened to [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn -- no less eloquent on this theme than on the other -- [Susy]159-susy began to measure the gulf between [her]159-susy past and present . “ This is the life [I]159-susy used to lead ; these are the things [I]159-susy used to live for , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought , as [she]159-susy stood before the outspread glories of [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s wardrobe . Not that [she]159-susy did not still care : [she]159-susy could not look at [Ellie]184-ellie ’s laces and silks and furs without picturing [herself]159-susy in them , and wondering by what new miracle of management [she]159-susy could give [herself]159-susy the air of being dressed by [the same consummate artists]793-the same consummate artists . But these had become minor interests : the past few months had given [her]159-susy a new perspective , and the thing that most puzzled and disconcerted [her]159-susy about [Ellie]184-ellie was the fact that love and finery and bridge and dining - out were seemingly all on the same plane to [her]159-susy . The inspection of the dresses lasted a long time , and was marked by many fluctuations of mood on the part of [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn , who passed from comparative hopefulness to despair at the total inadequacy of [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn wardrobe . It would n’t do to go to [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz looking like a frump , and yet there was no time to get anything sent from [Paris]4-paris , and , whatever [she]159-susy did , [she]159-susy was n’t going to show [herself]159-susy in any dowdy re - arrangements done at [home]606-home . But suddenly light broke on [her]159-susy , and [she]159-susy clasped [her]159-susy hands for joy . “ Why , [Nelson’ll]217-nelson’ll bring [them]2337-them -- [I’d]159-susy forgotten all about [Nelson]222-nelson ! There ’ll be just time if [I]159-susy wire to [him]222-nelson at once . ”[159-susy] “ Is [Nelson]222-nelson going to join [you]159-susy at [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy asked , surprised . “ Heavens , no ! [He]222-nelson ’s coming here to pick up [Clarissa]187-clarissa and take [her]187-clarissa to some stuffy cure in [Austria]53-austria with [[his]222-nelson mother]699-his mother . It ’s too lucky : there ’s just time to telegraph [him]222-nelson to bring [my]159-susy things . [I]159-susy did n’t mean to wait for [him]222-nelson ; but it wo n’t delay [me]159-susy more than day or two . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy ’s heart sank . [She]159-susy was not much afraid of [Ellie]184-ellie alone , but [Ellie]184-ellie and [Nelson]222-nelson together formed an incalculable menace . [No one]534-no one could tell what spark of truth might dash from [their]796-their collision . [Susy]159-susy felt that [she]159-susy could deal with the two dangers separately and successively , but not together and simultaneously . “ But , [Ellie]184-ellie , why should [you]184-ellie wait for [Nelson]222-nelson ? [I]159-susy ’m certain to find someone here who ’s going to [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz and will take [your]184-ellie things if [he]222-nelson brings them . It ’s a pity to risk losing [[your]184-ellie rooms]2339-your rooms . ”[159-susy] This argument appealed for a moment to [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn . “ That ’s true ; [they]2340-they say all [the hotels]2341-the hotels are jammed . [[You]159-susy dear]2342-you dear , [you]159-susy ’re always so practical ! ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [She]188-mrs. vanderlyn clasped [Susy]159-susy to [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn scented bosom . “ And [you]159-susy know , [darling]2329-darling , [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’m sure [you]159-susy ’ll be glad to get rid of [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn -- [you]159-susy and [Nick]200-nick ! Oh , do n’t be hypocritical and say ‘ Nonsense ! ’ [You]159-susy see , [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn understand ... [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn used to think of [you]159-susy so often , [you]159-susy two ... during those blessed weeks when [we]798-their two were alone .... ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] The sudden tears , brimming over [Ellie]184-ellie ’s lovely eyes , and threatening to make the blue circles below them run into [the adjoining carmine]797-the adjoining carmine , filled [Susy]159-susy with compunction . “ [Poor thing]2344-poor thing -- oh , poor thing ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought ; and hearing [herself]159-susy called by [Nick]200-nick , who was waiting to take [her]159-susy out for [their]798-their usual sunset on [the lagoon]527-the lagoon , [she]159-susy felt a wave of pity for the deluded creature who would never taste that highest of imaginable joys . “ But all the same , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy reflected , as [she]159-susy hurried down to [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband , “ [I]159-susy ’m glad [I]159-susy persuaded [her]159-susy not to wait for [Nelson]222-nelson . ”[159-susy] Some days had elapsed since [Susy]159-susy and [Nick]200-nick had had a sunset to [themselves]798-their , and in the interval [Susy]159-susy had once again learned the superior quality of the sympathy that held [them]798-their together . [She]159-susy now viewed all the rest of life as no more than a show : a jolly show which it would have been a thousand pities to miss , but which , if the need arose , [they]798-their could get up and leave at any moment -- provided that [they]798-their left it together . In the dusk , while [their]798-their prow slid over [inverted palaces]801-inverted palaces , and through the scent of [hidden gardens]802-hidden gardens , [she]159-susy leaned against [him]200-nick and murmured , [her]159-susy mind returning to the recent scene with [Ellie]184-ellie : “ [Nick]200-nick , should [you]200-nick hate [me]184-ellie dreadfully if [I]184-ellie had no clothes ? ”[184-ellie] [[Her]159-susy husband]327-her husband was kindling a cigarette , and the match lit up the grin with which [he]327-her husband answered : “ But , [[my]327-her husband dear]445-my dear , have [I]327-her husband ever shown the slightest symptom-- ? ”[327-her husband] “ Oh , rubbish ! When [a woman]467-a woman says : ‘ No clothes , ’ [she]467-a woman means : ‘ Not the right clothes . ’ ”[327-her husband] [He]327-her husband took a meditative puff . “ Ah , [you]327-her husband ’ve been going over [Ellie]184-ellie ’s finery with [her]184-ellie . ”[327-her husband] “ Yes : all those trunks and trunks full . And [she]184-ellie finds [she]184-ellie ’s got nothing for [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz ! ”[327-her husband] “ Of course , ”[327-her husband] [he]327-her husband murmured , drowsy with content , and manifesting but a languid interest in the subject of [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s wardrobe . “ Only fancy -- [she]184-ellie very nearly decided to stop over for [Nelson]222-nelson ’s arrival next week , so that [he]222-nelson might bring [her]184-ellie two or three more trunkfuls from [Paris]4-paris . But mercifully [I]327-her husband ’ve managed to persuade [her]184-ellie that it would be foolish to wait . ”[327-her husband] [Susy]159-susy felt a hardly perceptible shifting of [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s lounging body , and was aware , through all [her]159-susy watchful tentacles , of a widening of [his]327-her husband half - closed lids . “ [You]327-her husband ‘ managed’-- ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy fancied [he]327-her husband paused on the word ironically . “ But why ? ”[327-her husband] “ Why -- what ? ”[327-her husband] “ Why on earth should [you]327-her husband try to prevent [Ellie]184-ellie ’s waiting for [Nelson]222-nelson , if for once in [her]184-ellie life [she]184-ellie wants to ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy , conscious of reddening suddenly , drew back as though the leap of [her]159-susy tell - tale heart might have penetrated the blue flannel shoulder against which [she]159-susy leaned . “ Really , [dearest--]2347-dearest-- ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy murmured ; but with a sudden doggedness [he]327-her husband renewed [his]327-her husband “ Why ? ”[327-her husband] “ Because [she]184-ellie ’s in such a fever to get to [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz -- and in such a funk lest [the hotel]2348-the hotel should n’t keep [[her]184-ellie rooms]2349-her rooms , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy somewhat breathlessly produced . “ [Ah]2350-ah -- [I]159-susy see . ”[159-susy] [Nick]200-nick paused again . “ [You]159-susy ’re [a devoted friend]2351-a devoted friend , are n’t [you]159-susy ! ”[200-nick] “ What an odd question ! There ’s hardly anyone [I]332-his wife ’ve reason to be more devoted to than [Ellie]184-ellie , ”[332-his wife] [[his]327-her husband wife]332-his wife answered ; and [she]159-susy felt [his]327-her husband contrite clasp on [her]159-susy hand . “ [Darling]2329-darling ! No ; nor [I--]332-his wife . Or more grateful to for leaving [us]2353-us alone in [this heaven]2354-this heaven . ”[327-her husband] Dimness had fallen on [the waters]326-the waters , and [her]159-susy lifted lips met [his]327-her husband bending ones . Trailing late into dinner that evening , [Ellie]184-ellie announced that , after all , [she]184-ellie had decided it was safest to wait for [Nelson]222-nelson . “ [I]184-ellie should simply worry [myself]184-ellie ill if [I]184-ellie were n’t sure of getting [my]184-ellie things , ”[184-ellie] [she]184-ellie said , in the tone of tender solicitude with which [she]184-ellie always discussed [her]184-ellie own difficulties . “ After all , people who deny [themselves]2355-themselves everything do get warped and bitter , do n’t [they]2355-themselves ? ”[184-ellie] [she]184-ellie argued plaintively , [her]184-ellie lovely eyes wandering from one to the other of [[her]184-ellie assembled friends]807-her assembled friends . [Strefford]267-strefford remarked gravely that it was the complaint which had fatally undermined [his]267-strefford own health ; and in the laugh that followed the party drifted into [the great vaulted dining - room]808-the great vaulted dining - room . “ Oh , [I]809-his hostess do n’t mind [your]267-strefford laughing at [me]809-his hostess , [[Streffy]164-streffy darling]2356-streffy darling , ”[809-his hostess] [[his]267-strefford hostess]809-his hostess retorted , pressing [his]267-strefford arm against [her]809-his hostess own ; and [Susy]159-susy , receiving the shock of [their]810-their rapidly exchanged glance , said to [herself]159-susy , with a sharp twinge of apprehension : “ Of course [Streffy]164-streffy knows everything ; [he]164-streffy showed no surprise at finding [Ellie]184-ellie away when [he]164-streffy arrived . And if [he]164-streffy knows , what ’s to prevent [Nelson]222-nelson ’s finding out ? ”[159-susy] For [Strefford]267-strefford , in a mood of mischief , was no more to be trusted than [a malicious child]811-a malicious child . [Susy]159-susy instantly resolved to risk speaking to [him]267-strefford , if need be even betraying to [him]267-strefford the secret of the letters . Only by revealing the depth of [her]159-susy own danger could [she]159-susy hope to secure [his]267-strefford silence . On [the balcony]554-the balcony , late in the evening , while [the others]2262-the others were listening indoors to the low modulations of [a young composer who had embroidered [his]267-strefford fancies on [Browning]218-browning ’s “ Toccata]2357-a young composer who had embroidered his fancies on browning ’s “ toccata , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy found [her]159-susy chance . [Strefford]267-strefford , unsummoned , had followed [her]159-susy out , and stood silently smoking at [her]159-susy side . “ [You]159-susy see , [Streff]198-streff -- oh , why should [you]198-streff and [I]159-susy make mysteries to [each other]2188-each other ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy suddenly began . “ Why , indeed : but do [we]2359-we ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy glanced back at [the group around the piano]814-the group around the piano . “ About [Ellie]184-ellie , [I]159-susy mean -- and [Nelson]222-nelson . ”[159-susy] “ [Lord]2360-lord ! [Ellie]184-ellie and [Nelson]222-nelson ? [You]198-streff call that a mystery ? [I]159-susy should as soon apply the term to one of the million candle - power advertisements that adorn [[your]198-streff native thoroughfares]2361-your native thoroughfares . ”[159-susy] “ Well , yes . But-- ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy stopped again . Had [she]159-susy not tacitly promised [Ellie]184-ellie not to speak ? “ [[My]267-strefford [Susan]159-susy]2362-my susan , what ’s wrong ? ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford asked . “ [I]267-strefford do n’t know .... ”[267-strefford] “ Well , [I]159-susy do , then : [you]198-streff ’re afraid that , if [Ellie]184-ellie and [Nelson]222-nelson meet here , [she]159-susy ’ll blurt out something -- injudicious . ”[159-susy] “ Oh , [she]159-susy wo n’t ! ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy cried with conviction . “ Well , then -- who will ! [I]159-susy trust [that superhuman child]2363-that superhuman child not to . And [you]198-streff and [I]159-susy and [Nick--]219-nick-- ”[159-susy] “ Oh , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy gasped , interrupting [him]267-strefford , “ that ’s just it . [Nick]200-nick does n’t know ... does n’t even suspect . And if [he]200-nick did .... ”[159-susy] [Strefford]267-strefford flung away [his]267-strefford cigar and turned to scrutinize [her]159-susy . “ [I]267-strefford do n’t see -- hanged if [I]267-strefford do . What business is it of any of [us]2364-us , after all ? ”[267-strefford] That , of course , was the old view that cloaked connivance in an air of decency . But to [Susy]159-susy it no longer carried conviction , and [she]159-susy hesitated . “ If [Nick]200-nick should find out that [I]159-susy know .... ”[159-susy] “ [Good Lord]220-good lord -- doesn’t [he]200-nick know that [you]159-susy know ? After all , [I]159-susy suppose it ’s not the first time-- ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy remained silent . “ The first time [you]159-susy ’ve received confidences -- from [married friends]2365-married friends . Does [Nick]200-nick suppose [you]159-susy ’ve lived even to [your]159-susy tender age without ... Hang it , what ’s come over [you]159-susy , [child]2366-child ? ”[159-susy] What had , indeed , that [she]159-susy could make clear to [him]815-he ? And yet more than ever [she]159-susy felt the need of having [him]815-he securely on [her]159-susy side . Once [his]815-he word was pledged , [he]815-he was safe : otherwise there was no limit to [his]815-he capacity for wilful harmfulness . “ Look here , [Streff]198-streff , [you]198-streff and [I]159-susy know that [Ellie]184-ellie has n’t been away for a cure ; and that if poor [Clarissa]187-clarissa was sworn to secrecy it was not because it ‘ worries [father]2367-father ’ to think that [mother]2260-mother needs to take care of [her]2260-mother health . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy paused , hating [herself]159-susy for the ironic note [she]159-susy had tried to sound . “ Well-- ? ”[815-he] [he]815-he questioned , from the depths of the chair into which [he]815-he had sunk . “ Well , [Nick]200-nick does n’t ... does n’t dream of it . If [he]200-nick knew that [we]2369-we owed [our]2369-we summer here to ... to [my]815-he knowing .... ”[815-he] [Strefford]267-strefford sat silent : [she]159-susy felt [his]815-he astonished stare through the darkness . “ [Jove]221-jove ! ”[815-he] [he]815-he said at last , with a low whistle [Susy]159-susy bent over the balustrade , [her]159-susy heart thumping against the stone rail . “ What was left of soul , [I]816-the young composer wonder-- ? ”[816-the young composer] [the young composer]816-the young composer ’s voice shrilled through the open windows . [Strefford]267-strefford sank into another silence , from which [he]267-strefford roused [himself]267-strefford only as [Susy]159-susy turned back toward the lighted threshold . “ Well , [[my]815-he dear]445-my dear , [we]817-we ’ll see it through between [us]817-we ; [you]159-susy and [I]815-he -- and [Clarissa]187-clarissa , ”[815-he] [he]815-he said with [his]815-he rasping laugh , rising to follow [her]159-susy . [He]815-he caught [her]159-susy hand and gave it a short pressure as [they]817-we re - entered [the drawing - room]818-the drawing - room , where [Ellie]184-ellie was saying plaintively to [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow : “ [I]184-ellie can never hear that thing sung without wanting to cry like [a baby]2371-a baby . ”[184-ellie] [IX . NELSON VANDERLYN]222-nelson , still in [his]222-nelson travelling clothes , paused on the threshold of [[his]222-nelson own dining - room]819-his own dining - room and surveyed [the scene]820-the scene with pardonable satisfaction . [He]222-nelson was [a short round man , with a grizzled head , small facetious eyes and a large and credulous smile]821-a short round man , with a grizzled head , small facetious eyes and a large and credulous smile . Next to [Strefford]267-strefford , perched on [her]332-his wife high chair , [Clarissa]187-clarissa throned in infant beauty , while [Susy Lansing]159-susy cut up a peach for [her]332-his wife . Through wide orange awnings the sun slanted in upon [the white - clad group]823-the white - clad group . “ Well -- well -- well ! So [I]824-the happy father ’ve caught [you]187-clarissa at it ! ”[824-the happy father] cried [the happy father]824-the happy father , whose inveterate habit it was to address [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife and [friends]726-friends as if [he]222-nelson had surprised [them]827-them at an inopportune moment . It was two or three years since [Nick Lansing]170-nick had seen [Mr. Vanderlyn]223-mr. vanderlyn , who was now [the [London]54-london representative of [the big [New York]12-new york bank of [Vanderlyn]184-ellie & amp]830-the big new york bank of vanderlyn & amp]829-the london representative of the big new york bank of vanderlyn & amp ; [Co.]224-co. , and had exchanged [[his]223-mr. vanderlyn sumptuous house in [Fifth Avenue]8-fifth avenue]831-his sumptuous house in fifth avenue for another , more sumptuous still , in [Mayfair]56-mayfair ; and [the young man]370-the young man looked curiously and attentively at [[his]370-the young man host]833-his host . [Mr. Vanderlyn]223-mr. vanderlyn had grown older and stouter , but [his]223-mr. vanderlyn face still kept its look of somewhat worn optimism . [He]223-mr. vanderlyn embraced [[his]223-mr. vanderlyn wife]332-his wife , greeted [Susy]159-susy affectionately , and distributed cordial hand - grasps to [the two men]835-the two men . “ [Hullo]225-hullo , ”[223-mr. vanderlyn] [he]223-mr. vanderlyn exclaimed , suddenly noticing a pearl and coral trinket hanging from [Clarissa]187-clarissa ’s neck . “ Who ’s been giving [[my]223-mr. vanderlyn daughter]2372-my daughter jewellery , [I]223-mr. vanderlyn ’d like to know ! ”[223-mr. vanderlyn] “ Oh , [Streffy]164-streffy did -- just think , [father]2367-father ! But why was [he]267-strefford embarrassed , whose attention did [he]267-strefford wish to divert , It was plain that [Vanderlyn]187-clarissa ’s protest had been merely formal : like [most of the wealthy]840-most of the wealthy , [he]222-nelson had only the dimmest notion of what money represented to [the poor]841-the poor . But it was unusual for [Strefford]267-strefford to give [any one]2257-any one a present , and especially an expensive one : perhaps that was what had fixed [Vanderlyn]187-clarissa ’s attention . “ A windfall ? ”[222-nelson] [he]222-nelson gaily repeated . “ Oh , a tiny one : [I]267-strefford was offered a thumping rent for [[my]267-strefford little place at [Como]5-como]2377-my little place at como , and dashed over here to squander [my]267-strefford millions with the rest of [you]2378-you , ”[267-strefford] said [Strefford]267-strefford imperturbably . [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson ’s first word to [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife had been that [he]222-nelson had brought [her]332-his wife all [her]332-his wife toggery ; and [she]332-his wife had welcomed [him]222-nelson with appropriate enthusiasm . In fact , to [the lookers - on]846-the lookers - on [her]332-his wife joy at seeing [him]222-nelson seemed rather too patently in proportion to [her]332-his wife satisfaction at getting [her]332-his wife clothes . But no such suspicion appeared to mar [Mr. Vanderlyn]223-mr. vanderlyn ’s happiness in being , for once , and for nearly twenty - four hours , under the same roof with [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife and [child]2366-child . [He]222-nelson did not conceal [his]222-nelson regret at having promised [[his]222-nelson mother]699-his mother to join [her]332-his wife the next day ; and added , with a wistful glance at [Ellie]184-ellie : “ If only [I]222-nelson ’d known [you]184-ellie meant to wait for [me]222-nelson ! ”[222-nelson] But being [a man of duty]850-a man of duty , in domestic as well as business affairs , [he]222-nelson did not even consider the possibility of disappointing [the exacting old lady to whom [he]222-nelson owed [his]222-nelson being]851-the exacting old lady to whom he owed his being . “ [Mother]226-mother cares for [so few people]2381-so few people , ”[222-nelson] [he]222-nelson used to say , not without a touch of filial pride in the parental exclusiveness , “ that [I]222-nelson have to be with [her]851-the exacting old lady to whom he owed his being rather more than if [she]851-the exacting old lady to whom he owed his being were more sociable ”[222-nelson] ; and with smiling resignation [he]222-nelson gave orders that [Clarissa]187-clarissa should be ready to start the next evening . “ And meanwhile , ”[222-nelson] [he]222-nelson concluded , “ [we]2382-we ’ll have all the good time that ’s going . ”[222-nelson] [The ladies of the party]852-the ladies of the party seemed united in the desire to further this resolve ; and it was settled that as soon as [Mr. Vanderlyn]223-mr. vanderlyn had despatched a hasty luncheon , [[his]223-mr. vanderlyn wife]332-his wife , [Clarissa]187-clarissa and [Susy]159-susy should carry [him]223-mr. vanderlyn off for a tea - picnic at [Torcello]57-torcello . [They]852-the ladies of the party did not even suggest that [Strefford]267-strefford or [Nick]170-nick should be of [the party]648-the party , or that [any of [the other young men of the group]856-the other young men of the group]855-any of the other young men of the group should be summoned ; as [Susy]159-susy said , [Nelson]222-nelson wanted to go off alone with [[his]222-nelson harem]857-his harem . And [Lansing]159-susy and [Strefford]267-strefford were left to watch the departure of [the happy Pasha]858-the happy pasha ensconced between [attentive beauties]859-attentive beauties . “ Well -- that ’s what [you]159-susy call being married ! ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford commented , waving [his]267-strefford battered Panama at [Clarissa]187-clarissa . “ Oh , no , [I]159-susy do n’t ! ”[159-susy] [Lansing]159-susy laughed . “ [He]858-the happy pasha does . But do [you]159-susy know-- ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford paused and swung about on [his]267-strefford companion--“do [you]159-susy know , when the Rude Awakening comes , [I]267-strefford do n’t care to be [there]2229-there . [I]267-strefford believe there ’ll be some crockery broken . ”[267-strefford] “ Should n’t wonder , ”[159-susy] [Lansing]159-susy answered indifferently . [He]267-strefford wandered away to [[his]267-strefford own room]860-his own room , leaving [Strefford]267-strefford to philosophize to [his]267-strefford pipe . [Lansing]159-susy had always known about [poor old Nelson]222-nelson : who had n’t , except [poor old Nelson]222-nelson ? The case had once seemed amusing because so typical ; now , it rather irritated [Nick]170-nick that [Vanderlyn]222-nelson should be so complete an ass . But [he]170-nick would be off the next day , and so would [Ellie]184-ellie , and then , for many enchanted weeks , [the palace]613-the palace would once more be [the property of [Nick]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy]862-the property of nick and susy . Of all [the people who came and went in]863-the people who came and went in [it]613-the palace , [they]863-the people who came and went in were [the only ones who appreciated it , or knew how it was meant to be lived in]864-the only ones who appreciated it , or knew how it was meant to be lived in ; and that made it [theirs]863-the people who came and went in in the only valid sense . In this light it became easy to regard [the Vanderlyns]227-the vanderlyns as [mere transient intruders]865-mere transient intruders . Having relegated [them]227-the vanderlyns to this convenient distance , [Lansing]159-susy shut [himself]159-susy up with [his]866-he book . [He]866-he had returned to [it]867-it with fresh energy after [his]866-he few weeks of holiday - making , and was determined to finish it quickly . [He]866-he did not expect that it would bring in much money ; but if it were moderately successful it might give [him]866-he an opening in the reviews and magazines , and in that case [he]866-he meant to abandon archaeology for novels , since it was only as a purveyor of fiction that [he]866-he could count on earning a living for [himself]866-he and [Susy]159-susy . Late in the afternoon [he]866-he laid down [his]866-he pen and wandered out of doors . [He]866-he loved the increasing heat of the Venetian summer , the bruised peach - tints of worn [house]868-house - fronts , the enamelling of sunlight on dark green canals , the smell of half - decayed fruits and flowers thickening the languid air . What visions [he]866-he could build , if [he]866-he dared , of being tucked away with [Susy]159-susy in [the attic of [some tumble - down palace]870-some tumble - down palace]869-the attic of some tumble - down palace , above [a jade - green waterway]871-a jade - green waterway , with a terrace overhanging a scrap of neglected garden -- and cheques from [the publishers]872-the publishers dropping in at convenient intervals ! Why should [they]872-the publishers not settle in [Venice]15-venice if [he]866-he pulled it off ! [He]866-he found [himself]866-he before [the church of the Scalzi]873-the church of the scalzi , and pushing open the leathern door wandered up [the nave]874-the nave under the whirl of rose - and - lemon angels in [[Tiepolo]228-tiepolo ’s great vault]875-tiepolo ’s great vault . It was not [a church in which one was likely to run across [sight - seers]877-sight - seers]876-a church in which one was likely to run across sight - seers ; but [he]866-he presently remarked [a young lady standing alone near the choir]878-a young lady standing alone near the choir , and assiduously applying [her]878-a young lady standing alone near the choir field - glass to the celestial vortex , from which [she]878-a young lady standing alone near the choir occasionally glanced down at an open manual . As [Lansing]159-susy ’s step sounded on [the pavement]879-the pavement , [the young lady]880-the young lady , turning , revealed [herself]880-the young lady as [Miss Hicks]196-coral . “ Ah -- [you]866-he like this too ? It ’s several centuries out of [your]880-the young lady line , though , is n’t it ! ”[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick asked as [they]881-they shook hands . [She]880-the young lady gazed at [him]866-he gravely . “ Why should n’t one like things that are out of one ’s line ? ”[880-the young lady] [she]880-the young lady answered ; and [he]866-he agreed , with a laugh , that it was often an incentive . [She]880-the young lady continued to fix [her]880-the young lady grave eyes on [him]866-he , and after one or two remarks about [the Tiepolos]229-the tiepolos [he]866-he perceived that [she]880-the young lady was feeling [her]880-the young lady way toward a subject of more personal interest . “ [I]880-the young lady ’m glad to see [you]866-he alone , ”[880-the young lady] [she]880-the young lady said at length , with an abruptness that might have seemed awkward had it not been so completely unconscious . [She]880-the young lady turned toward a cluster of straw chairs , and signed to [Nick]170-nick to seat [himself]170-nick beside [her]880-the young lady . “ [I]880-the young lady seldom do , ”[880-the young lady] [she]880-the young lady added , with the serious smile that made [her]880-the young lady heavy face almost handsome ; and [she]880-the young lady went on , giving [him]866-he no time to protest : “ [I]880-the young lady wanted to speak to [you]866-he -- to explain about [father]2367-father ’s invitation to go with [us]2385-us to [Persia]58-persia and [Turkestan]42-turkestan . ”[880-the young lady] “ To explain ? ”[880-the young lady] “ Yes . [You]866-he found the letter when [you]866-he arrived here just after [your]866-he marriage , did n’t [you]866-he ? [You]866-he must have thought it odd , [our]2385-us asking [you]866-he just then ; but [we]2385-us had n’t heard that [you]866-he were married . ”[880-the young lady] “ Oh , [I]880-the young lady guessed as much : it happened very quietly , and [I]880-the young lady was remiss about announcing it , even to [old friends]2386-old friends . ”[880-the young lady] [Lansing]170-nick frowned . [His]170-nick thoughts had wandered away to the evening when [he]170-nick had found [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s letter in the mail awaiting [him]170-nick at [Venice]15-venice . The day was associated in [his]170-nick mind with the ridiculous and mortifying episode of the cigars -- the expensive cigars that [Susy]159-susy had wanted to carry away from [[Strefford]267-strefford ’s villa]2176-strefford ’s villa . [Their]883-their brief exchange of views on the subject had left the first blur on the perfect surface of [his]170-nick happiness , and [he]170-nick still felt an uncomfortable heat at the remembrance . For a few hours the prospect of life with [Susy]159-susy had seemed unendurable ; and it was just at that moment that [he]170-nick had found the letter from [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick , with its almost irresistible invitation . If only [[her]884-her daughter]885-her daughter had known how nearly [he]170-nick had accepted it ! “ It was a dreadful temptation , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said , smiling . “ To go with [us]883-their ? Then why-- ? ”[170-nick] “ Oh , everything ’s different now : [I]196-coral ’ve got to stick to [my]196-coral writing . ”[196-coral] [Miss Hicks]196-coral still bent on [him]170-nick the same unblinking scrutiny . “ Does that mean that [you]170-nick ’re going to give up [your]170-nick real work ? ”[196-coral] “ [My]170-nick real work -- archaeology ? ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick smiled again to hide a twitch of regret . “ Why , [I]170-nick ’m afraid it hardly produces a living wage ; and [I]170-nick ’ve got to think of that . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick coloured suddenly , as if suspecting that [Miss Hicks]196-coral might consider the avowal an opening for [he]170-nick hardly knew what ponderous offer of aid . [The Hicks]196-coral munificence was too uncalculating not to be occasionally oppressive . But looking at [her]196-coral again [he]170-nick saw that [her]196-coral eyes were full of tears . “ [I]196-coral thought it was [your]170-nick vocation , ”[196-coral] [she]196-coral said . “ So did [I.]196-coral But life comes along , and upsets things . ”[196-coral] “ Oh , [I]196-coral understand . There may be things -- worth giving up all other things for . ”[196-coral] “ There are ! ”[170-nick] cried [Nick]170-nick with beaming emphasis . [He]170-nick was conscious that [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s eyes demanded of [him]170-nick even more than this sweeping affirmation . “ But [your]170-nick novel may fail , ”[196-coral] [she]196-coral said with [her]196-coral odd harshness . “ [It]2387-it may -- it probably will , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick agreed . “ But if [one]2186-one stopped to consider such possibilities-- ”[196-coral] “ Do n’t [you]170-nick have to , with [a wife]2389-a wife ? ”[196-coral] “ Oh , [[my]170-nick dear]445-my dear [Coral]196-coral -- how old are [you]196-coral ? Because , [you]170-nick see , art ’s a wonderful resource . ”[196-coral] ( [She]196-coral pronounced it RE - source . ) [He]170-nick continued to look at [her]196-coral kindly . “ [You]196-coral wo n’t need it -- or any other -- when [you]196-coral grow young , as [you]196-coral will some day , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick assured [her]196-coral . “ Do [you]196-coral mean , when [I]196-coral fall in love ?
