[Lansing]170-nick , looking after [her]196-coral , wondered for half a moment whether [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck were the object of this apparently unrequited sentiment ; then , with a queer start of introspection , abruptly decided that , no , [he]207-mr. beck certainly was not . But then -- but then-- . Well , there was no use in following up such conjectures .... [He]170-nick turned [home - ward]889-home - ward , wondering if [the picnickers]890-the picnickers had already reached [Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn . [They]890-the picnickers got back only in time for a late dinner , full of chaff and laughter , and apparently still enchanted with [each other]2188-each other ’s society . [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson beamed on [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife , sent [[his]222-nelson daughter]828-his daughter off to bed with a kiss , and leaning back in [his]222-nelson armchair before the fruit - and - flower - laden table , declared that [he]222-nelson ’d never spent a jollier day in [his]222-nelson life . [Susy]159-susy seemed to come in for a full share of [his]222-nelson approbation , and [Lansing]159-susy thought that [Ellie]184-ellie was unusually demonstrative to [[her]184-ellie friend]367-her friend . [Strefford]267-strefford , from [[his]267-strefford hostess]809-his hostess ’s side , glanced across now and then at [young Mrs. Lansing]896-young mrs. lansing , and [his]267-strefford glance seemed to [Lansing]159-susy a confidential comment on the [Vanderlyn]184-ellie raptures . But then [Strefford]267-strefford was always having private jokes with [people]421-people or about [them]421-people ; and [Lansing]159-susy was irritated with [himself]159-susy for perpetually suspecting [[his]267-strefford best friends]898-his best friends of vague complicities at [his]267-strefford expense . “ If [I]267-strefford ’m going to be jealous of [Streffy]164-streffy now-- ! ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford concluded with a grimace of self - derision . Certainly [Susy]159-susy looked lovely enough to justify the most irrational pangs . As [a girl]899-a girl [she]159-susy had been , for [some people]2206-some people ’s taste , a trifle fine - drawn and sharp - edged ; now , to [her]159-susy old lightness of line was added a shadowy bloom , a sort of star - reflecting depth . [Her]159-susy movements were slower , less angular ; [her]159-susy mouth had a needing droop , [her]159-susy lids seemed weighed down by their lashes ; and then suddenly the old spirit would reveal itself through the new languor , like the tartness at the core of a sweet fruit . As [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband looked at [her]159-susy across the flowers and lights [he]327-her husband laughed inwardly at the nothingness of all things else . [Vanderlyn]184-ellie and [Clarissa]187-clarissa left betimes the next morning ; and [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn , who was to start for [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz in the afternoon , devoted [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn last hours to anxious conferences with [[her]188-mrs. vanderlyn maid]902-her maid and [Susy]159-susy . [Strefford]267-strefford , with [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow and [the others]2262-the others , had gone for a swim at [the Lido]34-the lido , and [Lansing]159-susy seized the opportunity to get back to [his]904-you book . The quietness of [the great echoing place]905-the great echoing place gave [him]904-you a foretaste of the solitude to come . By mid - August all [[their]906-their party]907-their party would be scattered : [the Hickses]177-the hickses off on a cruise to [Crete]59-crete and [the AEgean]60-the aegean , [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow on the way to [[his]904-you moor]2323-his moor , [Strefford]267-strefford to stay with [[friends]726-friends in [Capri]31-capri]910-friends in capri till [his]904-you annual visit to [Northumberland]61-northumberland in September . One by one [the others]2262-the others would follow , and [Lansing]159-susy and [Susy]159-susy be left alone in [the great sun - proof palace]912-the great sun - proof palace , alone under the star - laden skies , alone with the great orange moons -- still theirs!--above [the bell - tower of [San Giorgio]43-san giorgio]913-the bell - tower of san giorgio . The novel , in that blessed quiet , would unfold itself as harmoniously as [his]904-you dreams . [He]904-you wrote on , forgetful of the passing hours , till the door opened and [he]904-you heard a step behind [him]904-you . The next moment two hands were clasped over [his]904-you eyes , and the air was full of [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s last new scent . “ [You]904-you dear thing -- [I’m]188-mrs. vanderlyn just off , [you]904-you know , ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn said . “ [Susy]159-susy told [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn [you]904-you were working , and [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn forbade [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn to call [you]904-you down . [She]188-mrs. vanderlyn and [Streffy]164-streffy are waiting to take [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn to [the station]2395-the station , and [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’ve run up to say good - bye . ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] “ [Ellie]184-ellie , [dear]2236-dear ! ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] Full of compunction , [Lansing]159-susy pushed aside [his]904-you writing and started up ; but [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn pressed [him]904-you back into [his]904-you seat . “ No , no ! [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn should never forgive [myself]188-mrs. vanderlyn if [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’d interrupted [you]904-you . [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn ought n’t to have come up ; [Susy]159-susy did n’t want [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn to . But [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn had to tell [you]904-you , [[you]904-you dear]2342-you dear .... [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn had to thank [you]904-you ... ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] In [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn dark travelling dress and hat , so discreetly conspicuous , so negligent and so studied , with a veil masking [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn paint , and gloves hiding [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn rings , [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn looked younger , simpler , more natural than [he]904-you had ever seen [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn . [Poor Ellie]184-ellie such [a good fellow]914-a good fellow , after all ! “ To thank [me]904-you ? For what ? For being so happy here ? ”[904-you] [he]904-you laughed , taking [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn hands . [She]188-mrs. vanderlyn looked at [him]904-you , laughed back , and flung [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn arms about [his]904-you neck . “ For helping [me]188-mrs. vanderlyn to be so happy elsewhere -- [you]904-you and [Susy]159-susy , [[you]904-you two blessed darlings]2398-you two blessed darlings ! ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn cried , with a kiss on [his]904-you cheek . [Their]915-their eyes met for a second ; then [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn arms slipped slowly downward , dropping to [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn sides . [Lansing]159-susy sat before [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn like a stone . “ Oh , ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn gasped , “ why do [you]904-you stare so ? Did n’t [you]904-you know ... ? ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [They]915-their heard [Strefford]267-strefford ’s shrill voice on the stairs . “ [Ellie]184-ellie , where [the deuce]2208-the deuce are [you]184-ellie ? [Susy]159-susy ’s in [the gondola]2400-the gondola . [You]184-ellie ’ll miss [the train]2221-the train ! ”[159-susy] [Lansing]159-susy stood up and caught [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn by the wrist . “ What do [you]904-you mean ? What are [you]904-you talking about ? ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] “ Oh , nothing ... But [you]904-you were both such bricks about the letters .... And when [Nelson]222-nelson was [here]2184-here , too .... [Nick]170-nick , do n’t hurt [my]916-he wrist so ! [I]916-he must run ! ”[916-he] [He]916-he dropped [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn hand and stood motionless , staring after [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn and listening to the click of [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn high heels as [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn fled across [the room]379-the room and along [the echoing corridor]918-the echoing corridor . When [he]916-he turned back to the table [he]916-he noticed that a small morocco case had fallen among [his]916-he papers . In falling it had opened , and before [him]916-he , on the pale velvet lining , lay a scarf - pin set with a perfect pearl . [He]916-he picked the box up , and was about to hasten after [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn -- it was so like [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn to shed jewels on [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn path!--when [he]916-he noticed [his]916-he own initials on the cover . [He]916-he dropped the box as if it had been a hot coal , and sat for a long while gazing at the gold N. L. , which seemed to have burnt itself into [his]916-he flesh . At last [he]916-he roused [himself]916-he and stood up . [X.]230-x. WITH a sigh of relief [Susy]159-susy drew the pins from [her]159-susy hat and threw [herself]159-susy down on [the lounge]919-the lounge . The ordeal [she]159-susy had dreaded was over , and [Mr.]920-mr. and [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn had safely gone [their]921-their several ways . [Poor Ellie]184-ellie was not noted for prudence , and when life smiled on [her]159-susy [she]159-susy was given to betraying [her]159-susy gratitude too openly ; but thanks to [Susy]159-susy ’s vigilance ( and , no doubt , to [Strefford]267-strefford ’s tacit co - operation ) , the dreaded twenty - four hours were happily over . [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson had departed without a shadow on [his]222-nelson brow , and though [Ellie]184-ellie ’s , when [she]184-ellie came down from bidding [Nick]170-nick good - bye , had seemed to [Susy]159-susy less serene than usual , [she]159-susy became [her]159-susy normal self as soon as it was discovered that the red morocco bag with [her]159-susy jewel - box was missing . Before it had been discovered in [the depths of [the gondola]2400-the gondola]922-the depths of the gondola [they]924-they had reached [the station]2395-the station , and there was just time to thrust [her]159-susy into [her]159-susy “ sleeper , ”[267-strefford] from which [she]159-susy was seen to wave an unperturbed farewell to [[her]159-susy friends]926-her friends . “ Well , [[my]267-strefford dear]445-my dear , [we]924-they ’ve been it through , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford remarked with a deep breath as the St. Moritz express rolled away . “ Oh , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy sighed in mute complicity ; then , as if to cover [her]159-susy self - betrayal : “ [Poor darling]2250-poor darling , [she]159-susy does so like what [she]159-susy likes ! ”[159-susy] “ Yes -- even if it ’s a rotten bounder , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford agreed . “ [A rotten bounder]2405-a rotten bounder ? Why , [I]267-strefford thought-- ”[267-strefford] “ That it was still [young Davenant]231-young davenant ? Lord , no -- not for the last six months . Did n’t [she]159-susy tell [you--]2406-you-- ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy felt [herself]159-susy redden . “ [I]159-susy did n’t ask [her--]159-susy ”[159-susy] “ Ask [her]159-susy ? [You]267-strefford mean [you]267-strefford did n’t let [her]159-susy ! ”[267-strefford] “ [I]159-susy did n’t let [her]159-susy . And [I]159-susy do n’t let [you]267-strefford , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy added sharply , as [he]267-strefford helped [her]159-susy into [the gondola]2400-the gondola . “ Oh , all right : [I]267-strefford daresay [you]159-susy ’re right . It simplifies things , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford placidly acquiesced . [She]159-susy made no answer , and in silence [they]928-they glided homeward . Now , in the quiet of [[her]159-susy own room]929-her own room , [Susy]159-susy lay and pondered on the distance [she]159-susy had travelled during the last year . [Strefford]267-strefford had read [her]159-susy mind with [his]267-strefford usual penetration . It was true that there had been a time when [she]159-susy would have thought it perfectly natural that [Ellie]184-ellie should tell [her]159-susy everything ; that the name of [[young Davenant]231-young davenant ’s successor]930-young davenant ’s successor should be confided to [her]159-susy as a matter of course . Apparently even [Ellie]184-ellie had been obscurely aware of the change , for after a first attempt to force [her]184-ellie confidences on [Susy]159-susy [she]184-ellie had contented [herself]184-ellie with vague expressions of gratitude , allusive smiles and sighs , and the pretty “ surprise ”[184-ellie] of the sapphire bangle slipped onto [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s wrist in the act of [their]932-their farewell embrace . The bangle was extremely handsome . [Susy]159-susy , who had [an auctioneer]933-an auctioneer ’s eye for values , knew to a fraction the worth of those deep convex stones alternating with small emeralds and brilliants . [She]159-susy was glad to own the bracelet , and enchanted with the effect it produced on [her]159-susy slim wrist ; yet , even while admiring it , and rejoicing that it was [hers]159-susy , [she]159-susy had already transmuted it into specie , and reckoned just how far it would go toward the paying of domestic necessities . For whatever came to [her]159-susy now interested [her]159-susy only as something more to be offered up to [Nick]170-nick . The door opened and [Nick]170-nick came in . Dusk had fallen , and [she]159-susy could not see [his]170-nick face ; but something in the jerk of the door - handle roused [her]159-susy ever - wakeful apprehension . [She]159-susy hurried toward [him]170-nick with outstretched wrist . “ Look , [dearest]2233-dearest -- wasn’t it too darling of [Ellie]184-ellie ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy pressed the button of the lamp that lit [her]159-susy dressing - table , and [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s face started unfamiliarly out of the twilight . [She]159-susy slipped off the bracelet and held it up to [him]170-nick . “ Oh , [I]170-nick can go [you]159-susy one better , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said with a laugh ; and pulling a morocco case from [his]170-nick pocket [he]170-nick flung it down among the scent - bottles . [Susy]159-susy opened the case automatically , staring at the pearl because [she]159-susy was afraid to look again at [Nick]170-nick . “ [Ellie]184-ellie -- gave [you]170-nick this ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy asked at length . “ Yes . [She]184-ellie gave [me]159-susy this . ”[159-susy] There was a pause . “ Would [you]159-susy mind telling [me]159-susy , ”[159-susy] [Lansing]159-susy continued in the same dead - level tone , “ exactly for what services [we]2408-we ’ve both been so handsomely paid ? ”[159-susy] “ The pearl is beautiful , ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy murmured , to gain time , while [her]159-susy head spun round with unimaginable terrors . “ So are [your]159-susy sapphires ; though , on closer examination , [my]159-susy services would appear to have been valued rather higher than [yours]159-susy . Would [you]159-susy be kind enough to tell [me]159-susy just what [they]2409-they were ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy threw [her]159-susy head back and looked at [him]170-nick . “ What on earth are [you]170-nick talking about , [Nick]170-nick ! Why should n’t [Ellie]184-ellie have given [us]2410-us these things ? Do [you]170-nick forget that it ’s like [our]2410-us giving [her]184-ellie a pen - wiper or a button - hook ? What is it [you]170-nick are trying to suggest ? ”[159-susy] It had cost [her]159-susy a considerable effort to hold [his]170-nick eyes while [she]159-susy put the questions . Something had happened between [him]170-nick and [Ellie]184-ellie , that was evident -- one of those hideous unforeseeable blunders that may cause one ’s cleverest plans to crumble at a stroke ; and again [Susy]159-susy shuddered at the frailty of [her]159-susy bliss . But [her]159-susy old training stood [her]159-susy in good stead . There had been more than one moment in [her]159-susy past when everything -- [somebody else]935-somebody else ’s everything -- had depended on [her]159-susy keeping a cool head and a clear glance . It would have been a wonder if now , when [she]159-susy felt [her]159-susy own everything at stake , [she]159-susy had not been able to put up as good a defence . “ What is it ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy repeated impatiently , as [Lansing]159-susy continued to remain silent . “ That ’s what [I]170-nick ’m here to ask , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick returned , keeping [his]170-nick eyes as steady as [she]159-susy kept [hers]159-susy . “ There ’s no reason on [earth]2411-earth , as [you]159-susy say , why [Ellie]184-ellie should n’t give [us]2412-us presents -- as expensive presents as [she]184-ellie likes ; and the pearl is a beauty . All [I]170-nick ask is : for what specific services were [they]2413-they given ? For , allowing for all the absence of scruple that marks the intercourse of [truly civilized people]2414-truly civilized people , [you]159-susy ’ll probably agree that there are limits ; at least up to now there have been limits .... ”[170-nick] “ [I]159-susy really do n’t know what [you]159-susy mean . [I]159-susy suppose [Ellie]184-ellie wanted to show that [she]184-ellie was grateful to [us]2412-us for looking after [Clarissa]187-clarissa . ”[159-susy] “ But [she]184-ellie gave [us]2412-us all this in exchange for that , did n’t [she]184-ellie ? ”[936-he] [he]936-he suggested , with a sweep of the hand around [the beautiful shadowy room]937-the beautiful shadowy room . “ A whole summer of it if [we]2412-us choose . ”[936-he] [Susy]159-susy smiled . “ Apparently [she]184-ellie did n’t think that enough . ”[159-susy] “ What [a doting mother]2415-a doting mother ! It shows the store [she]184-ellie sets upon [[her]184-ellie child]522-her child . ”[159-susy] “ Well , do n’t [you]159-susy set store upon [Clarissa]187-clarissa ? ”[159-susy] “ [Clarissa]187-clarissa is exquisite ; but [[her]187-clarissa mother]521-her mother did n’t mention [her]187-clarissa in offering [me]159-susy this recompense . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy lifted [her]159-susy head again . “ Whom did [she]184-ellie mention ? ”[159-susy] “ [Vanderlyn]184-ellie , ”[159-susy] said [Lansing]159-susy . “ [Vanderlyn]184-ellie ? [Nelson]222-nelson ? ”[159-susy] “ Yes -- and some letters ... something about letters .... What is it , [[my]170-nick dear]445-my dear , that [you]159-susy and [I]170-nick have been hired to hide from [Vanderlyn]184-ellie ? Because [I]170-nick should like to know , ”[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick broke out savagely , “ if [we]2419-we ’ve been adequately paid . ”[170-nick] [Susy]159-susy was silent : [she]159-susy needed time to reckon up [her]159-susy forces , and study [her]159-susy next move ; and [her]159-susy brain was in such a whirl of fear that [she]159-susy could at last only retort : “ What is it that [Ellie]184-ellie said to [you]170-nick ? ”[159-susy] [Lansing]159-susy laughed again . “ That ’s just what [you]159-susy ’d like to find out -- isn’t it?--in order to know the line to take in making [your]159-susy explanation . ”[159-susy] The sneer had an effect that [he]170-nick could not have foreseen , and that [Susy]159-susy [herself]159-susy had not expected . “ Oh , don’t -- don’t let [us]938-their speak to [each other]2188-each other like that ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy cried ; and sinking down by the dressing - table [she]159-susy hid [her]159-susy face in [her]159-susy hands . It seemed to [her]159-susy , now , that nothing mattered except that [their]938-their love for each other , [their]938-their faith in [each other]2188-each other , should be saved from some unhealable hurt . [She]159-susy was willing to tell [Nick]170-nick everything -- [she]159-susy wanted to tell [him]170-nick everything -- if only [she]159-susy could be sure of reaching a responsive chord in [him]170-nick . But the scene of the cigars came back to [her]159-susy , and benumbed [her]159-susy . If only [she]159-susy could make [him]170-nick see that nothing was of any account as long as [they]938-their continued to love [each other]2188-each other ! [His]170-nick touch fell compassionately on [her]159-susy shoulder . “ [Poor child]388-poor child -- don’t , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said . [Their]938-their eyes met , but [his]170-nick expression checked the smile breaking through [her]159-susy tears . “ Do n’t [you]159-susy see , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick continued , “ that [we]938-their ’ve got to have this thing out ? ”[170-nick] [She]159-susy continued to stare at [him]170-nick through a prism of tears . “ [I]159-susy can’t -- while [you]170-nick stand up like that , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy stammered , childishly . [She]159-susy had cowered down again into a corner of [the lounge]919-the lounge ; but [Lansing]170-nick did not seat [himself]170-nick at [her]159-susy side . [He]170-nick took a chair facing [her]159-susy , like [a caller on the farther side of a stately tea - tray]942-a caller on the farther side of a stately tea - tray . “ Will that do ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick asked with a stiff smile , as if to humour [her]159-susy . “ Nothing will do -- as long as [you]159-susy ’re not [you]159-susy ! ”[170-nick] “ Not [me]159-susy ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy shook [her]159-susy head wearily . “ What ’s the use ? [You]159-susy accept things theoretically -- and then when they happen .... ”[159-susy] “ What things ? What has happened ! ”[170-nick] A sudden impatience mastered [her]159-susy . What did [he]170-nick suppose , after all-- ? “ But [you]170-nick know all about [Ellie]184-ellie . [We]2422-we used to talk about [her]184-ellie often enough in old times , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy said . “ [Ellie]184-ellie and [young Davenant]231-young davenant ? ”[159-susy] “ [Young Davenant]231-young davenant ; or [the others]2262-the others .... ”[159-susy] “ Or [the others]2262-the others . But what business was it of [ours]2422-we ? ”[170-nick] “ Ah , that ’s just what [I]159-susy think ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy cried , springing up with an explosion of relief . [Lansing]170-nick stood up also , but there was no answering light in [his]170-nick face . “ [We]2422-we ’re outside of all that ; [we]2422-we ’ve nothing to do with it , have [we]2422-we ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick pursued . “ Nothing whatever . ”[170-nick] “ Then what on earth is the meaning of [Ellie]184-ellie ’s gratitude ? Then [you]170-nick ? ”[159-susy] [He]170-nick came close and took [her]159-susy by the wrist . “ Answer [me]170-nick . Have [you]159-susy been mixed up in some dirty business of [Ellie]184-ellie ’s ? ”[170-nick] There was a pause . [She]159-susy found it impossible to speak , with that burning grasp on the wrist where the bangle had been . At length [he]170-nick let [her]159-susy go and moved away . “ Answer , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick repeated . “ [I]170-nick ’ve told [you]159-susy it was [my]170-nick business and not [yours]159-susy . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick received this in silence ; then [he]170-nick questioned : “ [You]159-susy ’ve been sending letters for [her]184-ellie , [I]170-nick suppose ? To whom ? ”[170-nick] “ Oh , why do [you]170-nick torment [me]943-she ? [Nelson]222-nelson was not supposed to know that [she]184-ellie ’d been away . [She]184-ellie left [me]943-she the letters to post to [him]222-nelson once a week . [I]943-she found them here the night [we]2425-we arrived .... It was the price -- for this . Oh , [Nick]170-nick , say it ’s been worth it -- say at least that it ’s been worth it ! ”[943-she] [she]943-she implored [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick stood motionless , unresponding . One hand drummed on the corner of [her]943-she dressing - table , making the jewelled bangle dance . “ How many letters ? ”[943-she] “ [I]943-she do n’t know ... four ... five ... What does it matter ? ”[943-she] “ And once a week , for six weeks-- ? ”[943-she] “ Yes . ”[943-she] “ And [you]159-susy took it all as a matter of course ? ”[943-she] “ No : [I]943-she hated it . But what could [I]943-she do ? ”[943-she] “ What could [you]159-susy do ? ”[943-she] “ When [our]2425-we being together depended on it ? Oh , [Nick]170-nick , how could [you]159-susy think [I]943-she ’d give [you]170-nick up ? ”[943-she] “ Give [me]170-nick up ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick echoed . “ Well -- doesn’t [our]2425-we being together depend on -- on what [we]2425-we can get out of [people]421-people ? And has n’t there always got to be some give - and - take ? Did [you]170-nick ever in [your]170-nick life get anything for nothing ? ”[943-she] [she]943-she cried with sudden exasperation . “ [You]170-nick ’ve lived among [these people]703-these people as long as [I]943-she have ; [I]943-she suppose it ’s not the first time-- ”[943-she] “ By God , but it is , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick exclaimed , flushing . “ And that ’s the difference -- the fundamental difference . ”[170-nick] “ The difference ! ”[943-she] “ Between [you]170-nick and [me]943-she . [I]943-she ’ve never in [my]943-she life done [people]421-people ’s dirty work for [them]421-people -- least of all for favours in return . [I]943-she suppose [you]170-nick guessed it , or [you]170-nick would n’t have hidden this beastly business from [me]943-she . ”[943-she] The blood rose to [Susy]159-susy ’s temples also . Yes , [she]943-she had guessed it ; instinctively , from the day [she]943-she had first visited [him]170-nick in [[his]170-nick bare lodgings]944-his bare lodgings , [she]943-she had been aware of [his]170-nick stricter standard . But how could [she]943-she tell [him]170-nick that under [his]170-nick influence [her]943-she standard had become stricter too , and that it was as much to hide [her]943-she humiliation from [herself]943-she as to escape [his]170-nick anger that [she]943-she had held [her]943-she tongue ? “ [You]943-she knew [I]170-nick would n’t have stayed [here]2184-here another day if [I]170-nick ’d known , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick continued . “ Yes : and then where in [the world]2205-the world should [we]945-we have gone ? ”[170-nick] “ [You]170-nick mean that -- in one way or another -- what [you]170-nick call give - and - take is the price of [our]945-we remaining together ? ”[170-nick] “ Well -- isn’t it , ”[943-she] [she]943-she faltered . “ Then [we]945-we ’d better part , had n’t [we]945-we ? ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick spoke in a low tone , thoughtfully and deliberately , as if this had been the inevitable conclusion to which [their]945-we passionate argument had led . [Susy]159-susy made no answer . For a moment [she]943-she ceased to be conscious of the causes of what had happened ; the thing itself seemed to have smothered [her]943-she under its ruins . [Nick]170-nick wandered away from the dressing - table and stood gazing out of the window at the darkening canal flecked with lights . [She]943-she looked at [his]170-nick back , and wondered what would happen if [she]943-she were to go up to [him]170-nick and fling [her]943-she arms about [him]170-nick . But even if [her]943-she touch could have broken the spell , [she]943-she was not sure [she]943-she would have chosen that way of breaking it . Beneath [her]943-she speechless anguish there burned the half - conscious sense of having been unfairly treated . When [they]945-we had entered into [their]945-we queer compact , [Nick]170-nick had known as well as [she]943-she on what compromises and concessions the life [they]945-we were to live together must be based . That [he]170-nick should have forgotten it seemed so unbelievable that [she]943-she wondered , with a new leap of fear , if [he]170-nick were using the wretched [Ellie]184-ellie ’s indiscretion as a means of escape from a tie already wearied of . Suddenly [she]943-she raised [her]943-she head with a laugh . “ After all -- [you]170-nick were right when [you]170-nick wanted [me]943-she to be [[your]170-nick mistress]2431-your mistress . ”[943-she] [He]170-nick turned on [her]943-she with an astonished stare . “ [You]943-she -- [[my]170-nick mistress]2432-my mistress ? ”[170-nick] Through all [her]943-she pain [she]943-she thrilled with pride at the discovery that such a possibility had long since become unthinkable to [him]170-nick . But [she]943-she insisted . “ That day at [the Fulmers’--have]2433-the fulmers’--have [you]170-nick forgotten ? When [you]170-nick said it would be sheer madness for [us]2434-we to marry . ”[943-she] [Lansing]170-nick stood leaning in the embrasure of the window , [his]170-nick eyes fixed on the mosaic volutes of the floor . “ [I]170-nick was right enough when [I]170-nick said it would be sheer madness for [us]2434-we to marry , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick rejoined at length . [She]943-she sprang up trembling . “ Well , that ’s easily settled . [Our]2434-we compact-- ”[943-she] “ Oh , that compact-- ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick interrupted [her]943-she with an impatient laugh . “ Are n’t [you]170-nick asking [me]170-nick to carry it out now ? ”[170-nick] “ Because [I]170-nick said [we]2434-we ’d better part ? ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick paused . “ But the compact -- [I’d]170-nick almost forgotten it -- was to the effect , was n’t it , that [we]2434-we were to give [each other]2188-each other a helping hand if either of [us]2434-we had a better chance ? The thing was absurd , of course ; a mere joke ; from [my]170-nick point of view , at least . [I]170-nick shall never want any better chance ... any other chance .... ”[170-nick] “ Oh , [Nick]170-nick , oh , [Nick]170-nick ... but then .... ”[943-she] [She]943-she was close to [him]170-nick , [his]170-nick face looming down through [her]943-she tears ; but [he]170-nick put [her]943-she back . “ It would have been easy enough , would n’t it , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick rejoined , “ if [we]2434-we ’d been as detachable as all that ? As it is , it ’s going to hurt horribly . But talking it over wo n’t help . [You]943-she were right just now when [you]943-she asked how else [we]2434-we were going to live . [We]2434-we ’re born parasites , both , [I]170-nick suppose , or [we]2434-we ’d have found out some way long ago . But [I]170-nick find there are things [I]170-nick might put up with for [myself]170-nick , at a pinch -- and should , probably , in time that [I]170-nick ca n’t let [you]943-she put up with for [me]170-nick ... ever .... Those cigars at [Como]5-como : do [you]943-she suppose [I]170-nick did n’t know it was for [me]170-nick ? And this too ? Well , it wo n’t do ... it wo n’t do .... ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick stopped , as if [his]170-nick courage failed [him]170-nick ; and [she]946-i moaned out : “ But [your]170-nick writing -- if [your]170-nick book ’s a success .... ”[946-i] “ [My]946-i poor [Susy]159-susy -- that ’s all part of the humbug . [We]2434-we both know that [my]946-i sort of writing will never pay . And what ’s the alternative except more of the same kind of baseness ? And getting more and more blunted to it ? At least , till now , [I]946-i ’ve minded certain things ; [I]946-i do n’t want to go on till [I]946-i find [myself]946-i taking them for granted . ”[946-i] [She]946-i reached out a timid hand . “ But [you]170-nick need n’t ever , [dear]2236-dear ... if [you]170-nick ’d only leave it to [me]170-nick .... ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick drew back sharply . “ That seems simple to [you]946-i , [I]170-nick suppose ? Well , [men]2437-men are different . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick walked toward the dressing - table and glanced at the little enamelled clock which had been one of [her]946-i wedding - presents . “ Time to dress , is n’t it ? [I]170-nick ’d rather like [a long tramp]2438-a long tramp , and no more talking just at present except with [myself]170-nick . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick passed [her]946-i by and walked rapidly out of [the room]379-the room . [Susy]159-susy stood motionless , unable to lift a detaining hand or to find a final word of appeal . On [her]946-i disordered dressing - table [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s gifts glittered in the rosy lamp - light . Yes : [men]2437-men were different , as [he]170-nick said . [XI]232-xi . BUT there were necessary [accommodations]949-accommodations , there always had been ; [Nick]170-nick in old times , had been the first to own [it]950-it .... How [they]951-they had laughed at [the Perpendicular People]952-the perpendicular people , [the people who went by on the other side ( since [you]954-you could n’t be [a good Samaritan]955-a good samaritan without stooping over and poking into heaps of [you]954-you]953-the people who went by on the other side ( since you could n’t be a good samaritan without stooping over and poking into heaps of you did n’t know what ) ! And now [Nick]170-nick had suddenly become perpendicular .... [Susy]159-susy , that evening , at the head of the dinner table , saw -- in the breaks between [her]159-susy scudding thoughts -- the nauseatingly familiar faces of [the people [she]159-susy called [[her]159-susy friends]926-her friends]956-the people she called her friends : [Strefford]267-strefford , [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow , [a giggling fool of a young Breckenridge , of [[their]951-they New York group]959-their new york group , who had arrived that day , and [Prince Nerone Altineri]195-prince altineri , [Ursula]168-ursula ’s Prince , who , in [Ursula]168-ursula ’s absence at a tiresome cure , had , quite simply and naturally , preferred to join [[her]168-ursula husband]327-her husband at [Venice]15-venice]958-a giggling fool of a young breckenridge , of their new york group , who had arrived that day , and prince nerone altineri , ursula ’s prince , who , in ursula ’s absence at a tiresome cure , had , quite simply and naturally , preferred to join her husband at venice . [Susy]159-susy looked from one to [the other of [them]956-the people she called her friends]961-the other of them , as if with newly - opened eyes , and wondered what life would be like with no faces but such as [theirs]951-they to furnish it .... Ah , [Nick]170-nick had become perpendicular ! ... After all , [most people]962-most people went through life making a given set of gestures , like dance - steps learned in advance . If [your]963-you dancing manual told [you]963-you at a given time to be perpendicular , [you]963-you had to be , automatically -- and that was [Nick]170-nick ! “ But what on earth , [Susy]159-susy , ”[168-ursula] [Gillow]168-ursula ’s puzzled voice suddenly came to [her]159-susy as from immeasurable distances , “ Are [you]159-susy going to do in this beastly stifling hole for the rest of the summer ? ”[168-ursula] “ Ask [Nick]170-nick , [[my]267-strefford dear fellow]2439-my dear fellow , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford answered for [her]159-susy ; and : “ By the way , where is [Nick]170-nick -- if [one]2186-one may ask ? ”[233-young breckenridge] [young Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge interposed , glancing up to take belated note of [[his]267-strefford host]833-his host ’s absence . “ Dining out , ”[159-susy] said [Susy]159-susy glibly . “ [People]421-people turned up : blighting bores that [I]159-susy would n’t have dared to inflict on [you]159-susy . ”[159-susy] How easily the old familiar fibbing came to [her]159-susy ! “ The kind to whom [you]159-susy say , ‘ Now mind [you]159-susy look [me]267-strefford up ’ ; and then spend the rest of [your]159-susy life dodging - like [[our]2442-our good Hickses]2443-our good hickses , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford amplified . [The Hickses]177-the hickses -- but , of course , [Nick]170-nick was with [the Hickses]177-the hickses ! It went through [Susy]159-susy like a knife , and the dinner [she]159-susy had so lightly fibbed became a hateful truth . [She]159-susy said to [herself]159-susy feverishly : “ [I]159-susy ’ll call [him]170-nick up [there]2229-there after dinner -- and then [he]170-nick will feel silly”--but[159-susy] only to remember that [the Hickses]177-the hickses , in [their]177-the hickses mediaeval setting , had of course sternly denied [themselves]177-the hickses a telephone . The fact of [Nick]170-nick ’s temporary inaccessibility -- since [she]159-susy was now convinced that [he]170-nick was really at the Hickses’--turned [her]159-susy distress to a mocking irritation . Ah , that was where [he]170-nick carried [his]170-nick principles , [his]170-nick standards , or whatever [he]170-nick called the new set of rules [he]170-nick had suddenly begun to apply to the old game ! It was stupid of [her]159-susy not to have guessed it at once . “ Oh , [the Hickses]177-the hickses -- [Nick]170-nick adores [them]177-the hickses , [you]168-ursula know . [He]170-nick ’s going to marry [Coral]196-coral next , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy laughed out , flashing the joke around the table with all [her]159-susy practiced flippancy . “ [Lord]2445-lord ! ”[159-susy] grasped [Gillow]168-ursula , inarticulate : while [the Prince]965-the prince displayed the unsurprised smile which [Susy]159-susy accused [him]965-the prince of practicing every morning with [his]965-the prince Mueller exercises . Suddenly [Susy]159-susy felt [Strefford]267-strefford ’s eyes upon [her]159-susy . “ What ’s the matter with [me]159-susy ? [The Prince]965-the prince and [young Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge caught [her]159-susy up , and [she]159-susy spun back with [the latter]608-the latter , while [Gillow]168-ursula -- it was believed to be [his]267-strefford sole accomplishment -- snapped [his]267-strefford fingers in simulation of bones , and shuffled after [the couple on stamping feet]971-the couple on stamping feet . [Susy]159-susy sank down on a sofa near the window , fanning [herself]159-susy with a floating scarf , and [the men]972-the men foraged for cigarettes , and rang for [the gondoliers]973-the gondoliers , who came in with trays of cooling drinks . “ Well , what next -- this ai n’t all , is it ? ”[168-ursula] [Gillow]168-ursula presently queried , from the divan where [he]267-strefford lolled half - asleep with dripping brow . [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow , like Nature , abhorred a void , and it was inconceivable to [him]267-strefford that every hour of [man]974-man ’s rational existence should not furnish a motive for getting up and going somewhere else . [Young Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge , who took the same view , and [the Prince , who earnestly desired to]975-the prince , who earnestly desired to , reminded [the company]976-the company that [somebody [they]976-the company knew]977-somebody they knew was giving a dance that night at [the Lido]34-the lido . What fun ! ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy was up in an instant . “ [Let ’s]2447-let ’s pay [somebody]598-somebody a surprise visit -- [I]159-susy do n’t know who ! [Susy]159-susy ran to [[her]159-susy room]664-her room for a light cloak , and without changing [her]159-susy high - heeled satin slippers went out with [the four men]979-the four men . There was no moon -- thank heaven there was no moon!--but the stars hung over [them]976-the company as close as fruit , and secret fragrances dropped on [them]976-the company from garden - walls . [Susy]159-susy ’s heart tightened with memories of [Como]5-como . [They]979-the four men wandered on , laughing and dawdling , and yielding to the drifting whims of [aimless people]980-aimless people . Presently [someone]981-someone proposed taking a nearer look at [the facade of [San Giorgio Maggiore]63-san giorgio maggiore]982-the facade of san giorgio maggiore , and [they]979-the four men hailed [a gondola]983-a gondola and were rowed out through the bobbing lanterns and twanging guitar - strings . Oh , do let ’s go up and surprise [them]177-the hickses ! ”[159-susy] The idea struck [her]159-susy as one of the drollest that [she]159-susy had ever originated , and [she]159-susy wondered that [[her]159-susy companions]987-her companions should respond so languidly . “ [I]168-ursula ca n’t see anything very thrilling in surprising [the Hickses]177-the hickses , ”[168-ursula] [Gillow]168-ursula protested , defrauded of possible excitements ; and [Strefford]267-strefford added : “ It would surprise [me]267-strefford more than [them]177-the hickses if [I]267-strefford went . ”[267-strefford] But [Susy]159-susy insisted feverishly : “ [You]168-ursula do n’t know . [Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge and [the Prince]965-the prince had sprung on ahead , and [Gillow]168-ursula , lumbering after [them]989-they , was already halfway up [the stairs]572-the stairs . “ [My]168-ursula face ?
