[I]267-strefford hear [those fools banging on the door]2452-those fools banging on the door already . ”[267-strefford] [He]267-strefford caught [her]159-susy by the hand , and [they]989-they started up [the stairway]991-the stairway . But on [the first landing]992-the first landing [she]159-susy paused , twisted [her]159-susy hand out of [his]267-strefford , and without a word , without a conscious thought , dashed down [the long flight]993-the long flight , across [the great resounding vestibule]994-the great resounding vestibule and out into the darkness of the calle . [Strefford]267-strefford caught up with [her]159-susy , and [they]989-they stood a moment silent in the night . “ [Susy]159-susy -- what the devil ’s the matter ? ”[989-they] “ The matter ? Ca n’t [you]267-strefford see ? That [I]159-susy ’m tired , that [I]159-susy ’ve got a splitting headache -- that [you]267-strefford bore [me]159-susy to death , one and all of [you]267-strefford ! ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy turned and laid a deprecating hand on [his]267-strefford arm . “ [Streffy]164-streffy , [old dear]2453-old dear , do n’t mind [me]159-susy : but for [God]236-god ’s sake find a gondola and send [me]159-susy [home]606-home . ”[159-susy] “ Alone ? ”[995-streff ’s] “ Alone . ”[159-susy] It was never any concern of [[Streff]198-streff ’s]995-streff ’s if [people]421-people wanted to do things [he]267-strefford did not understand , and [she]159-susy knew that [she]159-susy could count on [his]267-strefford obedience . [They]997-they walked on in silence to [the next canal]998-the next canal , and [he]267-strefford picked up [a passing gondola]999-a passing gondola and put [her]159-susy in it . “ Now go and amuse [yourself]267-strefford , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy called after [him]267-strefford , as [the boat]1000-the boat shot under [the nearest bridge]1001-the nearest bridge . Anything , anything , to be alone , away from the folly and futility that would be all [she]159-susy had left if [Nick]170-nick were to drop out of [her]159-susy life .... “ But perhaps [he]170-nick has dropped already -- dropped for good , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought as [she]159-susy set [her]159-susy foot on the [Vanderlyn]184-ellie threshold . The short summer night was already growing transparent : a new born breeze stirred the soiled surface of the water and sent it lapping freshly against the old palace doorways . Nearly two o’clock ! [Nick]170-nick had no doubt come back long ago . [Susy]159-susy hurried up [the stairs]572-the stairs , reassured by the mere thought of [his]267-strefford nearness . [She]159-susy knew that when [their]1003-their eyes and [their]1003-their lips met it would be impossible for anything to keep [them]1003-their apart . [The gondolier dozing on the landing]1004-the gondolier dozing on the landing roused [himself]267-strefford to receive [her]159-susy , and to proffer two envelopes . The upper one was a telegram for [Strefford]267-strefford : [she]159-susy threw it down again and paused under the lantern hanging from [the painted vault]1005-the painted vault , the other envelope in [her]159-susy hand . The address it bore was in [Nick]170-nick ’s writing . “ When did [the signore]2455-the signore leave this for [me]170-nick ? Has [he]1009-an unknown boy gone out again ? ”[170-nick] Gone out again ? But [the signore]2455-the signore had not come in since dinner : of that [the gondolier]1007-the gondolier was positive , as [he]1007-the gondolier had been on duty all the evening . [A boy]1008-a boy had brought the letter -- [an unknown boy]1009-an unknown boy : [he]1009-an unknown boy had left it without waiting . It must have been about half an hour after [the signora]1010-the signora had [herself]1010-the signora gone out with [[her]1010-the signora guests]525-her guests . [Susy]159-susy , hardly hearing [him]170-nick , fled on to [[her]159-susy own room]929-her own room , and there , beside the very lamp which , two months before , had illuminated [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s fatal letter , [she]159-susy opened [Nick]170-nick ’s . “ Do n’t think [me]159-susy hard on [you]170-nick , [dear]2236-dear ; but [I]159-susy ’ve got to work this thing out by [myself]159-susy . The sooner the better -- don’t [you]170-nick agree ? So [I]159-susy ’m taking the express to [Milan]19-milan presently . [You]170-nick ’ll get a proper letter in a day or two . [I]159-susy wish [I]159-susy could think , now , of something to say that would show [you]170-nick [I]159-susy ’m not a brute -- but [I]159-susy ca n’t . N. L. ”[159-susy] There was not much of the night left in which to sleep , even had a semblance of sleep been achievable . The letter fell from [Susy]159-susy ’s hands , and [she]159-susy crept out onto [the balcony]554-the balcony and cowered there , [her]159-susy forehead pressed against the balustrade , the dawn wind stirring in [her]159-susy thin laces . Through [her]159-susy closed eyelids and the tightly - clenched fingers pressed against them , [she]159-susy felt the penetration of the growing light , the relentless advance of another day -- a day without purpose and without meaning -- a day without [Nick]170-nick . At length [she]159-susy dropped [her]159-susy hands , and staring from dry lids saw a rim of fire above the roofs across [the Grand Canal]65-the grand canal . [She]159-susy sprang up , ran back into [[her]159-susy room]664-her room , and dragging the heavy curtains shut across the windows , stumbled over in the darkness to [the lounge]919-the lounge and fell among [its]919-the lounge pillows - face downward -- groping , delving for a deeper night .... [She]159-susy started up , stiff and aching , to see a golden wedge of sun on the floor at [her]159-susy feet . [She]159-susy had slept , then -- was it possible?--it must be eight or nine o’clock already ! [She]159-susy had slept -- slept like [a drunkard]1016-a drunkard -- with that letter on the table at [her]159-susy elbow ! Ah , now [she]159-susy remembered -- [she]159-susy had dreamed that the letter was a dream ! But there , inexorably , it lay ; and [she]159-susy picked it up , and slowly , painfully re - read it . Then [she]159-susy tore it into shreds hunted for a match , and kneeling before the empty hearth , as though [she]159-susy were accomplishing some funeral rite , [she]159-susy burnt every shred of it to ashes . [Nick]170-nick would thank [her]159-susy for that some day ! After a bath and a hurried toilet [she]159-susy began to be aware of feeling younger and more hopeful . After all , [Nick]170-nick had merely said that [he]170-nick was going away for “ a day or two . ”[170-nick] And the letter was not cruel : there were tender things in it , showing through the curt words . [She]159-susy smiled at [herself]159-susy a little stiffly in the glass , put a dash of red on [her]159-susy colourless lips , and rang for [the maid]539-the maid . “ Coffee , [Giovanna]237-giovanna , please ; and will [you]539-the maid tell [Mr. Strefford]267-strefford that [I]159-susy should like to see [him]267-strefford presently . ”[159-susy] If [Nick]170-nick really kept to [his]170-nick intention of staying away for a few days [she]159-susy must trump up some explanation of [his]170-nick absence ; but [her]159-susy mind refused to work , and the only thing [she]159-susy could think of was to take [Strefford]267-strefford into [her]159-susy confidence . [She]159-susy knew that [he]170-nick could be trusted in a real difficulty ; [his]170-nick impish malice transformed itself into a resourceful ingenuity when [[his]170-nick friends]574-his friends required it . [The maid]539-the maid stood looking at [her]159-susy with a puzzled gaze , and [Susy]159-susy somewhat sharply repeated [her]159-susy order . “ But do n’t wake [him]267-strefford on purpose , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy added , foreseeing the probable effect on [Strefford]267-strefford ’s temper . “ But , [signora]2457-signora , [the gentleman]2458-the gentleman is already out . ”[159-susy] “ Already out ? ”[159-susy] [Strefford]267-strefford , who could hardly be routed from [his]267-strefford bed before luncheon - time ! “ Is it so late ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy cried , incredulous . “ After nine . And [the gentleman]2458-the gentleman took the eight o’clock train for [England]67-england . [Gervaso]239-gervaso said [he]239-gervaso had received a telegram . [He]239-gervaso left word that [he]239-gervaso would write to [the signora]1010-the signora . ”[159-susy] The door closed upon [the maid]539-the maid , and [Susy]159-susy continued to gaze at [her]159-susy painted image in the glass , as if [she]159-susy had been trying to outstare [an importunate stranger]1021-an importunate stranger . There was [no one]534-no one left for [her]159-susy to take counsel of , then -- [no one]534-no one but poor [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow ! [She]159-susy made a grimace at the idea . But what on earth could have summoned [Strefford]267-strefford back to [England]67-england ? [XII]240-xii . [NICK LANSING]170-nick , in the [Milan]19-milan express , was roused by the same bar of sunshine lying across [his]170-nick knees . [He]170-nick yawned , looked with disgust at [[his]170-nick stolidly sleeping neighbours]1024-his stolidly sleeping neighbours , and wondered why [he]170-nick had decided to go to [Milan]19-milan , and what on [earth]2411-earth [he]170-nick should do when [he]170-nick got [there]2229-there . The difficulty about trenchant decisions was that the next morning they generally left one facing a void .... When [the train]2221-the train drew into [the station at [Milan]19-milan]1028-the station at milan , [he]170-nick scrambled out , got some coffee , and having drunk it decided to continue [his]170-nick journey to [Genoa]68-genoa . The state of being carried passively onward postponed action and dulled thought ; and after twelve hours of furious mental activity that was exactly what [he]170-nick wanted . [He]170-nick fell into a doze again , waking now and then to haggard intervals of more thinking , and then dropping off to the clank and rattle of [the train]2221-the train . Inside [his]170-nick head , in [his]170-nick waking intervals , the same clanking and grinding of wheels and chains went on unremittingly . [He]170-nick had done all [his]170-nick lucid thinking within an hour of leaving [the Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn the night before ; since then , [his]170-nick brain had simply continued to revolve indefatigably about the same old problem . [His]170-nick cup of coffee , instead of clearing [his]170-nick thoughts , had merely accelerated their pace . At [Genoa]68-genoa [he]170-nick wandered about in [the hot streets]1030-the hot streets , bought a cheap suit - case and some underclothes , and then went down to [the port]1031-the port in search of [a little hotel]1032-a little hotel [he]170-nick remembered [there]2229-there . An hour later [he]170-nick was sitting in [the coffee - room]1034-the coffee - room , smoking and glancing vacantly over the papers while [he]170-nick waited for dinner , when [he]170-nick became aware of being timidly but intently examined by [a small round - faced gentleman with eyeglasses who sat alone at the adjoining table]1035-a small round - faced gentleman with eyeglasses who sat alone at the adjoining table . “ Hullo -- [Buttles]208-mr. buttles ! ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick exclaimed , recognising with surprise [the recalcitrant secretary who had resisted [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s endeavour to convert [him]170-nick to [Tiepolo]228-tiepolo]1036-the recalcitrant secretary who had resisted miss hicks ’s endeavour to convert him to tiepolo . [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles , blushing to the roots of [his]208-mr. buttles scant hair , half rose and bowed ceremoniously . [Nick Lansing]170-nick ’s first feeling was of annoyance at being disturbed in [his]170-nick solitary broodings ; [his]170-nick next , of relief at having to postpone them even to converse with [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles . “ No idea [you]208-mr. buttles were [here]2184-here : is [the yacht]2318-the yacht in harbour ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick asked , remembering that [the Ibis]170-nick must be just about to spread [her]196-coral wings . [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles , at salute behind [his]208-mr. buttles chair , signed a mute negation : for the moment [he]208-mr. buttles seemed too embarrassed to speak . “ Ah -- [you’re]208-mr. buttles here as [an advance guard]2463-an advance guard ? [I]170-nick remember now -- [I]170-nick saw [Miss Hicks]196-coral in [Venice]15-venice the day before yesterday , ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick continued , dazed at the thought that hardly forty - eight hours had passed since [his]170-nick encounter with [Coral]196-coral in [the Scalzi]71-the scalzi . [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles , instead of speaking , had tentatively approached [his]170-nick table . “ May [I]208-mr. buttles take this seat for a moment , [Mr. Lansing]170-nick ? Thank [you]208-mr. buttles . No , [I]208-mr. buttles am not here as [an advance guard]2463-an advance guard -- though [I]208-mr. buttles believe [the Ibis]170-nick is due some time to - morrow . ”[208-mr. buttles] [He]208-mr. buttles cleared [his]208-mr. buttles throat , wiped [his]208-mr. buttles eyeglasses on a silk handkerchief , replaced them on [his]208-mr. buttles nose , and went on solemnly : “ Perhaps , to clear up any possible misunderstanding , [I]208-mr. buttles ought to say that [I]208-mr. buttles am no longer in the employ of [Mr. Hicks]170-nick . ”[208-mr. buttles] [Lansing]170-nick glanced at [him]208-mr. buttles sympathetically . It was clear that [he]208-mr. buttles suffered horribly in imparting this information , though [his]208-mr. buttles compact face did not lend itself to any dramatic display of emotion . “ Really , ”[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick smiled , and then ventured : “ [I]170-nick hope it ’s not owing to conscientious objections to [Tiepolo]228-tiepolo ? ”[170-nick] [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s blush became a smouldering agony . “ Ah , [Miss Hicks]196-coral mentioned to [you]170-nick ... told [you]170-nick ... ? No , [Mr. Lansing]170-nick . [I]208-mr. buttles am principled against the effete art of [Tiepolo]228-tiepolo , and of all [[his]228-tiepolo contemporaries]2465-his contemporaries , [I]208-mr. buttles confess ; but if [Miss Hicks]196-coral chooses to surrender [herself]196-coral momentarily to the unwholesome spell of the Italian decadence it is not for [me]208-mr. buttles to protest or to criticize . [Her]196-coral intellectual and aesthetic range so far exceeds [my]208-mr. buttles humble capacity that it would be ridiculous , unbecoming .... ”[208-mr. buttles] [He]208-mr. buttles broke off , and once more wiped a faint moisture from [his]208-mr. buttles eyeglasses . It was evident that [he]208-mr. buttles was suffering from a distress which [he]208-mr. buttles longed and yet dreaded to communicate . But [Nick]170-nick made no farther effort to bridge the gulf of [his]170-nick own preoccupations ; and [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles , after an expectant pause , went on : “ If [you]170-nick see [me]208-mr. buttles here to - day it is only because , after a somewhat abrupt departure , [I]208-mr. buttles find [myself]208-mr. buttles unable to take leave of [[our]2466-our friends]2467-our friends without a last look at [the Ibis]170-nick -- the scene of so many stimulating hours . But [I]208-mr. buttles must beg [you]170-nick , ”[208-mr. buttles] [he]208-mr. buttles added earnestly , “ should [you]170-nick see [Miss Hicks]196-coral -- or [any other member of the party]2468-any other member of the party -- to make no allusion to [my]208-mr. buttles presence in [Genoa]68-genoa . [I]208-mr. buttles wish , ”[208-mr. buttles] said [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles with simplicity , “ to preserve the strictest incognito . ”[208-mr. buttles] [Lansing]170-nick glanced at [him]208-mr. buttles kindly . “ Oh , but -- isn’t that a little unfriendly ? ”[170-nick] “ No other course is possible , [Mr. Lansing]170-nick , ”[1037-the ex - secretary] said [the ex - secretary]1037-the ex - secretary , “ and [I]208-mr. buttles commit [myself]208-mr. buttles to [your]170-nick discretion . The truth is , if [I]208-mr. buttles am here it is not to look once more at [the Ibis]170-nick , but at [Miss Hicks]196-coral : once only . [You]170-nick will understand [me]208-mr. buttles , and appreciate what [I]208-mr. buttles am suffering . ”[208-mr. buttles] [He]208-mr. buttles bowed again , and trotted away on [his]208-mr. buttles small , tightly - booted feet ; pausing on the threshold to say : “ From the first it was hopeless , ”[208-mr. buttles] before [he]208-mr. buttles disappeared through the glass doors . A gleam of commiseration flashed through [Nick]170-nick ’s mind : there was something quaintly poignant in the sight of [the brisk and efficient Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles reduced to a limp image of unrequited passion . And what a painful surprise to [the Hickses]177-the hickses to be thus suddenly deprived of [the secretary who possessed “ the foreign languages ”]2469-the secretary who possessed “ the foreign languages ”[2469-the secretary who possessed “ the foreign languages ”] ! [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck kept the accounts and settled with [the hotel - keepers]1038-the hotel - keepers ; but it was [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s loftier task to entertain in [their]1039-their own tongues [the unknown geniuses who flocked about [the Hickses]177-the hickses]1040-the unknown geniuses who flocked about the hickses , and [Nick]170-nick could imagine how disconcerting [his]208-mr. buttles departure must be on the eve of [their]1039-their Grecian cruise which [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick would certainly call an Odyssey . The next moment the vision of [[Coral]196-coral ’s hopeless suitor]1041-coral ’s hopeless suitor had faded , and [Nick]170-nick was once more spinning around on the wheel of [his]170-nick own woes . The night before , when [he]170-nick had sent [his]170-nick note to [Susy]159-susy , from [a little restaurant close to [Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn that [they]1039-their often patronized]1042-a little restaurant close to palazzo vanderlyn that they often patronized , [he]170-nick had done so with the firm intention of going away for a day or two in order to collect [his]170-nick wits and think over the situation . But after [his]170-nick letter had been entrusted to [[the landlord]1043-the landlord ’s little son]1044-the landlord ’s little son , who was [a particular friend of [Susy]159-susy ’s]1045-a particular friend of susy ’s , [Nick]170-nick had decided to await [the lad]1046-the lad ’s return . [The messenger]1047-the messenger had not been bidden to ask for an answer ; but [Nick]170-nick , knowing [the friendly and inquisitive Italian mind]1048-the friendly and inquisitive italian mind , was almost sure that [the boy]1049-the boy , in the hope of catching a glimpse of [Susy]159-susy , would linger about while the letter was carried up . And [he]170-nick pictured [the maid]539-the maid knocking at [[[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife ’s darkened room]1052-his wife ’s darkened room , and [Susy]159-susy dashing some powder on [her]159-susy tear - stained face before [she]159-susy turned on the light -- [poor foolish child]1053-poor foolish child ! [The boy]1049-the boy had returned rather sooner than [Nick]170-nick expected , and [he]170-nick had brought no answer , but merely the statement that [the signora]1010-the signora was out : that [everybody]2183-everybody was out . “ [Everybody]2183-everybody ? ”[170-nick] “ [The signora]1010-the signora and [the four gentlemen who were dining at [the palace]613-the palace]2472-the four gentlemen who were dining at the palace . [They]2472-the four gentlemen who were dining at the palace all went out together on foot soon after dinner . There was [no one]534-no one to whom [I]170-nick could give the note but the gondolier on [the landing]476-the landing , for [the signora]1010-the signora had said [she]1010-the signora would be very late , and had sent [the maid]539-the maid to bed ; and [the maid]539-the maid had , of course , gone out immediately with [[her]539-the maid innamorato]2479-her innamorato . ”[170-nick] “ Ah-- ”[170-nick] said [Nick]170-nick , slipping [his]170-nick reward into [the boy]1049-the boy ’s hand , and walking out of [the restaurant]1058-the restaurant . [Susy]159-susy had gone out -- gone out with [[their]1059-their usual band]1060-their usual band , as [she]159-susy did every night in these sultry summer weeks , gone out after [her]159-susy talk with [Nick]170-nick , as if nothing had happened , as if [his]170-nick whole world and [hers]159-susy had not crashed in ruins at [their]1059-their feet . Ah , [poor Susy]159-susy ! After all , [she]159-susy had merely obeyed the instinct of self preservation , the old hard habit of keeping up , going ahead and hiding [her]159-susy troubles ; unless indeed the habit had already engendered indifference , and it had become as easy for [her]159-susy as for [most of [[her]159-susy friends]926-her friends]1061-most of her friends to pass from drama to dancing , from sorrow to [the cinema]1063-the cinema . What of soul was left , [he]170-nick wondered-- ? [[His]170-nick train]1064-his train did not start till midnight , and after leaving [the restaurant]1058-the restaurant [Nick]170-nick tramped the sultry by - ways till [his]170-nick tired legs brought [him]170-nick to a standstill under the vine - covered pergola of [a gondolier ’s wine - shop]1066-a gondolier ’s wine - shop at [a landing close to [the Piazzetta]73-the piazzetta]1067-a landing close to the piazzetta . There [he]170-nick could absorb cooling drinks until it was time to go to [the station]2395-the station . It was after eleven , and [he]170-nick was beginning to look about for [a boat]1069-a boat , when a black prow pushed up to the steps , and with much chaff and laughter a party of [young people in evening dress]1070-young people in evening dress jumped out . [Nick]170-nick , from under the darkness of the vine , saw that there was only [one lady among [them]1072-them]1071-one lady among them , and it did not need the lamp above [the landing]476-the landing to reveal [her]1071-one lady among them identity . [Susy]159-susy , bareheaded and laughing , a light scarf slipping from [her]159-susy bare shoulders , a cigarette between [her]159-susy fingers , took [Strefford]267-strefford ’s arm and turned in the direction of [Florian]202-florian ’s , with [Gillow]167-fred gillow , [the Prince]965-the prince and [young Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge in [her]159-susy wake .... [Nick]170-nick had relived this rapid scene hundreds of times during [his]170-nick hours in [the train]2221-the train and [his]170-nick aimless trampings through [the streets of [Genoa]68-genoa]1076-the streets of genoa . In that squirrel - wheel of [a world of [his]170-nick]1077-a world of his and [Susy]159-susy ’s [you]1078-you had to keep going or drop out -- and [Susy]159-susy , it was evident , had chosen to keep going . Under the lamp - flare on [the landing]476-the landing [he]170-nick had had a good look at [her]159-susy face , and had seen that the mask of paint and powder was carefully enough adjusted to hide any ravages the scene between [them]1080-them might have left . [He]170-nick even fancied that [she]159-susy had dropped a little atropine into [her]159-susy eyes .... There was no time to spare if [he]170-nick meant to catch [the midnight train]1081-the midnight train , and no gondola in sight but that which [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife had just left . [He]170-nick sprang into it , and bade [the gondolier]1007-the gondolier carry [him]170-nick to [the station]2395-the station . The cushions , as [he]170-nick leaned back , gave out a breath of [her]159-susy scent ; and in the glare of electric light at [the station]2395-the station [he]170-nick saw at [his]170-nick feet a rose which had fallen from [her]159-susy dress . [He]170-nick ground [his]170-nick heel into it as [he]170-nick got out . There it was , then ; that was the last picture [he]170-nick was to have of [her]159-susy . For [he]170-nick knew now that [he]170-nick was not going back ; at least not to take up [their]1086-their life together . [He]170-nick supposed [he]170-nick should have to see [her]159-susy once , to talk things over , settle something for [their]1086-their future . [He]170-nick had been sincere in saying that [he]170-nick bore [her]159-susy no ill - will ; only [he]170-nick could never go back into [that slough]1087-that slough again . If [he]170-nick did , [he]170-nick knew [he]170-nick would inevitably be drawn under , slipping downward from concession to concession .... The noises of a hot summer night in [the port of [Genoa]68-genoa]1088-the port of genoa would have kept the most care - free from slumber ; but though [Nick]170-nick lay awake [he]170-nick did not notice [them]1089-them , for the tumult in [his]170-nick brain was more deafening . Dawn brought a negative relief , and out of sheer weariness [he]170-nick dropped into a heavy sleep . When [he]170-nick woke it was nearly noon , and from [his]170-nick window [he]170-nick saw the well - known outline of [the Ibis]170-nick standing up dark against the glitter of [the harbour]1090-the harbour . [He]170-nick had no fear of meeting [[her]159-susy owners]1091-her owners , who had doubtless long since landed and betaken [themselves]1091-her owners to [cooler and more fashionable regions]1092-cooler and more fashionable regions : oddly enough , the fact seemed to accentuate [his]170-nick loneliness , [his]170-nick sense of having [no one on earth to turn to]1093-no one on earth to turn to . [He]170-nick dressed , and wandered out disconsolately to pick up a cup of coffee in [some shady corner]1094-some shady corner . As [he]170-nick drank [his]170-nick coffee [his]170-nick thoughts gradually cleared . It became obvious to [him]170-nick that [he]170-nick had behaved like [a madman]1095-a madman or [a petulant child]1096-a petulant child -- [he]170-nick preferred to think it was like [a madman]1095-a madman . If [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy were to separate there was no reason why it should not be done decently and quietly , as such transactions were habitually managed among [people of [their]1098-people of their kind kind]1098-people of their kind . It seemed grotesque to introduce melodrama into [[their]1099-their little world of unruffled Sybarites]1100-their little world of unruffled sybarites , and [he]170-nick felt inclined , now , to smile at the incongruity of [his]170-nick gesture .... But suddenly [his]170-nick eyes filled with tears . The future without [Susy]159-susy was unbearable , inconceivable . Why , after all , should [they]1099-their separate ? At the question , [her]159-susy soft face seemed close to [his]170-nick , and that slight lift of the upper lip that made [her]159-susy smile so exquisite . Well -- [he]170-nick would go back . But not with any presence of going to talk things over , come to an agreement , wind up [their]1099-their joint life like [a business association]1101-a business association . No -- if [he]170-nick went back [he]170-nick would go without conditions , for good , forever .... Only , what about the future ? What about the not far - distant day when the wedding cheques would have been spent , and [Granny]241-granny ’s pearls sold , and nothing left except unconcealed and unconditional dependence on [rich friends]1102-rich friends , the role of [the acknowledged hangers - on]1103-the acknowledged hangers - on ? Was there no other possible solution , no new way of ordering [their]1099-their lives ? No -- there was none : [he]170-nick could not picture [Susy]159-susy out of [her]159-susy setting of luxury and leisure , could not picture either of [them]1099-their living such a life as [the Nat Fulmers]174-nat , for instance ! [He]170-nick remembered [the shabby untidy bungalow in [New Hampshire]13-new hampshire]1104-the shabby untidy bungalow in new hampshire , [the slatternly servants]1105-the slatternly servants , uneatable food and [ubiquitous children]1106-ubiquitous children . How could [he]170-nick ask [Susy]159-susy to share such a life with [him]170-nick ? If [he]170-nick did , [she]159-susy would probably have the sense to refuse . [Their]1099-their alliance had been based on a moment ’s midsummer madness ; now the score must be paid .... [He]170-nick decided to write . If [they]1099-their were to part [he]170-nick could not trust [himself]170-nick to see [her]159-susy . [He]170-nick called [a waiter]1107-a waiter , asked for pen and paper , and pushed aside a pile of unread newspapers on the corner of the table where [his]170-nick coffee had been served . As [he]170-nick did so , [his]170-nick eye lit on a Daily Mail of two days before . As a pretext for postponing [his]170-nick letter , [he]170-nick took up the paper and glanced down the first page . [He]170-nick read : “ Tragic Yachting Accident in [the Solent]74-the solent . [The Earl of Altringham]242-the earl of altringham and [[his]1109-their old friend son]2480-his son [Viscount d’Amblay]243-viscount d’amblay drowned in midnight collision . [Both bodies]2481-both bodies recovered . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick read on . [He]170-nick grasped the fact that the disaster had happened the night before [he]170-nick had left [Venice]15-venice and that , as the result of a fog in [the Solent]74-the solent , [[their]1108-their old friend]1109-their old friend [Strefford]267-strefford was now [Earl of Altringham]242-the earl of altringham , and possessor of [one of the largest private fortunes in [England]67-england]1110-one of the largest private fortunes in england . It was vertiginous to think of [[their]1108-their old impecunious [Streff]198-streff]1111-their old impecunious streff as [the hero of such an adventure]1112-the hero of such an adventure . And what irony in that double turn of the wheel which , in one day , had plunged [him]170-nick , [Nick Lansing]170-nick , into nethermost misery , while it tossed the other to the stars ! With an intenser precision [he]170-nick saw again [Susy]159-susy ’s descent from the gondola at [the calle steps]1113-the calle steps , the sound of [her]159-susy laughter and of [Strefford]267-strefford ’s chaff , the way [she]159-susy had caught [his]170-nick arm and clung to it , sweeping [the other men]1114-the other men on in [[her]159-susy train]1115-her train . [Strefford]267-strefford -- [Susy]159-susy and [Strefford]267-strefford ! ... More than once , [Nick]170-nick had noticed the softer inflections of [[his]170-nick friend]717-his friend ’s voice when [he]170-nick spoke to [Susy]159-susy , the brooding look in [his]170-nick lazy eyes when they rested on [her]159-susy . In the security of [his]170-nick wedded bliss [Nick]170-nick had made light of those signs . The only real jealousy [he]170-nick had felt had been of [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow , because of [his]170-nick unlimited power to satisfy [a woman]467-a woman ’s whims . Yet [Nick]170-nick knew that such material advantages would never again suffice for [Susy]159-susy . With [Strefford]267-strefford it was different . [She]159-susy had delighted in [his]267-strefford society while [he]267-strefford was notoriously ineligible ; might not [she]159-susy find [him]267-strefford irresistible now ? The forgotten terms of [their]1118-their bridal compact came back to [Nick]170-nick : the absurd agreement on which [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy had solemnly pledged [their]1118-their faith . But was it so absurd , after all ? It had been [Susy]159-susy ’s suggestion ( not [his]267-strefford , thank [God]236-god ! ) ; and perhaps in making it [she]159-susy had been more serious than [he]267-strefford imagined . Perhaps , even if [their]1118-their rupture had not occurred , [Strefford]267-strefford ’s sudden honours might have caused [her]159-susy to ask for [her]159-susy freedom .... Money , luxury , fashion , pleasure : those were the four cornerstones of [her]159-susy existence . [He]267-strefford had always known it -- [she]159-susy [herself]159-susy had always acknowledged it , even in [their]1118-their last dreadful talk together ; and once [he]267-strefford had gloried in [her]159-susy frankness . How could [he]267-strefford ever have imagined that , to have [her]159-susy fill of these things , [she]159-susy would not in time stoop lower than [she]159-susy had yet stooped ? Perhaps in giving [her]159-susy up to [Strefford]267-strefford [he]267-strefford might be saving [her]159-susy . At any rate , the taste of the past was now so bitter to [him]267-strefford that [he]267-strefford was moved to thank whatever gods there were for pushing that mortuary paragraph under [his]267-strefford eye .... “ [Susy]159-susy , [dear]2236-dear [ [he]267-strefford wrote ] , the fates seem to have taken [our]1118-their future in hand , and spared [us]1118-their the trouble of unravelling it . If [I]0-i have sometimes been selfish enough to forget the conditions on which [you]159-susy agreed to marry [me]0-i , [they]2483-they have come back to [me]0-i during these two days of solitude . [You]159-susy ’ve given [me]0-i the best [a man]2216-a man can have , and nothing else will ever be worth much to [me]0-i . But since [I]0-i have n’t the ability to provide [you]159-susy with what [you]159-susy want , [I]0-i recognize that [I]0-i ’ve no right to stand in [your]159-susy way . [We]1118-their must owe no more [Venetian palaces]2485-venetian palaces to underhand services . [I]0-i see by the newspapers that [Streff]198-streff can now give [you]159-susy as many [palaces]2486-palaces as [you]159-susy want . Let [him]2216-a man have the chance -- [I]0-i fancy [he]2216-a man ’ll jump at it , and [he]2216-a man ’s [the best man in sight]2487-the best man in sight . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were in [his]2216-a man shoes . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll write again in a day or two , when [I]0-i ’ve collected [my]0-i wits , and can give [you]1119-you an address . [NICK]170-nick . ” [He]2216-a man added a line on the subject of [their]2488-their modest funds , put the letter into an envelope , and addressed it to [Mrs. Nicholas Lansing]2489-mrs. nicholas lansing . As [he]2216-a man did so , [he]2216-a man reflected that it was the first time [he]2216-a man had ever written [[his]2216-a man wife]332-his wife ’s married name . “[170-nick] Well -- by [God]236-god , [no other woman]1120-no other woman shall have it after [her]1121-her , ” [he]2216-a man vowed , as [he]2216-a man groped in [his]2216-a man pocketbook for a stamp . [He]2216-a man stood up with a stretch of weariness -- the heat was stifling!--and put the letter in [his]2216-a man pocket . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll post it [myself]0-i , it ’s safer , ” [he]2216-a man thought ; “[0-i] and then what in the name of goodness shall [I]0-i do next , [I]0-i wonder ? ” [He]2216-a man jammed [his]2216-a man hat down on [his]2216-a man head and walked out into the sun - blaze . As [he]2216-a man was turning away from [the square]2491-the square by [the general Post Office]2492-the general post office , [a white parasol]2493-a white parasol waved from [a passing cab]2494-a passing cab , and [Coral Hicks]196-coral leaned forward with outstretched hand . “[0-i] [I]0-i knew [I]0-i ’d find [you]0-i , ” [she]0-i triumphed . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve been driving up and down in this broiling sun for hours , shopping and watching for [you]0-i at the same time . ” [He]2216-a man stared at [her]0-i blankly , too bewildered even to wonder how [she]0-i knew [he]2216-a man was in [Genoa]68-genoa ; and [she]0-i continued , with the kind of shy imperiousness that always made [him]2216-a man feel , in [her]0-i presence , like [a member of an orchestra under a masterful baton]2495-a member of an orchestra under a masterful baton ; “[0-i] Now please get right into [this carriage]1122-this carriage , and do n’t keep [me]0-i roasting here another minute . ” To the cabdriver [she]0-i called out : “[0-i] Al porto . ” [Nick Lansing]170-nick sank down beside [her]0-i . As [he]170-nick did so [he]170-nick noticed a heap of bundles at [her]0-i feet , and felt that [he]170-nick had simply added one more to the number . [He]170-nick supposed that [she]0-i was taking [her]0-i spoils to [the Ibis]170-nick , and that [he]170-nick would be carried up to [the deck - house]2496-the deck - house to be displayed with [the others]2262-the others . Well , it would all help to pass the day -- and by night [he]170-nick would have reached some kind of a decision about [his]170-nick future . On the third day after [Nick]170-nick ’s departure the post brought to the [Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn three letters for [Mrs. Lansing]2498-mrs. lansing . [The first to arrive]2499-the first to arrive was a word from [Strefford]267-strefford , scribbled in [the train]2221-the train and posted at [Turin]75-turin . In it [he]267-strefford briefly said that [he]267-strefford had been called [home]606-home by the dreadful accident of which [Susy]159-susy had probably read in the daily papers . [He]267-strefford added that [he]267-strefford would write again from [England]67-england , and then -- in a blotted postscript-- : “[0-i] [I]0-i wanted uncommonly badly to see [you]1123-you for good - bye , but the hour was impossible . Regards to [Nick]170-nick . Do write [me]0-i just a word to [Altringham]267-strefford . ” The other two letters , which came together in the afternoon , were both from [Genoa]68-genoa . [Susy]159-susy scanned the addresses and fell upon the one in [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s writing . [Her]159-susy hand trembled so much that for a moment [she]159-susy could not open the envelope . When [she]159-susy had done so , [she]159-susy devoured the letter in a flash , and then sat and brooded over the outspread page as it lay on [her]159-susy knee . It might mean so many things -- [she]159-susy could read into it so many harrowing alternatives of indifference and despair , of irony and tenderness ! Was [he]267-strefford suffering tortures when [he]267-strefford wrote it , or seeking only to inflict them upon [her]159-susy ? Or did the words represent [his]267-strefford actual feelings , no more and no less , and did [he]267-strefford really intend [her]159-susy to understand that [he]267-strefford considered it [his]267-strefford duty to abide by the letter of [their]1125-their preposterous compact ? [He]267-strefford had left [her]159-susy in wrath and indignation , yet , as a closer scrutiny revealed , there was not a word of reproach in [his]267-strefford brief lines . Perhaps that was why , in the last issue , they seemed so cold to [her]159-susy .... [She]159-susy shivered and turned to the other envelope . The large stilted characters , though half - familiar , called up no definite image . [She]159-susy opened the envelope and discovered a post - card of the Ibis , canvas spread , bounding over a rippled sea . On the back was written : “[1124-you] So awfully dear of [you]1124-you to lend [us]1125-their [Mr. Lansing]170-nick for a little cruise . [You]1124-you may count on [our]1125-their taking the best of care of [him]170-nick . “ CORAL ”[1124-you] PART II XIII WHEN [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose had said to [Susy Branch]159-susy , the winter before in [New York]12-new york : “ But why on earth do n’t [you]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick go to [[my]161-violet melrose little place at [Versailles]2-versailles]2503-my little place at versailles for the honeymoon ? [I]161-violet melrose ’m off to [China]76-china , and [you]159-susy could have it to [yourselves]159-susy all summer , ”[161-violet melrose] the offer had been tempting enough to make [the lovers]1126-the lovers waver . It was such [an artless ingenuous little house]1127-an artless ingenuous little house , so full of the demoralizing simplicity of great wealth , that [it]1127-an artless ingenuous little house seemed to [Susy]159-susy just the kind of place in which to take the first steps in renunciation . But [Nick]170-nick had objected that [Paris]4-paris , at that time of year , would be swarming with acquaintances who would hunt [them]1126-the lovers down at all hours ; and [Susy]159-susy ’s own experience had led [her]159-susy to remark that there was nothing [the very rich]1128-the very rich enjoyed more than taking pot - luck with [the very poor]1129-the very poor . [They]1130-they therefore gave [[Strefford]267-strefford ’s villa]2176-strefford ’s villa the preference , with an inward proviso ( on [Susy]159-susy ’s part ) that [[Violet]161-violet melrose ’s house]1132-violet ’s house might very conveniently serve [their]1130-they purpose at another season . These thoughts were in [her]159-susy mind as [she]159-susy drove up to [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s door on a rainy afternoon late in August , [her]159-susy boxes piled high on the roof of [the cab [she]159-susy had taken at [the station]2395-the station]1133-the cab she had taken at the station . [She]159-susy had travelled straight through from [Venice]15-venice , stopping in [Milan]19-milan just long enough to pick up a reply to the telegram [she]159-susy had despatched to [the perfect housekeeper whose permanent presence enabled [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose]1135-the perfect housekeeper whose permanent presence enabled mrs. melrose to say : “ Oh , when [I]244-mrs. melrose ’m sick of everything [I]244-mrs. melrose just rush off without warning to [[my]244-mrs. melrose little shanty at [Versailles]2-versailles]2504-my little shanty at versailles , and live there all alone on scrambled eggs . ”[244-mrs. melrose] [The perfect house - keeper]1136-the perfect house - keeper had replied to [Susy]159-susy ’s enquiry : “ Am sure [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose most happy ”[1136-the perfect house - keeper] ; and [Susy]159-susy , without further thought , had jumped into [a Versailles train]1137-a versailles train , and now stood in the thin rain before the sphinx - guarded threshold of [the pavilion]1138-the pavilion . The revolving year had brought around the season at which [[Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s house]1139-mrs. melrose ’s house might be convenient : [no visitors]1140-no visitors were to be feared at [Versailles]2-versailles at the end of August , and though [Susy]159-susy ’s reasons for seeking solitude were so remote from those [she]159-susy had once prefigured , they were none the less cogent . To be alone -- alone ! After those first exposed days when , in the persistent presence of [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow and [[his]1141-his satellites]1142-his satellites , and in the mocking radiance of late summer on [the lagoons]1143-the lagoons , [she]159-susy had fumed and turned about in [her]159-susy agony like a trapped animal in a cramping cage , to be alone had seemed the only respite , the one craving : to be alone somewhere in a setting as unlike as possible to the sensual splendours of [Venice]15-venice , under skies as unlike [its]15-venice azure roof . If [she]159-susy could have chosen [she]159-susy would have crawled away into [a dingy inn in [a rainy northern town]1145-a rainy northern town , where [she]159-susy had never been and [no one]534-no one knew [her]159-susy]1144-a dingy inn in a rainy northern town , where she had never been and no one knew her . Failing that unobtainable luxury , here [she]159-susy was on the threshold of [an empty house]1147-an empty house , in [a deserted place , under lowering skies]1148-a deserted place , under lowering skies . [She]159-susy had shaken off [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow , sulkily departing for [[his]1141-his moor ( where [she]159-susy had half - promised to join [him]1141-his in [September]77-september]1149-his moor ( where she had half - promised to join him in september ) ; [the Prince]965-the prince , [young Breckenridge]233-young breckenridge , and [the few remaining survivors of [the Venetian group]1152-the venetian group]1151-the few remaining survivors of the venetian group , had dispersed in [the direction of [the Engadine]78-the engadine or [Biarritz]50-biarritz]1153-the direction of the engadine or biarritz ; and now [she]159-susy could at least collect [her]159-susy wits , take stock of [herself]159-susy , and prepare the countenance with which [she]159-susy was to face the next stage in [her]159-susy career . Thank [God]236-god it was raining at [Versailles]2-versailles ! The door opened , [she]159-susy heard voices in [the drawing - room]818-the drawing - room , and a slender languishing figure appeared on the threshold . “ Darling ! ”[161-violet melrose] [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose cried in an embrace , drawing [her]159-susy into [the dusky perfumed room]1155-the dusky perfumed room . “ But [I]161-violet melrose thought [you]161-violet melrose were in [China]76-china ! ”[161-violet melrose] [Susy]159-susy stammered . “ In [China]76-china ... in [China]76-china , ”[161-violet melrose] [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose stared with dreamy eyes , and [Susy]159-susy remembered [her]159-susy drifting disorganised life , a life more planless , more inexplicable than that of any of [the other ephemeral beings blown about upon the same winds of pleasure]1156-the other ephemeral beings blown about upon the same winds of pleasure . “ Well , [Madam]245-madam , [I]1136-the perfect house - keeper thought so [myself]1136-the perfect house - keeper till [I]1136-the perfect house - keeper got a wire from [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose last evening , ”[1136-the perfect house - keeper] remarked [the perfect house - keeper]1136-the perfect house - keeper , following with [Susy]159-susy ’s handbag . [Fulmer]175-grace ! ”[159-susy] and , while [Susy Lansing]159-susy stood in the middle of [the room]379-the room with widening eyes , [a man]2216-a man emerged from the more deeply cushioned and scented twilight of [some inner apartment]1160-some inner apartment , and [she]159-susy saw with surprise [Nat Fulmer]247-nat , [the good [Nat Fulmer]247-nat of [the New Hampshire bungalow]1162-the new hampshire bungalow]1161-the good nat fulmer of the new hampshire bungalow and [the ubiquitous progeny]1163-the ubiquitous progeny , standing before [her]159-susy in lordly ease , [his]247-nat hands in [his]247-nat pockets , a cigarette between [his]247-nat lips , [his]247-nat feet solidly planted in the insidious depths of one of [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose ’s white leopard skins . “ [Susy]159-susy ! ”[247-nat] [he]247-nat shouted with open arms ; and [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose murmured : “ [You]159-susy did n’t know , then ? [I]809-his hostess ’ve travelled day and night to be here to meet [him]247-nat , ”[809-his hostess] [she]809-his hostess declared . “ But , [[you]159-susy darling]2511-you darling , ”[809-his hostess] and [she]809-his hostess held out a caressing hand to [Susy]159-susy , “ [I]809-his hostess ’m forgetting to ask if [you]159-susy ’ve had tea ? ”[809-his hostess] An hour later , over the tea - table , [Susy]159-susy already felt [herself]159-susy mysteriously reabsorbed into what had so long been [her]159-susy native element . [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie had brought a breath of it to [Venice]15-venice ; but [Susy]159-susy was then nourished on another air , the air of [Nick]170-nick ’s presence and personality ; now that [she]159-susy was abandoned , left again to [her]159-susy own devices , [she]159-susy felt [herself]159-susy suddenly at the mercy of the influences from which [she]159-susy thought [she]159-susy had escaped . In the queer social whirligig from which [she]159-susy had so lately fled , it seemed natural enough that a shake of the box should have tossed [Nat Fulmer]247-nat into celebrity , and sent [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose chasing back from the ends of [the earth]1165-the earth to bask in [his]247-nat success . [Susy]159-susy knew that [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose belonged to [the class of moral parasites]1166-the class of moral parasites ; for in [that strange world]1167-that strange world the parts were sometimes reversed , and [the wealthy]1168-the wealthy preyed upon [the pauper]1169-the pauper . Wherever there was a reputation to batten on , there poor [Violet]161-violet melrose appeared , [a harmless vampire in pearls who sought only to feed on the notoriety which [all [her]161-violet melrose millions could not create for [her]161-violet melrose]1171-all her millions could not create for her]1170-a harmless vampire in pearls who sought only to feed on the notoriety which all her millions could not create for her . [Any one less versed than [Susy]159-susy in the shallow mysteries of [[her]159-susy little world]1173-her little world]1172-any one less versed than susy in the shallow mysteries of her little world would have seen in [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose [a baleful enchantress]1174-a baleful enchantress , in [Nat Fulmer]247-nat [[her]161-violet melrose helpless victim]1175-her helpless victim . [Susy]159-susy knew better . [Violet]161-violet melrose , [poor Violet]161-violet melrose , was not even that . [The insignificant Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , with [her]184-ellie brief trivial passions , [her]184-ellie artless mixture of amorous and social interests , was [a woman with a purpose]1176-a woman with a purpose , a creature who fulfilled [herself]1176-a woman with a purpose ; but [Violet]161-violet melrose was only a drifting interrogation . And what of [Fulmer]247-nat ? Mustering with new eyes [his]247-nat short sturdily - built figure , [his]247-nat nondescript bearded face , and the eyes that dreamed and wandered , and then suddenly sank into [you]1177-you like claws , [Susy]159-susy seemed to have found the key to all [his]247-nat years of dogged toil , [his]247-nat indifference to neglect , indifference to poverty , indifference to the needs of [[his]247-nat growing family]1178-his growing family .... Yes : for the first time [she]159-susy saw that [he]247-nat looked commonplace enough to be [a genius]1179-a genius -- was [a genius]1179-a genius , perhaps , even though it was [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose who affirmed it ! [Susy]159-susy looked steadily at [Fulmer]247-nat , [their]1181-their eyes met , and [he]247-nat smiled at [her]159-susy faintly through [his]247-nat beard . “ Yes , [I]247-nat did discover [him]247-nat -- [I]247-nat did , ”[247-nat] [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose was insisting , from the depths of the black velvet divan in which [she]244-mrs. melrose lay sunk like a wan Nereid in [a midnight sea]1182-a midnight sea . “ [You]159-susy must n’t believe a word that [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula tells [you]159-susy about having pounced on [his]247-nat ‘ Spring Snow Storm ’ in a dark corner of [the American Artists ’ exhibition]2512-the american artists ’ exhibition -- skied , if [you]159-susy please ! [They]2513-they skied [him]247-nat less than a year ago ! And naturally [Ursula]168-ursula never in [her]168-ursula life looked higher than the first line at a picture - show . And now [she]168-ursula actually pretends ... oh , for pity ’s sake do n’t say it does n’t matter , [Fulmer]247-nat ! [Your]159-susy saying that just encourages [her]168-ursula , and makes [people]421-people think [she]168-ursula did . When , in reality , [any one who saw [me]244-mrs. melrose at the exhibition on varnishing]2515-any one who saw me at the exhibition on varnishing - day .... Who ? Well , [Eddy Breckenridge]249-little breckenridge , for instance . [He]249-little breckenridge was in [Egypt]82-egypt , [you]159-susy say ? Perhaps [he]249-little breckenridge was ! As if [one]2186-one could remember [the people]2517-the people about one , when suddenly [one]2186-one comes upon a great work of art , as [St. Paul]250-st. paul did -- didn’t he?--and the scales fell from [his]250-st. paul eyes . Well ... that ’s exactly what happened to [me]244-mrs. melrose that day ... and [Ursula]168-ursula , [everybody]2183-everybody knows , was down at [Roslyn]80-roslyn at the time , and did n’t come up for the opening of the exhibition at all . And [Fulmer]247-nat sits there and laughs , and says it does n’t matter , and that [he]247-nat ’ll paint another picture any day for [me]244-mrs. melrose to discover ! ”[244-mrs. melrose] [Susy]159-susy had rung the door - bell with a hand trembling with eagerness -- eagerness to be alone , to be quiet , to stare [her]159-susy situation in the face , and collect [herself]159-susy before [she]159-susy came out again among [[her]159-susy kind]1183-her kind . [She]159-susy had stood on the door - step , cowering among [her]159-susy bags , counting the instants till a step sounded and the door - knob turned , letting [her]159-susy in from the searching glare of [the outer world]1184-the outer world .... And now [she]159-susy had sat for an hour in [[Violet]161-violet melrose ’s drawing - room]1185-violet ’s drawing - room , in [the very house where [her]159-susy honey - moon might have been spent]1186-the very house where her honey - moon might have been spent ; and [no one]534-no one had asked [her]159-susy where [she]159-susy had come from , or why [she]159-susy was alone , or what was the key to the tragedy written on [her]159-susy shrinking face .... That was the way of [the world]2205-the world [they]1189-they lived in . [Nobody]2219-nobody questioned , [nobody]2219-nobody wondered any more -- because [nobody]2219-nobody had time to remember . The old risk of prying curiosity , of malicious gossip , was virtually over : [one]2186-one was left with [one]2186-one ’s drama , [one]2186-one ’s disaster , on one ’s hands , because there was [nobody]2219-nobody to stop and notice the little shrouded object [one]2186-one was carrying . As [Susy]159-susy watched [the two people before [her]159-susy]1198-the two people before her , each so frankly unaffected by [her]159-susy presence , [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose so engrossed in [her]161-violet melrose feverish pursuit of notoriety , [Fulmer]247-nat so plunged in the golden sea of [his]247-nat success , [she]159-susy felt like a ghost making inaudible and imperceptible appeals to the grosser senses of [the living]1199-the living . “ If [I]159-susy wanted to be alone , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought , “ [I]159-susy ’m alone enough , in all conscience . ”[159-susy] There was a deathly chill in such security . [She]159-susy turned to [Fulmer]247-nat . “ And [Grace]175-grace ? ”[159-susy] [He]247-nat beamed back without sign of embarrassment . “ Oh , [she]175-grace ’s here , naturally -- [we’re]2520-we’re in [Paris]4-paris , [kids]2521-kids and all . In [a pension]2522-a pension , where [we]2520-we’re can polish up the lingo . But [I]247-nat hardly ever lay eyes on [her]175-grace , because [she]175-grace ’s as deep in music as [I]247-nat am in paint ; it was as big a chance for [her]175-grace as for [me]247-nat , [you]159-susy see , and [she]175-grace ’s making the most of it , fiddling and listening to the fiddlers . Well , it ’s a considerable change from [New Hampshire]13-new hampshire . ”[247-nat] [He]247-nat looked at [her]159-susy dreamily , as if making an intense effort to detach [himself]247-nat from [his]247-nat dream , and situate [her]159-susy in the fading past . “ Remember [the bungalow]2523-the bungalow ? And [Nick]170-nick -- ah , how ’s [Nick]170-nick ? ”[247-nat] [he]247-nat brought out triumphantly . “ Oh , yes -- darling [Nick]170-nick ? ”[247-nat] [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose chimed in ; and [Susy]159-susy , [her]159-susy head erect , [her]159-susy cheeks aflame , declared with resonance : “ Most awfully well -- splendidly ! ”[159-susy] “ [He]170-nick ’s not [here]2184-here , though ? ”[175-grace] from [Fulmer]175-grace . “ No . [He]170-nick ’s off travelling -- cruising . ”[159-susy] [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s attention was faintly roused . “ With [anybody interesting]2525-anybody interesting ? ”[244-mrs. melrose] “ No ; [you]244-mrs. melrose would n’t know [them]2525-anybody interesting . [People]421-people [we]2527-we met .... ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy did not have to continue , for [[her]159-susy hostess]620-her hostess ’s gaze had again strayed . “ And [you]244-mrs. melrose ’ve come for [your]244-mrs. melrose clothes , [I]159-susy suppose , [darling]2329-darling ? Do n’t listen to [people who say that skirts are to be wider]2529-people who say that skirts are to be wider . [I]159-susy ’ve discovered [a new woman]2530-a new woman -- [a Genius]1179-a genius -- and [she]2530-a new woman absolutely swathes [you]244-mrs. melrose .... [Her]2530-a new woman name ’s [my]159-susy secret ; but [we]2527-we ’ll go to [her]2530-a new woman together . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy rose from [her]159-susy engulphing armchair . “ Do [you]620-her hostess mind if [I]159-susy go up to [[my]159-susy room]2532-my room ? [I]159-susy ’m rather tired -- coming straight through . ”[159-susy] “ Of course , [dear]2236-dear . [I]1201-i think there are [some people]2206-some people coming to dinner ... [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match will tell [you]2236-dear . [She]251-mrs. match has such a memory .... [Fulmer]175-grace , where on earth are those cartoons of [the music - room]2535-the music - room ? ”[1201-i] [Their]1201-i voices pursued [Susy]159-susy [upstairs]485-upstairs , as , in [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match ’s perpendicular wake , [she]159-susy mounted to [the white - panelled room with [its]1203-the white - panelled room with its gay linen hangings and the low bed heaped with more cushions gay linen hangings and the low bed heaped with more cushions]1203-the white - panelled room with its gay linen hangings and the low bed heaped with more cushions . “ If [we]1201-i ’d come [here]2184-here , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought , “ everything might have been different . ”[159-susy] And [she]159-susy shuddered at the sumptuous memories of [the Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn , and [the great painted bedroom where [she]159-susy had met [her]159-susy doom]1204-the great painted bedroom where she had met her doom . [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match , hoping [she]159-susy would find everything , and mentioning that dinner was not till nine , shut [her]159-susy softly in among [her]159-susy terrors . “ Find everything ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy echoed the phrase . Oh , yes , [she]159-susy would always find everything : every time the door shut on [her]159-susy now , and the sound of voices ceased , [her]159-susy memories would be there waiting for [her]159-susy , every one of [them]1205-them , waiting quietly , patiently , obstinately , like [poor people in [[a doctor]1207-a doctor ’s office]1208-a doctor ’s office]1206-poor people in a doctor ’s office , [the people who are always last to be attended to , but whom nothing will discourage or drive away]1209-the people who are always last to be attended to , but whom nothing will discourage or drive away , [people to whom time is nothing , fatigue nothing , hunger nothing , other engagements nothing]1210-people to whom time is nothing , fatigue nothing , hunger nothing , other engagements nothing : who just wait .... Thank heaven , after all , that [she]159-susy had not found [the house]342-the house empty , if , whenever [she]159-susy returned to [[her]159-susy room]664-her room , [she]159-susy was to meet [her]159-susy memories [there]2229-there ! It was just a week since [Nick]170-nick had left [her]159-susy . During that week , crammed with [people]421-people , questions , packing , explaining , evading , [she]159-susy had believed that in solitude lay [her]159-susy salvation . Now [she]159-susy understood that there was nothing [she]159-susy was so unprepared for , so unfitted for . When , in all [her]159-susy life , had [she]159-susy ever been alone ? And how was [she]159-susy to bear it now , with all these ravening memories besetting [her]159-susy ! Dinner not till nine ? What on earth was [she]159-susy to do till nine o’clock ? [She]159-susy knelt before [her]159-susy boxes , and feverishly began to unpack . Gradually , imperceptibly , the subtle influences of [her]159-susy old life were stealing into [her]159-susy . As [she]159-susy pulled out [her]159-susy tossed and crumpled dresses [she]159-susy remembered [Violet]161-violet melrose ’s emphatic warning : “ Do n’t believe [the people who tell [you]2538-you that skirts are going to be wider . ”[161-violet melrose] Were [hers]1215-hers]2537-the people who tell you that skirts are going to be wider . ” were hers , perhaps , too wide as it was ? [She]159-susy looked at [her]159-susy limp raiment , piling itself up on bed and sofa , and understood that , according to [Violet]161-violet melrose ’s standards , and that of all [her]159-susy set , those dresses , which [Nick]170-nick had thought so original and exquisite , were already commonplace and dowdy , fit only to be passed on to [poor relations]1216-poor relations or given to [one ’s maid]1217-one ’s maid . And [Susy]159-susy would have to go on wearing them till [they]1218-they fell to bits -- or else .... Well , or else begin the old life again in some new form .... [She]159-susy laughed aloud at the turn of [her]159-susy thoughts . Dresses ? How little [they]1218-they had mattered a few short weeks ago ! And now , perhaps , they would again be one of the foremost considerations in [her]159-susy life . How could it be otherwise , if [she]159-susy were to return again to [her]159-susy old dependence on [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula , [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose ? And beyond that , only [the Bockheimers]169-the bockheimers and [their]1219-their kind awaited [her]159-susy .... A knock on the door -- what a relief ! It was [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match again , with a telegram . To whom had [Susy]159-susy given [her]159-susy new address ? With a throbbing heart [she]159-susy tore open the envelope and read : “ Shall be in [Paris]4-paris Friday for twenty - four hours where can [I]159-susy see [you]267-strefford write [Nouveau Luxe]84-nouveau luxe . ”[159-susy] Ah , yes -- [she]159-susy remembered now : [she]159-susy had written to [Strefford]267-strefford ! And this was [his]267-strefford answer : [he]267-strefford was coming . [She]159-susy dropped into a chair , and tried to think . What on earth had [she]159-susy said in [her]159-susy letter ? It had been mainly , of course , one of condolence ; but now [she]159-susy remembered having added , in a precipitate postscript : “ [I]159-susy ca n’t give [your]267-strefford message to [Nick]170-nick , for [he]170-nick ’s gone off with [the Hickses]177-the hickses -- [I]159-susy do n’t know where , or for how long . It ’s all right , of course : it was in [our]2539-our bargain . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy had not meant to put in that last phrase ; but as [she]159-susy sealed [her]159-susy letter to [Strefford]267-strefford [her]159-susy eye had fallen on [Nick]170-nick ’s missive , which lay beside it . Nothing in [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband ’s brief lines had embittered [her]159-susy as much as the allusion to [Strefford]267-strefford . It seemed to imply that [Nick]170-nick ’s own plans were made , that [his]170-nick own future was secure , and that [he]170-nick could therefore freely and handsomely take thought for [hers]159-susy , and give [her]159-susy a pointer in the right direction . Sudden rage had possessed [her]159-susy at the thought : where [she]159-susy had at first read jealousy [she]159-susy now saw only a cold providence , and in a blur of tears [she]159-susy had scrawled [her]159-susy postscript to [Strefford]267-strefford . [She]159-susy remembered that [she]159-susy had not even asked [him]267-strefford to keep [her]159-susy secret . Well -- after all , what would it matter if [people]421-people should already know that [Nick]170-nick had left [her]159-susy ? [Their]1222-their parting could not long remain a mystery , and the fact that it was known might help [her]159-susy to keep up a presence of indifference . “ It was in the bargain -- in the bargain , ”[159-susy] rang through [her]159-susy brain as [she]159-susy re - read [Strefford]267-strefford ’s telegram . [She]159-susy understood that [he]267-strefford had snatched the time for this hasty trip solely in the hope of seeing [her]159-susy , and [her]159-susy eyes filled . The more bitterly [she]159-susy thought of [Nick]170-nick the more this proof of [Strefford]267-strefford ’s friendship moved [her]159-susy . The clock , to [her]159-susy relief , reminded [her]159-susy that it was time to dress for dinner . [She]159-susy would go down presently , chat with [Violet]161-violet melrose and [Fulmer]175-grace , and with [[Violet]161-violet melrose ’s other guests]1223-violet ’s other guests , who would probably be odd and amusing , and too much out of [[her]159-susy world]583-her world to embarrass [her]159-susy by awkward questions . [She]159-susy would sit at a softly - lit table , breathe delicate scents , eat exquisite food ( trust [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match ! ) , and be gradually drawn again under the spell of [her]159-susy old associations . Anything , anything but to be alone .... [She]159-susy dressed with even more than [her]159-susy habitual care , reddened [her]159-susy lips attentively , brushed the faintest bloom of pink over [her]159-susy drawn cheeks , and went down -- to meet [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match coming up with a tray . “ Oh , [Madam]2540-madam , [I]251-mrs. match thought [you]2540-madam were too tired .... [I]251-mrs. match was bringing it up to [you]2540-madam [myself]251-mrs. match -- just a little morsel of chicken . ”[251-mrs. match] [Susy]159-susy , glancing past [her]251-mrs. match , saw , through the open door , that the lamps were not lit in [the drawing - room]818-the drawing - room . “ Oh , no , [I]159-susy ’m not tired , thank [you]2540-madam . [I]159-susy thought [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose expected [friends]726-friends at dinner ! ”[159-susy] “ [Friends]726-friends at dinner - to - night ? ”[251-mrs. match] [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match heaved a despairing sigh . Sometimes , the sigh seemed to say , [[her]251-mrs. match mistress]1226-her mistress put too great a strain upon [her]251-mrs. match . “ Why , [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose and [Mr. Fulmer]252-mr. fulmer were engaged to dine in [Paris]4-paris . [They]2543-they left an hour ago . [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose told [me]1227-the house - keeper [she]244-mrs. melrose ’d told [you]159-susy , ”[1227-the house - keeper] [the house - keeper]1227-the house - keeper wailed . [Susy]159-susy kept [her]159-susy little fixed smile . “ [I]159-susy must have misunderstood . In that case ... well , yes , if it ’s no trouble , [I]159-susy believe [I]159-susy will have [my]159-susy tray [upstairs]485-upstairs . ”[159-susy] Slowly [she]159-susy turned , and followed [the housekeeper]1228-the housekeeper up into the dread solitude [she]159-susy had just left . [XIV]253-xiv . THE next day [a lot of [people]421-people]1229-a lot of people turned up unannounced for luncheon . [They]1229-a lot of people were not of the far - fetched and the exotic , in whom [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose now specialized , but merely [commonplace fashionable people belonging to [[Susy]159-susy ’s own group]1232-susy ’s own group]1231-commonplace fashionable people belonging to susy ’s own group , [people familiar with the amusing romance of [her]159-susy penniless marriage]1233-people familiar with the amusing romance of her penniless marriage , and to whom [she]159-susy had to explain ( though none of [them]1229-a lot of people really listened to the explanation ) that [Nick]170-nick was not with [her]159-susy just now but had gone off cruising ... cruising in the AEgean with [friends]726-friends ... getting up material for [his]170-nick book ( this detail had occurred to [her]159-susy in the night ) . It was the kind of encounter [she]159-susy had most dreaded ; but it proved , after all , easy enough to go through compared with those endless hours of turning to and fro , the night before , in the cage of [[her]159-susy lonely room]1235-her lonely room . Anything , anything , but to be alone .... Gradually , from the force of habit , [she]159-susy found [herself]159-susy actually in tune with the talk of the luncheon table , interested in the references to [absent friends]1236-absent friends , the light allusions to last year ’s loves and quarrels , scandals and absurdities . [The women]1237-the women , in [their]1237-the women pale summer dresses , were so graceful , indolent and sure of [themselves]1237-the women , [the men]972-the men so easy and good - humoured ! Perhaps , after all , [Susy]159-susy reflected , it was [the world [she]159-susy was meant for]1239-the world she was meant for , since the other , [the brief Paradise of [her]159-susy dreams]1240-the brief paradise of her dreams , had already shut its golden doors upon [her]159-susy . And then , as [they]1241-they sat on [the terrace]1242-the terrace after luncheon , looking across at the yellow tree - tops of [the park]1243-the park , [one of [the women]1237-the women]1244-one of the women said something -- made just an allusion -- that [Susy]159-susy would have let pass unnoticed in the old days , but that now filled [her]159-susy with a sudden deep disgust .... [She]159-susy stood up and wandered away , away from [them]1241-they all through [the fading garden]1246-the fading garden . Two days later [Susy]159-susy and [Strefford]267-strefford sat on [the terrace of [the Tuileries above [the Seine]85-the seine]1248-the tuileries above the seine]1247-the terrace of the tuileries above the seine . [She]159-susy had asked [him]267-strefford to meet [her]159-susy there , with the desire to avoid [the crowded halls and drawing - room of [the Nouveau Luxe where , even at that supposedly “ dead ”[159-susy] season]1250-the nouveau luxe where , even at that supposedly “ dead ” season]1249-the crowded halls and drawing - room of the nouveau luxe where , even at that supposedly “ dead ” season , [people one]1251-people one knew were always drifting to and fro ; and [they]1241-they sat on a bench in the pale sunlight , the discoloured leaves heaped at [their]1241-they feet , and [no one]534-no one to share [their]1241-they solitude but [a lame working - man]1253-a lame working - man and [a haggard woman who were lunching together mournfully at the other end of the majestic vista]1254-a haggard woman who were lunching together mournfully at the other end of the majestic vista . [Strefford]267-strefford , in [his]267-strefford new mourning , looked unnaturally prosperous and well - valeted ; but [his]267-strefford ugly untidy features remained as undisciplined , [his]267-strefford smile as whimsical , as of old . [He]267-strefford had been on cool though friendly terms with [the pompous uncle]1255-the pompous uncle and [the poor sickly cousin whose joint disappearance had so abruptly transformed [his]267-strefford future]1256-the poor sickly cousin whose joint disappearance had so abruptly transformed his future ; and it was [his]267-strefford way to understate [his]267-strefford feelings rather than to pretend more than [he]267-strefford felt . Nevertheless , beneath [his]267-strefford habitual bantering tone [Susy]159-susy discerned a change . The disaster had shocked [him]267-strefford profoundly ; already , in [his]267-strefford brief sojourn among [[his]267-strefford people]1257-his people and among the great possessions so tragically acquired , old instincts had awakened , forgotten associations had spoken in [him]267-strefford . [Susy]159-susy listened to [him]267-strefford wistfully , silenced by [her]159-susy imaginative perception of the distance that these things had put between [them]1258-them . “ It was horrible ... seeing [them]1258-them both there together , laid out in [that hideous Pugin chapel at [Altringham]267-strefford]2545-that hideous pugin chapel at altringham ... [the poor boy]2546-the poor boy especially . [I]267-strefford suppose that ’s really what ’s cutting [me]267-strefford up now , ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford murmured , almost apologetically . “ Oh , it ’s more than that -- more than [you]267-strefford know , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy insisted ; but [he]267-strefford jerked back : “ Now , [[my]267-strefford dear]445-my dear , do n’t be edifying , please , ”[267-strefford] and fumbled for a cigarette in the pocket which was already beginning to bulge with [his]267-strefford miscellaneous properties . “ And now about [you]159-susy -- for that ’s what [I]267-strefford came for , ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford continued , turning to [her]159-susy with one of [his]267-strefford sudden movements . “ [I]267-strefford could n’t make head or tail of [your]159-susy letter . ”[267-strefford] [She]159-susy paused a moment to steady [her]159-susy voice . “ Could n’t [you]267-strefford ? [I]159-susy suppose [you]267-strefford ’d forgotten [my]159-susy bargain with [Nick]170-nick . [He]267-strefford hadn’t -- and [he]267-strefford ’s asked [me]159-susy to fulfil it . ”[159-susy] [Strefford]267-strefford stared . “ What -- that nonsense about [your]159-susy setting each other free if either of [you]159-susy had the chance to make a good match ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy signed “ Yes . ”[267-strefford] “ And [he]267-strefford ’s actually asked [you--]2548-you-- ? ”[267-strefford] “ Well : practically . [He]267-strefford ’s gone off with [the Hickses]177-the hickses . Before going [he]267-strefford wrote [me]267-strefford that [we]2549-we ’d better both consider [ourselves]2549-we free . And [Coral]196-coral sent [me]267-strefford a postcard to say that [she]196-coral would take the best of care of [him]267-strefford . ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford mused , [his]267-strefford eyes upon [his]267-strefford cigarette . “ But what the deuce led up to all this ? It ca n’t have happened like that , out of a clear sky . ”[267-strefford] [Susy]159-susy flushed , hesitated , looked away . [She]159-susy had meant to tell [Strefford]267-strefford the whole story ; it had been one of [her]159-susy chief reasons for wishing to see [him]267-strefford again , and half - unconsciously , perhaps , [she]159-susy had hoped , in [his]267-strefford laxer atmosphere , to recover something of [her]159-susy shattered self - esteem . But now [she]159-susy suddenly felt the impossibility of confessing to anyone the depths to which [[Nick]170-nick ’s wife]1259-nick ’s wife had stooped . [She]159-susy fancied that [[her]159-susy companion]544-her companion guessed the nature of [her]159-susy hesitation . “ Do n’t tell [me]544-her companion anything [you]159-susy do n’t want to , [you]159-susy know , [[my]544-her companion dear]445-my dear . ”[544-her companion] “ No ; [I]544-her companion do want to ; only it ’s difficult . [You]159-susy see -- [we]1261-we had so very little money .... ”[544-her companion] “ Yes ? ”[267-strefford] “ And [Nick]170-nick -- who was thinking of [his]170-nick book , and of all sorts of big things , fine things -- didn’t realise [...]170-nick left it all to [me]159-susy ... to manage .... ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy stumbled over the word , remembering how [Nick]170-nick had always winced at it . But [Strefford]267-strefford did not seem to notice [her]159-susy , and [she]159-susy hurried on , unfolding in short awkward sentences the avowal of [their]1261-we pecuniary difficulties , and of [Nick]170-nick ’s inability to understand that , to keep on with the kind of life [they]1261-we were leading , [one]2186-one had to put up with things ... accept favours .... “ Borrow money , [you]267-strefford mean ? ”[159-susy] “ Well -- yes ; and all the rest . ”[159-susy] No -- decidedly [she]159-susy could not reveal to [Strefford]267-strefford the episode of [Ellie]184-ellie ’s letters . “ [Nick]170-nick suddenly felt , [I]159-susy suppose , that [he]170-nick could n’t stand it , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy continued ; “ and instead of asking [me]159-susy to try -- to try to live differently , go off somewhere with [him]170-nick and live , like [work - people]2551-work - people , in [two rooms]2552-two rooms , without [a servant]2553-a servant , as [I]159-susy was ready to do ; well , instead [he]170-nick wrote [me]159-susy that it had all been a mistake from the beginning , that [we]1261-we could n’t keep it up , and had better recognize the fact ; and [he]170-nick went off on [the [Hickses]177-the hickses ’ yacht]2554-the hickses ’ yacht . The last evening that [you]2555-you were in [Venice]15-venice -- the day [he]170-nick did n’t come back to dinner -- [he]170-nick had gone off to [Genoa]68-genoa to meet [them]177-the hickses . [I]159-susy suppose [he]170-nick intends to marry [Coral]196-coral . ”[159-susy] [Strefford]267-strefford received this in silence . “ Well -- it was [your]1263-i bargain , was n’t it ? ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford said at length . “ Yes ; but-- ”[267-strefford] “ Exactly : [I]1263-i always told [you]2555-you so . [You]2555-you were n’t ready to have [him]170-nick go yet -- that ’s all . ”[1263-i] [She]1263-i flushed to the forehead . “ Oh , [Streff]198-streff -- is it really all ? ”[1263-i] “ A question of time ? If [you]2555-you doubt it , [I]1264-i ’d like to see [you]2555-you try , for a while , in [those two rooms]2556-those two rooms without [a servant]2553-a servant ; and then let [me]1264-i hear from [you]2555-you . Why , [[my]1264-i dear]445-my dear , it ’s only a question of time in [a palace]2559-a palace , with [a steam yacht]2560-a steam yacht lying off the door - step , and a flock of motors in [the garage]2561-the garage ; look around [you]2555-you and see . And did [you]2555-you ever imagine that [you]2555-you and [Nick]170-nick , of [all people]2562-all people , were going to escape the common doom , and survive like [Mr.]2563-mr. and [Mrs. Tithonus]254-mrs. tithonus , while all about [you]2555-you the eternal passions were crumbling to pieces , and [[your]2555-you native Divorce - states]2564-your native divorce - states piling up [their]2564-your native divorce - states revenues ? ”[1264-i] [She]1264-i sat with bent head , the weight of the long years to come pressing like a leaden load on [her]1264-i shoulders . “ But [I]1264-i ’m so young ... life ’s so long . What does last , then ? ”[1264-i] “ Ah , [you]2555-you ’re too young to believe [me]1263-i , if [I]1263-i were to tell [you]2555-you ; though [you]2555-you ’re intelligent enough to understand . ”[1263-i] “ What does , then ? ”[1263-i] “ Why , the hold of the things [we]2565-we all think [we]2565-we could do without . Habits -- they outstand the Pyramids . Comforts , luxuries , the atmosphere of ease ... above all , the power to get away from dulness and monotony , from constraints and uglinesses . [You]2555-you chose that power , instinctively , before [you]2555-you were even grown up ; and so did [Nick]170-nick . And the only difference between [you]2555-you is that [he]170-nick ’s had the sense to see sooner than [you]2555-you that those are the things that last , the prime necessities . ”[1264-i] “ [I]1263-i do n’t believe it ! ”[1263-i] “ Of course [you]2555-you do n’t : at [your]2555-you age one does n’t reason [one]2186-one ’s materialism . And besides [you]2555-you ’re mortally hurt that [Nick]170-nick has found out sooner than [you]2555-you , and has n’t disguised [his]170-nick discovery under any hypocritical phrases . ”[1263-i] “ But surely there are [people--]2567-people-- ”[1264-i] “ Yes -- [saints]2568-saints and [geniuses]2569-geniuses and [heroes]2570-heroes : [all the fanatics]2571-all the fanatics !
