To which of [their]2571-all the fanatics categories do [you]2555-you suppose [we]2572-we [soft people]2573-soft people belong ? And [the heroes]2574-the heroes and [the geniuses]2575-the geniuses -- haven’t [they]2571-all the fanatics [their]2571-all the fanatics enormous frailties and [their]2571-all the fanatics giant appetites ? And how should [we]2572-we escape being [the victims of [our]2572-we little ones]2576-the victims of our little ones ? ”[1263-i] [She]1265-she sat for a while without speaking . “ But , [Streff]198-streff , how can [you]198-streff say such things , when [I]1265-she know [you]198-streff care : care for [me]1265-she , for instance ! ”[1265-she] “ Care ? ”[1266-i] [He]1266-i put [his]1266-i hand on [hers]1265-she . “ But , [[my]1266-i dear]445-my dear , it ’s just the fugitiveness of mortal caring that makes it so exquisite ! It ’s because [we]2572-we know [we]2572-we ca n’t hold fast to it , or to [each other]2188-each other , or to anything .... ”[1266-i] “ Yes ... yes ... but hush , please ! Oh , do n’t say it ! ”[1265-she] [She]1265-she stood up , the tears in [her]1265-she throat , and [he]1266-i rose also . “ Come along , then ; where do [we]2572-we lunch ? ”[1266-i] [he]1266-i said with a smile , slipping [his]1266-i hand through [her]1265-she arm . “ Oh , [I]1266-i do n’t know . Nowhere . [I]1266-i think [I]1266-i ’m going back to [Versailles]2-versailles . ”[1266-i] “ Because [I]1265-she ’ve disgusted [you]1266-i so deeply ? Just [my]1265-she luck -- when [I]1265-she came over to ask [you]1266-i to marry [me]1265-she ! ”[1265-she] [She]1265-she laughed , but [he]1266-i had become suddenly grave . “ Upon [my]1266-i soul , [I]1266-i did . ”[1266-i] “ [Dear Streff]255-streff ! As if -- now-- ”[1266-i] “ Oh , not now -- [I]1266-i know . [I]1266-i ’m aware that even with [your]1266-i accelerated divorce methods-- ”[1266-i] “ It ’s not that . [I]1266-i told [you]1266-i it was no use , [Streff]255-streff -- [I]1266-i told [you]1266-i long ago , in [Venice]15-venice . ”[1266-i] [He]1266-i shrugged ironically . “ It ’s not [Streff]255-streff who ’s asking [you]1266-i now . [Streff]255-streff was not [a marrying man]2579-a marrying man : [he]255-streff was only trifling with [you]1266-i . The present offer comes from [an elderly peer of independent means]2580-an elderly peer of independent means . Think it over , [[my]1266-i dear]445-my dear : as many days out as [you]1266-i like , and [five footmen]2582-five footmen kept . There ’s not the least hurry , of course ; but [I]1266-i rather think [Nick]170-nick [himself]170-nick would advise it . ”[1266-i] [She]1267-she flushed to the temples , remembering that [Nick]170-nick had ; and the remembrance made [Strefford]267-strefford ’s sneering philosophy seem less unbearable . Why should [she]1267-she not lunch with [him]267-strefford , after all ? In the first days of [his]267-strefford mourning [he]267-strefford had come to [Paris]4-paris expressly to see [her]1267-she , and to offer [her]1267-she one of the oldest names and one of the greatest fortunes in [England]67-england . [She]1267-she thought of [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula , [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose , of [their]1268-their condescending kindnesses , [their]1268-their last year ’s dresses , [their]1268-their Christmas cheques , and all the careless bounties that were so easy to bestow and so hard to accept . “ [I]1267-she should rather enjoy paying [them]1268-their back , ”[1267-she] something in [her]1267-she maliciously murmured . [She]1267-she did not mean to marry [Strefford]267-strefford -- [she]1267-she had not even got as far as contemplating the possibility of a divorce but it was undeniable that this sudden prospect of wealth and freedom was like fresh air in [her]1267-she lungs . [She]1267-she laughed again , but now without bitterness . “ Very good , then ; [we]1270-their ’ll lunch together . But it ’s [Streff]198-streff [I]1267-she want to lunch with to - day . ”[1267-she] “ Ah , well , ”[544-her companion] [[her]1267-she companion]544-her companion agreed , “ [I]544-her companion rather think that for a tête - à - tête [he]267-strefford ’s better company . ”[544-her companion] During [their]1270-their repast in [a little restaurant over [the Seine]85-the seine]1271-a little restaurant over the seine , where [she]1267-she insisted on the cheapest dishes because [she]1267-she was lunching with “ [Streff]255-streff , ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford became again [[his]267-strefford old whimsical companionable self]1272-his old whimsical companionable self . Once or twice [she]1267-she tried to turn the talk to [his]267-strefford altered future , and the obligations and interests that lay before [him]267-strefford ; but [he]267-strefford shrugged away from the subject , questioning [her]1267-she instead about [the motley company at [Violet Melrose ’s]161-violet melrose]1273-the motley company at violet melrose ’s , and fitting a droll or malicious anecdote to each of [the people [she]1267-she named]1274-the people she named . It was not till [they]1270-their had finished [their]1270-their coffee , and [she]1267-she was glancing at [her]1267-she watch with a vague notion of taking [the next train]1275-the next train , that [he]267-strefford asked abruptly : “ But what are [you]1267-she going to do ? [You]1267-she ca n’t stay forever at [Violet ’s]161-violet melrose . ”[267-strefford] “ Oh , no ! ”[1267-she] [she]1267-she cried with a shiver . “ Well , then -- [you’ve]267-strefford got some plan , [I]1267-she suppose ? ”[1267-she] “ Have [I]1267-she ? ”[1267-she] [she]1267-she wondered , jerked back into grim reality from the soothing interlude of [their]1270-their hour together . “ [You]1267-she ca n’t drift indefinitely , can [you]1267-she ? Unless [you]1267-she mean to go back to the old sort of life once for all . ”[1267-she] [She]1267-she reddened and [her]1267-she eyes filled . “ [I]1267-she ca n’t do that , [Streff]255-streff -- [I]1267-she know [I]1267-she ca n’t ! ”[1267-she] “ Then what-- ? ”[1267-she] [She]1267-she hesitated , and brought out with lowered head : “ [Nick]170-nick said [he]170-nick would write again -- in a few days . [I]1267-she must wait-- ”[1267-she] “ Oh , naturally . Do n’t do anything in a hurry . ”[1267-she] [Strefford]267-strefford also glanced at [his]267-strefford watch . “ [Garcon]89-garcon , l’addition ! [I]267-strefford ’m taking [the train]2221-the train back to - night , and [I]267-strefford ’ve a lot of things left to do . But look here , [[my]267-strefford dear]445-my dear -- when [you]445-my dear come to a decision one way or the other let [me]267-strefford know , will [you]445-my dear ? Oh , [I]267-strefford do n’t mean in the matter [I]267-strefford ’ve most at heart ; [we]2585-we ’ll consider that closed for the present . But at least [I]267-strefford can be of use in other ways -- hang it , [you]445-my dear know , [I]267-strefford can even lend [you]445-my dear money . There ’s a new sensation for [[our]2585-we jaded palates]2586-our jaded palates ! ”[267-strefford] “ Oh , [Streff]255-streff ... [Streff]255-streff ! ”[1276-she] [she]1276-she could only falter ; and [he]1277-he pressed on gaily : “ Try it , now do try it -- [I]1277-he assure [you]1276-she there ’ll be no interest to pay , and no conditions attached . And promise to let [me]1277-he know when [you]1276-she ’ve decided anything . ”[1277-he] [She]1276-she looked into [his]1277-he humorously puckered eyes , answering . [Their]1278-their friendly smile with [hers]1276-she . “ [I]1276-she promise ! ”[1276-she] [she]1276-she said . XV . THAT hour with [Strefford]267-strefford had altered [her]1276-she whole perspective . Instead of possible dependence , an enforced return to the old life of connivances and concessions , [she]1276-she saw before [her]1276-she -- whenever [she]1276-she chose to take them -- freedom , power and dignity . Dignity ! It was odd what weight that word had come to have for [her]1276-she . [She]1276-she had dimly felt its significance , felt the need of its presence in [her]1276-she inmost soul , even in the young thoughtless days when [she]1276-she had seemed to sacrifice so little to the austere divinities . And since [she]1276-she had been [[Nick Lansing]170-nick ’s wife]1279-nick lansing ’s wife [she]1276-she had consciously acknowledged it , had suffered and agonized when [she]1276-she fell beneath its standard . Yes : to marry [Strefford]267-strefford would give [her]1276-she that sense of self - respect which , in such a world as [theirs]1280-theirs , only wealth and position could ensure . If [she]1276-she had not the mental or moral training to attain independence in any other way , was [she]1276-she to blame for seeking it on such terms ? Of course there was always the chance that [Nick]170-nick would come back , would find life without [her]1276-she as intolerable as [she]1276-she was finding it without [him]170-nick . If that happened -- ah , if that happened ! Then [she]1276-she would cease to strain [her]1276-she eyes into the future , would seize upon the present moment and plunge into it to the very bottom of oblivion . Nothing on [earth]2411-earth would matter then -- money or freedom or pride , or [her]1276-she precious moral dignity , if only [she]1276-she were in [Nick]170-nick ’s arms again ! But there was [Nick]170-nick ’s icy letter , there was [Coral Hicks]196-coral ’s insolent post - card , to show how little chance there was of such a solution . [Susy]159-susy understood that , even before the discovery of [her]159-susy transaction with [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , [Nick]170-nick had secretly wearied , if not of [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife , at least of the life that [their]1283-their marriage compelled [him]170-nick to lead . [His]170-nick passion was not strong enough -- had never been strong enough -- to outweigh [his]170-nick prejudices , scruples , principles , or whatever [one]2186-one chose to call them . [Susy]159-susy ’s dignity might go up like tinder in the blaze of [her]159-susy love ; but [his]170-nick was made of a less combustible substance . [She]159-susy had felt , in [their]1283-their last talk together , that [she]159-susy had forever destroyed the inner harmony between [them]1283-their . Well -- there it was , and the fault was doubtless neither [hers]159-susy nor [his]170-nick , but that of the world [they]1283-their had grown up in , of [their]1283-their own moral contempt for it and physical dependence on it , of [his]170-nick half - talents and [her]159-susy half - principles , of the something in [them]1283-their both that was not stout enough to resist nor yet pliant enough to yield . [She]159-susy stared at the fact on the journey back to [Versailles]2-versailles , and all that sleepless night in [[her]159-susy room]664-her room ; and the next morning , when [the housemaid]1286-the housemaid came in with [her]1286-the housemaid breakfast tray , [she]159-susy felt the factitious energy that comes from having decided , however half - heartedly , on a definite course . [She]159-susy had said to [herself]159-susy : “ If there ’s no letter from [Nick]170-nick this time next week [I]159-susy ’ll write to [Streff--]256-streff-- ”[159-susy] and the week had passed , and there was no letter . It was now three weeks since [he]170-nick had left [her]159-susy , and [she]159-susy had had no word but [his]170-nick note from [Genoa]68-genoa . [She]159-susy had concluded that , foreseeing the probability of [her]159-susy leaving [Venice]15-venice , [he]170-nick would write to [her]159-susy in care of [[their]1287-they [Paris]4-paris bank]1288-their paris bank . But though [she]159-susy had immediately notified [the bank]1289-the bank of [her]159-susy change of address no communication from [Nick]170-nick had reached [her]159-susy ; and [she]159-susy smiled with a touch of bitterness at the difficulty [he]170-nick was doubtless finding in the composition of the promised letter . [Her]159-susy own scrap - basket , for the first days , had been heaped with the fragments of the letters [she]159-susy had begun ; and [she]159-susy told [herself]159-susy that , since [they]1287-they both found it so hard to write , it was probably because [they]1287-they had nothing left to say to [each other]2188-each other . Meanwhile the days at [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s drifted by as [they]1287-they had been wo nt to drift when , under the roofs of the rich , [Susy Branch]159-susy had marked time between one episode and the next of [her]159-susy precarious existence . [Her]159-susy experience of such sojourns was varied enough to make [her]159-susy acutely conscious of their effect on [her]159-susy temporary hosts ; and in the present case [she]159-susy knew that [Violet]161-violet melrose was hardly aware of [her]161-violet melrose presence . But if no more than tolerated [she]161-violet melrose was at least not felt to be an inconvenience ; when [[your]1291-you hostess]1292-your hostess forgot about [you]1291-you it proved that at least [you]1291-you were not in [her]161-violet melrose way . [Violet]161-violet melrose , as usual , was perpetually on the wing , for [her]161-violet melrose profound indolence expressed itself in a disordered activity . [Nat Fulmer]247-nat had returned to [Paris]4-paris ; but [Susy]159-susy guessed that [[his]247-nat benefactress]1293-his benefactress was still constantly in [his]247-nat company , and that when [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose was whirled away in [her]244-mrs. melrose noiseless motor it was generally toward the scene of some new encounter between [Fulmer]247-nat and the arts . On these occasions [she]244-mrs. melrose sometimes offered to carry [Susy]159-susy to [Paris]4-paris , and [they]1294-they devoted several long and hectic mornings to [the dress - makers]1295-the dress - makers , where [Susy]159-susy felt [herself]159-susy gradually succumbing to the familiar spell of heaped - up finery . It seemed impossible , as furs and laces and brocades were tossed aside , brought back , and at last carelessly selected from , that anything but the whim of the moment need count in deciding whether [one]2186-one should take all or none , or that [any woman]1297-any woman could be worth looking at who did not possess the means to make [her]1297-any woman choice regardless of cost . Once alone , and in [the street]1298-the street again , the evil fumes would evaporate , and daylight re - enter [Susy]159-susy ’s soul ; yet [she]159-susy felt that the old poison was slowly insinuating itself into [her]159-susy system . To dispel it [she]159-susy decided one day to look up [Grace Fulmer]175-grace . [She]159-susy was curious to know how [the happy - go - lucky companion of [Fulmer]175-grace ’s evil days]1299-the happy - go - lucky companion of fulmer ’s evil days was bearing the weight of [his]247-nat prosperity , and [she]159-susy vaguely felt that it would be refreshing to see [some one who had never been afraid of poverty]1300-some one who had never been afraid of poverty . [The airless pension sitting - room]1301-the airless pension sitting - room , where [she]159-susy waited while [a reluctant maid - servant]1302-a reluctant maid - servant screamed about [the house]342-the house for [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer , did not have the hoped - for effect . It was one thing for [Grace]175-grace to put up with such quarters when [she]175-grace shared them with [Fulmer]175-grace ; but to live [there]2229-there while [he]247-nat basked in the lingering radiance of [Versailles]2-versailles , or rolled from [chateau]1305-chateau to [picture gallery in [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s motor]1306-picture gallery in mrs. melrose ’s motor , showed a courage that [Susy]159-susy felt unable to emulate . “ [[My]175-grace dear]445-my dear ! [I]175-grace knew [you]159-susy ’d look [me]175-grace up , ”[175-grace] [Grace]175-grace ’s joyous voice ran down [the stairway]991-the stairway ; and in another moment [she]175-grace was clasping [Susy]159-susy to [[her]175-grace tumbled person]1308-her tumbled person . “ [Nat]247-nat could n’t remember if [he]247-nat ’d given [you]159-susy [our]2588-our address , though [he]247-nat promised [me]175-grace [he]247-nat would , the last time [he]247-nat was [here]2184-here . ”[175-grace] [She]175-grace held [Susy]159-susy at arms ’ length , beaming upon [her]159-susy with blinking short - sighted eyes : the same old dishevelled [Grace]175-grace , so careless of [her]175-grace neglected beauty and [her]175-grace squandered youth , so amused and absent - minded and improvident , that the boisterous air of [the New Hampshire bungalow]1162-the new hampshire bungalow seemed to enter with [her]175-grace into [the little air - tight salon]1310-the little air - tight salon . While [she]175-grace poured out the tale of [Nat]247-nat ’s sudden celebrity , and its unexpected consequences , [Susy]159-susy marvelled and dreamed . Was the secret of [his]247-nat triumph perhaps due to those long hard unrewarded years , the steadfast scorn of popularity , the indifference to every kind of material ease in which [[his]247-nat wife]332-his wife had so gaily abetted [him]247-nat ? Had it been bought at the cost of [her]332-his wife own freshness and [her]332-his wife own talent , of [the children]1312-the children ’s “ advantages , ”[1314-wife] of everything except the closeness of the tie between [husband]1313-husband and [wife]1314-wife ? Well -- it was worth the price , no doubt ; but what if , now that honours and prosperity had come , the tie were snapped , and [Grace]175-grace were left alone among [the ruins]1315-the ruins ? There was nothing in [her]175-grace tone or words to suggest such a possibility . [Susy]159-susy noticed that [her]159-susy ill - assorted raiment was costlier in quality and more professional in cut than the home - made garments which had draped [her]159-susy growing bulk at [the bungalow]2523-the bungalow : it was clear that [she]159-susy was trying to dress up to [Nat]247-nat ’s new situation . But , above all , [she]159-susy was rejoicing in it , filling [her]159-susy hungry lungs with the strong air of [his]247-nat success . It had evidently not occurred to [her]159-susy as yet that [those who consent to share the bread of adversity]1317-those who consent to share the bread of adversity may want the whole cake of prosperity for [themselves]1317-those who consent to share the bread of adversity . “ [[My]159-susy dear]445-my dear , it ’s too wonderful ! [He]247-nat ’s told [me]159-susy to take as many concert and opera tickets as [I]159-susy like ; [he]247-nat lets [me]159-susy take all [the children]1312-the children with [me]159-susy . The big concerts do n’t begin till later ; but of course the Opera is always going . And there are little things -- there ’s music in [Paris]4-paris at all seasons . And later it ’s just possible [we]2592-we may get to [Munich]90-munich for a week -- oh , [Susy]159-susy ! ”[159-susy] [Her]159-susy hands clasped , [her]159-susy eyes brimming , [she]159-susy drank the new wine of life almost sacramentally . “ Do [you]159-susy remember , [Susy]159-susy , when [you]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick came to stay at [the bungalow]2523-the bungalow ? [Nat]247-nat said [you]159-susy ’d be horrified by [our]2592-we primitiveness -- but [I]159-susy knew better ! And [I]159-susy was right , was n’t [I]159-susy ? Seeing [us]2592-we so happy made [you]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick decide to follow [our]2592-we example , did n’t it ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy glowed with the remembrance . “ And now , what are [your]159-susy plans ? Is [Nick]170-nick ’s book nearly done ? [I]159-susy suppose [you]159-susy ’ll have to live very economically till [he]170-nick finds [a publisher]2594-a publisher . And [the baby]2595-the baby , [darling]2329-darling -- when is that to be ? If [you]159-susy ’re coming [home]606-home soon [I]159-susy could let [you]159-susy have a lot of [the children]1312-the children ’s little old things . ”[159-susy] “ [You]159-susy ’re always so dear , [Grace]175-grace . But [we]2592-we have n’t any special plans as yet -- not even for [a baby]2371-a baby . And [I]257-mrs. fulmer wish [you]159-susy ’d tell [me]257-mrs. fulmer all of [yours]159-susy instead . ”[257-mrs. fulmer] [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer asked nothing better : [Susy]159-susy perceived that , so far , the greater part of [her]159-susy European experience had consisted in talking about what it was to be . “ Well , [you]159-susy see , [Nat]247-nat is so taken up all day with sight - seeing and galleries and meeting [important people]2600-important people that [he]247-nat has n’t had time to go about with [us]2592-we ; and as so [few theatres]2601-few theatres are open , and there ’s so little music , [I]159-susy ’ve taken the opportunity to catch up with [my]159-susy mending . [Junie]258-junie helps [me]159-susy with it now -- [she]2602-she ’s [[our]2592-we eldest]2603-our eldest , [you]159-susy remember ? [She]2602-she ’s grown into [a big girl]2604-a big girl since [you]159-susy saw [her]2602-she . And later , perhaps , [we]2592-we ’re to travel . And the most wonderful thing of all -- next to [Nat]247-nat ’s recognition , [I]159-susy mean -- is not having to contrive and skimp , and give up something every single minute . Just think -- [Nat]247-nat has even made special arrangements here in [the pension]2605-the pension , so that [the children]1312-the children all have second helpings to everything . And when [I]159-susy go up to bed [I]159-susy can think of [my]159-susy music , instead of lying awake calculating and wondering how [I]159-susy can make things come out at the end of the month . Oh , [Susy]159-susy , that ’s simply heaven ! ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy ’s heart contracted . [She]159-susy had come to [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend to be taught again the lesson of indifference to material things , and instead [she]159-susy was hearing from [Grace Fulmer]175-grace ’s lips the long - repressed avowal of [their]1319-their tyranny . After all , that battle with poverty on [the [New Hampshire]13-new hampshire hillside]1320-the new hampshire hillside had not been the easy smiling business that [Grace]175-grace and [Nat]247-nat had made it appear . And yet ... and yet .... [Susy]159-susy stood up abruptly , and straightened the expensive hat which hung irresponsibly over [Grace]175-grace ’s left ear . “ What ’s wrong with it ? [Junie]258-junie helped [me]159-susy choose it , and [she]159-susy generally knows , ”[159-susy] [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer wailed with helpless hands . “ It ’s the way [you]159-susy wear it , dearest -- and the bow is rather top - heavy . Let [me]257-mrs. fulmer have it a minute , please . ”[257-mrs. fulmer] [Susy]159-susy lifted the hat from [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s head and began to manipulate its trimming . “ This is the way [Maria Guy]259-maria guy or [Suzanne]159-susy would do it .... And now go on about [Nat]247-nat .... ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy listened musingly while [Grace]175-grace poured forth the tale of [[her]175-grace husband]327-her husband ’s triumph , of the notices in the papers , the demand for [his]247-nat work , [the fine ladies]1323-the fine ladies ’ battles over [their]1323-the fine ladies priority in discovering [him]247-nat , and the multiplied orders that had resulted from [their]1324-they rivalry . “ Of course [they]1324-they ’re simply furious with [each other]2188-each other -- [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose and [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow especially -- because [each one]694-each one pretends to have been the first to notice [his]247-nat ‘ Spring Snow - Storm , ’ and in reality it was n’t [either of [them]1324-they]2609-either of them , but only poor [Bill Haslett]260-bill haslett , an art - critic [we]2610-we [’ve known for years , who chanced on the picture]2611-’ve known for years , who chanced on the picture , and rushed off to tell [a dealer who was looking for a new painter to push]2612-a dealer who was looking for a new painter to push . ”[175-grace] [Grace]175-grace suddenly raised [her]175-grace soft myopic eyes to [Susy]159-susy ’s face . “ But , do [you]159-susy know , the funny thing is that [I]175-grace believe [Nat]247-nat is beginning to forget this , and to believe that it was [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose who stopped short in front of [his]247-nat picture on the opening day , and screamed out : ‘ This is genius ! ’ It seems funny [he]247-nat should care so much , when [I]175-grace ’ve always known [he]247-nat had genius -- and [he]247-nat has known it too . But [they]1324-they ’re all so kind to [him]247-nat ; and [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose especially . And [I]175-grace suppose it makes a thing sound new to hear it said in a new voice . ”[175-grace] [Susy]159-susy looked at [her]159-susy meditatively . “ And how should [you]159-susy feel if [Nat]247-nat liked too much to hear [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose say it ? Too much , [I]159-susy mean , to care any longer what [you]159-susy felt or thought ? ”[159-susy] [[Her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s worn face flushed quickly , and then paled : [Susy]159-susy almost repented the question . But [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer met it with a tranquil dignity . “ [You]159-susy have n’t been married long enough , [dear]2236-dear , to understand ... how [people]421-people like [Nat]247-nat and [me]257-mrs. fulmer feel about such things ... or how trifling [they]421-people seem , in the balance ... the balance of one ’s memories . ”[257-mrs. fulmer] [Susy]159-susy stood up again , and flung [her]159-susy arms about [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend . “ Oh , [Grace]175-grace , ”[257-mrs. fulmer] [she]257-mrs. fulmer laughed with wet eyes , “ how can [you]175-grace be as wise as that , and yet not have sense enough to buy a decent hat ? ”[257-mrs. fulmer] [She]257-mrs. fulmer gave [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer a quick embrace and hurried away . [She]257-mrs. fulmer had learned [her]257-mrs. fulmer lesson after all ; but it was not exactly the one [she]257-mrs. fulmer had come to seek . The week [she]257-mrs. fulmer had allowed [herself]257-mrs. fulmer had passed , and still there was no word from [Nick]170-nick . [She]257-mrs. fulmer allowed [herself]257-mrs. fulmer yet another day , and that too went by without a letter . [She]257-mrs. fulmer then decided on a step from which [her]257-mrs. fulmer pride had hitherto recoiled ; [she]257-mrs. fulmer would call at [the bank]1289-the bank and ask for [Nick]170-nick ’s address . [She]257-mrs. fulmer called , embarrassed and hesitating ; and was told , after enquiries in [the post - office department]1328-the post - office department , that [Mr. Nicholas Lansing]170-nick had given no address since that of [the Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn , three months previously . [She]257-mrs. fulmer went back to [Versailles]2-versailles that afternoon with the definite intention of writing to [Strefford]267-strefford unless the next morning ’s post brought a letter . The next morning brought nothing from [Nick]170-nick , but a scribbled message from [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose : would [Susy]159-susy , as soon as possible , come into [[her]244-mrs. melrose room]664-her room for a word , [Susy]159-susy jumped up , hurried through [her]159-susy bath , and knocked at [[her]159-susy hostess]620-her hostess ’s door . In the immense low bed that faced [the rich umbrage of [the park]1243-the park]1331-the rich umbrage of the park [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose lay smoking cigarettes and glancing over [her]244-mrs. melrose letters . [She]244-mrs. melrose looked up with [her]244-mrs. melrose vague smile , and said dreamily : “ [Susy]159-susy darling , have [you]159-susy any particular plans -- for the next few months , [I]244-mrs. melrose mean ? ”[244-mrs. melrose] [Susy]159-susy coloured : [she]159-susy knew the intonation of old , and fancied [she]159-susy understood what it implied . “ Plans , [dearest]2233-dearest ? Any number ... [I]159-susy ’m tearing [myself]159-susy away the day after to - morrow ... to [the Gillows ’ moor]2616-the gillows ’ moor , very probably , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy hastened to announce . Instead of the relief [she]159-susy had expected to read on [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s dramatic countenance [she]159-susy discovered there the blankest disappointment . “ Oh , really ? That ’s too bad . Is it absolutely settled-- ? ”[159-susy] “ As far as [I]159-susy ’m concerned , ”[159-susy] said [Susy]159-susy crisply . [The other]475-the other sighed . “ [I]475-the other ’m too sorry . [You]159-susy see , [dear]2236-dear , [I]475-the other ’d meant to ask [you]2236-dear to stay on [here]2184-here quietly and look after [the Fulmer children]2619-the fulmer children . [Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer and [I]475-the other are going to [Spain]91-spain next week -- [I]475-the other want to be with [him]2620-he when [he]2620-he makes [his]2620-he studies , receives [his]2620-he first impressions ; such a marvellous experience , to be there when [he]2620-he and [Velasquez]261-velasquez meet ! ”[475-the other] [She]475-the other broke off , lost in prospective ecstasy . “ And , [you]2236-dear see , as [Grace Fulmer]175-grace insists on coming with [us--]2621-us-- ”[475-the other] “ [Ah]2622-ah , [I]1334-the benefactress see . ”[1334-the benefactress] “ Well , there are [the five children]2623-the five children -- such a problem , ”[1334-the benefactress] sighed [the benefactress]1334-the benefactress . “ If [you]2236-dear were at a loose end , [you]2236-dear know , [dear]2236-dear , while [Nick]170-nick ’s away with [[his]170-nick friends]574-his friends , [I]1334-the benefactress could really make it worth [your]2236-dear while .... ”[1334-the benefactress] “ So awfully good of [you]2236-dear , [Violet]161-violet melrose ; only [I]1334-the benefactress ’m not , as it happens . ”[1334-the benefactress] Oh the relief of being able to say that , gaily , firmly and even truthfully ! Take charge of [the Fulmer children]2619-the fulmer children , indeed ! [Susy]159-susy remembered how [Nick]170-nick and [she]159-susy had fled from [them]2619-the fulmer children that autumn afternoon in [New Hampshire]13-new hampshire . The offer gave [her]159-susy a salutary glimpse of the way in which , as the years passed , and [she]159-susy lost [her]159-susy freshness and novelty , [she]159-susy would more and more be used as a convenience , a stop - gap , writer of notes , runner of errands , [nursery governess]1336-nursery governess or [companion]1337-companion . [She]159-susy called to mind [several elderly women of [her]159-susy acquaintance]1338-several elderly women of her acquaintance , [pensioners of [[her]159-susy own group , who still wore its livery , struck its attitudes and chattered its jargon , but had long since been ruthlessly relegated to [these slave - ant offices]1341-these slave - ant offices]1340-her own group , who still wore its livery , struck its attitudes and chattered its jargon , but had long since been ruthlessly relegated to these slave - ant offices . Never in [the world]2205-the world would [she]159-susy join [their]1338-several elderly women of her acquaintance numbers]1339-pensioners of her own group , who still wore its livery , struck its attitudes and chattered its jargon , but had long since been ruthlessly relegated to these slave - ant offices . never in the world would she join their numbers . [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s face fell , and [she]244-mrs. melrose looked at [Susy]159-susy with the plaintive bewilderment of [the wielder of millions to whom everything that can not be bought]1343-the wielder of millions to whom everything that can not be bought is imperceptible . “ But [I]244-mrs. melrose ca n’t see why [you]159-susy ca n’t change [your]159-susy plans , ”[244-mrs. melrose] [she]244-mrs. melrose murmured with a soft persistency . “ Ah , well , [you]159-susy know”--Susy[244-mrs. melrose] paused on a slow inward smile--“they’re not [mine]159-susy only , as it happens . ”[244-mrs. melrose] [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ’s brow clouded . The unforeseen complication of [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer ’s presence on the journey had evidently tried [her]159-susy nerves , and this new obstacle to [her]159-susy arrangements shook [her]159-susy faith in the divine order of things . “ [Your]159-susy plans are not [yours]159-susy only ? But surely [you]159-susy wo n’t let [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula dictate to [you]159-susy ? ... There ’s [my]159-susy jade pendant ; the one [you]159-susy said [you]159-susy liked the other day .... [The Fulmers]174-nat wo n’t go with [me]159-susy , [you]159-susy understand , unless [they]2626-they ’re satisfied about [the children]1312-the children ; the whole plan will fall through . [Susy]159-susy darling , [you]159-susy were always too unselfish ; [I]159-susy hate to see [you]159-susy sacrificed to [Ursula]168-ursula . ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy ’s smile lingered . Time was when [she]159-susy might have been glad to add the jade pendant to the collection already enriched by [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s sapphires ; more recently , [she]159-susy would have resented the offer as an insult to [her]159-susy newly - found principles . But already the mere fact that [she]159-susy might henceforth , if [she]159-susy chose , be utterly out of reach of such bribes , enabled [her]159-susy to look down on them with tolerance . Oh , the blessed moral freedom that wealth conferred ! [She]159-susy recalled [Mrs. Fulmer]257-mrs. fulmer ’s uncontrollable cry : “ The most wonderful thing of all is not having to contrive and skimp , and give up something every single minute ! ”[257-mrs. fulmer] Yes ; it was only on such terms that [one]2186-one could call [one]2186-one ’s soul one ’s own . The sense of it gave [Susy]159-susy the grace to answer amicably : “ If [I]159-susy could possibly help [you]159-susy out , [Violet]161-violet melrose , [I]159-susy should n’t want a present to persuade [me]159-susy . And , as [you]159-susy say , there ’s no reason why [I]159-susy should sacrifice [myself]159-susy to [Ursula]168-ursula -- or to [anybody else]2628-anybody else . Only , as it happens”--she[159-susy] paused and took the plunge--“I’m going to [England]67-england because [I]267-strefford ’ve promised to see [a friend]2629-a friend . ”[267-strefford] That night [she]159-susy wrote to [Strefford]267-strefford . XVI . STRETCHED out under an awning on [the deck of [the Ibis]170-nick]1346-the deck of the ibis , [Nick Lansing]170-nick looked up for a moment at [the vanishing cliffs of [Malta]92-malta]1347-the vanishing cliffs of malta and then plunged again into [his]170-nick book . [He]170-nick had had nearly three weeks of drug - taking on [the Ibis]170-nick . The drugs [he]170-nick had absorbed were of two kinds : visions of fleeing landscapes , looming up from [the blue sea]1348-the blue sea to vanish into it again , and visions of study absorbed from the volumes piled up day and night at [his]170-nick elbow . For the first time in months [he]170-nick was in reach of [a real library]1349-a real library , just [the kind of scholarly yet miscellaneous library , that [his]170-nick restless and impatient spirit craved]1350-the kind of scholarly yet miscellaneous library , that his restless and impatient spirit craved . [He]170-nick was aware that the books [he]170-nick read , like the fugitive scenes on which [he]170-nick gazed , were merely a form of anesthetic : [he]170-nick swallowed them with the careless greed of [the sufferer who seeks only to still pain and deaden memory]1351-the sufferer who seeks only to still pain and deaden memory . But they were beginning to produce in [him]170-nick a moral languor that was not disagreeable , that , indeed , compared with the fierce pain of the first days , was almost pleasurable . It was exactly the kind of drug that [he]170-nick needed . There is probably no point on which [the average man]1352-the average man has more definite views than on the uselessness of writing a letter that is hard to write . In the line [he]170-nick had sent to [Susy]159-susy from [Genoa]68-genoa [Nick]170-nick had told [her]159-susy that [she]159-susy would hear from [him]170-nick again in a few days ; but when the few days had passed , and [he]170-nick began to consider setting [himself]170-nick to the task , [he]170-nick found fifty reasons for postponing it . Had there been any practical questions to write about it would have been different ; [he]170-nick could not have borne for twenty - four hours the idea that [she]159-susy was in uncertainty as to money . But that had all been settled long ago . From the first [she]159-susy had had the administering of [their]1353-their modest fortune . On [their]1353-their marriage [Nick]170-nick ’s own meagre income , paid in , none too regularly , by [the agent who had managed for years the dwindling [family properties]1355-family properties]1354-the agent who had managed for years the dwindling family properties , had been transferred to [her]159-susy : it was the only wedding present [he]170-nick could make . And the wedding cheques had of course all been deposited in [her]159-susy name . There were therefore no “ business ”[159-susy] reasons for communicating with [her]159-susy ; and when it came to reasons of another order the mere thought of them benumbed [him]170-nick . For the first few days [he]170-nick reproached [himself]170-nick for [his]170-nick inertia ; then [he]170-nick began to seek reasons for justifying it . After all , for both [their]1353-their sakes a waiting policy might be the wisest [he]170-nick could pursue . [He]170-nick had left [Susy]159-susy because [he]170-nick could not tolerate the conditions on which [he]170-nick had discovered [their]1353-their life together to be based ; and [he]170-nick had told [her]159-susy so . What more was there to say ? Nothing was changed in [their]1353-their respective situations ; if [they]1353-their came together it could be only to resume the same life ; and that , as the days went by , seemed to [him]170-nick more and more impossible . [He]170-nick had not yet reached the point of facing a definite separation ; but whenever [his]170-nick thoughts travelled back over [their]1353-their past life [he]170-nick recoiled from any attempt to return to it . As long as this state of mind continued there seemed nothing to add to the letter [he]170-nick had already written , except indeed the statement that [he]170-nick was cruising with [the Hickses]177-the hickses . And [he]170-nick saw no pressing reason for communicating that . To [the Hickses]177-the hickses [he]170-nick had given no hint of [his]170-nick situation . When [Coral Hicks]196-coral , a fortnight earlier , had picked [him]170-nick up in [the broiling streets of [Genoa]68-genoa]1356-the broiling streets of genoa , and carried [him]170-nick off to [the Ibis]170-nick , [he]170-nick had thought only of a cool dinner and perhaps a moonlight sail . Then , in reply to [their]1353-their friendly urging , [he]170-nick had confessed that [he]170-nick had not been well -- had indeed gone off hurriedly for a few days ’ change of air -- and that left [him]170-nick without defence against the immediate proposal that [he]170-nick should take [his]170-nick change of air on [the Ibis]170-nick . [They]1353-their were just off to [Corsica]93-corsica and [Sardinia]94-sardinia , and from there to [Sicily]95-sicily : [he]170-nick could rejoin the railway at [Naples]96-naples , and be back at [Venice]15-venice in ten days . Ten days of respite -- the temptation was irresistible . And [he]170-nick really liked [the kind uncomplicated Hickses]1357-the kind uncomplicated hickses . A wholesome honesty and simplicity breathed through all [their]1353-their opulence , as if the rich trappings of [their]1353-their present life still exhaled the fragrance of [[their]1353-their native prairies]1358-their native prairies . The mere fact of being with [such people]1359-such people was like a purifying bath . When [the yacht]2318-the yacht touched at [Naples]96-naples [he]170-nick agreed since [they]1353-their were so awfully kind -- to go on to [Sicily]95-sicily . And when [the chief steward]1361-the chief steward , going ashore at [Naples]96-naples for the last time before [they]1353-their got up steam , said : “ Any letters for the post , [sir]2630-sir ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick answered , as [he]170-nick had answered at each previous halt : “ No , thank [you]2630-sir : none . ”[170-nick] Now [they]1353-their were heading for [Rhodes]163-lansing and [Crete]59-crete -- [[Crete]59-crete , where [he]170-nick had never been , where [he]170-nick had so often longed to go]59-crete . In spite of the lateness of the season the weather was still miraculously fine : the short waves danced ahead under a sky without a cloud , and the strong bows of [the Ibis]170-nick hardly swayed as [she]1362-she flew forward over the flying crests . Only [[his]170-nick hosts]1363-his hosts and [[their]1353-their daughter]647-their daughter were on [the yacht]2318-the yacht -- of course with [Eldorada Tooker]205-eldorada and [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck in attendance . [An eminent archaeologist , who was to have joined [them]1353-their at [Naples]96-naples]1366-an eminent archaeologist , who was to have joined them at naples , had telegraphed an excuse at the last moment ; and [Nick]170-nick noticed that , while [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick was perpetually apologizing for [the great man]1367-the great man ’s absence , [Coral]196-coral merely smiled and said nothing . As a matter of fact , [Mr.]1368-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick were never as pleasant as when one had [them]1369-them to [one]2186-one ’s self . In company , [Mr. Hicks]170-nick ran the risk of appearing over - hospitable , and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick confused dates and names in the desire to embrace all culture in [her]196-coral conversation . But alone with [Nick]170-nick , [[their]1353-their old travelling - companion]1371-their old travelling - companion , [they]1353-their shone out in [their]1353-their native simplicity , and [Mr. Hicks]170-nick talked soundly of investments , and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick recalled [her]196-coral early married days in [Apex City]99-apex city , when , on being brought [home]606-home to [[her]196-coral new house in [Aeschylus Avenue]100-aeschylus avenue]1373-her new house in aeschylus avenue , [her]196-coral first thought had been : “ How on earth shall [I]196-coral get all those windows washed ? ”[196-coral] The loss of [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles had been as serious to [them]1353-their as [Nick]170-nick had supposed : [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck could never hope to replace [him]208-mr. buttles . Apart from [his]208-mr. buttles mysterious gift of languages , and [his]208-mr. buttles almost superhuman faculty for knowing how to address letters to [eminent people]1374-eminent people , and in what terms to conclude [them]1353-their , [he]208-mr. buttles had a smattering of archaeology and general culture on which [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick had learned to depend -- [her]196-coral own memory being , alas , so inadequate to the range of [her]196-coral interests . [[Her]196-coral daughter]885-her daughter might perhaps have helped [her]196-coral ; but it was not [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s way to mother [[her]196-coral parents]650-her parents . [She]196-coral was exceedingly kind to [them]650-her parents , but left [them]650-her parents , as it were , to bring [themselves]650-her parents up as best [they]650-her parents could , while [she]196-coral pursued [her]196-coral own course of self - development . A sombre zeal for knowledge filled the mind of [this strange girl]1377-this strange girl : [she]1377-this strange girl appeared interested only in fresh opportunities of adding to [her]1377-this strange girl store of facts . They were illuminated by little imagination and less poetry ; but , carefully catalogued and neatly sorted in [her]1377-this strange girl large cool brain , they were always as accessible as the volumes in an up - to - date public library . To [Nick]170-nick there was something reposeful in this lucid intellectual curiosity . [He]170-nick wanted above all things to get away from sentiment , from seduction , from the moods and impulses and flashing contradictions that were [Susy]159-susy . [Susy]159-susy was [not a great reader]1378-not a great reader : [her]159-susy store of facts was small , and [she]159-susy had grown up among [people who dreaded ideas as much as if they had been a contagious disease]1379-people who dreaded ideas as much as if they had been a contagious disease . But , in the early days especially , when [Nick]170-nick had put a book in [her]159-susy hand , or read a poem to [her]159-susy , [her]159-susy swift intelligence had instantly shed a new light on the subject , and , penetrating to its depths , had extracted from [them]650-her parents whatever belonged to [her]159-susy . What a pity that this exquisite insight , this intuitive discrimination , should for the most part have been spent upon reading the thoughts of [vulgar people]1380-vulgar people , and extracting a profit from [them]1380-vulgar people -- should have been wasted , since [her]1377-this strange girl childhood , on all the hideous intricacies of “ managing ”[1377-this strange girl] ! And visible beauty -- how [she]1377-this strange girl cared for that too ! [He]170-nick had not guessed it , or rather [he]170-nick had not been sure of it , till the day when , on [their]1381-their way through [Paris]4-paris , [he]170-nick had taken [her]1377-this strange girl to [the Louvre]101-the louvre , and [they]1381-their had stood before the little Crucifixion of [Mantegna]102-mantegna . [He]170-nick had not been looking at the picture , or watching to see what impression it produced on [Susy]159-susy . [His]170-nick own momentary mood was for [Correggio]262-correggio and [Fragonard]263-fragonard , the laughter of the Music Lesson and the bold pagan joys of the Antiope ; and then [he]170-nick had missed [her]1377-this strange girl from [his]170-nick side , and when [he]170-nick came to where [she]1377-this strange girl stood , forgetting [him]170-nick , forgetting everything , had seen the glare of that tragic sky in [her]1377-this strange girl face , [her]1377-this strange girl trembling lip , the tears on [her]1377-this strange girl lashes . That was [Susy]159-susy .... Closing [his]170-nick book [he]170-nick stole a glance at [Coral Hicks]196-coral ’s profile , thrown back against the cushions of the deck - chair at [his]170-nick side . There was something harsh and bracing in [her]1377-this strange girl blunt primitive build , in the projection of the black eyebrows that nearly met over [her]1377-this strange girl thick straight nose , and the faint barely visible black down on [her]1377-this strange girl upper lip . Some miracle of will - power , combined with all the artifices that wealth can buy , had turned [the fat sallow girl [he]170-nick remembered]1382-the fat sallow girl he remembered into [this commanding young woman , almost handsome at times indisputably handsome -- in [her]1377-this strange girl big authoritative way]1383-this commanding young woman , almost handsome at times indisputably handsome -- in her big authoritative way . Watching the arrogant lines of [her]1377-this strange girl profile against [the blue sea]1348-the blue sea , [he]170-nick remembered , with a thrill that was sweet to [his]170-nick vanity , how twice -- under the dome of [the Scalzi]71-the scalzi and in [the streets of [Genoa]68-genoa]1076-the streets of genoa -- [he]170-nick had seen those same lines soften at [his]170-nick approach , turn womanly , pleading and almost humble . That was [Coral]196-coral .... Suddenly [she]1377-this strange girl said , without turning toward [him]170-nick : “ [You]170-nick ’ve had no letters since [you]170-nick ’ve been on board . ”[1377-this strange girl] [He]170-nick looked at [her]1377-this strange girl , surprised . “ No -- thank [the Lord]2631-the lord ! ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick laughed . “ And [you]170-nick have n’t written one either , ”[1377-this strange girl] [she]1377-this strange girl continued in [her]1377-this strange girl hard statistical tone . “ No , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick again agreed , with the same laugh . “ That means that [you]1377-this strange girl really are free-- ”[1377-this strange girl] “ Free ? ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick saw the cheek nearest [him]170-nick redden . “ Really off on a holiday , [I]170-nick mean ; not tied down . ”[170-nick] After a pause [he]170-nick rejoined : “ No , [I]170-nick ’m not particularly tied down . ”[170-nick] “ And [your]1377-this strange girl book ? ”[170-nick] “ Oh , [my]170-nick book-- ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick stopped and considered . [He]170-nick had thrust The Pageant of [Alexander]211-alexander into [his]170-nick handbag on the night of [his]170-nick Bight from [Venice]15-venice ; but since then [he]170-nick had never looked at it . Too many memories and illusions were pressed between its pages ; and [he]170-nick knew just at what page [he]170-nick had felt [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie bending over [him]170-nick from behind , caught a whiff of [her]184-ellie scent , and heard [her]184-ellie breathless “ [I]184-ellie had to thank [you]170-nick ! ”[184-ellie] “ [My]170-nick book ’s hung up , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick said impatiently , annoyed with [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s lack of tact . There was [a girl who never put out feelers]1386-a girl who never put out feelers .... “ Yes ; [I]1386-a girl who never put out feelers thought it was , ”[1386-a girl who never put out feelers] [she]1386-a girl who never put out feelers went on quietly , and [he]170-nick gave [her]1386-a girl who never put out feelers a startled glance . What the devil else did [she]1386-a girl who never put out feelers think , [he]170-nick wondered ? [He]170-nick had never supposed [her]1386-a girl who never put out feelers capable of getting far enough out of [her]1386-a girl who never put out feelers own thick carapace of self - sufficiency to penetrate into [any one else]1387-any one else ’s feelings . “ The truth is , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick continued , embarrassed , “ [I]170-nick suppose [I]170-nick dug away at it rather too continuously ; that ’s probably why [I]170-nick felt the need of a change . [You]1386-a girl who never put out feelers see [I]170-nick ’m only [a beginner]2632-a beginner . ”[170-nick] [She]1386-a girl who never put out feelers still continued [her]1386-a girl who never put out feelers relentless questioning . “ But later -- you’ll go on with it , of course ? ”[1386-a girl who never put out feelers] “ Oh , [I]170-nick do n’t know . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick paused , glanced down [the glittering deck]1388-the glittering deck , and then out across [the glittering water]1389-the glittering water . “ [I]170-nick ’ve been dreaming dreams , [you]1386-a girl who never put out feelers see . [I]170-nick rather think [I]170-nick shall have to drop the book altogether , and try to look out for a job that will pay . To indulge in [my]170-nick kind of literature one must first have an assured income . ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick was instantly annoyed with [himself]170-nick for having spoken . Hitherto in [his]170-nick relations with [the Hickses]177-the hickses [he]170-nick had carefully avoided the least allusion that might make [him]170-nick feel the heavy hand of [their]177-the hickses beneficence . But the idle procrastinating weeks had weakened [him]170-nick and [he]170-nick had yielded to the need of putting into words [his]170-nick vague intentions . To do so would perhaps help to make them more definite . To [his]170-nick relief [Miss Hicks]196-coral made no immediate reply ; and when [she]196-coral spoke it was in a softer voice and with an unwonted hesitation . “ It seems a shame that with gifts like [yours]1386-a girl who never put out feelers [you]1386-a girl who never put out feelers should n’t find some kind of employment that would leave [you]1386-a girl who never put out feelers leisure enough to do [your]1386-a girl who never put out feelers real work .... ”[170-nick] [He]170-nick shrugged ironically . “ Yes -- there are a goodish number of [us]177-the hickses hunting for that particular kind of employment . ”[170-nick] [Her]196-coral tone became more business - like . “ [I]196-coral know it ’s hard to find -- almost impossible . But would [you]170-nick take it , [I]196-coral wonder , if it were offered to [you--]170-nick ? ”[196-coral] [She]196-coral turned [her]196-coral head slightly , and [their]177-the hickses eyes met . For an instant blank terror loomed upon [him]170-nick ; but before [he]170-nick had time to face it [she]196-coral continued , in the same untroubled voice : “ [[Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s place]2633-mr. buttles ’s place , [I]196-coral mean . [[My]196-coral parents]2391-my parents must absolutely have some one [they]2391-my parents can count on . [You]170-nick know what [an easy place]2635-an easy place [it]2633-mr. buttles ’s place is .... [I]196-coral think [you]170-nick would find the salary satisfactory . ”[196-coral] [Nick]170-nick drew a deep breath of relief . For a moment [her]196-coral eyes had looked as they had in the Scalzi -- and [he]170-nick liked [the girl]1390-the girl too much not to shrink from reawakening that look . But [[Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s place]2633-mr. buttles ’s place : why not ? “ [Poor Buttles]264-poor buttles ! ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick murmured , to gain time . “ Oh , ”[196-coral] [she]196-coral said , “ [you]170-nick wo n’t find the same reasons as [he]208-mr. buttles did for throwing up the job . [He]208-mr. buttles was the martyr of [his]208-mr. buttles artistic convictions . ”[196-coral] [He]170-nick glanced at [her]196-coral sideways , wondering . After all [she]196-coral did not know of [his]170-nick meeting with [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles in [Genoa]68-genoa , nor of [the latter]608-the latter ’s confidences ; perhaps [she]196-coral did not even know of [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s hopeless passion . At any rate [her]196-coral face remained calm . “ Why not consider it -- at least just for a few months ? Till after [our]2636-our expedition to [Mesopotamia]39-mesopotamia ? ”[196-coral] [she]196-coral pressed on , a little breathlessly . “ [You]170-nick ’re awfully kind : but [I]196-coral do n’t know-- ”[196-coral] [She]196-coral stood up with one of [her]196-coral abrupt movements . “ [You]170-nick need n’t , all at once . [He]170-nick felt the inadequacy of [his]170-nick response . “ It tempts [me]170-nick awfully , of course . But [I]170-nick must wait , at any rate -- wait for letters . The fact is [I]170-nick shall have to wire from [Rhodes]163-lansing to have them sent . [I]170-nick had chucked everything , even letters , for a few weeks . ”[170-nick] “ Ah , [you]170-nick are tired , ”[196-coral] [she]196-coral murmured , giving [him]170-nick a last downward glance as [she]196-coral turned away . From [Rhodes Nick Lansing]163-lansing telegraphed to [[his]170-nick [Paris]4-paris bank]1393-his paris bank to send [his]170-nick letters to [Candia]103-candia ; but when [the Ibis]170-nick reached [Candia]103-candia , and the mail was brought on board , the thick envelope handed to [him]170-nick contained no letter from [Susy]159-susy . Why should it , since [he]170-nick had not yet written to [her]159-susy ? [He]170-nick had not written , no : but in sending [his]170-nick address to [the bank]1289-the bank [he]170-nick knew [he]170-nick had given [her]159-susy the opportunity of reaching [him]170-nick if [she]159-susy wished to . And [she]159-susy had made no sign . Late that afternoon , when [they]1395-they returned to [the yacht]2318-the yacht from [their]1395-they first expedition , a packet of newspapers lay on the deck - house table . [Nick]170-nick picked up one of the [London]54-london journals , and [his]170-nick eye ran absently down the list of social events . [He]170-nick read : “ Among the visitors expected next week at [Ruan Castle]104-ruan castle ( let for the season to [Mr. Frederick J. Gillow]266-mr. frederick j. gillow of [New York]12-new york ) are [[Prince Altineri]195-prince altineri of [Rome]23-rome]2637-prince altineri of rome , [the Earl of Altringham]242-the earl of altringham and [Mrs. Nicholas Lansing]2638-mrs. nicholas lansing , who arrived in [London]54-london last week from [Paris]4-paris . ”[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick threw down the paper . It was just a month since [he]170-nick had left [the Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn and flung [himself]170-nick into the night express for [Milan]19-milan . A whole month -- and [Susy]159-susy had not written . Only a month -- and [Susy]159-susy and [Strefford]267-strefford were already together ! XVII . [SUSY]159-susy had decided to wait for [Strefford]267-strefford in [London]54-london . [The new Lord Altringham]267-strefford was with [[his]267-strefford family]1397-his family in [the north]1398-the north , and though [she]159-susy found a telegram on arriving , saying that [he]267-strefford would join [her]159-susy in [town]1399-town the following week , [she]159-susy had still an interval of several days to fill . [London]54-london was [a desert]1400-a desert ; the rain fell without ceasing , and alone in [the shabby family hotel]1401-the shabby family hotel which , even out of season , was the best [she]159-susy could afford , [she]159-susy sat at last face to face with [herself]159-susy . From the moment when [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose had failed to carry out [her]161-violet melrose plan for the Fulmer children [her]161-violet melrose interest in [Susy]159-susy had visibly waned . Often before , in the old days , [Susy Branch]159-susy had felt the same abrupt change of temperature in the manner of [the hostess of the moment]1402-the hostess of the moment ; and often -- how often -- had yielded , and performed the required service , rather than risk the consequences of estrangement . To that , at least , thank heaven , [she]159-susy need never stoop again . But as [she]159-susy hurriedly packed [her]159-susy trunks at [Versailles]2-versailles , scraped together an adequate tip for [Mrs. Match]251-mrs. match , and bade good - bye to [Violet]161-violet melrose ( grown suddenly fond and demonstrative as [she]159-susy saw [[her]159-susy visitor]1403-her visitor safely headed for the station)--as [Susy]159-susy went through the old familiar mummery of the enforced leave - taking , there rose in [her]159-susy so deep a disgust for the life of [makeshifts]1404-makeshifts and [accommodations]949-accommodations , that if at that moment [Nick]170-nick had reappeared and held out [his]170-nick arms to [her]159-susy , [she]159-susy was not sure [she]159-susy would have had the courage to return to [them]1406-them . In [[her]159-susy [London]54-london]1407-her london solitude the thirst for independence grew fiercer . Independence with ease , of course . Oh , [her]159-susy hateful useless love of beauty ... the curse it had always been to [her]159-susy , the blessing it might have been if only [she]159-susy had had the material means to gratify and to express it ! And instead , it only gave [her]159-susy a morbid loathing of [that hideous hotel bedroom]1408-that hideous hotel bedroom drowned in yellow rain - light , of the smell of soot and cabbage through the window , the blistered wall - paper , the dusty wax bouquets under glass globes , and the electric lighting so contrived that as [you]1409-you turned on the feeble globe hanging from the middle of the ceiling the feebler one beside the bed went out ! What [a sham world [she]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick had lived in during [their]1411-their few months together]1410-a sham world she and nick had lived in during their few months together ! What right had either of [them]1412-them to those exquisite settings of the life of leisure : [the long white house]1413-the long white house hidden in camellias and cypresses above [the lake]335-the lake , or [the great rooms on [the Giudecca]18-the giudecca with the shimmer of [the canal]1416-the canal always playing over [their]1406-them frescoed ceilings]1415-the great rooms on the giudecca with the shimmer of the canal always playing over their frescoed ceilings ! Yet [she]159-susy had come to imagine that [these places]1417-these places really belonged to [them]1417-these places , that [they]1417-these places would always go on living , fondly and irreproachably , in the frame of [other people]394-other people ’s wealth .... That , again , was the curse of [her]159-susy love of beauty , the way [she]159-susy always took to it as if it belonged to [her]159-susy ! Well , the awakening was bound to come , and it was perhaps better that it should have come so soon . At any rate there was no use in letting [her]159-susy thoughts wander back to [that shattered fool ’s paradise of theirs]1419-that shattered fool ’s paradise of theirs . Only , as [she]159-susy sat there and reckoned up the days till [Strefford]267-strefford arrived , what else in [the world]2205-the world was there to think of ? [Her]159-susy future and [his]267-strefford ? But [she]159-susy knew that future by heart already ! [She]159-susy had not spent [her]159-susy life among [the rich and fashionable]1421-the rich and fashionable without having learned every detail of the trappings of a rich and fashionable marriage . [She]159-susy had calculated long ago just how many dinner - dresses , how many tea - gowns and how much lacy lingerie would go to make up the outfit of [the future Countess of [Altringham]267-strefford]1422-the future countess of altringham . [She]159-susy had even decided to which dressmaker [she]159-susy would go for [her]159-susy chinchilla cloak -- for [she]159-susy meant to have one , and down to [her]159-susy feet , and softer and more voluminous and more extravagantly sumptuous than [Violet]161-violet melrose ’s or [Ursula]168-ursula ’s ... not to speak of silver foxes and sables ... nor yet of the [Altringham]267-strefford jewels . [She]159-susy knew all this by heart ; had always known it . It all belonged to the make - up of the life of elegance : there was nothing new about it . What had been new to [her]159-susy was just that short interval with [Nick]170-nick -- a life unreal indeed in [its]1423-its setting , but so real in its essentials : the one reality [she]159-susy had ever known . As [she]159-susy looked back on it [she]159-susy saw how much it had given [her]159-susy besides the golden flush of [her]159-susy happiness , the sudden flowering of sensuous joy in heart and body . Yes -- there had been the flowering too , in pain like birth - pangs , of something graver , stronger , fuller of future power , something [she]159-susy had hardly heeded in [her]159-susy first light rapture , but that always came back and possessed [her]159-susy stilled soul when the rapture sank : the deep disquieting sense of something that [Nick]170-nick and love had taught [her]159-susy , but that reached out even beyond love and beyond [Nick]170-nick . [Her]159-susy nerves were racked by the ceaseless swish , swish of the rain on the dirty panes and the smell of cabbage and coal that came in under the door when [she]159-susy shut the window . This nauseating foretaste of the luncheon [she]159-susy must presently go down to was more than [she]159-susy could bear . It brought with it a vision of [the dank coffee - room below]1424-the dank coffee - room below , the sooty Smyrna rug , the rain on the sky - light , [the listless waitresses]1425-the listless waitresses handing about food that tasted as if it had been rained on too . There was really no reason why [she]159-susy should let such material miseries add to [her]159-susy depression .... [She]159-susy sprang up , put on [her]159-susy hat and jacket , and calling for [a taxi]1426-a taxi drove to [the [London]54-london branch of [the Nouveau Luxe hotel]1428-the nouveau luxe hotel]1427-the london branch of the nouveau luxe hotel . It was just one o’clock and [she]159-susy was sure to pick up a luncheon , for though [London]54-london was empty that [great establishment]1429-great establishment was not . [It]1429-great establishment never was . Along [those sultry velvet - carpeted halls]1430-those sultry velvet - carpeted halls , in [that great flowered and scented dining - room]1431-that great flowered and scented dining - room , there was always a come - and - go of [rich aimless people]1432-rich aimless people , [the busy people who , having nothing to do , perpetually pursue [their]1433-the busy people who , having nothing to do , perpetually pursue their inexorable task from one end of the earth to the other inexorable task from one end of [the earth]1165-the earth to the other]1433-the busy people who , having nothing to do , perpetually pursue their inexorable task from one end of the earth to the other . Oh , the monotony of those faces -- the faces [one]2186-one always knew , whether [one]2186-one knew [the people [they]2186-one belonged to or not]1437-the people they belonged to or not ! A fresh disgust seized [her]159-susy at the sight of [them]2186-one : [she]159-susy wavered , and then turned and fled . But on the threshold [a still more familiar figure]1438-a still more familiar figure met [her]159-susy : that of [a lady in exaggerated pearls and sables , descending from an exaggerated motor]1439-a lady in exaggerated pearls and sables , descending from an exaggerated motor , like the motors in magazine advertisements , the huge arks in which jewelled beauties and [slender youths]1440-slender youths pause to gaze at snowpeaks from [an Alpine summit]1441-an alpine summit . It was [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula -- [dear old Ursula]168-ursula , on [her]168-ursula way to [Scotland]30-scotland -- and [she]168-ursula and [Susy]159-susy fell on [each other]2188-each other ’s necks . It appeared that [Ursula]168-ursula , detained till the next evening by [a dress - maker]1443-a dress - maker ’s delay , was also out of a job and killing time , and [the two]1444-the two were soon smiling at [each other]2188-each other over the exquisite preliminaries of a luncheon which [the head - waiter]1446-the head - waiter had authoritatively asked [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow to “ leave to [him]1446-the head - waiter , as usual . ”[1446-the head - waiter] [Ursula]168-ursula was in a good humour . It did not often happen ; but when it did [her]168-ursula benevolence knew no bounds . Like [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose , like [all [her]244-mrs. melrose tribe]1447-all her tribe in fact , [she]244-mrs. melrose was too much absorbed in [her]244-mrs. melrose own affairs to give more than a passing thought to [any one else]1387-any one else ’s ; but [she]244-mrs. melrose was delighted at the meeting with [Susy]159-susy , as [her]244-mrs. melrose wandering kind always were when [they]1449-they ran across [fellow - wanderers]1450-fellow - wanderers , unless the meeting happened to interfere with choicer pleasures . Not to be alone was the urgent thing ; and [Ursula]168-ursula , who had been forty - eight hours alone in [London]54-london , at once exacted from [[her]168-ursula friend]367-her friend a promise that [they]1449-they should spend the rest of the day together . But once the bargain struck [her]168-ursula mind turned again to [her]168-ursula own affairs , and [she]168-ursula poured out [her]168-ursula confidences to [Susy]159-susy over a succession of dishes that manifested [the head - waiter]1446-the head - waiter ’s understanding of the case . [Ursula]168-ursula ’s confidences were always the same , though they were usually about [a different person]1453-a different person . [She]168-ursula demolished and rebuilt [her]168-ursula sentimental life with the same frequency and impetuosity as that with which [she]168-ursula changed [her]168-ursula dress - makers , did over [[her]168-ursula drawing - rooms]1454-her drawing - rooms , ordered new motors , altered the mounting of [her]168-ursula jewels , and generally renewed the setting of [her]168-ursula life . [Susy]159-susy knew in advance what the tale would be ; but to listen to it over perfect coffee , an amber - scented cigarette at [her]159-susy lips , was pleasanter than consuming cold mutton alone in [a mouldy coffee - room]1455-a mouldy coffee - room . The contrast was so soothing that [she]159-susy even began to take a languid interest in [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s narrative . After luncheon [they]1457-they got into the motor together and began a systematic round of [the West End shops]1458-the west end shops : [furriers]1459-furriers , [jewellers]1460-jewellers and [dealers in old furniture]1461-dealers in old furniture . Nothing could be more unlike [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose ’s long hesitating sessions before the things [she]168-ursula thought [she]168-ursula wanted till the moment came to decide . [Ursula]168-ursula pounced on silver foxes and old lacquer as promptly and decisively as on the objects of [her]168-ursula surplus sentimentality : [she]168-ursula knew at once what [she]168-ursula wanted , and valued it more after it was [hers]168-ursula . “ And now -- [I]168-ursula wonder if [you]1462-the last antiquarian could n’t help [me]168-ursula choose a grand piano ? ”[168-ursula] [she]168-ursula suggested , as [the last antiquarian]1462-the last antiquarian bowed [them]1463-them out . “ A piano ? ”[168-ursula] “ Yes : for [Ruan]106-ruan . [I]168-ursula ’m sending one down for [Grace Fulmer]175-grace . [She]175-grace ’s coming to stay ... did [I]168-ursula tell [you]1462-the last antiquarian ? [[My]168-ursula dear]445-my dear , [she]175-grace ’s [a Genius]1179-a genius . ”[168-ursula] “ A Genius -- [Grace]175-grace ! ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy gasped . “ [I]159-susy thought it was [Nat]174-nat .... ”[159-susy] “ [Nat]174-nat -- [Nat Fulmer]247-nat ? ”[168-ursula] [Ursula]168-ursula laughed derisively . “ Ah , of course -- [you’ve]1462-the last antiquarian been staying with that silly [Violet]161-violet melrose ! The poor thing is off [her]161-violet melrose head about [Nat]247-nat -- it ’s really pitiful . Of course [he]247-nat has talent : [I]168-ursula saw that long before [Violet]161-violet melrose had ever heard of [him]247-nat . Have [you]1462-the last antiquarian never heard [Grace]175-grace play the violin ? [Poor Violet]269-poor violet , as usual , is off on the wrong tack . [I]168-ursula ’ve given [Fulmer]175-grace [[my]168-ursula garden - house]2646-my garden - house to do -- no doubt [Violet]161-violet melrose told [you]1462-the last antiquarian -- because [I]168-ursula wanted to help [him]247-nat . [I]168-ursula thought [you]159-susy were so fond of music ! ”[168-ursula] “ [I]1464-i am fond of it ; but without knowing anything about it -- in the way [we]2650-we ’re all of [us]2650-we fond of the worthwhile things in [our]2650-we stupid set , ”[1464-i] [she]1464-i added to [herself]1464-i -- since it was obviously useless to impart such reflections to [Ursula]168-ursula . “ But are [you]159-susy sure [Grace]175-grace is coming ? ”[1464-i] [she]1464-i questioned aloud . “ Quite sure . Why should n’t [she]175-grace ? [I]1464-i wired to [her]175-grace yesterday . [I]1464-i ’m giving [her]175-grace a thousand dollars and all [her]175-grace expenses . ”[1464-i] It was not till [they]1465-they were having tea in [a Piccadilly tea - room]1466-a piccadilly tea - room that [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow began to manifest some interest in [[her]167-fred gillow companion]544-her companion ’s plans . The thought of losing [Susy]159-susy became suddenly intolerable to [her]167-fred gillow . [The Prince , who did not see why [he]270-the prince , who did not see why he should be expected to linger in london out of season should be expected to linger in [London]54-london out of season]270-the prince , who did not see why he should be expected to linger in london out of season , was already at [Ruan]106-ruan , and [Ursula]168-ursula could not face the evening and the whole of the next day by [herself]168-ursula . “ But what are [you]159-susy doing in [town]1399-town , [darling]2329-darling , [I]168-ursula do n’t remember if [I]168-ursula ’ve asked [you]159-susy , ”[168-ursula] [she]168-ursula said , resting [her]168-ursula firm elbows on the tea - table while [she]168-ursula took a light from [Susy]159-susy ’s cigarette . [Susy]159-susy hesitated . [She]159-susy had foreseen that the time must soon come when [she]159-susy should have to give some account of [herself]159-susy ; and why should [she]159-susy not begin by telling [Ursula]168-ursula ? But telling [her]168-ursula what ? [Her]159-susy silence appeared to strike [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow as a reproach , and [she]168-ursula continued with compunction : “ And [Nick]170-nick ? [Nick]170-nick ’s with [you]159-susy ? How is [he]170-nick , [I]168-ursula thought [you]159-susy and [he]170-nick still were in [Venice]15-venice with [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie . ”[168-ursula] “ [We]2653-we were , for a few weeks . ”[168-ursula] [She]168-ursula steadied [her]168-ursula voice . “ It was delightful . But now [we]2653-we ’re both on [our]2653-we own again -- for a while . ”[168-ursula] [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow scrutinized [her]159-susy more searchingly . “ Oh , [you]159-susy ’re alone [here]2184-here , then ; quite alone ? ”[167-fred gillow] “ Yes : [Nick]170-nick ’s cruising with [some friends in [the Mediterranean]107-the mediterranean]2655-some friends in the mediterranean . ”[168-ursula] [Ursula]168-ursula ’s shallow gaze deepened singularly . “ But , [Susy darling]159-susy , then if [you]159-susy ’re alone -- and out of a job , just for the moment ? ”[168-ursula] [Susy]159-susy smiled . “ Well , [I]159-susy ’m not sure . ”[159-susy] “ Oh , but if [you]159-susy are , [darling]2329-darling , and [you]159-susy would come to [Ruan]106-ruan ! How familiar , how hatefully familiar , was that old appeal ! [Ursula]168-ursula felt the pressing need of [someone]981-someone to flirt with [Fred]167-fred gillow for a few weeks ... and here was [the very person [she]168-ursula needed]1469-the very person she needed . [Susy]159-susy shivered at the thought . [She]159-susy had never really meant to go to [Ruan]106-ruan . [She]159-susy had simply used [the moor]2321-the moor as a pretext when [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose had gently put [her]159-susy out of doors . Rather than do what [Ursula]168-ursula asked [she]168-ursula would borrow a few hundred pounds of [Strefford]267-strefford , as [he]267-strefford had suggested , and then look about for some temporary occupation until-- Until [she]168-ursula became [Lady Altringham]271-lady altringham ? Well , perhaps . At any rate , [she]168-ursula was not going back to slave for [Ursula]168-ursula . [She]168-ursula shook [her]168-ursula head with a faint smile . “ [I]168-ursula ’m so sorry , [Ursula]168-ursula : of course [I]168-ursula want awfully to oblige [you--]168-ursula ”[168-ursula] [Mrs. Gillow]167-fred gillow ’s gaze grew reproachful . “ [I]168-ursula should have supposed [you]168-ursula would , ”[168-ursula] [she]168-ursula murmured . [She]159-susy knew [he]267-strefford would not be likely to postpone [his]267-strefford visit to [Ruan]106-ruan in order to linger in [London]54-london with [her]159-susy : such concessions had never been [his]267-strefford way , and were less than ever likely to be , now that [he]267-strefford could do so thoroughly and completely as [he]267-strefford pleased . For the first time [she]159-susy fully understood how different [his]267-strefford destiny had become . Now of course all [his]267-strefford days and hours were mapped out in advance : invitations assailed [him]267-strefford , opportunities pressed on [him]267-strefford , [he]267-strefford had only to choose [....]272-.... And [the women]1237-the women ! [She]159-susy had never before thought of [the women]1237-the women . [All the girls in [England]67-england]1479-all the girls in england would be wanting to marry [him]267-strefford , not to mention [[her]159-susy own enterprising compatriots]1480-her own enterprising compatriots . And there were [the married women , who were even more to be feared]1481-the married women , who were even more to be feared . [Streff]255-streff might , for the time , escape marriage ; though [she]159-susy could guess the power of persuasion , family pressure , all the converging traditional influences [he]267-strefford had so often ridiculed , yet , as [she]159-susy knew , had never completely thrown off .... Yes , [those quiet invisible women at [Altringham]267-strefford]1482-those quiet invisible women at altringham -- [[his]267-strefford uncle ’s widow]1483-his uncle ’s widow , [[his]267-strefford mother]699-his mother , [the spinster sisters]1485-the spinster sisters -- it was not impossible that , with tact and patience -- and [the stupidest women]1486-the stupidest women could be tactful and patient on such occasions -- [they]1486-the stupidest women might eventually persuade [him]267-strefford that it was [his]267-strefford duty , [they]1486-the stupidest women might put just the right young loveliness in [his]267-strefford way .... But meanwhile , now , at once , there were [the married women]1487-the married women . Ah , [they]1487-the married women would n’t wait , [they]1487-the married women were doubtless laying [their]1487-the married women traps already ! [Susy]159-susy shivered at the thought . [She]159-susy knew too much about the way the trick was done , had followed , too often , all the sinuosities of such approaches . Not that [they]1487-the married women were very sinuous nowadays : more often there was just a swoop and a pounce when the time came ; but [she]159-susy knew all the arts and the wiles that led up to it . [She]159-susy knew them , oh , how [she]159-susy knew [them]1487-the married women -- though with [Streff]255-streff , thank heaven , [she]159-susy had never been called upon to exercise [them]1487-the married women ! [His]267-strefford love was there for the asking : would [she]159-susy not be [a fool]1488-a fool to refuse it ? Perhaps ; though on that point [her]159-susy mind still wavered . But at any rate [she]159-susy saw that , decidedly , it would be better to yield to [Ursula]168-ursula ’s pressure ; better to meet [him]267-strefford at [Ruan]106-ruan , in a congenial setting , where [she]159-susy would have time to get [her]159-susy bearings , observe what dangers threatened [him]267-strefford , and make up [her]159-susy mind whether , after all , it was to be [her]159-susy mission to save [him]267-strefford from [the other women]1489-the other women . “ Well , if [you]168-ursula like , then , [Ursula]168-ursula .... ”[167-fred gillow] “ Oh , [[you]168-ursula angel]2668-you angel , [you]168-ursula !
