[People]421-people are beginning to do it , [I]184-ellie assure [you]159-susy -- it ’s so much safer ! ”[184-ellie] [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn , on the way back from [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz to [England]67-england , had paused in [Paris]4-paris to renew the depleted wardrobe which , only two months earlier , had filled so many trunks to bursting . [Other ladies , flocking there from all points of the globe]1492-other ladies , flocking there from all points of the globe for the same purpose , disputed with [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn [the Louis XVI suites of the Nouveau Luxe]1493-the louis xvi suites of the nouveau luxe , the pink - candled tables in [the restaurant]1058-the restaurant , the hours for trying - on at [the dressmakers]1495-the dressmakers ’ ; and just because [they]1492-other ladies , flocking there from all points of the globe were so many , and all feverishly fighting to get the same things at the same time , [they]1492-other ladies , flocking there from all points of the globe were all excited , happy and at ease . It was the most momentous period of the year : the height of the “ [dress makers]2672-dress makers ’ season . ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn had run across [Susy Lansing]159-susy at [one of [the Rue de la Paix openings]1497-the rue de la paix openings]1496-one of the rue de la paix openings , where rows of [ladies wan with heat and emotion]1498-ladies wan with heat and emotion sat for hours in rapt attention while spectral apparitions in incredible raiment tottered endlessly past [them]1492-other ladies , flocking there from all points of the globe on aching feet . Distracted from the regal splendours of a chinchilla cloak by the sense that [another lady]1499-another lady was also examining it , [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn turned in surprise at sight of [Susy]159-susy , whose head was critically bent above the fur . “ [Susy]159-susy ! [I]159-susy ’d no idea [you]159-susy were [here]2184-here ! [I]159-susy saw in the papers that [you]159-susy were with [the Gillows]162-the gillows . ”[159-susy] The customary embraces followed ; then [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn , [her]188-mrs. vanderlyn eyes pursuing the matchless cloak as it disappeared down a vista of receding mannequins , interrogated sharply : “ Are [you]159-susy shopping for [Ursula]168-ursula ? If [you]159-susy mean to order that cloak for [her]168-ursula [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’d rather know . ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [Susy]159-susy smiled , and paused a moment before answering . During the pause [she]159-susy took in all the exquisite details of [[Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s perpetually youthful person]1500-ellie vanderlyn ’s perpetually youthful person , from the plumed crown of [her]159-susy head to the perfect arch of [her]159-susy patent - leather shoes . At last [she]159-susy said quietly : “ No -- to - day [I]159-susy ’m shopping for [myself]159-susy . ”[159-susy] “ [Yourself]159-susy ? [Yourself]159-susy ? ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn echoed with a stare of incredulity . “ Yes ; just for a change , ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [Susy]159-susy serenely acknowledged . “ But the cloak -- [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn meant the chinchilla cloak ... the one with the ermine lining .... ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] “ Yes ; it is awfully good , is n’t it ? But [I]159-susy mean to look elsewhere before [I]159-susy decide . ”[159-susy] Ah , how often [she]159-susy had heard [[her]159-susy friends]926-her friends use that phrase ; and how amusing it was , now , to see [Ellie]184-ellie ’s amazement as [she]159-susy heard it tossed off in [her]159-susy own tone of contemptuous satiety ! [Susy]159-susy was becoming more and more dependent on such diversions ; without [them]1502-them [her]159-susy days , crowded as they were , would nevertheless have dragged by heavily . But it still amused [her]159-susy to go to [the big dressmakers]1503-the big dressmakers ’ , watch the mannequins sweep by , and be seen by [[her]159-susy friends]926-her friends superciliously examining all the most expensive dresses in the procession . [She]159-susy knew the rumour was abroad that [she]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick were to be divorced , and that [Lord Altringham]267-strefford was “ devoted ”[267-strefford] to [her]159-susy . [She]159-susy neither confirmed nor denied the report : [she]159-susy just let [herself]159-susy be luxuriously carried forward on its easy tide . But although it was now three months since [Nick]170-nick had left [the Palazzo]108-the palazzo [Vanderlyn]184-ellie [she]159-susy had not yet written to [him]170-nick -- nor [he]170-nick to [her]159-susy . Meanwhile , in spite of all that [she]159-susy packed into [them]1505-them , the days passed more and more slowly , and the excitements [she]159-susy had counted on no longer excited [her]159-susy . [Strefford]267-strefford was [hers]159-susy : [she]159-susy knew that [he]267-strefford would marry [her]159-susy as soon as [she]159-susy was free . [They]1506-they had been together at [Ruan]106-ruan for ten days , and after that [she]159-susy had motored south with [him]267-strefford , stopping on the way to see [Altringham]267-strefford , from which , at the moment , [[his]267-strefford mourning relatives]1507-his mourning relatives were absent . At [Altringham]267-strefford [they]1506-they had parted ; and after one or two more visits in [England]67-england [she]159-susy had come back to [Paris]4-paris , where [he]267-strefford was now about to join [her]159-susy . After [her]159-susy few hours at [Altringham]267-strefford [she]159-susy had understood that [he]267-strefford would wait for [her]159-susy as long as was necessary : the fear of [the “ other women ”]2674-the “ other women ”[2674-the “ other women ”] had ceased to trouble [her]159-susy . But , perhaps for that very reason , the future seemed less exciting than [she]159-susy had expected . Sometimes [she]159-susy thought it was the sight of [that great house]1508-that great house which had overwhelmed [her]159-susy : [it]1508-that great house was too vast , too venerable , too like a huge monument built of ancient territorial traditions and obligations . Perhaps [it]1508-that great house had been lived in for too long by [too many serious - minded and conscientious women]1509-too many serious - minded and conscientious women : somehow [she]159-susy could not picture [it]1508-that great house invaded by bridge and debts and adultery . And yet that was what would have to be , of course ... [she]159-susy could hardly picture either [Strefford]267-strefford or [herself]159-susy continuing there the life of heavy county responsibilities , dull parties , laborious duties , weekly church - going , and presiding over local committees .... What a pity [they]1510-they could n’t sell [it]1508-that great house and have [a little house on [the Thames]109-the thames]1511-a little house on the thames ! Nevertheless [she]159-susy was not sorry to let it be known that [Altringham]267-strefford was [hers]159-susy when [she]159-susy chose to take it . At times [she]159-susy wondered whether [Nick]170-nick knew ... whether rumours had reached [him]170-nick . If [they]1510-they had , [he]170-nick had only [his]170-nick own letter to thank for it . [He]170-nick had told [her]159-susy what course to pursue ; and [she]159-susy was pursuing it . For a moment the meeting with [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie had been a shock to [her]159-susy ; [she]159-susy had hoped never to see [Ellie]184-ellie again . But now that [they]1512-they were actually face to face [Susy]159-susy perceived how dulled [her]159-susy sensibilities were . In a few moments [she]159-susy had grown used to [Ellie]184-ellie , as [she]159-susy was growing used to [everybody]2183-everybody and to everything in the old life [she]159-susy had returned to . What was the use of making such a fuss about things ? [She]159-susy and [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn left [the dress - maker]1514-the dress - maker ’s together , and after an absorbing session at [a new milliner ’s]1515-a new milliner ’s were now taking tea in [[Ellie]184-ellie ’s drawing - room]1516-ellie ’s drawing - room at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe . [Ellie]184-ellie , with [[her]184-ellie spoiled child]1518-her spoiled child ’s persistency , had come back to the question of the chinchilla cloak . It was the only one [she]184-ellie had seen that [she]184-ellie fancied in the very least , and as [she]184-ellie had n’t a decent fur garment left to [her]184-ellie name [she]184-ellie was naturally in somewhat of a hurry ... but , of course , if [Susy]159-susy had been choosing that model for [a friend]2629-a friend .... [Susy]159-susy , leaning back against [her]159-susy cushions , examined through half - closed lids [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s small delicately - restored countenance , which wore the same expression of childish eagerness as when [she]188-mrs. vanderlyn discoursed of [the young Davenant of the moment]1520-the young davenant of the moment . Once again [Susy]159-susy remarked that , in [Ellie]184-ellie ’s agitated existence , every interest appeared to be on exactly the same plane . “ [The poor shivering dear]2675-the poor shivering dear , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy answered laughing , “ of course it shall have its nice warm winter cloak , and [I]159-susy ’ll choose another one instead . ”[159-susy] “ Oh , [you]184-ellie darling , [you]184-ellie ! That [Ellie]184-ellie should dare to think that of [her]159-susy -- that [anyone]389-anyone should dare to ! “ Someone buying chinchilla cloaks for [me]159-susy ? [She]159-susy turned toward [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend . “ [I]159-susy suppose [everybody else]2678-everybody else will think it if [you]367-her friend do ; so perhaps [I]159-susy ’d better explain . ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy paused , and drew a quick breath . “ [Nick]170-nick and [I]159-susy mean to part -- have parted , in fact . [He]170-nick ’s decided that the whole thing was a mistake . [He]170-nick will probably ; marry again soon -- and so shall [I.]159-susy ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy flung the avowal out breathlessly , in [her]159-susy nervous dread of letting [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie think for an instant longer that any other explanation was conceivable . [She]159-susy had not meant to be so explicit ; but once the words were spoken [she]159-susy was not altogether sorry . Of course [people]421-people would soon begin to wonder why [she]159-susy was again straying about [the world]2205-the world alone ; and since it was by [Nick]170-nick ’s choice , why should [she]159-susy not say so ? Remembering the burning anguish of those last hours in [Venice]15-venice [she]159-susy asked [herself]159-susy what possible consideration [she]159-susy owed to [the man who had so humbled [her]159-susy]1527-the man who had so humbled her . [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie glanced at [her]159-susy in astonishment . “ [You]159-susy ? [You]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick -- are going to part ? ”[184-ellie] A light appeared to dawn on [her]159-susy . “ Ah -- then that ’s why [he]170-nick sent [me]184-ellie back [my]184-ellie pin , [I]184-ellie suppose ? ”[184-ellie] “ [Your]159-susy pin ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy wondered , not at once remembering . “ The poor little scarf - pin [I]159-susy gave [him]170-nick before [I]159-susy left [Venice]15-venice . [He]170-nick sent it back almost at once , with the oddest note -- just : ‘ [I]159-susy have n’t earned it , really . ’ [I]159-susy could n’t think why [he]170-nick did n’t care for the pin . But , now [I]159-susy suppose it was because [you]159-susy and [he]170-nick had quarrelled ; though really , even so , [I]159-susy ca n’t see why [he]170-nick should bear [me]159-susy a grudge .... ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy ’s quick blood surged up . [Nick]170-nick had sent back the pin -- the fatal pin ! And [she]159-susy , [Susy]159-susy , had kept the bracelet -- locked it up out of sight , shrunk away from the little packet whenever [her]159-susy hand touched it in packing or unpacking -- but never thought of returning it , no , not once ! Which of the two , [she]159-susy wondered , had been right ? Was it not an indirect slight to [her]159-susy that [Nick]170-nick should fling back the gift to [poor uncomprehending [Ellie]184-ellie]1528-poor uncomprehending ellie ? Or was it not rather another proof of [his]170-nick finer moral sensitiveness ! ... And how could one tell , in [their]1529-we bewildering world , “ It was not because [we]1529-we ’ve quarrelled ; [we]1529-we have n’t quarrelled , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy said slowly , moved by the sudden desire to defend [her]159-susy privacy and [Nick]170-nick ’s , to screen from every eye [their]1529-we last bitter hour together . “ [We]1529-we ’ve simply decided that [our]1529-we experiment was impossible -- for [two paupers]2679-two paupers . ”[159-susy] “ Ah , well -- of course [we]1529-we all felt that at the time . And now [somebody else]935-somebody else wants to marry [you]159-susy ! And it ’s [your]159-susy trousseau [you]159-susy were choosing that cloak for ? ”[184-ellie] [Ellie]184-ellie cried in incredulous rapture ; then [she]184-ellie flung [her]184-ellie arms about [Susy]159-susy ’s shrinking shoulders . “ [You]159-susy [lucky lucky girl]2681-lucky lucky girl ! [You]159-susy [clever clever darling]2682-clever clever darling ! But who on earth can [he]267-strefford be ? ”[184-ellie] And it was then that [Susy]159-susy , for the first time , had pronounced the name of [Lord Altringham]267-strefford . “ [Streff]255-streff -- [Streff]255-streff ? [[Our]1529-we dear old Streff]2683-our dear old streff , [You]159-susy mean to say [he]267-strefford wants to marry [you]184-ellie ? ”[159-susy] As the news took possession of [her]184-ellie mind [Ellie]184-ellie became dithyrambic . “ But , [[my]184-ellie dearest]2684-my dearest , what a miracle of luck ! Of course [I]184-ellie always knew [he]267-strefford was awfully gone on [you]184-ellie : [Fred Davenant]273-fred davenant used to say so , [I]184-ellie remember ... and even [Nelson]222-nelson , who ’s so stupid about such things , noticed it in [Venice]15-venice .... But then it was so different . [No one]534-no one could possibly have thought of marrying [him]267-strefford then ; whereas now of course [every woman]2686-every woman is trying for [him]267-strefford . Oh , [Susy]159-susy , whatever [you]159-susy do , do n’t miss [your]159-susy chance ! [You]159-susy ca n’t conceive of the wicked plotting and intriguing there will be to get [him]267-strefford -- on all sides , and even where [one least]2687-one least suspects it . [You]159-susy do n’t know what horrors [women]2688-women will do -- and even [girls]2689-girls ! ”[184-ellie] A shudder ran through [her]1530-her at the thought , and [she]1530-her caught [Susy]159-susy ’s wrists in vehement fingers . “ But [I]1530-her ca n’t think , [[my]1530-her dear]445-my dear , why [you]159-susy do n’t announce [your]159-susy engagement at once . [People]421-people are beginning to do it , [I]1530-her assure [you]159-susy -- it ’s so much safer ! ”[1530-her] [Susy]159-susy looked at [her]1530-her , wondering . Not a word of sympathy for the ruin of [her]159-susy brief bliss , not even a gleam of curiosity as to its cause ! No doubt [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , like [all [Susy]159-susy ’s other friends]1531-all susy ’s other friends , had long since “ discounted ”[184-ellie] the brevity of [her]184-ellie dream , and perhaps planned a sequel to it before [she]184-ellie [herself]184-ellie had seen the glory fading . [She]184-ellie and [Nick]170-nick had spent the greater part of [their]1532-their few weeks together under [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s roof ; but to [Ellie]184-ellie , obviously , the fact meant no more than [her]184-ellie own escapade , at the same moment , with [young Davenant]273-fred davenant ’s supplanter -- [the “ bounder ”[1533-the “ bounder ” whom strefford had never named] whom [Strefford]267-strefford had never named]1533-the “ bounder ” whom strefford had never named . [Her]184-ellie one thought for [[her]184-ellie friend]367-her friend was that [Susy]159-susy should at last secure [her]159-susy prize -- [her]159-susy incredible prize . And therein at any rate [Ellie]184-ellie showed the kind of cold disinterestedness that raised [her]184-ellie above [the smiling perfidy of [the majority of [her]184-ellie kind]1536-the majority of her kind]1535-the smiling perfidy of the majority of her kind . At least [her]184-ellie advice was sincere ; and perhaps it was wise . Why should [Susy]159-susy not let [every one]2647-every one know that [she]159-susy meant to marry [Strefford]267-strefford as soon as the “ formalities ”[184-ellie] were fulfilled ? [She]159-susy did not immediately answer [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s question ; and [the latter]608-the latter , repeating it , added impatiently : “ [I]608-the latter do n’t understand [you]159-susy ; if [Nick]170-nick agrees-- ”[608-the latter] “ Oh , [he]170-nick agrees , ”[159-susy] said [Susy]159-susy . “ Then what more do [you]367-her friend want ! Oh , [Susy]159-susy , if [you]367-her friend ’d only follow [my]159-susy example ! ”[159-susy] “ [Your]159-susy example ? ”[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy paused , weighed the word , was struck by something embarrassed , arch yet half - apologetic in [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend ’s expression . “ [Your]159-susy example ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy repeated . “ Why , [Ellie]184-ellie , what on earth do [you]367-her friend mean ? Not that [you]367-her friend ’re going to part from [poor Nelson]222-nelson ? ”[159-susy] [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn met [her]159-susy reproachful gaze with a crystalline glance . “ [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn do n’t want to , heaven knows -- [poor dear Nelson]222-nelson ! [Algie]274-algie ’s so rich , so appallingly rich , that [I]188-mrs. vanderlyn have to be perpetually on the watch to keep [other women]2696-other women away from [him]274-algie -- and it ’s too exhausting .... ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] “ [Algie]274-algie ? ”[188-mrs. vanderlyn] [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn ’s lovely eyebrows rose . “ [Algie]274-algie : [Algie Bockheimer]274-algie . [She]159-susy recalled [his]274-algie too faultless clothes and [his]274-algie small glossy furtive countenance . As if [anybody]404-anybody ever had all the money [they]404-anybody wanted ! ”[184-ellie] [She]184-ellie wiped [her]184-ellie dark - rimmed eyes with a cautious handkerchief , glanced at [herself]184-ellie in the mirror , and added magnanimously : “ But [I]184-ellie shall try to forget what [you]159-susy ’ve said . ”[184-ellie] XIX . JUST such a revolt as [she]184-ellie had felt as [a girl]899-a girl , such a disgusted recoil from the standards and ideals of everybody about [her]184-ellie as had flung [her]184-ellie into [her]184-ellie mad marriage with [Nick]170-nick , now flamed in [Susy Lansing]159-susy ’s bosom . How could [she]184-ellie ever go back into [that world]1545-that world again ? How echo its appraisals of life and bow down to its judgments ? Alas , it was only by marrying according to its standards that [she]184-ellie could escape such subjection . Perhaps the same thought had actuated [Nick]170-nick : perhaps [he]170-nick had understood sooner than [she]184-ellie that to attain moral freedom [they]1546-they must both be above material cares . Perhaps ... [Her]184-ellie talk with [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie had left [Susy]159-susy so oppressed and humiliated that [she]159-susy almost shrank from [her]159-susy meeting with [Altringham]267-strefford the next day . [She]159-susy knew that [he]170-nick was coming to [Paris]4-paris for [his]170-nick final answer ; [he]170-nick would wait as long as was necessary if only [she]159-susy would consent to take immediate steps for a divorce . [She]159-susy was staying at [a modest hotel in [the Faubourg St. Germain]110-the faubourg st. germain]1547-a modest hotel in the faubourg st. germain , and had once more refused [his]170-nick suggestion that [they]1546-they should lunch at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe , or at [some fashionable restaurant of [the Boulevards]1550-the boulevards]1549-some fashionable restaurant of the boulevards . As before , [she]159-susy insisted on going to [an out - of - the - way place near [the Luxembourg]111-the luxembourg]1551-an out - of - the - way place near the luxembourg , where the prices were moderate enough for [her]159-susy own purse . “ [I]267-strefford ca n’t understand , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford objected , as [they]1546-they turned from [[her]159-susy hotel]1552-her hotel door toward [this obscure retreat]1553-this obscure retreat , “ why [you]159-susy insist on giving [me]267-strefford bad food , and depriving [me]267-strefford of the satisfaction of being seen with [you]159-susy . Why must [we]1546-they be so dreadfully clandestine ? Do n’t [people]421-people know by this time that [we]1546-they ’re to be married ? ”[267-strefford] [Susy]159-susy winced a little : [she]159-susy wondered if the word would always sound so unnatural on [his]267-strefford lips . “ No , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy said , with a laugh , “ [they]421-people simply think , for the present , that [you]267-strefford ’re giving [me]159-susy pearls and chinchilla cloaks . ”[159-susy] [He]267-strefford wrinkled [his]267-strefford brows good - humouredly . “ Well , so [I]267-strefford would , with joy -- at this particular minute . Do n’t [you]159-susy think perhaps [you]159-susy ’d better take advantage of it ? [I]267-strefford do n’t wish to insist -- but [I]267-strefford foresee that [I]267-strefford ’m much too rich not to become stingy . ”[267-strefford] [She]159-susy gave a slight shrug . “ At present there ’s nothing [I]159-susy loathe more than pearls and chinchilla , or anything else in [the world]2205-the world that ’s expensive and enviable .... ”[159-susy] Suddenly [she]159-susy broke off , colouring with the consciousness that [she]159-susy had said exactly the kind of thing that [all the women who were trying for [him]267-strefford]1554-all the women who were trying for him ( except [the very cleverest]1555-the very cleverest ) would be sure to say ; and that [he]267-strefford would certainly suspect [her]159-susy of attempting the conventional comedy of disinterestedness , than which nothing was less likely to deceive or to flatter [him]267-strefford . [His]267-strefford twinkling eyes played curiously over [her]159-susy face , and [she]159-susy went on , meeting [them]1556-them with a smile : “ But do n’t imagine , all the same , that if [I]159-susy should ... decide ... it would be altogether for [your]267-strefford beaux yeux .... ”[159-susy] [He]267-strefford laughed , [she]159-susy thought , rather drily . “ No , ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford said , “ [I]267-strefford do n’t suppose that ’s ever likely to happen to [me]267-strefford again . ”[267-strefford] “ Oh , [Streff--]256-streff-- ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy faltered with compunction . It was odd -- once upon a time [she]159-susy had known exactly what to say to [the man of the moment]1557-the man of the moment , whoever [he]267-strefford was , and whatever kind of talk [he]267-strefford required ; [she]159-susy had even , in the difficult days before [her]159-susy marriage , reeled off glibly enough the sort of lime - light sentimentality that plunged poor [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow into such speechless beatitude . But since then [she]159-susy had spoken the language of real love , looked with its eyes , embraced with [its]1558-its hands ; and now the other trumpery art had failed [her]159-susy , and [she]159-susy was conscious of bungling and groping like [a beginner]2632-a beginner under [Strefford]267-strefford ’s ironic scrutiny . [They]1560-they had reached [their]1560-they obscure destination and [he]267-strefford opened the door and glanced in . “ [It]2707-it ’s jammed -- not a table . And stifling ! Where shall [we]1560-they go ? Perhaps [they]2708-they could give [us]1560-they a room to [ourselves--]2709-ourselves-- ”[267-strefford] [he]267-strefford suggested . [She]159-susy assented , and [they]1560-they were led up [a cork - screw staircase]1561-a cork - screw staircase to [a squat - ceilinged closet lit by the arched top of a high window , the lower panes of which served for the floor below]1562-a squat - ceilinged closet lit by the arched top of a high window , the lower panes of which served for the floor below . [Strefford]267-strefford opened the window , and [Susy]159-susy , throwing [her]159-susy cloak on the divan , leaned on [the balcony]554-the balcony while [he]267-strefford ordered luncheon . On the whole [she]159-susy was glad [they]1560-they were to be alone . Just because [she]159-susy felt so sure of [Strefford]267-strefford it seemed ungenerous to keep [him]267-strefford longer in suspense . The moment had come when [they]1560-they must have a decisive talk , and in [the crowded rooms below]1564-the crowded rooms below it would have been impossible . [Strefford]267-strefford , when [the waiter]1565-the waiter had brought the first course and left [them]1566-them to [themselves]1560-they , made no effort to revert to personal matters . [He]267-strefford turned instead to the topic always most congenial to [him]267-strefford : the humours and ironies of the human comedy , as presented by [[his]267-strefford own particular group]1567-his own particular group . [His]267-strefford malicious commentary on life had always amused [Susy]159-susy because of the shrewd flashes of philosophy [he]267-strefford shed on the social antics [they]1560-they had so often watched together . [He]267-strefford was in fact [the one person [she]159-susy knew ( excepting [Nick]170-nick ) who was in the show and yet outside of it]1568-the one person she knew ( excepting nick ) who was in the show and yet outside of it ; and [she]159-susy was surprised , as the talk proceeded , to find [herself]159-susy so little interested in [his]267-strefford scraps of gossip , and so little amused by [his]267-strefford comments on them . With an inward shrug of discouragement [she]159-susy said to [herself]159-susy that probably nothing would ever really amuse [her]159-susy again ; then , as [she]159-susy listened , [she]159-susy began to understand that [her]159-susy disappointment arose from the fact that [Strefford]267-strefford , in reality , could not live without [these people]703-these people whom [he]267-strefford saw through and satirized , and that the rather commonplace scandals [he]267-strefford narrated interested [him]267-strefford as much as [his]267-strefford own racy considerations on [them]703-these people ; and [she]159-susy was filled with terror at the thought that the inmost core of the richly - decorated life of [the Countess of Altringham]275-the countess of altringham would be just as poor and low - ceilinged a place as [the little room in which [he]267-strefford and [she]159-susy now sat , elbow to elbow yet so unapproachably apart]1570-the little room in which he and she now sat , elbow to elbow yet so unapproachably apart . If [Strefford]267-strefford could not live without [these people]703-these people , neither could [she]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick ; but for reasons how different ! And if [his]267-strefford opportunities had been [theirs]1572-theirs , what [a world]1573-a world [they]1572-theirs would have created for [themselves]1572-theirs ! Such imaginings were vain , and [she]159-susy shrank back from [them]703-these people into the present . After all , as [Lady Altringham]271-lady altringham [she]159-susy would have the power to create that world which [she]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick had dreamed ... only [she]159-susy must create it alone . Well , that was probably the law of things . All human happiness was thus conditioned and circumscribed , and [hers]159-susy , no doubt , must always be of the lonely kind , since material things did not suffice for it , even though it depended on [them]1574-them as [Grace Fulmer]175-grace ’s , for instance , never had . Yet even [Grace Fulmer]175-grace had succumbed to [Ursula]168-ursula ’s offer , and had arrived at [Ruan]106-ruan the day before [Susy]159-susy left , instead of going to [Spain]91-spain with [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband and [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose . But then [Grace]175-grace was making the sacrifice for [[her]175-grace children]1576-her children , and somehow [one]2186-one had the feeling that in giving up [her]175-grace liberty [she]175-grace was not surrendering a tittle of [herself]175-grace . All the difference was there .... “ How [I]267-strefford do bore [you]267-strefford ! ”[267-strefford] [Susy]159-susy heard [Strefford]267-strefford exclaim . [She]159-susy became aware that [she]159-susy had not been listening : stray echoes of names of places and [people]421-people -- [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose , [Ursula]168-ursula , [Prince Altineri]195-prince altineri , [others of [their]1580-their group]1579-others of their group and persuasion -- had vainly knocked at [her]159-susy barricaded brain ; what had [he]267-strefford been telling [her]159-susy about [them]1580-their ? [She]159-susy turned to [him]267-strefford and [their]1581-their eyes met ; [his]267-strefford were full of a melancholy irony . “ [Susy]159-susy , [old girl]2710-old girl , what ’s wrong ? ”[267-strefford] [She]159-susy pulled [herself]159-susy together . “ [I]159-susy was thinking , [Streff]255-streff , just now -- when [I]159-susy said [I]159-susy hated the very sound of pearls and chinchilla -- how impossible it was that [you]255-streff should believe [me]159-susy ; in fact , what a blunder [I]159-susy ’d made in saying it . ”[159-susy] [He]267-strefford smiled . “ Because it was what [so many other women]2711-so many other women might be likely to say so awfully unoriginal , in fact ? ”[267-strefford] [She]159-susy laughed for sheer joy at [his]267-strefford insight . “ It ’s going to be easier than [I]159-susy imagined , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy thought . Aloud [she]159-susy rejoined : “ Oh , [Streff]255-streff -- how [you]267-strefford ’re always going to find [me]159-susy out ! Where on earth shall [I]159-susy ever hide from [you]267-strefford ? ”[159-susy] “ Where ? ”[267-strefford] [He]267-strefford echoed [her]159-susy laugh , laying [his]267-strefford hand lightly on [hers]159-susy . “ In [my]267-strefford heart , [I]267-strefford ’m afraid . ”[267-strefford] In spite of the laugh [his]267-strefford accent shook [her]159-susy : something about it took all the mockery from [his]267-strefford retort , checked on [her]159-susy lips the : “ What ? [A valentine]2712-a valentine ! ”[267-strefford] and made [her]159-susy suddenly feel that , if [he]267-strefford were afraid , so was [she]159-susy . Yet [she]159-susy was touched also , and wondered half exultingly if [any other woman]1582-any other woman had ever caught that particular deep inflexion of [his]267-strefford shrill voice . [She]159-susy had never liked [him]267-strefford as much as at that moment ; and [she]159-susy said to [herself]159-susy , with an odd sense of detachment , as if [she]159-susy had been rather breathlessly observing the vacillations of someone whom [she]159-susy longed to persuade but dared not : “ Now -- NOW , if [he]267-strefford speaks , [I]159-susy shall say yes ! ”[159-susy] [He]267-strefford did not speak ; but abruptly , and as startlingly to [her]159-susy as if [she]159-susy had just dropped from a sphere whose inhabitants had other methods of expressing [their]1583-their sympathy , [he]267-strefford slipped [his]267-strefford arm around [her]159-susy and bent [his]267-strefford keen ugly melting face to [hers]159-susy .... It was the lightest touch -- in an instant [she]159-susy was free again . But something within [her]159-susy gasped and resisted long after [his]267-strefford arm and [his]267-strefford lips were gone , and [he]267-strefford was proceeding , with a too - studied ease , to light a cigarette and sweeten [his]267-strefford coffee . [He]267-strefford had kissed [her]159-susy .... Well , naturally : why not ? It was not the first time [she]159-susy had been kissed . It was true that [one]2186-one did n’t habitually associate [Streff]255-streff with such demonstrations ; but [she]159-susy had not that excuse for surprise , for even in [Venice]15-venice [she]159-susy had begun to notice that [he]267-strefford looked at [her]159-susy differently , and avoided [her]159-susy hand when [he]267-strefford used to seek it . No -- [she]159-susy ought not to have been surprised ; nor ought a kiss to have been so disturbing . Such incidents had punctuated the career of [Susy Branch]159-susy : there had been , in particular , in far - off discarded times , [Fred Gillow]167-fred gillow ’s large but artless embraces . Well -- nothing of that kind had seemed of any more account than the click of a leaf in a woodland walk . It had all been merely epidermal , ephemeral , part of the trivial accepted “ business ”[167-fred gillow] of the social comedy . But this kiss of [Strefford ’s]267-strefford was what [Nick]170-nick ’s had been , under [the New Hampshire]1585-the new hampshire pines , on the day that had decided [their]1586-their fate . It was a kiss with a future in it : like a ring slipped upon [her]159-susy soul . And now , in the dreadful pause that followed -- while [Strefford]267-strefford fidgeted with [his]267-strefford cigarette - case and rattled the spoon in [his]267-strefford cup , [Susy]159-susy remembered what [she]159-susy had seen through the circle of [Nick]170-nick ’s kiss : that blue illimitable distance which was at once the landscape at [their]1586-their feet and the future in [their]1586-their souls .... Perhaps that was what [Strefford]267-strefford ’s sharply narrowed eyes were seeing now , that same illimitable distance that [she]159-susy had lost forever -- perhaps [he]267-strefford was saying to [himself]267-strefford , as [she]159-susy had said to [herself]159-susy when [her]159-susy lips left [Nick]170-nick ’s : “ Each time [we]1586-their kiss [we]1586-their shall see it all again .... ”[159-susy] Whereas all [she]159-susy [herself]159-susy had felt was the gasping recoil from [Strefford]267-strefford ’s touch , and an intenser vision of [the sordid room in which [he]267-strefford and [she]159-susy sat]1587-the sordid room in which he and she sat , and of [[their]1586-their two selves]1588-their two selves , more distant from [each other]2188-each other than if [their]1586-their embrace had been a sudden thrusting apart .... The moment prolonged itself , and [they]1586-their sat numb . How long had it lasted ? How long ago was it that [she]159-susy had thought : “ It ’s going to be easier than [I]159-susy imagined ”[159-susy] ? Suddenly [she]159-susy felt [Strefford]267-strefford ’s queer smile upon [her]159-susy , and saw in [his]267-strefford eyes a look , not of reproach or disappointment , but of deep and anxious comprehension . Instead of being angry or hurt , [he]267-strefford had seen , [he]267-strefford had understood , [he]267-strefford was sorry for [her]159-susy ! Impulsively [she]159-susy slipped [her]159-susy hand into [his]267-strefford , and [they]1586-their sat silent for another moment . Then [he]267-strefford stood up and took [her]159-susy cloak from the divan . “ Shall [we]1586-their go now ! [I]267-strefford ’ve got cards for the private view of the Reynolds exhibition at [the Petit Palais]2713-the petit palais . There are some portraits from [Altringham]267-strefford . It might amuse [you]159-susy . ”[267-strefford] In the taxi [she]159-susy had time , through [their]1586-their light rattle of talk , to readjust [herself]159-susy and drop back into [her]159-susy usual feeling of friendly ease with [him]267-strefford . [He]267-strefford had been extraordinarily considerate , for anyone who always so undisguisedly sought [his]267-strefford own satisfaction above all things ; and if [his]267-strefford considerateness were just an indirect way of seeking that satisfaction now , well , that proved how much [he]267-strefford cared for [her]159-susy , how necessary to [his]267-strefford happiness [she]159-susy had become . The sense of power was undeniably pleasant ; pleasanter still was the feeling that [someone]981-someone really needed [her]159-susy , that the happiness of [the man at [her]159-susy side]1591-the man at her side depended on [her]159-susy yes or no . [She]159-susy abandoned [herself]159-susy to the feeling , forgetting the abysmal interval of [his]267-strefford caress , or at least saying to [herself]159-susy that in time [she]159-susy would forget it , that really there was nothing to make a fuss about in being kissed by anyone [she]159-susy liked as much as [Streff]255-streff .... [She]159-susy had guessed at once why [he]267-strefford was taking [her]159-susy to see [the Reynoldses]276-the reynoldses . Fashionable and artistic [Paris]4-paris had recently discovered English eighteenth century art . [The principal collections of [England]67-england]1592-the principal collections of england had yielded up [their]1592-the principal collections of england best examples of [the great portrait painter]1593-the great portrait painter ’s work , and the private view at [the Petit Palais]2713-the petit palais was to be the social event of the afternoon . [Everybody]2183-everybody -- [[Strefford]267-strefford ’s everybody]1596-strefford ’s everybody and [Susy’s]277-susy’s -- was sure to be [there]2229-there ; and these , as [she]159-susy knew , were the occasions that revived [Strefford]267-strefford ’s intermittent interest in art . [He]267-strefford really liked picture shows as much as the races , if one could be sure of seeing as many [people there]1598-people there . With [Nick]170-nick how different it would have been ! [Nick]170-nick hated openings and varnishing days , and worldly aesthetics in general ; [he]170-nick would have waited till the tide of fashion had ebbed , and slipped off with [Susy]159-susy to see the pictures some morning when [they]1599-they were sure to have the place to [themselves]1599-they . But [Susy]159-susy divined that there was another reason for [Strefford]267-strefford ’s suggestion . [She]159-susy had never yet shown [herself]159-susy with [him]267-strefford publicly , among [[their]1599-they own group of people]1600-their own group of people : now [he]267-strefford had determined that [she]159-susy should do so , and [she]159-susy knew why . [She]159-susy had humbled [his]267-strefford pride ; [he]267-strefford had understood , and forgiven [her]159-susy . But [she]159-susy still continued to treat [him]267-strefford as [she]159-susy had always treated [the Strefford of old , [Charlie Strefford]278-the strefford of old , charlie strefford]278-the strefford of old , charlie strefford , dear [old negligible impecunious Streff]255-streff ; and [he]267-strefford wanted to show [her]159-susy , ever so casually and adroitly , that [the man who had asked [her]159-susy to marry [him]267-strefford]1601-the man who had asked her to marry him was no longer [Strefford]278-the strefford of old , charlie strefford , but [Lord Altringham]267-strefford . At the very threshold , [[his]267-strefford Ambassador]1602-his ambassador ’s greeting marked the difference : it was followed , wherever [they]1603-they turned , by ejaculations of welcome from [the rulers of [the world]2205-the world [they]1603-they moved in]1604-the rulers of the world they moved in . Everybody rich enough or titled enough , or clever enough or stupid enough , to have forced a way into [the social citadel]1606-the social citadel , was there , waving and flag - flying from the battlements ; and to all of [them]1603-they [Lord Altringham]267-strefford had become [a marked figure]1607-a marked figure . During [their]1603-they slow progress through the dense mass of [important people who made the approach to the pictures so well worth fighting for]1608-important people who made the approach to the pictures so well worth fighting for , [he]267-strefford never left [Susy]159-susy ’s side , or failed to make [her]159-susy feel [herself]159-susy a part of [his]267-strefford triumphal advance . [She]159-susy heard [her]159-susy name mentioned : “ [Lansing]170-nick -- [a Mrs. Lansing]2714-a mrs. lansing -- an American ... [Susy Lansing]159-susy ? Yes , of course .... [You]159-susy remember [her]159-susy ? At [Newport]6-newport , At [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz ? Exactly .... Divorced already ? [They]2715-they say so ... [Susy]159-susy darling ! [I]159-susy ’d no idea [you]159-susy were here ... and [Lord Altringham]267-strefford ! [You]159-susy ’ve forgotten [me]159-susy , [I]159-susy know , [Lord Altringham]267-strefford .... Any night that [you]159-susy and [he]267-strefford are free [I]159-susy ’ll arrange to be .... ”[159-susy] “ [You]159-susy and [he]267-strefford ”[1609-they] : [they]1609-they were “ [you]159-susy and [he]267-strefford ”[1609-they] already ! “ Ah , there ’s [one of [them]1609-they -- of [[my]267-strefford great - grandmothers]2717-my great - grandmothers]2716-one of them -- of my great - grandmothers , ”[267-strefford] [Strefford]267-strefford explained , giving a last push that drew [him]267-strefford and [Susy]159-susy to the front rank , before a tall isolated portrait which , by sheer majesty of presentment , sat in [its]1610-its great carved golden frame as on a throne above the other pictures . [Susy]159-susy read on the scroll beneath it : “ [The Hon’ble Diana Lefanu]279-the hon’ble diana lefanu , [fifteenth Countess of [Altringham”--and]114-altringham”--and]2718-fifteenth countess of altringham”--and[159-susy] heard [Strefford]267-strefford say : “ Do [you]159-susy remember ? It hangs where [you]159-susy noticed the empty space above the mantel - piece , in [the Vandyke room]2719-the vandyke room . [They]2720-they say [Reynolds]280-reynolds stipulated that it should be put with [the Vandykes]281-the vandykes . ”[267-strefford] [She]159-susy had never before heard [him]267-strefford speak of [his]267-strefford possessions , whether ancestral or merely material , in just that full and satisfied tone of voice : [the rich man]838-the rich man ’s voice . [She]159-susy saw that [he]267-strefford was already feeling the influence of [his]267-strefford surroundings , that [he]267-strefford was glad the portrait of [a Countess of [Altringham]267-strefford]1612-a countess of altringham should occupy the central place in [the principal room of the exhibition]1613-the principal room of the exhibition , that [the crowd about it]1614-the crowd about it should be denser there than before any of the other pictures , and that [he]267-strefford should be standing there with [Susy]159-susy , letting [her]159-susy feel , and letting [all the people about]1615-all the people about [them]1616-their guess , that the day [she]159-susy chose [she]159-susy could wear the same name as [[his]267-strefford pictured ancestress]1617-his pictured ancestress . On the way back to [[her]159-susy hotel]1552-her hotel , [Strefford]267-strefford made no farther allusion to [their]1616-their future ; [they]1616-their chatted like old comrades in [[their]1616-their respective corners of [the taxi]1620-the taxi]1619-their respective corners of the taxi . But as [the carriage]1621-the carriage stopped at [her]159-susy door [he]267-strefford said : “ [I]267-strefford must go back to [England]67-england the day after to - morrow , worse luck ! Why not dine with [me]267-strefford to - night at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe ? [I]267-strefford ’ve got to have [the Ambassador]2722-the ambassador and [Lady Ascot]282-lady ascot , with [[their]2722-the ambassador youngest girl]2723-their youngest girl and [[my]267-strefford old Dunes aunt]2724-my old dunes aunt , [the Dowager Duchess]2725-the dowager duchess , who ’s over here hiding from [[her]2725-the dowager duchess creditors]2726-her creditors ; but [I]267-strefford ’ll try to get [two or three amusing men]2727-two or three amusing men to leaven the lump . [We]2728-we might go on to a boite afterward , if [you]1622-she ’re bored . Unless the dancing amuses [you]1622-she more .... ”[267-strefford] [She]1622-she understood that [he]1623-he had decided to hasten [his]1623-he departure rather than linger on in uncertainty ; [she]1622-she also remembered having heard [[the Ascots]283-the ascots ’ youngest daughter]1624-the ascots ’ youngest daughter , [Lady Joan Senechal]284-joan senechal , spoken of as [one of [the prettiest girls of the season]1626-the prettiest girls of the season]1625-one of the prettiest girls of the season ; and [she]1622-she recalled the almost exaggerated warmth of [the Ambassador]2722-the ambassador ’s greeting at the private view . “ Of course [I]1622-she ’ll come , [Streff dear]2729-streff dear ! ”[1622-she] [she]1622-she cried , with an effort at gaiety that sounded successful to [her]1622-she own strained ears , and reflected itself in the sudden lighting up of [his]1623-he face . [She]1622-she waved a good - bye from the step , saying to [herself]1622-she , as [she]1622-she looked after [him]1623-he : “ [He]1623-he ’ll drive [me]1622-she [home]606-home to - night , and [I]1622-she shall say ‘ yes ’ ; and then [he]1623-he ’ll kiss [me]1622-she again . But the next time it wo n’t be nearly as disagreeable . ”[1622-she] [She]1622-she turned into [the hotel]2348-the hotel , glanced automatically at the empty pigeon - hole for letters under [her]1622-she key - hook , and mounted the stairs following the same train of images . “ Yes , [I]1622-she shall say ‘ yes ’ to - night , ”[1622-she] [she]1622-she repeated firmly , [her]1622-she hand on the door of [[her]1622-she room]664-her room . “ That is , unless , [they]2731-their ’ve brought up a letter .... ”[1622-she] [She]1622-she never re - entered [the hotel]2348-the hotel without imagining that the letter [she]1622-she had not found below had already been brought up . Opening the door , [she]1622-she turned on the light and sprang to the table on which [her]1622-she correspondence sometimes awaited [her]1622-she . There was no letter ; but the morning papers , still unread , lay at hand , and glancing listlessly down the column which chronicles the doings of society , [she]1622-she read : “ After an extended cruise in [the AEgean]60-the aegean and [the Black Sea]115-the black sea on [[their]2731-their steam - yacht [Ibis]170-nick]2732-their steam - yacht ibis , [Mr.]2733-mr. and [Mrs. Mortimer Hicks]285-mrs. hicks and [[their]2731-their daughter]647-their daughter are established at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe in [Rome]23-rome . [They]2731-their have lately had the honour of entertaining at dinner [the Reigning Prince of [Teutoburger]117-teutoburger - [Waldhain]286-waldhain]2736-the reigning prince of teutoburger - waldhain and [[his]2736-the reigning prince of teutoburger - waldhain mother]699-his mother [the Princess Dowager]2738-the princess dowager , with [[their]2731-their suite]2739-their suite . Among those invited to meet [[their]2731-their Serene Highnesses]2740-their serene highnesses were [the French and Spanish Ambassadors]2741-the french and spanish ambassadors , [the Duchesse de Vichy]2742-the duchesse de vichy , [Prince]2449-prince and [Princess Bagnidilucca]2744-princess bagnidilucca , [Lady Penelope Pantiles--]287-lady penelope pantiles-- ”[1622-she] [Susy]159-susy ’s eye flew impatiently on over the long list of titles--“and [Mr. Nicholas Lansing of [New York]12-new york , who has been cruising with [Mr.]2746-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks on [the Ibis]170-nick for the last few months]2745-mr. nicholas lansing of new york , who has been cruising with mr. and mrs. hicks on the ibis for the last few months . ”[1622-she] XX . [THE Mortimer Hickses]177-the hickses were in [Rome]23-rome ; not , as [they]177-the hickses would in former times have been , in [one of [the antiquated hostelries of [the Piazza di Spagna]1633-the piazza di spagna]1632-the antiquated hostelries of the piazza di spagna]1631-one of the antiquated hostelries of the piazza di spagna or [the Porta del Popolo]1634-the porta del popolo , where of old [they]177-the hickses had so gaily defied fever and nourished [themselves]177-the hickses on local colour ; but spread out , with all the ostentation of [philistine millionaires]1635-philistine millionaires , under the piano nobile ceilings of [one of [the high - perched “ Palaces]2748-the high - perched “ palaces , ”[285-mrs. hicks] where , as [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks shamelessly declared , [they]177-the hickses could “ rely on the plumbing , ”[285-mrs. hicks] and “ have the privilege of over - looking [the Queen Mother ’s Gardens]2749-the queen mother ’s gardens]2747-one of the high - perched “ palaces , ” where , as mrs. hicks shamelessly declared , they could “ rely on the plumbing , ” and “ have the privilege of over - looking the queen mother ’s gardens . ”[285-mrs. hicks] It was that speech , uttered with beaming aplomb at a dinner - table surrounded by [the cosmopolitan nobility of [the Eternal City]1637-the eternal city]1636-the cosmopolitan nobility of the eternal city , that had suddenly revealed to [Lansing]159-susy the profound change in the [Hicks]285-mrs. hicks point of view . As [he]1638-he looked back over the four months since [he]1638-he had so unexpectedly joined [the Ibis at [Genoa]68-genoa]1639-the ibis at genoa , [he]1638-he saw that the change , at first insidious and unperceived , dated from the ill - fated day when [the Hickses]177-the hickses had run across [a Reigning Prince]1640-a reigning prince on [his]1640-a reigning prince travels . Hitherto [they]177-the hickses had been proof against such perils : both [Mr.]1641-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks had often declared that [the aristocracy of the intellect]1642-the aristocracy of the intellect was the only one which attracted [them]177-the hickses . But in this case [the Prince]965-the prince possessed an intellect , in addition to [his]965-the prince few square miles of territory , and to one of the most beautiful Field Marshal ’s uniforms that had ever encased [a royal warrior]1644-a royal warrior . [The Prince]965-the prince was not [a warrior]1646-a warrior , however ; [he]965-the prince was stooping , pacific and spectacled , and [his]965-the prince possession of the uniform had been revealed to [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks only by the gift of a full - length photograph in a [Bond Street]118-bond street frame , with [Anastasius]288-anastasius written slantingly across its legs . [The Prince]965-the prince -- and herein lay [the Hickses]177-the hickses ’ undoing -- [the Prince]965-the prince was [an archaeologist]1649-an archaeologist : [an earnest anxious enquiring and scrupulous archaeologist]1650-an earnest anxious enquiring and scrupulous archaeologist . Delicate health ( so [[his]965-the prince suite]1651-his suite hinted ) banished [him]965-the prince for a part of each year from [[his]965-the prince cold and foggy principality]1652-his cold and foggy principality ; and in the company of [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother , [the active and enthusiastic Dowager Princess]1654-the active and enthusiastic dowager princess , [he]965-the prince wandered from [one Mediterranean shore]1655-one mediterranean shore to another , now assisting at the exhumation of Ptolemaic mummies , now at the excavation of Delphic temples or of [North African]1656-north african basilicas . The beginning of winter usually brought [the Prince]965-the prince and [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother to [Rome]23-rome or [Nice]119-nice , unless indeed [they]177-the hickses were summoned by family duties to [Berlin]120-berlin , [Vienna]121-vienna or [Madrid]122-madrid ; for an extended connection with [the principal royal houses of [Europe]25-europe]1659-the principal royal houses of europe compelled [them]177-the hickses , as [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother said , to be always burying or marrying [a cousin]1661-a cousin . At other moments [they]177-the hickses were seldom seen in the glacial atmosphere of [courts]1662-courts , preferring to [royal palaces those of the other , and more modern type , in one of which [the Hickses]669-the hickses were now lodged]1663-royal palaces those of the other , and more modern type , in one of which the hickses were now lodged . Yes : [the Prince]965-the prince and [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother ( [they]177-the hickses gaily avowed it ) revelled in [Palace Hotels]1667-palace hotels ; and , being unable to afford the luxury of inhabiting [them]1667-palace hotels , [they]177-the hickses liked , as often as possible , to be invited to dine [there]2229-there by [[their]177-the hickses friends--“or]2750-their friends--“or even to tea , [[my]1669-the princess dear]445-my dear , ”[1669-the princess] [the Princess]1669-the princess laughingly avowed , “ for [I]1669-the princess ’m so awfully fond of buttered scones ; and [Anastasius]288-anastasius gives [me]1669-the princess so little to eat in [the desert]2752-the desert . ”[1669-the princess] The encounter with [these ambulant Highnesses]1670-these ambulant highnesses had been fatal -- [Lansing]159-susy now perceived it -- to [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks ’s principles . [She]285-mrs. hicks had known [a great many archaeologists]1671-a great many archaeologists , but never one as agreeable as [the Prince]965-the prince , and above all never [one who had left a throne to camp in [the desert]2752-the desert and delve in [Libyan tombs]1675-libyan tombs]1673-one who had left a throne to camp in the desert and delve in libyan tombs . And it seemed to [her]285-mrs. hicks infinitely pathetic that [these two gifted beings]1676-these two gifted beings , who grumbled when [they]1676-these two gifted beings had to go to “ marry [a cousin ”]2753-a cousin ”[1676-these two gifted beings] at [the Palace of [St. James]123-st. james or of [Madrid]122-madrid]1677-the palace of st. james or of madrid , and hastened back breathlessly to the far - off point where , metaphorically speaking , pick - axe and spade had dropped from [their]1676-these two gifted beings royal hands -- that [these heirs of the ages]1678-these heirs of the ages should be unable to offer [themselves]1678-these heirs of the ages the comforts of up - to - date hotel life , and should enjoy [themselves]1678-these heirs of the ages “ like [babies ”]2754-babies ”[170-nick] when [they]1678-these heirs of the ages were invited to the other kind of “ Palace , ”[170-nick] to feast on buttered scones and watch the tango . [She]285-mrs. hicks simply could not bear the thought of [their]1676-these two gifted beings privations ; and neither , after a time , could [Mr. Hicks]170-nick , who found [the Prince]965-the prince more democratic than anyone [he]170-nick had ever known at [Apex City]99-apex city , and was immensely interested by the fact that [their]1676-these two gifted beings spectacles came from [the same optician]1680-the same optician . But it was , above all , the artistic tendencies of [the Prince]965-the prince and [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother which had conquered [the Hickses]177-the hickses . There was fascination in the thought that , among [the rabble of [vulgar uneducated royalties who overran [Europe]25-europe from [Biarritz]50-biarritz to [the Engadine]78-the engadine , gambling , tangoing , and sponging on [no less vulgar plebeians]1685-no less vulgar plebeians]1684-vulgar uneducated royalties who overran europe from biarritz to the engadine , gambling , tangoing , and sponging on no less vulgar plebeians]1683-the rabble of vulgar uneducated royalties who overran europe from biarritz to the engadine , gambling , tangoing , and sponging on no less vulgar plebeians , [they]177-the hickses , [the unobtrusive and self - respecting Hickses]1686-the unobtrusive and self - respecting hickses , should have had the luck to meet [this cultivated pair , who joined [them]1676-these two gifted beings in gentle ridicule of [[their]1676-these two gifted beings own frivolous kinsfolk]1688-their own frivolous kinsfolk , and whose tastes were exactly those of [the eccentric , unreliable and sometimes money - borrowing persons who had hitherto represented the higher life to [the Hickses]177-the hickses]1689-the eccentric , unreliable and sometimes money - borrowing persons who had hitherto represented the higher life to the hickses]1687-this cultivated pair , who joined them in gentle ridicule of their own frivolous kinsfolk , and whose tastes were exactly those of the eccentric , unreliable and sometimes money - borrowing persons who had hitherto represented the higher life to the hickses . Now at last [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick saw the possibility of being at once artistic and luxurious , of surrendering [herself]170-nick to the joys of modern plumbing and yet keeping the talk on the highest level . “ If [the poor dear Princess]2755-the poor dear princess wants to dine at [the Nouveau Luxe]84-nouveau luxe why should n’t [we]2756-we give [her]2755-the poor dear princess that pleasure ? ”[170-nick] [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick smilingly enquired ; “ and as for enjoying [her]2755-the poor dear princess buttered scones like [a baby]2371-a baby , as [she]2755-the poor dear princess says , [I]170-nick think it ’s the sweetest thing about [her]2755-the poor dear princess . ”[170-nick] [Coral Hicks]196-coral did not join in this chorus ; but [she]196-coral accepted , with [her]196-coral curious air of impartiality , the change in [[her]196-coral parents]650-her parents ’ manner of life , and for the first time ( as [Nick]170-nick observed ) occupied [herself]196-coral with [[her]196-coral mother]521-her mother ’s toilet , with the result that [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s outline became firmer , [her]196-coral garments soberer in hue and finer in material ; so that , should [anyone]389-anyone chance to detect [the daughter]1693-the daughter ’s likeness to [[her]1693-the daughter mother]521-her mother , the result was less likely to be disturbing . Such precautions were the more needful -- [Lansing]170-nick could not but note because of the different standards of the society in which [the Hickses]177-the hickses now moved . For it was a curious fact that admission to the intimacy of [the Prince]965-the prince and [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother -- who continually declared [themselves]1697-themselves to be [the pariahs]1698-the pariahs , [the outlaws]1699-the outlaws , [the Bohemians among crowned heads]1700-the bohemians among crowned heads nevertheless involved not only living in [Palace Hotels]1667-palace hotels but mixing with [those who frequented [them]1667-palace hotels]1702-those who frequented them . [The Prince ’s aide - de - camp]1703-the prince ’s aide - de - camp -- [an agreeable young man of easy manners]1704-an agreeable young man of easy manners -- had smilingly hinted that [[their]177-the hickses Serene Highnesses]2740-their serene highnesses , though so thoroughly democratic and unceremonious , were yet accustomed to inspecting in advance the names of [the persons whom [[their]177-the hickses hosts]691-their hosts wished to invite with [them]177-the hickses]1706-the persons whom their hosts wished to invite with them ; and [Lansing]170-nick noticed that [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s lists , having been “ submitted , ”[170-nick] usually came back lengthened by the addition of [numerous wealthy and titled guests]1708-numerous wealthy and titled guests . [[Their]177-the hickses Highnesses]1709-their highnesses never struck out a name ; [they]177-the hickses welcomed with enthusiasm and curiosity [[the Hickses]669-the hickses ’ oddest and most inexplicable friends]1711-the hickses ’ oddest and most inexplicable friends , at most putting off some of [them]1711-the hickses ’ oddest and most inexplicable friends to a later day on the plea that it would be “ cosier ”[177-the hickses] to meet [them]1711-the hickses ’ oddest and most inexplicable friends on a more private occasion ; but [they]177-the hickses invariably added to the list [any friends of [their]177-the hickses own]1712-any friends of their own , with the gracious hint that [they]177-the hickses wished [these latter ( though socially so well - provided for]1713-these latter ( though socially so well - provided for ) to have the “ immense privilege ”[177-the hickses] of knowing [the Hickses]177-the hickses . And thus it happened that when October gales necessitated laying up [the Ibis]170-nick , [the Hickses]177-the hickses , finding again in [Rome]23-rome [the august travellers from whom [they]177-the hickses had parted the previous month in [Athens]125-athens]1714-the august travellers from whom they had parted the previous month in athens , also found [their]177-the hickses visiting - list enlarged by all that [the capital]1715-the capital contained of fashion . It was true enough , as [Lansing]170-nick had not failed to note , that [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother adored prehistoric art , and Russian music , and the paintings of [Gauguin]290-gauguin and [Matisse]291-matisse ; but [she]1660-the princess mother also , and with a beaming unconsciousness of perspective , adored large pearls and powerful motors , caravan tea and modern plumbing , perfumed cigarettes and society scandals ; and [[her]1660-the princess mother son]1717-her son , while apparently less sensible to these forms of luxury , adored [[his]1717-her son mother]699-his mother , and was charmed to gratify [her]1660-the princess mother inclinations without cost to [himself--“Since poor Mamma]292-himself--“since poor mamma , ”[170-nick] as [he]170-nick observed , “ is so courageous when [we]1724-their are roughing it in [the desert]2752-the desert . ”[170-nick] [The smiling aide - de - camp]1719-the smiling aide - de - camp , who explained these things to [Lansing]170-nick , added with an intenser smile that [the Prince]965-the prince and [[his]965-the prince mother]699-his mother were under obligations , either social or cousinly , to [most of [the titled persons whom [they]1724-their begged [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick to invite]1723-the titled persons whom they begged mrs. hicks to invite]1722-most of the titled persons whom they begged mrs. hicks to invite ; “ and it seems to [[their]1724-their Serene Highnesses]2740-their serene highnesses , ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick added , “ the most flattering return [they]1724-their can make for the hospitality of [[their]1724-their friends]629-their friends to give [them]1724-their such an intellectual opportunity . ”[170-nick] The dinner - table at which [[their]1724-their Highnesses ’ friends]1725-their highnesses ’ friends were seated on the evening in question represented , numerically , one of the greatest intellectual opportunities yet afforded [them]1724-their . [Thirty guests]1726-thirty guests were grouped about the flower - wreathed board , from which [Eldorada]205-eldorada and [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck had been excluded on the plea that [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother liked cosy parties and begged [[her]1660-the princess mother hosts]1728-her hosts that there should never be more than thirty at table . Such , at least , was the reason given by [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick to [[her]1660-the princess mother faithful followers]1729-her faithful followers ; but [Lansing]170-nick had observed that , of late , the same skilled hand which had refashioned [the Hickses]177-the hickses ’ social circle usually managed to exclude from it the timid presences of [the two secretaries]684-the two secretaries . [Their]1724-their banishment was the more displeasing to [Lansing]170-nick from the fact that , for the last three months , [he]170-nick had filled [[Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s place]2633-mr. buttles ’s place , and was [himself]170-nick [[their]1724-their salaried companion]1732-their salaried companion . But since [he]170-nick had accepted the post , [his]170-nick obvious duty was to fill it in accordance with [[his]170-nick employers]1733-his employers ’ requirements ; and it was clear even to [Eldorada]205-eldorada and [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck that [he]170-nick had , as [Eldorada]205-eldorada ungrudgingly said , “ Something of [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’s marvellous social gifts . ”[205-eldorada] During the cruise [his]170-nick task had not been distasteful to [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick was glad of any definite duties , however trivial , [he]170-nick felt more independent as [[the Hickses]669-the hickses ’ secretary]1735-the hickses ’ secretary than as [[their]1724-their pampered guest]1736-their pampered guest , and the large cheque which [Mr. Hicks]170-nick handed over to [him]170-nick on the first of each month refreshed [his]170-nick languishing sense of self - respect . [He]170-nick considered [himself]170-nick absurdly over - paid , but that was [the Hickses]669-the hickses ’ affair ; and [he]170-nick saw nothing humiliating in being in the employ of [people [he]170-nick liked and respected]1738-people he liked and respected . But from the moment of the ill - fated encounter with [the wandering Princes]1739-the wandering princes , [his]170-nick position had changed as much as that of [[his]170-nick employers]1733-his employers . [He]170-nick was no longer , to [Mr.]1741-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick , [a useful and estimable assistant , on the same level as [Eldorada]205-eldorada and [Mr. Beck]207-mr. beck]1742-a useful and estimable assistant , on the same level as eldorada and mr. beck ; [he]170-nick had become a social asset of unsuspected value , equalling [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles in [his]208-mr. buttles capacity for dealing with the mysteries of foreign etiquette , and surpassing [him]208-mr. buttles in the art of personal attraction . [Nick Lansing]170-nick , [the Hickses]177-the hickses found , already knew [most of [[the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother ’s rich and aristocratic friends]1745-the princess mother ’s rich and aristocratic friends]1743-most of the princess mother ’s rich and aristocratic friends . [Many of [them]1745-the princess mother ’s rich and aristocratic friends]1746-many of them hailed [him]170-nick with enthusiastic “ Old Nicks ”[1745-the princess mother ’s rich and aristocratic friends] , and [he]170-nick was almost as familiar as [[His]170-nick Highness ’s own aide - de - camp]1747-his highness ’s own aide - de - camp with all those secret ramifications of love and hate that made dinner - giving so much more of a science in [Rome]23-rome than at [Apex City]99-apex city . [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick , at first , had hopelessly lost [her]1660-the princess mother way in this labyrinth of subterranean scandals , rivalries and jealousies ; and finding [Lansing]170-nick ’s hand within reach [she]1660-the princess mother clung to it with pathetic tenacity . But if [the young man]370-the young man ’s value had risen in the eyes of [[his]370-the young man employers]1733-his employers it had deteriorated in [his]370-the young man own . [He]370-the young man was condemned to play a part [he]370-the young man had not bargained for , and it seemed to [him]370-the young man more degrading when paid in bank - notes than if [his]370-the young man retribution had consisted merely in good dinners and [luxurious lodgings]1750-luxurious lodgings . The first time [the smiling aide - de - camp]1719-the smiling aide - de - camp had caught [his]370-the young man eye over a verbal slip of [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s , [Nick]170-nick had flushed to the forehead and gone to bed swearing that [he]170-nick would chuck [his]170-nick job the next day . Two months had passed since then , and [he]170-nick was still [the paid secretary]1752-the paid secretary . [He]370-the young man had contrived to let [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp feel that [he]370-the young man was too deficient in humour to be worth exchanging glances with ; but even this had not restored [his]370-the young man self - respect , and on the evening in question , as [he]370-the young man looked about the long table , [he]370-the young man said to [himself]370-the young man for the hundredth time that [he]370-the young man would give up [his]370-the young man position on the morrow . Only -- what was the alternative ? The alternative , apparently , was [Coral Hicks]196-coral . [He]370-the young man glanced down the line of [diners]1754-diners , beginning with the tall lean countenance of [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother , with its small inquisitive eyes perched as high as attic windows under a frizzled thatch of hair and a pediment of uncleaned diamonds ; passed on to the vacuous and overfed or fashionably haggard masks of [the ladies next in rank]1756-the ladies next in rank ; and finally caught , between branching orchids , a distant glimpse of [Miss Hicks]196-coral . In contrast with the others , [he]370-the young man thought , [she]196-coral looked surprisingly noble . [Her]196-coral large grave features made [her]196-coral appear like an old monument in [a street of Palace Hotels]1757-a street of palace hotels ; and [he]370-the young man marvelled at the mysterious law which had brought this archaic face out of [Apex City]99-apex city , and given to [the oldest society of [Europe]25-europe]1758-the oldest society of europe a look of such mixed modernity . [Lansing]170-nick perceived that [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp , who was [[his]170-nick neighbour]1760-his neighbour , was also looking at [Miss Hicks]196-coral . [His]1753-the aide - de - camp expression was serious , and even thoughtful ; but as [his]1753-the aide - de - camp eyes met [Lansing]170-nick ’s [he]1753-the aide - de - camp readjusted [his]1753-the aide - de - camp official smile . “ [I]1753-the aide - de - camp was admiring [[[our]2761-our hostess]2762-our hostess ’s daughter]2763-our hostess ’s daughter . [Her]2763-our hostess ’s daughter absence of jewels is -- er -- an inspiration , ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [he]1753-the aide - de - camp remarked in the confidential tone which [Lansing]170-nick had come to dread . “ Oh , [Miss Hicks]196-coral is full of inspirations , ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [he]1753-the aide - de - camp returned curtly , and [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp bowed with an admiring air , as if inspirations were rarer than pearls , as in [his]1753-the aide - de - camp milieu they undoubtedly were . “ [She]196-coral is the equal of any situation , [I]1753-the aide - de - camp am sure , ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [he]1753-the aide - de - camp replied ; and then abandoned the subject with one of [his]1753-the aide - de - camp automatic transitions . After dinner , in the embrasure of a drawing - room window , [he]1753-the aide - de - camp surprised [Nick]170-nick by returning to the same topic , and this time without thinking it needful to readjust [his]1753-the aide - de - camp smile . [His]1753-the aide - de - camp face remained serious , though [his]1753-the aide - de - camp manner was studiously informal . “ [I]170-nick was admiring , at dinner , [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s invariable sense of appropriateness . It must permit [[her]196-coral friends]926-her friends to foresee for [her]196-coral almost any future , however exalted . ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick hesitated , and controlled [his]170-nick annoyance . Decidedly [he]170-nick wanted to know what was in [[his]170-nick companion]1762-his companion ’s mind . “ What do [you]1753-the aide - de - camp mean by exalted ? ”[170-nick] [he]170-nick asked , with a smile of faint amusement . “ Well -- equal to [her]196-coral marvellous capacity for shining in the public eye . ”[170-nick] [Lansing]170-nick still smiled . “ The question is , [I]1753-the aide - de - camp suppose , whether [her]196-coral desire to shine equals [her]196-coral capacity . ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [The aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp stared . “ [You]1753-the aide - de - camp mean , [she]196-coral ’s not ambitious ? ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] “ On the contrary ; [I]1753-the aide - de - camp believe [her]196-coral to be immeasurably ambitious . ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] “ Immeasurably ? ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [The aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp seemed to try to measure it . “ But not , surely , beyond -- beyond what [we]2765-us can offer , ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [his]1753-the aide - de - camp eyes completed the sentence ; and it was [Lansing]170-nick ’s turn to stare . [The aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp faced the stare . “ Yes , ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] [his]1753-the aide - de - camp eyes concluded in a flash , while [his]1753-the aide - de - camp lips let fall : “ [The Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother admires [her]196-coral immensely . ”[1753-the aide - de - camp] But at that moment a wave of [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s fan drew [them]1766-them hurriedly from [their]1766-them embrasure . “ [Professor Darchivio]293-professor darchivio had promised to explain to [us]2765-us the difference between the Sassanian and Byzantine motives in Carolingian art ; but [the Manager]2767-the manager has sent up word that [the two new Creole dancers from [Paris]4-paris]2768-the two new creole dancers from paris have arrived , and [[her]196-coral Serene Highness]2769-her serene highness wants to pop down to [the ball - room]2770-the ball - room and take a peep at [them]2768-the two new creole dancers from paris .... [She]2769-her serene highness ’s sure [the Professor]2771-the professor will understand .... ”[170-nick] “ And accompany [us]2765-us , of course , ”[1669-the princess] [the Princess]1669-the princess irresistibly added . [Lansing]170-nick ’s brief colloquy in the Nouveau Luxe window had lifted the scales from [his]170-nick eyes . Innumerable dim corners of memory had been flooded with light by that one quick glance of [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp ’s : things [he]170-nick had heard , hints [he]170-nick had let pass , smiles , insinuations , cordialities , rumours of the improbability of [the Prince]965-the prince ’s founding [a family]1770-a family , suggestions as to the urgent need of replenishing the Teutoburger treasury .... [Miss Hicks]196-coral , perforce , had accompanied [[her]196-coral parents]650-her parents and [[their]650-her parents princely guests]1772-their princely guests to [the ballroom]1773-the ballroom ; but as [she]196-coral did not dance , and took little interest in the sight of [others so engaged]1774-others so engaged , [she]196-coral remained aloof from the party , absorbed in an archaeological discussion with [the baffled but smiling savant who was to have enlightened [the party]648-the party on the difference between Sassanian and Byzantine ornament]1775-the baffled but smiling savant who was to have enlightened the party on the difference between sassanian and byzantine ornament . [Lansing]170-nick , also aloof , had picked out a post from which [he]170-nick could observe [the girl]1390-the girl : [she]1390-the girl wore a new look to [him]170-nick since [he]170-nick had seen [her]1390-the girl as the centre of all these scattered threads of intrigue . Yes ; decidedly [she]1390-the girl was growing handsomer ; or else [she]1390-the girl had learned how to set off [her]1390-the girl massive lines instead of trying to disguise them . As [she]1390-the girl held up [her]1390-the girl long eye - glass to glance absently at [the dancers]1778-the dancers [he]170-nick was struck by the large beauty of [her]1390-the girl arm and the careless assurance of the gesture . There was nothing nervous or fussy about [Coral Hicks]196-coral ; and [he]170-nick was not surprised that , plastically at least , [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother had discerned [her]1390-the girl possibilities . [Nick Lansing]170-nick , all that night , sat up and stared at [his]170-nick future . [He]170-nick knew enough of the society into which [the Hickses]669-the hickses had drifted to guess that , within a very short time , the hint of [the Prince ’s aide - de - camp]1703-the prince ’s aide - de - camp would reappear in the form of a direct proposal . [Lansing]170-nick [himself]170-nick would probably -- as [the one person in [the Hicks entourage with whom [one]2186-one could intelligibly commune]1783-the hicks entourage with whom one could intelligibly commune]1782-the one person in the hicks entourage with whom one could intelligibly commune -- be entrusted with the next step in the negotiations : [he]170-nick would be asked , as [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp would have said , “ to feel the ground . ”[170-nick] It was clearly part of the state policy of [Teutoburg]126-teutoburg to offer [Miss Hicks]196-coral , with the hand of [its sovereign]1786-its sovereign , an opportunity to replenish [its]1786-its sovereign treasury . What would [the girl]1390-the girl do ? [Lansing]170-nick could not guess ; yet [he]170-nick dimly felt that [her]1390-the girl attitude would depend in a great degree upon [his]170-nick own . And [he]170-nick knew no more what [his]170-nick own was going to be than on the night , four months earlier , when [he]170-nick had flung out of [[[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife ’s room]1789-his wife ’s room in [Venice]15-venice to take the midnight express for [Genoa]68-genoa . The whole of [his]170-nick past , and above all the tendency , on which [he]170-nick had once prided [himself]170-nick , to live in the present and take whatever chances it offered , now made it harder for [him]170-nick to act . [He]170-nick began to see that [he]170-nick had never , even in the closest relations of life , looked ahead of [his]170-nick immediate satisfaction . [He]170-nick had thought it rather fine to be able to give [himself]170-nick so intensely to the fullness of each moment instead of hurrying past it in pursuit of something more , or something else , in the manner of [the over - scrupulous or the under - imaginative , whom [he]170-nick had always grouped together and equally pitied]1790-the over - scrupulous or the under - imaginative , whom he had always grouped together and equally pitied . It was not till [he]170-nick had linked [his]170-nick life with [Susy]159-susy ’s that [he]170-nick had begun to feel it reaching forward into a future [he]170-nick longed to make sure of , to fasten upon and shape to [his]170-nick own wants and purposes , till , by an imperceptible substitution , that future had become [his]170-nick real present , [his]170-nick all - absorbing moment of time . Now the moment was shattered , and the power to rebuild it failed [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick had never before thought about putting together broken bits : [he]170-nick felt like [a man whose house has been wrecked by an earthquake]1791-a man whose house has been wrecked by an earthquake , and who , for lack of skilled labour , is called upon for the first time to wield a trowel and carry bricks . [He]170-nick simply did not know how . Will - power , [he]170-nick saw , was not a thing [one]2186-one could suddenly decree [oneself]2186-one to possess . It must be built up imperceptibly and laboriously out of a succession of small efforts to meet definite objects , out of the facing of daily difficulties instead of cleverly eluding [them]1793-them , or shifting [their]1793-them burden on [others]397-others .
