The making of the substance called character was a process about as slow and arduous as the building of [the Pyramids]1795-the pyramids ; and the thing itself , like [those awful edifices]1796-those awful edifices , was mainly useful to lodge [[one]2186-one ’s descendants]1798-one ’s descendants in , after [they]1798-one ’s descendants too were dust . Yet the Pyramid - instinct was the one which had made [the world]2205-the world , made [man]974-man , and caused [his]170-nick fugitive joys to linger like fading frescoes on imperishable walls .... XXI . ON the drive back from [her]1801-her dinner at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe , events had followed the course foreseen by [Susy]159-susy . [She]1801-her had promised [Strefford]267-strefford to seek legal advice about [her]1801-her divorce , and [he]267-strefford had kissed [her]1801-her ; and the promise had been easier to make than [she]1801-her had expected , the kiss less difficult to receive . [She]1801-her had gone to the dinner a - quiver with the mortification of learning that [[her]1801-her husband]327-her husband was still with [the Hickses]177-the hickses . [Morally]295-morally sure of it though [she]1801-her had been , the discovery was a shock , and [she]1801-her measured for the first time the abyss between fearing and knowing . No wonder [he]267-strefford had not written -- [the modern husband]1804-the modern husband did not have to : [he]267-strefford had only to leave it to time and the newspapers to make known [his]267-strefford intentions . [Susy]159-susy could imagine [Nick]170-nick ’s saying to [himself]170-nick , as [he]170-nick sometimes used to say when [she]159-susy reminded [him]170-nick of an unanswered letter : “ But there are lots of ways of answering a letter -- and writing does n’t happen to be mine . ”[170-nick] Well -- [he]267-strefford had done it in [his]267-strefford way , and [she]159-susy was answered . For a minute , as [she]1801-her laid aside the paper , darkness submerged [her]1801-her , and [she]1801-her felt [herself]1801-her dropping down into the bottomless anguish of [her]1801-her dreadful vigil in [the Palazzo Vanderlyn]189-the palazzo vanderlyn . But [she]1801-her was weary of anguish : [her]1801-her healthy body and nerves instinctively rejected it . The wave was spent , and [she]1801-her felt [herself]1801-her irresistibly struggling back to light and life and youth . [He]267-strefford did n’t want [her]1801-her ! Well , [she]1801-her would try not to want [him]267-strefford ! There lay all the old expedients at [her]1801-her hand -- the rouge for [her]1801-her white lips , the atropine for [her]1801-her blurred eyes , the new dress on [her]1801-her bed , the thought of [Strefford]267-strefford and [[his]267-strefford guests]1805-his guests awaiting [her]1801-her , and of the conclusions that [the diners of the Nouveau Luxe]1806-the diners of the nouveau luxe would draw from seeing [them]1807-them together . Thank heaven [no one]534-no one would say : “ [Poor old Susy]159-susy -- did [you]1801-her know [Nick]170-nick had chucked [her]159-susy ? ”[534-no one] [They]1809-they would all say : “ [Poor old Nick]170-nick ! Yes , [I]1809-they daresay [she]159-susy was sorry to chuck [him]170-nick ; but [Altringham]267-strefford ’s mad to marry [her]159-susy , and what could [she]159-susy do ? ”[1809-they] And once again events had followed the course [she]1801-her had foreseen . Seeing [her]1801-her at [Lord Altringham]267-strefford ’s table , with [the Ascots]1810-the ascots and [the old Duchess of [Dunes]127-dunes]1811-the old duchess of dunes , [the interested spectators]1812-the interested spectators could not but regard the dinner as confirming the rumour of [her]1801-her marriage . As [Ellie]184-ellie said , [people]421-people did n’t wait nowadays to announce [their]421-people “ engagements ”[184-ellie] till the tiresome divorce proceedings were over . [Ellie]184-ellie [herself]184-ellie , prodigally pearled and ermined , had floated in late with [Algie Bockheimer]274-algie in [her]184-ellie wake , and sat , in conspicuous tête - à - tête , nodding and signalling [her]184-ellie sympathy to [Susy]159-susy . Approval beamed from every eye : it was awfully exciting , [they]1814-they all seemed to say , seeing [Susy Lansing]159-susy pull it off ! As the party , after dinner , drifted from [the restaurant]1058-the restaurant back into [the hall]480-the hall , [she]184-ellie caught , in the smiles and hand - pressures crowding about [her]184-ellie , the scarcely - repressed hint of official congratulations ; and [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose , seated in a corner with [Fulmer]175-grace , drew [her]184-ellie down with a wan jade - circled arm , to whisper tenderly : “ It ’s most awfully clever of [you]184-ellie , [darling]2329-darling , not to be wearing any jewels . ”[161-violet melrose] In all [the women]1237-the women ’s eyes [she]184-ellie read the reflected lustre of the jewels [she]184-ellie could wear when [she]184-ellie chose : it was as though their glitter reached [her]184-ellie from [the far - off bank]1818-the far - off bank where they lay sealed up in the Altringham strong - box . What [a fool]1488-a fool [she]184-ellie had been to think that [Strefford]267-strefford would ever believe [she]184-ellie did n’t care for [them]1237-the women ! [The Ambassadress]1820-the ambassadress , [a blank perpendicular person]1821-a blank perpendicular person , had been a shade less affable than [Susy]159-susy could have wished ; but then there was [Lady Joan]284-joan senechal -- and [the girl]1390-the girl was handsome , alarmingly handsome to account for that : probably [every one in [the room]379-the room]1823-every one in the room had guessed it . And [the old Duchess of [Dunes]127-dunes]1811-the old duchess of dunes was delightful . [She]1811-the old duchess of dunes looked rather like [Strefford]267-strefford in a wig and false pearls ( [Susy]159-susy was sure they were as false as [her]1811-the old duchess of dunes teeth ) ; and [her]1811-the old duchess of dunes cordiality was so demonstrative that [the future bride]1826-the future bride found it more difficult to account for than [Lady Ascot]282-lady ascot ’s coldness , till [she]184-ellie heard [the old lady]1827-the old lady , as [they]1828-they passed into [the hall]480-the hall , breathe in a hissing whisper to [[her]1827-the old lady nephew]1830-her nephew : “ [Streff]255-streff , dearest , when [you]255-streff have a minute ’s time , and can drop in at [[my]1827-the old lady wretched little pension]2773-my wretched little pension , [I]1827-the old lady know [you]255-streff can explain in two words what [I]1827-the old lady ought to do to pacify [those awful money - lenders .... And [you]255-streff ’ll bring [[your]255-streff exquisite American]2775-your exquisite american]2774-those awful money - lenders .... and you ’ll bring your exquisite american to see [me]1827-the old lady , wo n’t [you]255-streff ! ... No , [Joan Senechal]284-joan senechal ’s too fair for [my]1827-the old lady taste .... Insipid .... ”[1827-the old lady] Yes : the taste of it all was again sweet on [her]1827-the old lady lips . A few days later [she]1827-the old lady began to wonder how the thought of [Strefford]267-strefford ’s endearments could have been so alarming . To be sure [he]267-strefford was not lavish of [them]1831-them ; but when [he]267-strefford did touch [her]1827-the old lady , even when [he]267-strefford kissed [her]1827-the old lady , it no longer seemed to matter . An almost complete absence of sensation had mercifully succeeded to the first wild flurry of [her]1827-the old lady nerves . And so it would be , no doubt , with everything else in [her]1827-the old lady new life . If it failed to provoke any acute reactions , whether of pain or pleasure , the very absence of sensation would make for peace . And in the meanwhile [she]1827-the old lady was tasting what , [she]1827-the old lady had begun to suspect , was the maximum of bliss to [most of [the women [she]1827-the old lady knew]1833-the women she knew]1832-most of the women she knew : days packed with engagements , the exhilaration of [fashionable crowds]1834-fashionable crowds , the thrill of snapping up a jewel or a bibelot or [a new “ model ”[1836-one ’s best friend] that]1835-a new “ model ” that [one ’s best friend]1836-one ’s best friend wanted , or of being invited to some private show , or some exclusive entertainment , that [one ’s best friend]1836-one ’s best friend could n’t get to . There was nothing , now , that [she]1827-the old lady could n’t buy , nowhere that [she]1827-the old lady could n’t go : [she]1827-the old lady had only to choose and to triumph . And for a while the surface - excitement of [her]1827-the old lady life gave [her]1827-the old lady the illusion of enjoyment . [Strefford]267-strefford , as [she]1827-the old lady had expected , had postponed [his]267-strefford return to [England]67-england , and [they]1838-their had now been for nearly three weeks together in [[their]1838-their new , and virtually avowed , relation]1839-their new , and virtually avowed , relation . [She]1827-the old lady had fancied that , after all , the easiest part of it would be just the being with [Strefford]267-strefford -- the falling back on [their]1838-their old tried friendship to efface the sense of strangeness . But , though [she]1827-the old lady had so soon grown used to [his]267-strefford caresses , [he]267-strefford [himself]267-strefford remained curiously unfamiliar : [she]1827-the old lady was hardly sure , at times , that it was the old Strefford [she]1827-the old lady was talking to . It was not that [his]267-strefford point of view had changed , but that new things occupied and absorbed [him]267-strefford . In all the small sides of [his]267-strefford great situation [he]267-strefford took an almost childish satisfaction ; and though [he]267-strefford still laughed at both its privileges and its obligations , it was now with a jealous laughter . It amused [him]267-strefford inexhaustibly , for instance , to be made up to by [all the people who had always disapproved of [him]267-strefford , and to unite at the same table persons who had to dissemble [their]1841-their annoyance at being invited together lest [they]1841-their should not be invited at all]1840-all the people who had always disapproved of him , and to unite at the same table persons who had to dissemble their annoyance at being invited together lest they should not be invited at all . Equally exhilarating was the capricious favouring of the dull and dowdy on occasions when [the brilliant and disreputable]1842-the brilliant and disreputable expected [his]267-strefford notice . It enchanted [him]267-strefford , for example , to ask [the old Duchess of [Dunes]127-dunes]1811-the old duchess of dunes and [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose to dine with [the Vicar of [Altringham]267-strefford]1844-the vicar of altringham , on [his]1844-the vicar of altringham way to [Switzerland]128-switzerland for a month ’s holiday , and to watch the face of [[the Vicar]1845-the vicar ’s wife]1846-the vicar ’s wife while [the Duchess]1847-the duchess narrated [her]1847-the duchess last difficulties with [book - makers]1848-book - makers and [money - lenders]1849-money - lenders , and [Violet]161-violet melrose proclaimed the rights of Love and [Genius]246-genius to all that had once been supposed to belong exclusively to Respectability and [Dulness]296-dulness . [Susy]159-susy had to confess that [her]159-susy own amusements were hardly of a higher order ; but then [she]159-susy put up with them for lack of better , whereas [Strefford]267-strefford , who might have had what [he]267-strefford pleased , was completely satisfied with such triumphs . Somehow , in spite of [his]267-strefford honours and [his]267-strefford opportunities , [he]267-strefford seemed to have shrunk . [The old Strefford]267-strefford had certainly been [a larger person]1850-a larger person , and [she]159-susy wondered if material prosperity were always a beginning of ossification . [Strefford]267-strefford had been much more fun when [he]267-strefford lived by [his]267-strefford wits . Sometimes , now , when [he]267-strefford tried to talk of politics , or assert [himself]267-strefford on some question of public interest , [she]159-susy was startled by [his]267-strefford limitations . Formerly , when [he]267-strefford was not sure of [his]267-strefford ground , it had been [his]267-strefford way to turn the difficulty by glib nonsense or easy irony ; now [he]267-strefford was actually dull , at times almost pompous . [She]159-susy noticed too , for the first time , that [he]267-strefford did not always hear clearly when [several people]1851-several people were talking at once , or when [he]267-strefford was at [the theatre]1852-the theatre ; and [he]267-strefford developed a habit of saying over and over again : “ Does so - and - so speak indistinctly ? Or am [I]267-strefford getting deaf , [I]267-strefford wonder ? ”[267-strefford] which wore on [her]159-susy nerves by its suggestion of a corresponding mental infirmity . These thoughts did not always trouble [her]159-susy . The current of idle activity on which [they]1853-their were both gliding was [her]159-susy native element as well as [his]267-strefford ; and never had its tide been as swift , its waves as buoyant . In [his]267-strefford relation to [her]159-susy , too , [he]267-strefford was full of tact and consideration . [She]159-susy saw that [he]267-strefford still remembered [their]1853-their frightened exchange of glances after [their]1853-their first kiss ; and the sense of this little hidden spring of imagination in [him]267-strefford was sometimes enough for [her]159-susy thirst . [She]159-susy had always had a rather masculine punctuality in keeping [her]159-susy word , and after [she]159-susy had promised [Strefford]267-strefford to take steps toward a divorce [she]159-susy had promptly set about doing it . A sudden reluctance prevented [her]159-susy asking the advice of friends like [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie , whom [she]159-susy [knew to be in the thick of the same negotiations]1854-knew to be in the thick of the same negotiations , and all [she]159-susy could think of was to consult [a young American lawyer practicing in [Paris]4-paris , with whom [she]159-susy felt [she]159-susy could talk the more easily because [he]1855-a young american lawyer practicing in paris , with whom she felt she could talk the more easily because he was not from new york , and probably unacquainted with her history was not from [New York]12-new york , and probably unacquainted with [her]159-susy history]1855-a young american lawyer practicing in paris , with whom she felt she could talk the more easily because he was not from new york , and probably unacquainted with her history . [She]159-susy was so ignorant of the procedure in such matters that [she]159-susy was surprised and relieved at [his]1855-a young american lawyer practicing in paris , with whom she felt she could talk the more easily because he was not from new york , and probably unacquainted with her history asking few personal questions ; but it was a shock to learn that a divorce could not be obtained , either in [New York]12-new york or [Paris]4-paris , merely on the ground of desertion or incompatibility . “ [I]159-susy thought nowadays ... if [people]421-people preferred to live apart ... it could always be managed , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy stammered , wondering at [her]159-susy own ignorance , after the many conjugal ruptures [she]159-susy had assisted at . [The young lawyer]1856-the young lawyer smiled , and coloured slightly . [[His]1856-the young lawyer lovely client]1857-his lovely client evidently intimidated [him]1856-the young lawyer by [her]1857-his lovely client grace , and still more by [her]1857-his lovely client inexperience . “ It can be -- generally , ”[1856-the young lawyer] [he]1856-the young lawyer admitted ; “ and especially so if ... as [I]1856-the young lawyer gather is the case ... [[your]159-susy husband]2777-your husband is equally anxious .... ”[1856-the young lawyer] “ Oh , quite ! ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy exclaimed , suddenly humiliated by having to admit it . “ Well , then -- may [I]159-susy suggest that , to bring matters to a point , the best way would be for [you]1856-the young lawyer to write to [him]2777-your husband ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy recoiled slightly . It had never occurred to [her]159-susy that [the lawyers]1858-the lawyers would not “ manage it ”[1856-the young lawyer] without [her]159-susy intervention . “ Write to [him]2777-your husband ... but what about ? ”[1858-the lawyers] “ Well , expressing [your]159-susy wish ... to recover [your]159-susy freedom .... The rest , [I]1856-the young lawyer assume , ”[1856-the young lawyer] said [the young lawyer]1856-the young lawyer , “ may be left to [Mr. Lansing]170-nick . ”[1856-the young lawyer] [She]159-susy did not know exactly what [he]1856-the young lawyer meant , and was too much perturbed by the idea of having to communicate with [Nick]170-nick to follow any other train of thought . How could [she]159-susy write such a letter ? And yet how could [she]159-susy confess to [the lawyer]1860-the lawyer that [she]159-susy had not the courage to do so ? [He]1856-the young lawyer would , of course , tell [her]159-susy to go [home]606-home and be reconciled . [She]159-susy hesitated perplexedly . “ Would n’t it be better , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy suggested , “ if the letter were to come from -- from [[your]1856-the young lawyer office]2778-your office ? ”[159-susy] [He]1856-the young lawyer considered this politely . “ On the whole : no . If , as [I]159-susy take it , an amicable arrangement is necessary -- to secure the requisite evidence then a line from [you]1856-the young lawyer , suggesting an interview , seems to [me]159-susy more advisable . ”[159-susy] “ An interview ? Is an interview necessary ? ”[159-susy] [She]159-susy was ashamed to show [her]159-susy agitation to [this cautiously smiling young man , who must wonder at [her]159-susy childish lack of understanding]1862-this cautiously smiling young man , who must wonder at her childish lack of understanding ; but the break in [her]159-susy voice was uncontrollable . “ Oh , please write to [him]1856-the young lawyer -- [I]159-susy ca n’t ! And [I]159-susy ca n’t see [him]1856-the young lawyer ! Oh , ca n’t [you]1856-the young lawyer arrange it for [me]159-susy ? ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy pleaded . [She]159-susy saw now that [her]159-susy idea of a divorce had been that it was something [one]2186-one went out -- or sent out -- to buy in [a shop]1864-a shop : something concrete and portable , that [Strefford]267-strefford ’s money could pay for , and that it required no personal participation to obtain . What [a fool]1488-a fool [the lawyer]1860-the lawyer must think [her]159-susy ! Stiffening [herself]159-susy , [she]159-susy rose from [her]159-susy seat . “ [[My]159-susy husband]2779-my husband and [I]159-susy do n’t wish to see [each other]2188-each other again .... [I]159-susy ’m sure it would be useless ... and very painful . ”[159-susy] “ [You]1860-the lawyer are [the best judge]2781-the best judge , of course . But in any case , a letter from [you]1860-the lawyer , a friendly letter , seems wiser ... considering the apparent lack of evidence .... ”[1860-the lawyer] “ Very well , then ; [I]159-susy ’ll write , ”[159-susy] [she]159-susy agreed , and hurried away , scarcely hearing [his]1860-the lawyer parting injunction that [she]159-susy should take a copy of [her]159-susy letter . That night [she]159-susy wrote . At the last moment it might have been impossible , if at [the theatre]1852-the theatre [little Breckenridge]249-little breckenridge had not bobbed into [her]159-susy box . [He]1860-the lawyer was just back from [Rome]23-rome , where [he]1860-the lawyer had dined with [the Hickses]177-the hickses ( “ [a bang - up show]2782-a bang - up show -- [they’re]177-the hickses really lances -- [you]1860-the lawyer would n’t know [them]177-the hickses ! ”[177-the hickses] ) , and had met there [Lansing]170-nick , whom [he]1860-the lawyer reported as intending to marry [Coral]196-coral “ as soon as things were settled ”[1860-the lawyer] . “ [You]1860-the lawyer were dead right , were n’t [you]1860-the lawyer , [Susy]159-susy , ”[1860-the lawyer] [he]1860-the lawyer snickered , “ that night in [Venice]15-venice last summer , when [we]2783-we all thought [you]1860-the lawyer were joking about [their]177-the hickses engagement ? Pity now [you]1860-the lawyer chucked [our]2783-we surprise visit to [the Hickses]177-the hickses , and sent [Streff]255-streff up to drag [us]2783-we back just as [we]2783-we were breaking in ! [You]1860-the lawyer remember ? ”[1860-the lawyer] [He]1860-the lawyer flung off the “ [Streff]255-streff ”[1860-the lawyer] airily , in the old way , but with a tentative side - glance at [[his]1860-the lawyer host]833-his host ; and [Lord Altringham]267-strefford , leaning toward [Susy]159-susy , said coldly : “ Was [Breckenridge]249-little breckenridge speaking about [me]267-strefford ? [I]267-strefford did n’t catch what [he]249-little breckenridge said . Does [he]249-little breckenridge speak indistinctly -- or am [I]267-strefford getting deaf , [I]267-strefford wonder ? ”[267-strefford] After that it seemed comparatively easy , when [Strefford]267-strefford had dropped [her]159-susy at [[her]159-susy hotel]1552-her hotel , to go [upstairs]485-upstairs and write . [She]159-susy dashed off the date and [her]159-susy address , and then stopped ; but suddenly [she]159-susy remembered [Breckenridge]249-little breckenridge ’s snicker , and the words rushed from [her]159-susy . “ [Nick]170-nick dear , it was July when [you]159-susy left [Venice]15-venice , and [I]249-little breckenridge have had no word from [you]159-susy since the note in which [you]159-susy said [you]159-susy had gone for a few days , and that [I]249-little breckenridge should hear soon again . “[249-little breckenridge] [You]159-susy have n’t written yet , and it is five months since [you]159-susy left [me]0-i . That means , [I]0-i suppose , that [you]159-susy want to take back [your]159-susy freedom and give [me]0-i [mine]0-i . Would n’t it be kinder , in that case , to tell [me]0-i so ? It is worse than anything to go on as [we]1871-we are now . [I]0-i do n’t know how to put these things but since [you]159-susy seem unwilling to write to [me]0-i perhaps [you]159-susy would prefer to send [your]159-susy answer to [Mr. Frederic Spearman]297-mr. frederic spearman , [the American lawyer]1872-the american lawyer [here]2184-here . [His]297-mr. frederic spearman address is 100 , [Boulevard Haussmann]129-boulevard haussmann . [I]0-i hope-- ” [She]0-i broke off on the last word . [Hope]298-hope ? What did [she]0-i hope , either for [him]297-mr. frederic spearman or for [herself]0-i ? [Wishes]299-wishes for [his]297-mr. frederic spearman welfare would sound like a mockery -- and [she]0-i would rather [her]0-i letter should seem bitter than unfeeling . Above all , [she]0-i wanted to get it done . To have to re - write even those few lines would be torture . So [she]0-i left “[0-i] [I]0-i hope , ” and simply added : “[0-i] to hear before long what [you]159-susy have decided . ” [She]0-i read it over , and shivered . Not one word of the past -- not one allusion to that mysterious interweaving of [their]2784-them lives which had enclosed [them]2784-them one in the other like the flower in its sheath ! What place had such memories in such a letter ? [She]0-i had the feeling that [she]0-i wanted to hide that other [Nick]170-nick away in [her]0-i own bosom , and with [him]297-mr. frederic spearman [the other Susy]159-susy , [the Susy [he]297-mr. frederic spearman had once imagined [her]0-i to be .... Neither of [them]2784-them]159-susy seemed concerned with the present business . The letter done , [she]0-i stared at the sealed envelope till its presence in [the room]379-the room became intolerable , and [she]0-i understood that [she]0-i must either tear it up or post it immediately . [She]0-i went down to [the hall of [the sleeping hotel]2787-the sleeping hotel]2786-the hall of the sleeping hotel , and bribed [the night - porter]2788-the night - porter to carry the letter to [the nearest post office]2669-the nearest post office , though [he]2788-the night - porter objected that , at that hour , no time would be gained . “[0-i] [I]0-i want it out of [the house]342-the house , ” [she]0-i insisted : and waited sternly by the desk , in [her]0-i dressing - gown , till [he]2788-the night - porter had performed the errand . As [she]0-i re - entered [[her]0-i room]664-her room , the disordered writing - table struck [her]0-i ; and [she]0-i remembered [the lawyer]1860-the lawyer ’s injunction to take a copy of [her]0-i letter . A copy to be filed away with the documents in “[0-i] [Lansing]159-susy versus [Lansing]159-susy ! ” [She]0-i burst out laughing at the idea . What were [lawyers]2792-lawyers made of , [she]0-i wondered ? Did n’t [the man]2644-the man guess , by the mere look in [her]0-i eyes and the sound of [her]0-i voice , that [she]0-i would never , as long as [she]0-i lived , forget a word of that letter -- that night after night [she]0-i would lie down , as [she]0-i was lying down to - night , to stare wide - eyed for hours into the darkness , while a voice in [her]0-i brain monotonously hammered out : “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick dear , it was [July]300-july when [you]170-nick left [me]0-i ... ” and so on , word after word , down to the last fatal syllable ? XXII . [STREFFORD]267-strefford was leaving for [England]67-england . Once assured that [Susy]159-susy had taken the first step toward freeing [herself]159-susy , [he]267-strefford frankly regarded [her]159-susy as [[his]267-strefford affianced wife]2794-his affianced wife , and could see no reason for further mystery . [She]159-susy understood [his]267-strefford impatience to have [their]2795-their plans settled ; it would protect [him]267-strefford from the formidable menace of the marriageable , and cause [people]421-people , as [he]267-strefford said , to stop meddling . Now that the novelty of [his]267-strefford situation was wearing off , [his]267-strefford natural indolence reasserted itself , and there was nothing [he]267-strefford dreaded more than having to be on [his]267-strefford guard against the innumerable plans that [[his]267-strefford well - wishers]2797-his well - wishers were perpetually making for [him]267-strefford . Sometimes [Susy]159-susy fancied [he]267-strefford was marrying [her]159-susy because to do so was to follow the line of least resistance . “[170-nick] To marry [me]0-i is the easiest way of not marrying [all the others]1875-all the others , ” [she]159-susy laughed , as [he]267-strefford stood before [her]159-susy one day in [a quiet alley of [the Bois de Boulogne]131-the bois de boulogne]2798-a quiet alley of the bois de boulogne , insisting on the settlement of various preliminaries . “[0-i] [I]0-i believe [I]0-i ’m only a protection to [you]0-i . ” An odd gleam passed behind [his]267-strefford eyes , and [she]159-susy instantly guessed that [he]267-strefford was thinking : “[0-i] And what else am [I]0-i to [you]0-i ? ” [She]159-susy changed colour , and [he]267-strefford rejoined , laughing also : “[0-i] Well , [you]0-i ’re that at any rate , thank [the Lord]2631-the lord ! ” [She]159-susy pondered , and then questioned : “[2631-the lord] But in the interval -- how are [you]0-i going to defend [yourself]0-i for another year ? ” “[2631-the lord] Ah , [you]0-i ’ve got to see to that ; [you]0-i ’ve got to take [a little house in [London]54-london]1877-a little house in london . [You]0-i ’ve got to look after [me]0-i , [you]0-i know . ” It was on the tip of [her]159-susy tongue to flash back : “[0-i] Oh , if that ’s all [you]0-i care-- ! ” But caring was exactly the factor [she]159-susy wanted , as much as possible , to keep out of [their]2799-their talk and [their]2799-their thoughts . [She]159-susy could not ask [him]267-strefford how much [he]267-strefford cared without laying [herself]159-susy open to the same question ; and that way terror lay . As a matter of fact , though [Strefford]267-strefford was not [an ardent wooer]2800-an ardent wooer -- perhaps from tact , perhaps from temperament , perhaps merely from the long habit of belittling and disintegrating every sentiment and every conviction -- yet [she]159-susy knew [he]267-strefford did care for [her]159-susy as much as [he]267-strefford was capable of caring for [anyone]389-anyone . If the element of habit entered largely into the feeling -- if [he]267-strefford liked [her]159-susy , above all , because [he]267-strefford was used to [her]159-susy , knew [her]159-susy views , [her]159-susy indulgences , [her]159-susy allowances , knew [he]267-strefford was never likely to be bored , and almost certain to be amused , by [her]159-susy ; why , such ingredients though not of the fieriest , were perhaps those most likely to keep [his]267-strefford feeling for [her]159-susy at a pleasant temperature . [She]159-susy had had a taste of [the tropics]2802-the tropics , and wanted more equable weather ; but the idea of having to fan [his]267-strefford flame gently for a year was unspeakably depressing to [her]159-susy . Yet all this was precisely what [she]159-susy could not say . The long period of probation , during which , as [she]159-susy knew , [she]159-susy would have to amuse [him]267-strefford , to guard [him]267-strefford , to hold [him]267-strefford , and to keep off [the other women]1489-the other women , was a necessary part of [their]2804-their situation . [She]159-susy was sure that , as [little Breckenridge]249-little breckenridge would have said , [she]159-susy could “[0-i] pull it off ” ; but [she]159-susy did not want to think about it . What [she]159-susy would have preferred would have been to go away -- no matter where and not see [Strefford]267-strefford again till [they]2804-their were married . But [she]159-susy dared not tell [him]267-strefford that either . “[0-i] [A little house in [London--]132-london--]1878-a little house in london-- ? ” [She]159-susy wondered . “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i suppose [you]1879-you ’ve got to have some sort of a roof over [your]1879-you head . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so . ” [He]267-strefford sat down beside [her]159-susy . “[0-i] If [you]1879-you like [me]0-i well enough to live at [Altringham]267-strefford some day , wo n’t [you]1879-you , in the meantime , let [me]0-i provide [you]1879-you with [a smaller and more convenient establishment]1880-a smaller and more convenient establishment ? ” Still [she]159-susy hesitated . The alternative , [she]159-susy knew , would be to live on [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula , [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose , or [some other of [[her]159-susy rich friends]357-her rich friends , any one of whom would be ready to lavish the largest hospitality on the prospective [Lady Altringham]271-lady altringham]2805-some other of her rich friends , any one of whom would be ready to lavish the largest hospitality on the prospective lady altringham . Such an arrangement , in the long run , would be no less humiliating to [her]159-susy pride , no less destructive to [her]159-susy independence , than [[Altringham]267-strefford ’s little establishment]2807-altringham ’s little establishment . But [she]159-susy temporized . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall go over to [London]54-london in December , and stay for a while with [various people]1881-various people -- then [we]1882-we can look about . ” “[1879-you] All right ; as [you]1879-you like . ” [He]255-streff obviously considered [her]159-susy hesitation ridiculous , but was too full of satisfaction at [her]159-susy having started divorce proceedings to be chilled by [her]159-susy reply . “[1879-you] And now , look here , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear ; could n’t [I]0-i give [you]445-my dear some sort of a ring ? ” “[0-i] A ring ? ” [She]159-susy flushed at the suggestion . “[0-i] What ’s the use , [Streff]255-streff , [dear]2236-dear ? With all those jewels locked away in [London--]132-london-- ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i daresay [you]445-my dear ’ll think them old - fashioned . And , hang it , why should n’t [I]0-i give [you]445-my dear something new , [I]0-i ran across [Ellie]184-ellie and [Bockheimer]274-algie yesterday , in [the rue de la Paix]1885-the rue de la paix , picking out sapphires . Do [you]445-my dear like sapphires , or emeralds ? Or just a diamond ? [I]0-i ’ve seen a thumping one .... [I]0-i ’d like [you]445-my dear to have it . ” [Ellie]184-ellie and [Bockheimer]274-algie ! How [she]0-i hated the conjunction of the names ! [Their]1886-their case always seemed to [her]0-i like a caricature of [her]0-i own , and [she]0-i felt an unreasoning resentment against [Ellie]184-ellie for having selected the same season for [her]184-ellie unmating and re - mating . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]445-my dear would n’t speak of [them]1886-their , [Streff]255-streff ... as if [they]1886-their were like [us]1887-us ! [I]0-i can hardly bear to sit in [the same room]1888-the same room with [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie . ” “[184-ellie] [Hullo]225-hullo ? What ’s wrong ? [You]255-streff mean because of [her]184-ellie giving up [Clarissa]187-clarissa ? ” “[255-streff] Not that only .... [You]445-my dear do n’t know .... [I]0-i ca n’t tell [you]445-my dear .... ” [She]445-my dear shivered at the memory , and rose restlessly from the bench where [they]1887-us had been sitting . [Strefford]267-strefford gave [his]267-strefford careless shrug . “[0-i] Well , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear , [you]445-my dear can hardly expect [me]0-i to agree , for after all it was to [Ellie]184-ellie [I]0-i owed the luck of being so long alone with [you]445-my dear in [Venice]15-venice . If [she]184-ellie and [Algie]274-algie had n’t prolonged [their]1890-their honeymoon at [the villa--]1891-the villa-- ” [He]267-strefford stopped abruptly , and looked at [Susy]159-susy . [She]159-susy was conscious that every drop of blood had left [her]159-susy face . [She]159-susy felt it ebbing away from [her]159-susy heart , flowing out of [her]159-susy as if from all [her]159-susy severed arteries , till it seemed as though nothing were left of life in [her]159-susy but one point of irreducible pain . “[184-ellie] [Ellie]184-ellie -- at [[your]184-ellie villa]1892-your villa ? What do [you]184-ellie mean ? Was it [Ellie]184-ellie and [Bockheimer]274-algie who-- ? ” [Strefford]267-strefford still stared . “[184-ellie] [You]184-ellie mean to say [you]184-ellie did n’t know ? ” “[184-ellie] Who came after [Nick]170-nick and [me]0-i ... ? ” [she]0-i insisted . “[184-ellie] Why , do [you]184-ellie suppose [I]0-i ’d have turned [you]184-ellie out otherwise ? [That beastly Bockheimer]1893-that beastly bockheimer simply smothered [me]0-i with gold . Ah , well , there ’s one good thing : [I]0-i shall never have to let [the villa]454-the villa again ! [I]0-i rather like [the little place]1895-the little place [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i daresay once in a while [we]1896-we might go [there]2229-there for a day or two .... [Susy]159-susy , what ’s the matter ? ” [he]1893-that beastly bockheimer exclaimed . [She]159-susy returned [his]1893-that beastly bockheimer stare , but without seeing [him]1893-that beastly bockheimer . Everything swam and danced before [her]159-susy eyes . “[1898-she] Then [she]1898-she was there while [I]0-i was posting all those letters for [her--]1899-her-- ? ” “[1898-she] Letters -- what letters ? What makes [you]0-i look so frightfully upset ? ” [She]159-susy pursued [her]159-susy thought as if [he]1893-that beastly bockheimer had not spoken . “[1898-she] [She]1898-she and [Algie Bockheimer]274-algie arrived [there]2229-there the very day that [Nick]170-nick and [I]0-i left ? ” “[1898-she] [I]0-i suppose so . [I]0-i thought [she]1898-she ’d told [you]0-i . [Ellie]184-ellie always tells [everybody]2183-everybody everything . ” “[1898-she] [She]1898-she would have told [me]0-i , [I]0-i daresay -- but [I]0-i would n’t let [her]1898-she . ” “[1898-she] Well , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear , that was hardly [my]0-i fault , was it ? Though [I]0-i really do n’t see-- ” But [Susy]159-susy , still blind to everything but the dance of dizzy sparks before [her]159-susy eyes , pressed on as if [she]159-susy had not heard [him]2808-him . “[1898-she] It was [their]1903-their motor , then , that took [us]1904-us to [Milan]19-milan ! [It]1905-it was [Algie Bockheimer]274-algie ’s motor ! ” [She]159-susy did not know why , but this seemed to [her]159-susy the most humiliating incident in the whole hateful business . [She]159-susy remembered [Nick]170-nick ’s reluctance to use [the motor]2222-the motor -- [she]159-susy remembered [his]2808-him look when [she]159-susy had boasted of [her]159-susy “[1905-it] managing . ” The nausea mounted to [her]159-susy throat . [Strefford]267-strefford burst out laughing . “[0-i] [I]0-i say -- [you]0-i borrowed [their]1903-their motor ? And [you]0-i did n’t know whose it was ? ” “[0-i] How could [I]0-i know ? [I]0-i persuaded [the chauffeur]2226-the chauffeur ... for a little tip .... It was to save [our]1907-our railway fares to [Milan]19-milan ... extra luggage costs so frightfully in [Italy]134-italy .... ” “[159-susy] [Good old Susy]159-susy ! Well done ! [I]0-i can see [you]0-i doing it-- ” “[0-i] Oh , how horrible -- how horrible ! ” [she]159-susy groaned . “[0-i] Horrible ? What ’s horrible ? ” “[0-i] Why , [your]0-i not seeing ... not feeling ... ” [she]159-susy began impetuously ; and then stopped . How could [she]159-susy explain to [him]267-strefford that what revolted [her]159-susy was not so much the fact of [his]267-strefford having given [the little house]2810-the little house , as soon as [she]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick had left [it]2810-the little house , to [those two people of all others]2811-those two people of all others -- though the vision of [them]2811-those two people of all others in [the sweet secret house]2812-the sweet secret house , and under the plane - trees of [the terrace]1242-the terrace , drew such a trail of slime across [her]159-susy golden hours ? No , it was not that from which [she]159-susy most recoiled , but from the fact that [Strefford]267-strefford , living in luxury in [[Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson ’s house]2814-nelson vanderlyn ’s house , should at the same time have secretly abetted [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s love - affairs , and allowed [her]159-susy -- for a handsome price -- to shelter [them]2811-those two people of all others under [his]267-strefford own roof . The reproach trembled on [her]159-susy lip -- but [she]159-susy remembered [her]159-susy own part in the wretched business , and the impossibility of avowing it to [Strefford]267-strefford , and of revealing to [him]267-strefford that [Nick]170-nick had left [her]159-susy for that very reason . [She]159-susy was not afraid that the discovery would diminish [her]159-susy in [Strefford]267-strefford ’s eyes : [he]267-strefford was untroubled by moral problems , and would laugh away [her]159-susy avowal , with a sneer at [Nick]170-nick in [his]267-strefford new part of moralist . But that was just what [she]159-susy could not bear : that [anyone]389-anyone should cast a doubt on the genuineness of [Nick]170-nick ’s standards , or should know how far below [them]2816-them [she]159-susy had fallen . [She]159-susy remained silent , and [Strefford]267-strefford , after a moment , drew [her]159-susy gently down to the seat beside [him]267-strefford . “[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy , upon [my]0-i soul [I]0-i do n’t know what [you]159-susy ’re driving at . Is it [me]0-i [you]159-susy ’re angry with -- or [yourself]159-susy ? And what ’s it all about ! Are [you]159-susy disgusted because [I]0-i let [the villa]454-the villa to [a couple who were n’t married]1909-a couple who were n’t married ! But , hang it , [they]1910-they ’re the kind that pay the highest price and [I]0-i had to earn [my]0-i living somehow ! [One]2186-one does n’t run across a bridal pair every day .... ” [She]159-susy lifted [her]159-susy eyes to [his]267-strefford puzzled incredulous face . [Poor Streff]198-streff ! No , it was not with [him]267-strefford that [she]159-susy was angry . Why should [she]159-susy be ? Even that ill - advised disclosure had told [her]159-susy nothing [she]159-susy had not already known about [him]267-strefford . It had simply revealed to [her]159-susy once more the real point of view of [the people [he]267-strefford and [she]159-susy lived among]2817-the people he and she lived among had shown [her]159-susy that , in spite of the superficial difference , [he]267-strefford felt as [they]2817-the people he and she lived among felt , judged as [they]2817-the people he and she lived among judged , was blind as [they]2817-the people he and she lived among were -- and as [she]159-susy would be expected to be , should [she]159-susy once again become [one of [them]2817-the people he and she lived among]2818-one of them . What was the use of being placed by fortune above such shifts and compromises , if in one ’s heart one still condoned [them]2817-the people he and she lived among ? And [she]159-susy would have to -- [she]159-susy would catch the general note , grow blunted as [those other people]2234-those other people were blunted , and gradually come to wonder at [her]159-susy own revolt , as [Strefford]267-strefford now honestly wondered at it . [She]159-susy felt as though [she]159-susy were on the point of losing some new - found treasure , a treasure precious only to [herself]159-susy , but beside which all [he]267-strefford offered [her]159-susy was nothing , the triumph of [her]159-susy wounded pride nothing , the security of [her]159-susy future nothing . “[2186-one] What is it , [Susy]159-susy ? ” [he]267-strefford asked , with the same puzzled gentleness . Ah , the loneliness of never being able to make [him]267-strefford understand ! [She]159-susy had felt lonely enough when the flaming sword of [Nick]170-nick ’s indignation had shut [her]159-susy out from [[their]2820-their Paradise]2821-their paradise ; but there had been a cruel bliss in the pain . [Nick]170-nick had not opened [her]159-susy eyes to new truths , but had waked in [her]159-susy again something which had lain unconscious under years of accumulated indifference . And that re - awakened sense had never left [her]159-susy since , and had somehow kept [her]159-susy from utter loneliness because it was a secret shared with [Nick]170-nick , a gift [she]159-susy owed to [Nick]170-nick , and which , in leaving [her]159-susy , [he]267-strefford could not take from [her]159-susy . It was almost , [she]159-susy suddenly felt , as if [he]267-strefford had left [her]159-susy with [a child]609-a child . “[159-susy] [[My]0-i dear girl]1912-my dear girl , ” [Strefford]267-strefford said , with a resigned glance at [his]267-strefford watch , “[1912-my dear girl] [you]1912-my dear girl know [we]1913-we ’re dining at [the Embassy]1914-the embassy .... ” At [the Embassy]1914-the embassy ? [She]159-susy looked at [him]267-strefford vaguely : then [she]159-susy remembered . Yes , [they]1913-we were dining that night at [the Ascots ’]2824-the ascots ’ , with [[Strefford]267-strefford ’s cousin]2825-strefford ’s cousin , [the Duke of [Dunes]127-dunes]2826-the duke of dunes , and [[his]267-strefford wife]332-his wife , [the handsome irreproachable young Duchess]2828-the handsome irreproachable young duchess ; with [the old gambling Dowager Duchess , whom [[her]332-his wife son and daughter - in - law had come over from [England]67-england to see]2830-her son and daughter - in - law had come over from england to see]2829-the old gambling dowager duchess , whom her son and daughter - in - law had come over from england to see ; and with other English and [French guests of a rank and standing worthy of the Duneses]2831-french guests of a rank and standing worthy of the duneses . [Susy]159-susy knew that [her]159-susy inclusion in such a dinner could mean but one thing : it was [her]159-susy definite recognition as [[Altringham]267-strefford ’s future wife]2832-altringham ’s future wife . [She]159-susy was “[2833-the little american ” whom one had to ask when one invited him] [the little American ” whom [one]2186-one had to ask when [one]2186-one invited [him]2186-one]2833-the little american ” whom one had to ask when one invited him , even on ceremonial occasions . [The family]2836-the family had accepted [her]159-susy ; [the Embassy]135-the embassy could but follow suit . “[2833-the little american ” whom one had to ask when one invited him] It ’s late , [dear]2236-dear ; and [I]0-i ’ve got to see [someone]981-someone on business first , ” [Strefford]267-strefford reminded [her]2236-dear patiently . “[981-someone] Oh , [Streff]198-streff -- [I]0-i ca n’t , [I]0-i ca n’t ! ” The words broke from [her]2236-dear without [her]2236-dear knowing what [she]2236-dear was saying . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t go with [you]198-streff -- [I]0-i ca n’t go to [the Embassy]1914-the embassy . [I]0-i ca n’t go on any longer like this .... ” [She]2236-dear lifted [her]2236-dear eyes to [his]267-strefford in desperate appeal . “[198-streff] Oh , understand -- do please understand ! ” [she]2236-dear wailed , knowing , while [she]2236-dear spoke , the utter impossibility of what [she]2236-dear asked . [Strefford]267-strefford ’s face had gradually paled and hardened . From sallow it turned to a dusky white , and lines of obstinacy deepened between the ironic eyebrows and about the weak amused mouth . “[198-streff] Understand ? What do [you]198-streff want [me]0-i to understand , ” [He]267-strefford laughed . “[198-streff] That [you]198-streff ’re trying to chuck [me]0-i already ? ” [She]2236-dear shrank at the sneer of the “[198-streff] already , ” but instantly remembered that it was the only thing [he]267-strefford could be expected to say , since it was just because [he]267-strefford could n’t understand that [she]2236-dear was flying from [him]267-strefford . “[198-streff] Oh , [Streff]198-streff -- if [I]0-i knew how to tell [you]198-streff ! ” “[198-streff] It does n’t so much matter about the how . Is that what [you]198-streff ’re trying to say ? ” [Her]2236-dear head drooped , and [she]2236-dear saw the dead leaves whirling across the path at [her]2236-dear feet , lifted on a sudden wintry gust . “[198-streff] The reason , ” [he]267-strefford continued , clearing [his]267-strefford throat with a stiff smile , “[198-streff] is not quite as important to [me]0-i as the fact . ” [She]2236-dear stood speechless , agonized by [his]267-strefford pain . But still , [she]2236-dear thought , [he]267-strefford had remembered the dinner at [the Embassy]1914-the embassy . The thought gave [her]2236-dear courage to go on . “[198-streff] It would n’t do , [Streff]198-streff . [I]0-i ’m not a bit the kind of person to make [you]198-streff happy . ” “[0-i] Oh , leave that to [me]0-i , please , wo n’t [you]198-streff ? ” “[198-streff] No , [I]0-i ca n’t . Because [I]0-i should be unhappy too . ” [He]267-strefford clicked at the leaves as they whirled past . “[198-streff] [You]198-streff ’ve taken a rather long time to find it out . ” [She]2236-dear saw that [his]267-strefford new - born sense of [his]267-strefford own consequence was making [him]267-strefford suffer even more than [his]267-strefford wounded affection ; and that again gave [her]2236-dear courage . “[198-streff] If [I]0-i ’ve taken long it ’s all the more reason why [I]0-i should n’t take longer . If [I]0-i ’ve made a mistake it ’s [you]198-streff who would have suffered from it .... ” “[198-streff] Thanks , ” [he]267-strefford said , “[198-streff] for [your]198-streff extreme solicitude . ” [She]2236-dear looked at [him]267-strefford helplessly , penetrated by the despairing sense of [their]2838-their inaccessibility to [each other]2188-each other . Then [she]2236-dear remembered that [Nick]170-nick , during [their]2838-their last talk together , had seemed as inaccessible , and wondered if , when [human souls]2840-human souls try to get too near [each other]2188-each other , [they]2840-human souls do not inevitably become mere blurs to [each other]2188-each other ’s vision . [She]2236-dear would have liked to say this to [Streff]198-streff -- but [he]267-strefford would not have understood it either . The sense of loneliness once more enveloped [her]2236-dear , and [she]2236-dear groped in vain for a word that should reach [him]267-strefford . “[198-streff] Let [me]0-i go [home]606-home alone , wo n’t [you]1919-you ? ” [she]2236-dear appealed to [him]267-strefford . “[1919-you] Alone ? ” [She]2236-dear nodded . “[198-streff] To - morrow -- to - morrow .... ” [He]267-strefford tried , rather valiantly , to smile . “[198-streff] Hang to - morrow ! Whatever is wrong , it need n’t prevent [my]0-i seeing [you]0-i [home]606-home . ” [He]267-strefford glanced toward [the taxi]1620-the taxi that awaited [them]2844-them at the end of [the deserted drive]2845-the deserted drive . “[198-streff] No , please . [You]0-i ’re in a hurry ; take [the taxi]1620-the taxi . [I]0-i want immensely a long long walk by [myself]0-i ... through [the streets]1922-the streets , with the lights coming out .... ” [He]267-strefford laid [his]267-strefford hand on [her]0-i arm . “[0-i] [I]0-i say , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear , [you]0-i ’re not ill ? ” “[0-i] No ; [I]0-i ’m not ill . But [you]0-i may say [I]0-i am , to - night at [the Embassy]1914-the embassy . ” [He]267-strefford released [her]0-i and drew back . “[0-i] Oh , very well , ” [he]267-strefford answered coldly ; and [she]0-i understood by [his]267-strefford tone that the knot was cut , and that at that moment [he]267-strefford almost hated [her]0-i . [She]0-i turned away , hastening down [the deserted alley]2846-the deserted alley , flying from [him]267-strefford , and knowing , as [she]0-i fled , that [he]267-strefford was still standing there motionless , staring after [her]0-i , wounded , humiliated , uncomprehending . It was neither [her]0-i fault nor [his]267-strefford .... XXIII . AS [she]0-i fled on toward the lights of [the streets]1922-the streets a breath of freedom seemed to blow into [her]0-i face . Like a weary load the accumulated hypocrisies of the last months had dropped from [her]0-i : [she]0-i was [herself]0-i again , [Nick ’s Susy]301-susy , and [no one else]2848-no one else ’s . [She]0-i sped on , staring with bright bewildered eyes at [the stately facades of [the La Muette quarter]2850-the la muette quarter]2849-the stately facades of the la muette quarter , the perspectives of bare trees , the awakening glitter of [shop]2851-shop - windows holding out to [her]0-i all the things [she]0-i would never again be able to buy .... In [an avenue of shops]2852-an avenue of shops [she]0-i paused before a [milliner]2853-milliner ’s window , and said to [herself]0-i : “[0-i] Why should n’t [I]0-i earn [my]0-i living by trimming hats ? ” [She]0-i met [work - girls streaming out under a doorway]2854-work - girls streaming out under a doorway , and scattering to catch [trams]2855-trams and [omnibuses]2856-omnibuses ; and [she]0-i looked with newly - wakened interest at [their]1925-their tired independent faces . “[0-i] Why should n’t [I]0-i earn [my]0-i living as well as [they]1925-their do ? ” [she]0-i thought . A little farther on [she]0-i passed [a Sister of Charity with softly trotting feet , a calm anonymous glance]2857-a sister of charity with softly trotting feet , a calm anonymous glance , and hands hidden in [her]2857-a sister of charity with softly trotting feet , a calm anonymous glance capacious sleeves . [Susy]301-susy looked at [her]0-i and thought : “[0-i] Why should n’t [I]0-i be [a Sister]1926-a sister , and have no money to worry about , and trot about under a white coif helping [poor people]1927-poor people ? ” [All these strangers on whom [she]0-i smiled in passing]2858-all these strangers on whom she smiled in passing , and glanced back at enviously , were free from the necessities that enslaved [her]0-i , and would not have known what [she]0-i meant if [she]0-i had told [them]1925-their that [she]0-i must have so much money for [her]0-i dresses , so much for [her]0-i cigarettes , so much for bridge and cabs and tips , and all kinds of extras , and that at that moment [she]0-i ought to be hurrying back to a dinner at [the British Embassy]2859-the british embassy , where [her]0-i permanent right to such luxuries was to be solemnly recognized and ratified . The artificiality and unreality of [her]0-i life overcame [her]0-i as with stifling fumes . [She]0-i stopped at [a street - corner]2860-a street - corner , drawing long panting breaths as if [she]0-i had been running a race . Then , slowly and aimlessly , [she]0-i began to saunter along [a street of [small private houses]2862-small private houses in [damp gardens]2863-damp gardens that led to [the Avenue du Bois]136-the avenue du bois]2861-a street of small private houses in damp gardens that led to the avenue du bois . [She]0-i sat down on a bench . Not far off , [the Arc de Triomphe]137-the arc de triomphe raised its august bulk , and beyond it a river of lights streamed down toward [Paris]4-paris , and the stir of [the city]2864-the city ’s heart - beats troubled the quiet in [her]0-i bosom . But not for long . [She]0-i seemed to be looking at [it]2865-it all from the other side of [the grave]2866-the grave ; and as [she]0-i got up and wandered down [the Champs Elysees]138-the champs elysees , half empty in the evening lull between dusk and dinner , [she]0-i felt as if [the glittering avenue]2867-the glittering avenue were really changed into [the Field of Shadows from which [it]2867-the glittering avenue takes [its]2867-the glittering avenue name]2868-the field of shadows from which it takes its name , and as if [she]0-i were a ghost among ghosts . Halfway [home]606-home , a weakness of loneliness overcame [her]0-i , and [she]0-i seated [herself]0-i under the trees near [the Rond Point]2870-the rond point . Lines of motors and [carriages]2871-carriages were beginning to animate the converging thoroughfares , streaming abreast , crossing , winding in and out of each other in a tangle of hurried pleasure - seeking . [She]0-i caught the light on jewels and shirt - fronts and hard bored eyes emerging from dim billows of fur and velvet . [She]0-i seemed to hear what [the couples]2872-the couples were saying to [each other]2188-each other , [she]0-i pictured [the drawing - rooms]2874-the drawing - rooms , [restaurants]2875-restaurants , [dance - halls [they]2872-the couples were hastening to]2876-dance - halls they were hastening to , the breathless routine that was hurrying [them]2872-the couples along , as Time , the old vacuum - cleaner , swept [them]2872-the couples away with the dust of [[their]2872-the couples carriage - wheels]2877-their carriage - wheels . And again the loneliness vanished in a sense of release .... At the corner of [the Place de la Concorde]2878-the place de la concorde [she]0-i stopped , recognizing [a man in evening dress who was hailing [a taxi]1426-a taxi]2879-a man in evening dress who was hailing a taxi . [Their]2881-their eyes met , and [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson came forward . [He]222-nelson was [the last person [she]0-i cared to run across]2882-the last person she cared to run across , and [she]0-i shrank back involuntarily . What did [he]222-nelson know , what had [he]222-nelson guessed , of [her]0-i complicity in [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife ’s affairs ? No doubt [Ellie]184-ellie had blabbed it all out by this time ; [she]184-ellie was just as likely to confide [her]184-ellie love - affairs to [Nelson]222-nelson as to [anyone else]2884-anyone else , now that the Bockheimer prize was landed . “[0-i] Well -- well -- well -- so [I]0-i ’ve caught [you]1928-you at it ! Glad to see [you]1928-you , [Susy]301-susy , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear . ” [She]0-i found [her]0-i hand cordially clasped in [Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s , and [his]222-nelson round pink face bent on [her]0-i with all its old urbanity . Did nothing matter , then , in [this world [she]0-i was fleeing from]2885-this world she was fleeing from , did [no one]534-no one love or hate or remember ? “[301-susy] No idea [you]1928-you were in [Paris]4-paris -- just got [here]2184-here [myself]0-i , ” [Vanderlyn]184-ellie continued , visibly delighted at the meeting . “[0-i] Look here , do n’t suppose [you]1928-you ’re out of a job this evening by any chance , and would come and cheer up [a lone bachelor]1931-a lone bachelor , eh ? No ? [You]1928-you are ? Well , that ’s luck for once ! [I]0-i say , where shall [we]1932-we go ? [One of the places where [they]1934-they dance]1933-one of the places where they dance , [I]0-i suppose ? Yes , [I]0-i twirl the light fantastic once in a while [myself]0-i . Got to keep up with the times ! Hold on , [taxi]1935-taxi ! Here -- [I’ll]0-i drive [you]1928-you [home]606-home first , and wait while [you]1928-you jump into [[your]1928-you toggery]1937-your toggery . Lots of time . ” As [he]222-nelson steered [her]1928-you toward [the carriage]1621-the carriage [she]1928-you noticed that [he]222-nelson had a gouty limp , and pulled [himself]222-nelson in after [her]1928-you with difficulty . “[0-i] May n’t [I]0-i come as [I]0-i am , [Nelson]222-nelson , [I]0-i do n’t feel like dancing . Let ’s go and dine in [one of [those nice smoky little restaurants by [the Place de la Bourse]139-the place de la bourse]1939-those nice smoky little restaurants by the place de la bourse]1938-one of those nice smoky little restaurants by the place de la bourse . ” [He]222-nelson seemed surprised but relieved at the suggestion , and [they]2888-they rolled off together . In a corner at [Bauge ’s]2889-bauge ’s [they]2888-they found a quiet table , screened from [the other diners]2890-the other diners , and while [Vanderlyn]184-ellie adjusted [his]222-nelson eyeglasses to study the carte [Susy]301-susy stole a long look at [him]222-nelson . [He]222-nelson was dressed with even more than [his]222-nelson usual formal trimness , and [she]2891-she detected , in an ultra - flat wrist - watch and discreetly expensive waistcoat buttons , an attempt at smartness altogether new . [His]222-nelson face had undergone the same change : its familiar look of worn optimism had been , as it were , done up to match [his]222-nelson clothes , as though a sort of moral cosmetic had made [him]222-nelson pinker , shinier and sprightlier without really rejuvenating [him]222-nelson . A thin veil of high spirits had merely been drawn over [his]222-nelson face , as the shining strands of hair were skilfully brushed over [his]222-nelson baldness . “[301-susy] Here ! Carte des vins , [waiter]1940-waiter ! What champagne , [Susy]301-susy ? ” [He]222-nelson chose , fastidiously , the best [the cellar]2892-the cellar could produce , grumbling a little at the bourgeois character of the dishes . “[301-susy] Capital food of its kind , no doubt , but coarsish , do n’t [you]301-susy think ? Well , [I]0-i do n’t mind ... it ’s rather a jolly change from the Luxe cooking . A new sensation -- [I’m]0-i all for new sensations , ai n’t [you]301-susy , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear ? ” [He]222-nelson re - filled [their]1942-their champagne glasses , flung an arm sideways over [his]222-nelson chair , and smiled at [her]445-my dear with a foggy benevolence . As the champagne flowed [his]222-nelson confidences flowed with it . “[301-susy] Suppose [you]301-susy know what [I]0-i ’m here for -- this divorce business ? [We]1942-their wanted to settle it quietly without a fuss , and of course [Paris]4-paris is [the best place for that sort of job]1943-the best place for that sort of job . Live and let live ; no questions asked . None of [your]301-susy dirty newspapers . [Great country]1944-great country , this . No hypocrisy ... [they]1945-they understand Life over here ! ” [Susy]301-susy gazed and listened . [She]445-my dear remembered that [people]421-people had thought [Nelson]222-nelson would make a row when [he]222-nelson found out . [He]222-nelson had always been addicted to truculent anecdotes about [unfaithful wives]2894-unfaithful wives , and the very formula of [his]222-nelson perpetual ejaculation--“Caught[1946-you] [you]1946-you at it , eh?”--seemed to hint at a constant preoccupation with such ideas . But now it was evident that , as the saying was , [he]222-nelson had “[1947-his] swallowed [his]1947-his dose ” like all the others . No strong blast of indignation had momentarily lifted [him]222-nelson above [his]222-nelson normal stature : [he]222-nelson remained [a little man]2895-a little man among [little men]2896-little men , and [his]222-nelson eagerness to rebuild [his]222-nelson life with all the old smiling optimism reminded [Susy]301-susy of the patient industry of an ant remaking [its]2897-its ruined ant - heap . “[1946-you] Tell [you]1946-you what , great thing , this liberty ! Everything ’s changed nowadays ; why should n’t marriage be too ? [A man]2216-a man can get out of a business partnership when [he]2216-a man wants to ; but [the parsons]1949-the parsons want to keep [us]1950-we noosed up to each other for life because [we]1950-we ’ve blundered into [a church]1951-a church one day and said ‘ Yes ’ before one of ’em . No , no -- that ’s too easy . [We]1950-we ’ve got beyond that . Science , and all these new discoveries .... [I]0-i say the Ten Commandments were made for [man]974-man , and not [man for the Commandments]1953-man for the commandments ; and there ai n’t a word against divorce in ’em , anyhow ! That ’s what [I]0-i tell [[my]0-i poor old mother , who builds everything on [her]1954-my poor old mother , who builds everything on her bible Bible]1954-my poor old mother , who builds everything on her bible . Find [me]0-i the place where it says : ‘ [Thou]1955-thou shalt not sue for divorce . ’ It makes [her]1954-my poor old mother , who builds everything on her bible wild , [poor old lady]1956-poor old lady , because [she]1954-my poor old mother , who builds everything on her bible ca n’t ; and [she]1954-my poor old mother , who builds everything on her bible does n’t know how [they]1949-the parsons happen to have left it out .... [I]0-i rather think [Moses]302-moses left it out because [he]302-moses knew more about human nature than [these snivelling modern parsons]1957-these snivelling modern parsons do . Not that [they]1949-the parsons ’ll always bear investigating either ; but [I]0-i do n’t care about that . Live and let live , eh , [Susy]301-susy ? Have n’t [we]1958-our all got a right to [our]1958-our Affinities ? [I]0-i hear [you]301-susy ’re following [our]1958-our example [yourself]301-susy . First - rate idea : [I]0-i do n’t mind telling [you]301-susy [I]0-i saw it coming on last summer at [Venice]15-venice . Caught [you]301-susy at it , so to speak ! [Old Nelson]303-nelson ai n’t as blind as [people]421-people think . Here , let ’s open another bottle to the health of [Streff]198-streff and [Mrs. Streff]304-mrs. streff ! ” [She]304-mrs. streff caught the hand with which [he]303-nelson was signalling to [the sommelier]2898-the sommelier . This flushed and garrulous [Nelson]303-nelson moved [her]304-mrs. streff more poignantly than [a more heroic figure]2899-a more heroic figure . “[304-mrs. streff] No more champagne , please , [Nelson]303-nelson . Besides , ” [she]304-mrs. streff suddenly added , “[305-geordie] it ’s not true . ” [He]303-nelson stared . “[305-geordie] Not true that [you]303-nelson ’re going to marry [Altringham]267-strefford ? ” “[267-strefford] No . ” “[267-strefford] By [George]305-geordie then what on earth did [you]303-nelson chuck [Nick]301-susy for ? [Ai]303-nelson n’t [you]303-nelson got an Affinity , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear ? ” [She]304-mrs. streff laughed and shook [her]304-mrs. streff head . “[303-nelson] Do [you]303-nelson mean to tell [me]0-i it ’s all [Nick]301-susy ’s doing , then ? ” “[303-nelson] [I]0-i do n’t know . Let ’s talk of [you]303-nelson instead , [Nelson]303-nelson . [I]0-i ’m glad [you]303-nelson ’re in such good spirits . [I]0-i rather thought-- ” [He]303-nelson interrupted [her]304-mrs. streff quickly . “[0-i] Thought [I]0-i ’d cut up a rumpus -- do some shooting ? [I]0-i know -- [people]421-people did . ” [He]303-nelson twisted [his]303-nelson moustache , evidently proud of [his]303-nelson reputation . “[421-people] Well , maybe [I]0-i did see red for a day or two -- but [I]0-i ’m [a philosopher]1962-a philosopher , first and last . Before [I]0-i went into banking [I]0-i ’d made and lost two fortunes out [West]140-west . Well , how did [I]0-i build [’em]1963-’em up again ? Not by shooting [anybody]404-anybody even [myself]0-i . By just buckling to , and beginning all over again . That ’s how ... and that ’s what [I]0-i am doing now . Beginning all over again . ” [His]303-nelson voice dropped from boastfulness to a note of wistful melancholy , the look of strained jauntiness fell from [his]303-nelson face like a mask , and for an instant [she]304-mrs. streff saw [the real man]2900-the real man , old , ruined , lonely . Yes , that was it : [he]303-nelson was lonely , desperately lonely , foundering in such deep seas of solitude that any presence out of the past was like a spar to which [he]303-nelson clung . Whatever [he]303-nelson knew or guessed of the part [she]304-mrs. streff had played in [his]303-nelson disaster , it was not callousness that had made [him]303-nelson greet [her]304-mrs. streff with such forgiving warmth , but the same sense of smallness , insignificance and isolation which perpetually hung like a cold fog on [her]304-mrs. streff own horizon . Suddenly [she]304-mrs. streff too felt old -- old and unspeakably tired . “[0-i] It ’s been nice seeing [you]0-i , [Nelson]303-nelson . But now [I]0-i must be getting [home]606-home . ” [He]303-nelson offered no objection , but asked for the bill , resumed [his]303-nelson jaunty air while [he]303-nelson scattered largesse among [the waiters]589-the waiters , and sauntered out behind [her]304-mrs. streff after calling for [a taxi]1426-a taxi . [They]2903-they drove off in silence . [Susy]301-susy was thinking : “[0-i] And [Clarissa]187-clarissa ? ” but dared not ask . [Vanderlyn]187-clarissa lit a cigarette , hummed a dance - tune , and stared out of the window . Suddenly [she]304-mrs. streff felt [his]303-nelson hand on [hers]304-mrs. streff . “[187-clarissa] [Susy]301-susy -- do [you]301-susy ever see [her]187-clarissa ? ” “[301-susy] See -- [Ellie]184-ellie ? ” [He]303-nelson nodded , without turning toward [her]304-mrs. streff . “[184-ellie] Not often ... sometimes .... ” “[301-susy] If [you]301-susy do , for [God]236-god ’s sake tell [her]187-clarissa [I]0-i ’m happy ... happy as [a king]1966-a king ... tell [her]187-clarissa [you]301-susy could see for [yourself]301-susy that [I]0-i was .... ” [His]303-nelson voice broke in a little gasp . “[0-i] [I]0-i ... [I]0-i ’ll be damned if ... if [she]187-clarissa shall ever be unhappy about [me]0-i ... if [I]0-i can help it .... ” The cigarette dropped from [his]303-nelson fingers , and with a sob [he]303-nelson covered [his]303-nelson face . “[303-nelson] Oh , [poor Nelson]303-nelson -- poor [Nelson]303-nelson , ” [Susy]301-susy breathed . While [[their]2904-their cab]2905-their cab rattled across [the Place du Carrousel]2906-the place du carrousel , and over [the bridge]2907-the bridge , [he]303-nelson continued to sit beside [her]1967-she with hidden face . At last [he]303-nelson pulled out a scented handkerchief , rubbed [his]303-nelson eyes with it , and groped for another cigarette . “[303-nelson] [I]0-i ’m all right ! Tell [her]187-clarissa that , will [you]1967-she , [Susy]301-susy ? There are some of [our]1968-our old times [I]0-i do n’t suppose [I]0-i shall ever forget ; but [they]1969-they make [me]0-i feel kindly to [her]187-clarissa , and not angry . [I]0-i did n’t know it would be so , beforehand -- but it is .... And now the thing ’s settled [I]0-i ’m as right as a trivet , and [you]1967-she can tell [her]187-clarissa so .... Look here , [Susy]301-susy ... ” [he]1967-she caught [her]1967-she by the arm as [the taxi]1620-the taxi drew up at [[her]1967-she hotel]1552-her hotel .... “[1967-she] Tell [her]187-clarissa [I]0-i understand , will [you]1967-she ? [I]0-i ’d rather like [her]187-clarissa to know that .... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll tell [her]187-clarissa , [Nelson]303-nelson , ” [she]1967-she promised ; and climbed the stairs alone to [[her]1967-she dreary room]2910-her dreary room . [Susy]301-susy ’s one fear was that [Strefford]267-strefford , when [he]267-strefford returned the next day , should treat [their]2911-their talk of the previous evening as a fit of “[0-i] nerves ” to be jested away . [He]267-strefford might , indeed , resent [her]1967-she behaviour too deeply to seek to see [her]1967-she at once ; but [his]267-strefford easygoing modern attitude toward conduct and convictions made that improbable . [She]1967-she had an idea that what [he]267-strefford had most minded was [her]1967-she dropping so unceremoniously out of the Embassy Dinner . But , after all , why should [she]1967-she see [him]267-strefford again ? [She]1967-she had had enough of explanations during the last months to have learned how seldom [they]2912-they explain anything . If [the other person]2913-the other person did not understand at the first word , at the first glance even , subsequent elucidations served only to deepen the obscurity . And [she]1967-she wanted above all -- and especially since [her]1967-she hour with [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson -- to keep [herself]1967-she free , aloof , to retain [her]1967-she hold on [her]1967-she precariously recovered self . [She]1967-she sat down and wrote to [Strefford]267-strefford -- and the letter was only a little less painful to write than the one [she]1967-she had despatched to [Nick]301-susy . It was not that [her]1967-she own feelings were in any like measure engaged ; but because , as the decision to give up [Strefford]267-strefford affirmed itself , [she]1967-she remembered only [his]267-strefford kindness , [his]267-strefford forbearance , [his]267-strefford good humour , and all the other qualities [she]1967-she had always liked in [him]267-strefford ; and because [she]1967-she felt ashamed of the hesitations which must cause [him]267-strefford so much pain and humiliation . Yes : humiliation chiefly . [She]1967-she knew that what [she]1967-she had to say would hurt [his]267-strefford pride , in whatever way [she]1967-she framed [her]1967-she renunciation ; and [her]1967-she pen wavered , hating its task . Then [she]1967-she remembered [Vanderlyn]222-nelson ’s words about [[his]222-nelson wife]332-his wife : “[303-nelson] There are some of [our]1970-our old times [I]0-i do n’t suppose [I]0-i shall ever forget-- ” and a phrase of Grace [Fulmer]175-grace ’s that [she]1967-she had but half grasped at the time : “[1971-you] [You]1971-you have n’t been married long enough to understand how trifling such things seem in the balance of one ’s memories . ” Here were two people who had penetrated farther than [she]1967-she into the labyrinth of the wedded state , and struggled through some of its thorniest passages ; and yet both , one consciously , [the other half - unaware]2915-the other half - unaware , testified to the mysterious fact which was already dawning on [her]1967-she : that the influence of a marriage begun in mutual understanding is too deep not to reassert itself even in the moment of flight and denial . “[1971-you] The real reason is that [you]1971-you ’re not [Nick]301-susy ” was what [she]1967-she would have said to [Strefford]267-strefford if [she]1967-she had dared to set down the bare truth ; and [she]1967-she knew that , whatever [she]1967-she wrote , [he]267-strefford was too acute not to read that into it . “[301-susy] [He]301-susy ’ll think it ’s because [I]0-i ’m still in love with [Nick]301-susy ... and perhaps [I]0-i am . But even if [I]0-i were , the difference does n’t seem to lie there , after all , but deeper , in things [we]1972-we ’ve shared that seem to be meant to outlast love , or to change it into something different . ” If [she]1967-she could have hoped to make [Strefford]267-strefford understand that , the letter would have been easy enough to write -- but [she]1967-she knew just at what point [his]267-strefford imagination would fail , in what obvious and superficial inferences it would rest . “[198-streff] [Poor Streff]198-streff -- poor [me]0-i ! ” [she]1967-she thought as [she]1967-she sealed the letter . After [she]1967-she had despatched it a sense of blankness descended on [her]1967-she . [She]1967-she had succeeded in driving from [her]1967-she mind all vain hesitations , doubts , returns upon [herself]1967-she : [her]1967-she healthy system naturally rejected them . But they left a queer emptiness in which [her]1967-she thoughts rattled about as thoughts might , [she]1967-she supposed , in the first moments after death -- before [one]2186-one got used to it . To get used to being dead : that seemed to be [her]1967-she immediate business . And [she]1967-she felt such [a novice at it]2917-a novice at it -- felt so horribly alive ! How had [those others]2918-those others learned to do without living ? [Nelson]222-nelson -- well , [he]222-nelson was still in the throes ; and probably never would understand , or be able to communicate , the lesson when [he]222-nelson had mastered it . But [Grace Fulmer]175-grace -- [she]1967-she suddenly remembered that [Grace]175-grace was in [Paris]4-paris , and set forth to find [her]175-grace . XXIV . [NICK LANSING]170-nick had walked out a long way into [the Campagna]141-the campagna . [His]170-nick hours were seldom [his]170-nick own , for both [Mr.]2919-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick were becoming more and more addicted to sudden and somewhat imperious demands upon [his]170-nick time ; but on this occasion [he]170-nick had simply slipped away after luncheon , and taking [the tram]2920-the tram to [the Porta Salaria]2921-the porta salaria , had wandered on thence in the direction of [the Ponte Nomentano]2922-the ponte nomentano . [He]170-nick wanted to get away and think ; but now that [he]170-nick had done it the business proved as unfruitful as everything [he]170-nick had put [his]170-nick hand to since [he]170-nick had left [Venice]15-venice . Think -- think about what ? [His]170-nick future seemed to [him]170-nick a negligible matter since [he]170-nick had received , two months earlier , the few lines in which [Susy]301-susy had asked [him]170-nick for [her]2923-her freedom . The letter had been a shock -- though [he]170-nick had fancied [himself]170-nick so prepared for it -- yet it had also , in another sense , been a relief , since , now that at last circumstances compelled [him]170-nick to write to [her]2923-her , [they]2924-they also told [him]170-nick what to say . And [he]170-nick had said it as briefly and simply as possible , telling [her]2923-her that [he]170-nick would put no obstacle in the way of [her]2923-her release , that [he]170-nick held [himself]170-nick at [[her]2923-her lawyer]2925-her lawyer ’s disposal to answer any further communication -- and that [he]170-nick would never forget [their]2924-they days together , or cease to bless [her]2923-her for [them]2924-they . That was all . [He]170-nick gave [[his]170-nick Roman banker]2926-his roman banker ’s address , and waited for another letter ; but none came . Probably the “[198-streff] formalities , ” whatever they were , took longer than [he]170-nick had supposed ; and being in no haste to recover [his]170-nick own liberty , [he]170-nick did not try to learn the cause of the delay . From that moment , however , [he]170-nick considered [himself]170-nick virtually free , and ceased , by the same token , to take any interest in [his]170-nick own future . [His]170-nick life seemed as flat as [a convalescent]2927-a convalescent ’s first days after the fever has dropped . The only thing [he]170-nick was sure of was that [he]170-nick was not going to remain in [[the Hickses]669-the hickses ’ employ]2929-the hickses ’ employ : when [they]669-the hickses left [Rome]23-rome for [Central Asia]142-central asia [he]170-nick had no intention of accompanying [them]669-the hickses . The part of [[Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles ’ successor]2930-mr. buttles ’ successor was becoming daily more intolerable to [him]170-nick , for the very reasons that had probably made it most gratifying to [Mr. Buttles]208-mr. buttles . To be treated by [Mr.]2931-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick as [a paid oracle]2932-a paid oracle , [a paraded and petted piece of property]2933-a paraded and petted piece of property , was a good deal more distasteful than [he]170-nick could have imagined any relation with [these kindly people]2934-these kindly people could be . And since [their]2934-these kindly people aspirations had become frankly social [he]170-nick found [his]170-nick task , if easier , yet far less congenial than during [his]170-nick first months with [them]2934-these kindly people . [He]170-nick preferred patiently explaining to [Mrs. Hicks]170-nick , for the hundredth time , that [Sassanian]306-sassanian and [Saracenic]143-saracenic were not interchangeable terms , to unravelling for [her]2935-her the genealogies of [[her]2935-her titled guests]2936-her titled guests , and reminding [her]2935-her , when [she]2935-her “[198-streff] seated ” [her]2935-her dinner - parties , that [Dukes]2937-dukes ranked higher than [Princes]307-princes . No -- the job was decidedly intolerable ; and [he]170-nick would have to look out for another means of earning [his]170-nick living . But that was not what [he]170-nick had really got away to think about . [He]170-nick knew [he]170-nick should never starve ; [he]170-nick had even begun to believe again in [his]170-nick book . What [he]170-nick wanted to think of was [Susy]301-susy -- or rather , it was [Susy]301-susy that [he]170-nick could not help thinking of , on whatever train of thought [he]170-nick set out . Again and again [he]170-nick fancied [he]170-nick had established a truce with the past : had come to terms -- the terms of defeat and failure with that bright enemy called happiness . And , in truth , [he]170-nick had reached the point of definitely knowing that [he]170-nick could never return to the kind of life that [he]170-nick and [Susy]301-susy had embarked on . It had been the tragedy , of [their]2938-their relation that loving [her]2939-her roused in [him]170-nick ideals [she]2939-her could never satisfy . [He]170-nick had fallen in love with [her]2939-her because [she]2939-her was , like [himself]170-nick , amused , unprejudiced and disenchanted ; and [he]170-nick could not go on loving [her]2939-her unless [she]2939-her ceased to be all these things . From that circle there was no issue , and in it [he]170-nick desperately revolved . If [he]170-nick had not heard such persistent rumours of [her]2939-her re - marriage to [Lord Altringham]267-strefford [he]170-nick might have tried to see [her]2939-her again ; but , aware of the danger and the hopelessness of a meeting , [he]170-nick was , on the whole , glad to have a reason for avoiding it .
