Such , at least , [he]170-nick honestly supposed to be [his]170-nick state of mind until [he]170-nick found [himself]170-nick , as on this occasion , free to follow out [his]170-nick thought to its end . That end , invariably , was [Susy]301-susy ; not the bundle of qualities and defects into which [his]170-nick critical spirit had tried to sort [her]2939-her out , but the soft blur of identity , of personality , of eyes , hair , mouth , laugh , tricks of speech and gesture , that were all so solely and profoundly [her]2939-her own , and yet so mysteriously independent of what [she]2939-her might do , say , think , in crucial circumstances . [He]170-nick remembered [her]2939-her once saying to [him]170-nick : “[1973-you] After all , [you]1973-you were right when [you]1973-you wanted [me]0-i to be [[your]1973-you mistress]2431-your mistress , ” and the indignant stare of incredulity with which [he]170-nick had answered [her]2939-her . Yet in these hours it was the palpable image of [her]2939-her that clung closest , till , as invariably happened , [his]170-nick vision came full circle , and feeling [her]2939-her on [his]170-nick breast [he]170-nick wanted [her]2939-her also in [his]170-nick soul . Well -- such all - encompassing loves were the rarest of human experiences ; [he]170-nick smiled at [his]170-nick presumption in wanting no other . Wearily [he]170-nick turned , and tramped homeward through the winter twilight .... At the door of [the hotel]2348-the hotel [he]170-nick ran across [the Prince of [Teutoburg]126-teutoburg [’s aide - de - camp]2942-’s aide - de - camp]2941-the prince of teutoburg ’s aide - de - camp . [They]2943-they had not met for some days , and [Nick]301-susy had a vague feeling that if [the Prince]965-the prince ’s matrimonial designs took definite shape [he]170-nick [himself]170-nick was not likely , after all , to be [[their]2943-they chosen exponent]2945-their chosen exponent . [He]170-nick had surprised , now and then , a certain distrustful coldness under [the Princess Mother]1660-the princess mother ’s cordial glance , and had concluded that [she]1660-the princess mother perhaps suspected [him]170-nick of being an obstacle to [[her]1660-the princess mother son]1717-her son ’s aspirations . [He]170-nick had no idea of playing that part , but was not sorry to appear to ; for [he]170-nick was sincerely attached to [Coral Hicks]196-coral , and hoped for [her]196-coral a more human fate than that of becoming [[Prince Anastasius]288-anastasius ’s consort]2948-prince anastasius ’s consort . This evening , however , [he]170-nick was struck by the beaming alacrity of [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp ’s greeting . Whatever cloud had hung between [them]2950-them had lifted : [the Teutoburg clan]2951-the teutoburg clan , for one reason or another , no longer feared or distrusted [him]170-nick . The change was conveyed in a mere hand - pressure , a brief exchange of words , for [the aide - de - camp]1753-the aide - de - camp was hastening after [a well - known dowager of the old Roman world]2953-a well - known dowager of the old roman world , whom [he]170-nick helped into a large coronetted brougham which looked as if it had been extracted , for some ceremonial purpose , from [a museum of historic vehicles]2954-a museum of historic vehicles . And in an instant it flashed on [Lansing]170-nick that [this lady]2955-this lady had been [the person chosen to lay the Prince]2956-the person chosen to lay the prince ’s offer at [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s feet . The discovery piqued [him]170-nick ; and instead of making straight for [[his]170-nick own [room]2958-room]860-his own room [he]170-nick went up to [[Mrs. Hicks]170-nick ’s drawing - room]2959-mrs. hicks ’s drawing - room . [The room]379-the room was empty , but traces of elaborate tea pervaded [it]379-the room , and an immense bouquet of stiff roses lay on the centre table . As [he]170-nick turned away , [Eldorada Tooker]205-eldorada , flushed and tear - stained , abruptly entered . “[1973-you] Oh , [Mr. Lansing]170-nick -- [we]1975-we were looking everywhere for [you]170-nick . ” “[1975-we] Looking for [me]0-i ? ” “[1975-we] Yes . [Coral]196-coral especially ... [she]196-coral wants to see [you]170-nick . [She]196-coral wants [you]170-nick to come to [[her]196-coral own sitting - room]1976-her own sitting - room . ” [She]196-coral led [him]170-nick across [the ante - chamber]2961-the ante - chamber and down [the passage]2962-the passage to [the separate suite which [Miss Hicks]196-coral inhabited]2963-the separate suite which miss hicks inhabited . On the threshold [Eldorada]205-eldorada gasped out emotionally : “[196-coral] [You]170-nick ’ll find [her]196-coral looking lovely-- ” and jerked away with a sob as [he]170-nick entered . [Coral Hicks]196-coral was never lovely : but [she]196-coral certainly looked unusually handsome . Perhaps it was the long dress of black velvet which , outlined against a shaded lamp , made [her]196-coral strong build seem slenderer , or perhaps the slight flush on [her]196-coral dusky cheek : a bloom of womanhood hung upon [her]196-coral which [she]196-coral made no effort to dissemble . Indeed , it was one of [her]196-coral originalities that [she]196-coral always gravely and courageously revealed the utmost of whatever mood possessed [her]196-coral . “[196-coral] How splendid [you]196-coral look ! ” [he]170-nick said , smiling at [her]196-coral . [She]196-coral threw [her]196-coral head back and gazed [him]170-nick straight in the eyes . “[196-coral] That ’s going to be [my]0-i future job . ” “[196-coral] To look splendid ? ” “[196-coral] Yes . ” “[196-coral] And wear a crown ? ” “[196-coral] And wear a crown .... ” [They]2964-they continued to consider [each other]2188-each other without speaking . [Nick]170-nick ’s heart contracted with pity and perplexity . “[196-coral] Oh , [Coral]196-coral -- it ’s not decided ? ” [She]196-coral scrutinized [him]170-nick for a last penetrating moment ; then [she]196-coral looked away . “[196-coral] [I]0-i ’m never long deciding . ” [He]170-nick hesitated , choking with contradictory impulses , and afraid to formulate any , lest [they]2964-they should either mislead or pain [her]196-coral . “[0-i] Why did n’t [you]196-coral tell [me]0-i ? ” [he]170-nick questioned lamely ; and instantly perceived [his]170-nick blunder . [She]196-coral sat down , and looked up at [him]170-nick under brooding lashes -- had [he]170-nick ever noticed the thickness of [her]196-coral lashes before ? “[196-coral] Would it have made any difference if [I]0-i had told [you]196-coral ? ” “[0-i] Any difference-- ? ” “[0-i] Sit down by [me]0-i , ” [she]196-coral commanded . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to talk to [you]0-i . [You]196-coral can say now whatever [you]196-coral might have said sooner . [I]0-i ’m not married yet : [I]0-i ’m still free . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i have n’t given [your]0-i answer ? ” “[0-i] It does n’t matter if [I]0-i have . ” The retort frightened [him]170-nick with the glimpse of what [she]196-coral still expected of [him]170-nick , and what [he]170-nick was still so unable to give . “[0-i] That means [you]196-coral ’ve said yes ? ” [he]170-nick pursued , to gain time . “[196-coral] Yes or no -- it does n’t matter . [I]0-i had to say something . What [I]0-i want is [your]196-coral advice . ” “[196-coral] At the eleventh hour ? ” “[196-coral] Or the twelfth . ” [She]196-coral paused . “[196-coral] What shall [I]0-i do ? ” [she]196-coral questioned , with a sudden accent of helplessness . [He]170-nick looked at [her]196-coral as helplessly . [He]170-nick could not say : “[196-coral] Ask [yourself]196-coral -- ask [[your]196-coral parents]1977-your parents . ” [Her]196-coral next word would sweep away such frail hypocrisies . [Her]196-coral “[1977-your parents] What shall [I]0-i do ? ” meant “[0-i] What are [you]0-i going to do ? ” and [he]170-nick knew it , and knew that [she]196-coral knew it . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m [a bad person to give any one matrimonial]1978-a bad person to give any one matrimonial advice , ” [he]170-nick began , with a strained smile ; “[0-i] but [I]0-i had such a different vision for [you]196-coral . ” “[0-i] What kind of a vision ? ” [She]196-coral was merciless . “[421-people] Merely what [people]421-people call happiness , [dear]2236-dear . ” “[421-people] ‘ [People]421-people call’--you see [you]2236-dear do n’t believe in it [yourself]2236-dear ! Well , neither do [I]0-i -- in that form , at any rate . ” [He]170-nick considered . “[0-i] [I]0-i believe in trying for it -- even if the trying ’s the best of it . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i ’ve tried , and failed . And [I]0-i ’m twenty - two , and [I]0-i never was young . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i have n’t enough imagination . ” [She]0-i drew a deep breath . “[0-i] Now [I]0-i want something different . ” [She]0-i appeared to search for the word . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to be -- prominent , ” [she]0-i declared . “[0-i] Prominent ? ” [She]0-i reddened swarthily . “[2236-dear] Oh , [you]2236-dear smile -- [you]2236-dear think it ’s ridiculous : it does n’t seem worth while to [you]2236-dear . That ’s because [you]2236-dear ’ve always had all those things . But [I]0-i have n’t . [I]0-i know what [father]2367-father pushed up from , and [I]0-i want to push up as high again -- higher . No , [I]0-i have n’t got much imagination . [I]0-i ’ve always liked Facts . And [I]0-i find [I]0-i shall like the fact of being [a Princess]1983-a princess -- choosing [the people [I]0-i associate with]1984-the people i associate with , and being up above [all these European grandees that [father]2367-father and [mother]2260-mother]1985-all these european grandees that father and mother bow down to , though [they]1985-all these european grandees that father and mother think [they]1985-all these european grandees that father and mother despise [them]1985-all these european grandees that father and mother . [You]2236-dear can be up above [these people]703-these people by just being [yourself]2236-dear ; [you]2236-dear know how . But [I]0-i need a platform -- a sky - scraper . [Father]2367-father and [mother]2260-mother slaved to give [me]0-i [my]0-i education . [They]1985-all these european grandees that father and mother thought education was the important thing ; but , since [we]1991-we ’ve [all three of [us]1991-we]1992-all three of us got mediocre minds , it has just landed [us]1991-we among [mediocre people]1993-mediocre people . Do n’t [you]2236-dear suppose [I]0-i see through all the sham science and sham art and sham everything [we]1991-we ’re surrounded with ? That ’s why [I]0-i want to buy a place at [the very top]1994-the very top , where [I]0-i shall be powerful enough to get about [me]0-i [the people [I]0-i want]1995-the people i want , [the big people]1996-the big people , [the right people]1997-the right people , and to help [them]1995-the people i want [I]0-i want to promote culture , like [those Renaissance women [you]2236-dear ’re always talking about]1998-those renaissance women you ’re always talking about . [I]0-i want to do it for [Apex City]1999-apex city ; do [you]2236-dear understand ? And for [father]2367-father and [mother]2260-mother too . [I]0-i want all those titles carved on [my]0-i tombstone . [They]2002-they ’re facts , anyhow ! Do n’t laugh at [me]0-i .... ” [She]0-i broke off with one of [her]0-i clumsy smiles , and moved away from [him]2367-father to the other end of [the room]379-the room . [He]2367-father sat looking at [her]0-i with a curious feeling of admiration . [Her]0-i harsh positivism was like a tonic to [his]2367-father disenchanted mood , and [he]2367-father thought : “[0-i] What a pity ! ” Aloud [he]2367-father said : “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t feel like laughing at [you]0-i . [You]0-i ’re [a great woman]2003-a great woman . ” “[0-i] Then [I]0-i shall be [a great Princess]2004-a great princess . ” “[0-i] Oh -- but [you]0-i might have been something so much greater ! ” [Her]0-i face flamed again . “[0-i] Do n’t say that ! ” [He]2367-father stood up involuntarily , and drew near [her]0-i . “[0-i] Why not ? ” “[0-i] Because [you]0-i ’re [the only man with whom [I]0-i can imagine the other kind of greatness]2005-the only man with whom i can imagine the other kind of greatness . ” It moved [him]2367-father -- moved [him]2367-father unexpectedly . [He]2367-father got as far as saying to [himself]2367-father : “[2005-the only man with whom i can imagine the other kind of greatness] [Good God]236-god , if [she]2006-she were not so hideously rich-- ” and then of yielding for a moment to the persuasive vision of all that [he]2367-father and [she]0-i might do with those very riches which [he]2367-father dreaded . After all , there was nothing mean in [her]0-i ideals they were hard and material , in keeping with [her]0-i primitive and massive person ; but [they]2967-they had a certain grim nobility . And when [she]0-i spoke of “[236-god] the other kind of greatness ” [he]2367-father knew that [she]0-i understood what [she]0-i was talking of , and was not merely saying something to draw [him]2367-father on , to get [him]2367-father to commit [himself]2367-father . There was not a drop of guile in [her]0-i , except that which [her]0-i very honesty distilled . “[236-god] The other kind of greatness ? ” [he]2367-father repeated . “[236-god] Well , is n’t that what [you]2007-you said happiness was ? [I]0-i wanted to be happy ... but one ca n’t choose . ” [He]2367-father went up to [her]0-i . “[2007-you] No , one ca n’t choose . And how can [anyone]389-anyone give [you]2007-you happiness who has n’t got it [himself]389-anyone ? ” [He]2367-father took [her]0-i hands , feeling how large , muscular and voluntary they were , even as they melted in [his]2367-father palms . “[389-anyone] [[My]0-i poor Coral]2009-my poor coral , of what use can [I]0-i ever be to [you]2007-you ? What [you]2007-you need is to be loved . ” [She]0-i drew back and gave [him]2367-father one of [her]0-i straight strong glances : “[2007-you] No , ” [she]0-i said gallantly , “[2007-you] but just to love . ” PART III XXV IN the persistent drizzle of a [Paris]4-paris winter morning [Susy Lansing]159-susy walked back alone from [the school at which [she]159-susy had just deposited [the four eldest Fulmers]2969-the four eldest fulmers]2968-the school at which she had just deposited the four eldest fulmers to [the little house in [Passy]144-passy where , for the last two months , [she]159-susy had been living with [them]2969-the four eldest fulmers]2970-the little house in passy where , for the last two months , she had been living with them . [She]159-susy had on ready - made boots , an old waterproof and a last year ’s hat ; but none of these facts disturbed [her]159-susy , though [she]159-susy took no particular pride in them . The truth was that [she]159-susy was too busy to think much about them . Since [she]159-susy had assumed the charge of [the Fulmer children]2619-the fulmer children , in the absence of both [[their]2619-the fulmer children parents]2972-their parents in [Italy]134-italy , [she]159-susy had had to pass through such an arduous apprenticeship of motherhood that every moment of [her]159-susy waking hours was packed with things to do at once , and other things to remember to do later . There were only [five Fulmers]2973-five fulmers ; but at times [they]2973-five fulmers were like [an army with banners]2974-an army with banners , and [their]2973-five fulmers power of self - multiplication was equalled only by the manner in which [they]2973-five fulmers could dwindle , vanish , grow mute , and become as it were a single tumbled brown head bent over a book in some corner of [the house]342-the house in which [nobody]2219-nobody would ever have thought of hunting for [them]2973-five fulmers -- and which , of course , were it [the bonne ’s room in [the attic]2978-the attic]2977-the bonne ’s room in the attic , or [the subterranean closet where the trunks were kept]2979-the subterranean closet where the trunks were kept , had been singled out by [them]2973-five fulmers for that very reason . These changes from ubiquity to invisibility would have seemed to [Susy]159-susy , a few months earlier , one of the most maddening of many characteristics not calculated to promote repose . But now [she]159-susy felt differently . [She]159-susy had grown interested in [her]159-susy charges , and the search for a clue to [their]2973-five fulmers methods , whether tribal or individual , was as exciting to [her]159-susy as the development of a detective story . What interested [her]159-susy most in the whole stirring business was the discovery that [they]2973-five fulmers had a method . These little creatures , pitched upward into experience on the tossing waves of [[their]2973-five fulmers parents]2972-their parents ’ agitated lives , had managed to establish a rough - and - ready system of self - government . [Junie]258-junie , [the eldest]2981-the eldest ( the one who already chose [[her]2981-the eldest mother]521-her mother ’s hats , and tried to put order in [her]2981-the eldest wardrobe ) was [the recognized head of [the state]2984-the state]2983-the recognized head of the state . At twelve [she]2981-the eldest knew lots of things which [[her]2981-the eldest mother]521-her mother had never thoroughly learned , and [Susy]159-susy , [[her]2981-the eldest temporary mother]2986-her temporary mother , had never even guessed at : [she]159-susy spoke with authority on all vital subjects , from castor - oil to flannel under - clothes , from the fair sharing of stamps or marbles to the number of helpings of rice - pudding or jam which [each child]2987-each child was entitled to . There was hardly any appeal from [her]159-susy verdict ; yet [each of [[her]159-susy subjects]2989-her subjects]2988-each of her subjects revolved in [his]2990-his or [her]2991-her own orbit of independence , according to laws which [Junie]258-junie acknowledged and respected ; and the interpreting of this mysterious charter of rights and privileges had not been without difficulty for [Susy]159-susy . Besides this , there were material difficulties to deal with . [The six of [them]2992-the six of them]2992-the six of them , and [the breathless bonne who cooked and slaved for [them]2992-the six of them all]2993-the breathless bonne who cooked and slaved for them all , had but a slim budget to live on ; and , as [Junie]258-junie remarked , [you]2994-you ’d have thought [the boys]2995-the boys ate [their]2995-the boys shoes , the way [they]2995-the boys vanished . [They]2995-the boys ate , certainly , a great deal else , and mostly of a nourishing and expensive kind . [They]2995-the boys had definite views about the amount and quality of [their]2995-the boys food , and were capable of concerted rebellion when [Susy]159-susy ’s catering fell beneath [their]2995-the boys standard . All this made [her]159-susy life a hurried and harassing business , but never -- what [she]159-susy had most feared it would be a dull or depressing one . It was not , [she]159-susy owned to [herself]159-susy , that [the society of [the Fulmer children]2619-the fulmer children]2996-the society of the fulmer children had roused in [her]159-susy any abstract passion for [the human young]2998-the human young . [She]159-susy knew -- had known since [Nick]170-nick ’s first kiss -- how [she]159-susy would love [any child of [his]170-nick and [hers]159-susy]2999-any child of his and hers ; and [she]159-susy had cherished poor little [Clarissa Vanderlyn]187-clarissa with a shrinking and wistful solicitude . But in these rough young [Fulmers]174-nat [she]159-susy took a positive delight , and for reasons that were increasingly clear to [her]159-susy . It was because , in the first place , [they]2619-the fulmer children were all intelligent ; and because [their]2619-the fulmer children intelligence had been fed only on things worth caring for . However inadequate [Grace Fulmer]175-grace ’s bringing - up of [[her]159-susy increasing tribe]3000-her increasing tribe had been , [they]2619-the fulmer children had heard in [her]159-susy company nothing trivial or dull : good music , good books and good talk had been [their]2619-the fulmer children daily food , and if at times [they]2619-the fulmer children stamped and roared and crashed about like [children unblessed by such privileges]3001-children unblessed by such privileges , at [others]397-others [they]2619-the fulmer children shone with the light of poetry and spoke with the voice of wisdom . That had been [Susy]159-susy ’s discovery : for the first time [she]159-susy was among awakening minds which had been wakened only to beauty . From [[their]2619-the fulmer children cramped and uncomfortable household]3003-their cramped and uncomfortable household [Grace]175-grace and [Nat Fulmer]247-nat had managed to keep out mean envies , vulgar admirations , shabby discontents ; above all the din and confusion the great images of beauty had brooded , like those ancestral figures that stood apart on [their]2619-the fulmer children shelf in [the poorest Roman households]3004-the poorest roman households . No , the task [she]159-susy had undertaken for want of a better gave [Susy]159-susy no sense of a missed vocation : “[2007-you] mothering ” on a large scale would never , [she]159-susy perceived , be [her]159-susy job . Rather it gave [her]159-susy , in odd ways , the sense of being [herself]159-susy mothered , of taking [her]159-susy first steps in the life of immaterial values which had begun to seem so much more substantial than any [she]159-susy had known . On the day when [she]159-susy had gone to [Grace Fulmer]175-grace for counsel and comfort [she]159-susy had little guessed that [they]2619-the fulmer children would come to [her]159-susy in this form . [She]159-susy had found [[her]159-susy friend]367-her friend , more than ever distracted and yet buoyant , riding the large untidy waves of [her]159-susy life with the splashed ease of [an amphibian]3006-an amphibian . [Grace]175-grace was probably [the only person among [[Susy]159-susy ’s friends]3008-susy ’s friends who could have understood why [she]175-grace could not make up [her]175-grace mind to marry [Altringham]267-strefford]3007-the only person among susy ’s friends who could have understood why she could not make up her mind to marry altringham ; but at the moment [Grace]175-grace was too much absorbed in [her]175-grace own problems to pay much attention to [[her]175-grace friend]367-her friend ’s , and , according to [her]175-grace wo nt , [she]175-grace immediately “[2007-you] unpacked ” [her]175-grace difficulties . [Nat]247-nat was not getting what [she]175-grace had hoped out of [his]247-nat European opportunity . Oh , [she]175-grace was enough of [an artist]3010-an artist [herself]175-grace to know that there must be fallow periods -- that the impact of new impressions seldom produced immediate results . [She]175-grace had allowed for all that . But [her]175-grace past experience of [Nat]247-nat ’s moods had taught [her]175-grace to know just when [he]247-nat was assimilating , when impressions were fructifying in [him]247-nat . And now they were not , and [he]247-nat knew it as well as [she]175-grace did . There had been too much rushing about , too much excitement and sterile flattery ... [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose ? Well , yes , for a while ... the trip to [Spain]91-spain had been a love - journey , no doubt . [Grace]175-grace spoke calmly , but the lines of [her]175-grace face sharpened : [she]175-grace had suffered , oh horribly , at [his]247-nat going to [Spain]91-spain without [her]175-grace . Yet [she]175-grace could n’t , for [the children]1312-the children ’s sake , afford to miss the big sum that [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula had given [her]175-grace for [her]175-grace fortnight at [Ruan]106-ruan . And [her]175-grace playing had struck [people]421-people , and led , on the way back , to two or three profitable engagements in [private houses in [London]54-london]3013-private houses in london . [Fashionable society]3014-fashionable society had made “[2007-you] a little fuss ” about [her]175-grace , and it had surprised and pleased [Nat]247-nat , and given [her]175-grace a new importance in [his]247-nat eyes . “[2010-he] [He]2010-he was beginning to forget that [I]0-i was n’t only [a nursery - maid]2011-a nursery - maid , and it ’s been a good thing for [him]2010-he to be reminded ... but the great thing is that with what [I]0-i ’ve earned [he]2010-he and [I]0-i can go off to southern [Italy]134-italy and [Sicily]95-sicily for three months . [You]2012-you know [I]0-i know how to manage ... and , alone with [me]0-i , [Nat]247-nat will settle down to work : to observing , feeling , soaking things in . It ’s the only way . [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose wants to take [him]247-nat , to pay all the expenses again -- well [she]244-mrs. melrose sha n’t . [I]0-i ’ll pay [them]2013-them . ” [Her]0-i worn cheek flushed with triumph . “[0-i] And [you]2012-you ’ll see what wonders will come of it .... Only there ’s the problem of [the children]1312-the children . [Junie]258-junie quite agrees that [we]2015-we ca n’t take [them]1312-the children .... ” Thereupon [she]0-i had unfolded [her]0-i idea . If [Susy]159-susy was at a loose end , and hard up , why should n’t [she]159-susy take charge of [the children]1312-the children while [[their]1312-the children parents]2972-their parents were in [Italy]134-italy ? For three months at most -- [Grace]175-grace could promise it should n’t be longer . [They]2972-their parents could n’t pay [her]159-susy much , of course , but at least [she]159-susy would be lodged and fed . “[258-junie] And , [you]2012-you know , it will end by interesting [you]2012-you -- [I’m]2016-i’m sure it will , ” [the mother]3017-the mother concluded , [her]3017-the mother irrepressible hopefulness rising even to this height , while [Susy]159-susy stood before [her]0-i with a hesitating smile . Take care of [five Fulmers]174-nat for three months ! The prospect cowed [her]0-i . If there had been only [Junie]258-junie and [Geordie]305-geordie , [the oldest and youngest of [the band]3019-the band]3018-the oldest and youngest of the band , [she]0-i might have felt less hesitation . But there was [Nat]247-nat , the second in age , whose motor - horn had driven [her]0-i and [Nick]170-nick out to [the hill - side]3020-the hill - side on [their]3019-the band fatal day at [the Fulmers ’]3021-the fulmers ’ and there were [the twins]3022-the twins , [Jack]308-jack and [Peggy]309-peggy , of whom [she]0-i had kept memories almost equally disquieting . To rule [this uproarious tribe]3023-this uproarious tribe would be a sterner business than trying to beguile [Clarissa Vanderlyn]187-clarissa ’s ladylike leisure ; and [she]0-i would have refused on the spot , as [she]0-i had refused once before , if the only possible alternatives had not come to seem so much less bearable , and if [Junie]258-junie , called in for advice , and standing there , small , plain and competent , had not said in [her]0-i quiet grown - up voice : “[2016-i’m] Oh , yes , [I]0-i ’m sure [Mrs. Lansing]2017-mrs. lansing and [I]0-i can manage while [you]2018-you ’re away -- especially if [she]2019-she reads aloud well . ” Reads aloud well ! The stipulation had enchanted [Susy]159-susy . [She]159-susy had never before known [children who cared to be read aloud to]3024-children who cared to be read aloud to ; [she]159-susy remembered with a shiver [her]159-susy attempts to interest [Clarissa]187-clarissa in anything but gossip and the fashions , and the tone in which [the child]547-the child had said , showing [Strefford]267-strefford ’s trinket to [[her]0-i father]836-her father : “[2019-she] Because [I]0-i said [I]0-i ’d rather have it than a book . ” And here were [children who consented to be left for three months by [[their]3027-children who consented to be left for three months by their parents , but on condition that a good reader was provided for them parents]2972-their parents , but on condition that [a good reader]3029-a good reader was provided for [them]3027-children who consented to be left for three months by their parents , but on condition that a good reader was provided for them]3027-children who consented to be left for three months by their parents , but on condition that a good reader was provided for them ! “[0-i] Very well -- [I]0-i will ! But what shall [I]0-i be expected to read to [you]2020-you ? ” [she]0-i had gaily questioned ; and [Junie]258-junie had answered , after one of [her]0-i sober pauses of reflection : “[0-i] The little ones like nearly everything ; but [Nat]247-nat and [I]0-i want poetry particularly , because if [we]2021-we read it to [ourselves]2021-we [we]2021-we so often pronounce the puzzling words wrong , and then it sounds so horrid . ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall pronounce them right , ” [Susy]159-susy murmured , stricken with self - distrust and humility . Apparently [she]0-i did ; for [her]0-i reading was a success , and even [the twins]3022-the twins and [Geordie]305-geordie , once [they]3022-the twins had grown used to [her]0-i , seemed to prefer a ringing page of [Henry V]310-henry v , or the fairy scenes from the Midsummer Night ’s Dream , to [their]3022-the twins own more specialized literature , though that had also at times to be provided . There were , in fact , no lulls in [her]0-i life with [the Fulmers]174-nat ; but its commotions seemed to [Susy]159-susy less meaningless , and therefore less fatiguing , than those that punctuated the existence of [people like [Altringham]267-strefford]3031-people like altringham , [Ursula Gillow]168-ursula , [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie and [[their]3031-people like altringham train]3032-their train ; and [the noisy uncomfortable little house at [Passy]144-passy]3033-the noisy uncomfortable little house at passy was beginning to greet [her]0-i with the eyes of [home]606-home when [she]0-i returned [there]2229-there after [her]0-i tramps to and from [the children]1312-the children ’s classes . At any rate [she]0-i had the sense of doing something useful and even necessary , and of earning [her]0-i own keep , though on so modest a scale ; and when [the children]1312-the children were in [their]1312-the children quiet mood , and demanded books or music ( or , even , on one occasion , at the surprising [Junie]258-junie ’s instigation , a collective visit to [the Louvre]3038-the louvre , where [they]1312-the children recognized the most unlikely pictures , and [the two elders]3039-the two elders emitted startling technical judgments , and called [[their]3039-the two elders companion]3040-their companion ’s attention to details [she]0-i had not observed ) ; on these occasions , [Susy]159-susy had a surprised sense of being drawn back into [her]0-i brief life with [Nick]170-nick , or even still farther and deeper , into those visions of [Nick]170-nick ’s own childhood on which the trivial later years had heaped [their]1312-the children dust . It was curious to think that if [he]170-nick and [she]0-i had remained together , and [she]0-i had had [a child]609-a child -- the vision used to come to [her]0-i , in [her]0-i sleepless hours , when [she]0-i looked at [little Geordie]305-geordie , in [his]170-nick cot by [her]0-i bed -- [their]1312-the children life together might have been very much like the life [she]0-i was now leading , a small obscure business to [the outer world]1184-the outer world , but to [themselves]1312-the children how wide and deep and crowded ! [She]0-i could not bear , at that moment , the thought of giving up this mystic relation to the life [she]0-i had missed . In spite of the hurry and fatigue of [her]0-i days , the shabbiness and discomfort of everything , and the hours when [the children]1312-the children were as “[0-i] horrid ” as [any other children]3044-any other children , and turned a conspiracy of hostile faces to all [her]0-i appeals ; in spite of all this [she]0-i did not want to give [them]1312-the children up , and had decided , when [[their]1312-the children parents]2972-their parents returned , to ask to go back to [America]146-america with [them]1312-the children . Perhaps , if [Nat]174-nat ’s success continued , and [Grace]175-grace was able to work at [her]175-grace music , [they]1312-the children would need a kind of [governess - companion]3046-governess - companion . At any rate , [she]0-i could picture no future less distasteful . [She]0-i had not sent to [Mr. Spearman Nick]311-nick ’s answer to [her]0-i letter . In the interval between writing to [him]311-nick and receiving [his]311-nick reply [she]0-i had broken with [Strefford]267-strefford ; [she]0-i had therefore no object in seeking [her]0-i freedom . If [Nick]311-nick wanted [his]311-nick , [he]311-nick knew [he]311-nick had only to ask for it ; and [his]311-nick silence , as the weeks passed , woke a faint hope in [her]0-i . The hope flamed high when [she]0-i read one day in the newspapers a vague but evidently “[0-i] inspired ” allusion to the possibility of an alliance between [[his]311-nick Serene Highness [the reigning Prince of [Teutoburg]126-teutoburg - [Waldhain]286-waldhain and [Miss Coral Hicks]196-coral of [Apex City]99-apex city]3048-the reigning prince of teutoburg - waldhain and miss coral hicks of apex city]3047-his serene highness the reigning prince of teutoburg - waldhain and miss coral hicks of apex city ; it sank to ashes when , a few days later , [her]0-i eye lit on a paragraph wherein [Mr.]3049-mr. and [Mrs. Mortimer Hicks]285-mrs. hicks “[0-i] requested to state ” that there was no truth in the report . On the foundation of these two statements [Susy]159-susy raised [one watch - tower of hope]3050-one watch - tower of hope after another , feverish edifices demolished or rebuilt by every chance hint from [the outer world]1184-the outer world wherein [Nick]311-nick ’s name figured with [the Hickses]177-the hickses ’ . And still , as the days passed and [she]0-i heard nothing , either from [him]311-nick or from [[her]0-i lawyer]2925-her lawyer , [her]0-i flag continued to fly from [the quaking structures]3053-the quaking structures . Apart from the custody of [the children]1312-the children there was indeed little to distract [her]0-i mind from these persistent broodings . [She]0-i winced sometimes at the thought of the ease with which [[her]0-i fashionable friends]3055-her fashionable friends had let [her]0-i drop out of sight . In the perpetual purposeless rush of [their]1312-the children days , the feverish making of winter plans , hurrying off to [the Riviera]148-the riviera or [St. Moritz]32-st. moritz , [Egypt]82-egypt or [New York]12-new york , there was no time to hunt up the vanished or to wait for the laggard . Had [they]1312-the children learned that [she]0-i had broken [her]0-i “[0-i] engagement ” ( how [she]0-i hated the word ! ) to [Strefford]267-strefford , and had the fact gone about that [she]0-i was once more only [a poor hanger - on , to be taken up when it was convenient , and ignored in the intervals]3056-a poor hanger - on , to be taken up when it was convenient , and ignored in the intervals ? [She]0-i did not know ; though [she]0-i fancied [Strefford]267-strefford ’s newly - developed pride would prevent [his]267-strefford revealing to any one what had passed between [them]1312-the children . For several days after [her]0-i abrupt flight [he]267-strefford had made no sign ; and though [she]0-i longed to write and ask [his]267-strefford forgiveness [she]0-i could not find the words . Finally it was [he]267-strefford who wrote : a short note , from [Altringham]267-strefford , typical of all that was best in the old [Strefford]267-strefford . [He]267-strefford had gone down to [Altringham]267-strefford , [he]267-strefford told [her]0-i , to think quietly over [their]1312-the children last talk , and try to understand what [she]0-i had been driving at . [He]267-strefford had to own that [he]267-strefford could n’t ; but that , [he]267-strefford supposed , was the very head and front of [his]267-strefford offending . Whatever [he]267-strefford had done to displease [her]0-i , [he]267-strefford was sorry for ; but [he]267-strefford asked , in view of [his]267-strefford invincible ignorance , to be allowed not to regard [his]267-strefford offence as a cause for a final break . The possibility of that , [he]267-strefford found , would make [him]267-strefford even more unhappy than [he]267-strefford had foreseen ; as [she]0-i knew , [his]267-strefford own happiness had always been [his]267-strefford first object in life , and [he]267-strefford therefore begged [her]0-i to suspend [her]0-i decision a little longer . [He]267-strefford expected to be in [Paris]4-paris within another two months , and before arriving [he]267-strefford would write again , and ask [her]0-i to see [him]267-strefford . The letter moved [her]0-i but did not make [her]0-i waver . [She]0-i simply wrote that [she]0-i was touched by [his]267-strefford kindness , and would willingly see [him]267-strefford if [he]267-strefford came to [Paris]4-paris later ; though [she]0-i was bound to tell [him]267-strefford that [she]0-i had not yet changed [her]0-i mind , and did not believe it would promote [his]267-strefford happiness to have [her]0-i try to do so . [He]267-strefford did not reply to this , and there was nothing further to keep [her]0-i thoughts from revolving endlessly about [her]0-i inmost hopes and fears . On the rainy afternoon in question , tramping [home]606-home from [the “[0-i] cours ”]3058-the “ cours ” ( to which [she]0-i was to return at six ) , [she]0-i had said to [herself]0-i that it was two months that very day since [Nick]311-nick had known [she]0-i was ready to release [him]311-nick -- and that after such a delay [he]311-nick was not likely to take any further steps . The thought filled [her]0-i with a vague ecstasy . [She]0-i had had to fix an arbitrary date as the term of [her]0-i anguish , and [she]0-i had fixed that one ; and behold [she]0-i was justified . For what could [his]311-nick silence mean but that [he]311-nick too .... On the hall - table lay a typed envelope with the [Paris]4-paris postage - mark . [She]0-i opened it carelessly , and saw that the letter - head bore [[Mr. Spearman]311-nick ’s office address]3059-mr. spearman ’s office address . The words beneath spun round before [her]0-i eyes .... “[2023-he] Has notified [us]2022-us that [he]2023-he is at [your]2024-your disposal ... carry out [your]2024-your wishes ... arriving in [Paris]4-paris ... fix an appointment with [[his]2023-he lawyers]2025-his lawyers .... ” [Nick]311-nick -- it was [Nick]311-nick the words were talking of ! It was the fact of [Nick]311-nick ’s return to [Paris]4-paris that was being described in those preposterous terms ! [She]0-i sank down on the bench beside the dripping umbrella - stand and stared vacantly before [her]0-i . It had fallen at last -- this blow in which [she]0-i now saw that [she]0-i had never really believed ! And yet [she]0-i had imagined [she]0-i was prepared for it , had expected it , was already planning [her]0-i future life in view of it -- an effaced impersonal life in the service of [[somebody else]935-somebody else ’s children]3061-somebody else ’s children -- when , in reality , under that thin surface of abnegation and acceptance , all the old hopes had been smouldering red - hot in [their]3061-somebody else ’s children ashes ! What was the use of any self - discipline , any philosophy , any experience , if [the lawless self underneath]3062-the lawless self underneath could in an instant consume [them]3061-somebody else ’s children like tinder ? [She]0-i tried to collect [herself]0-i -- to understand what had happened . [Nick]311-nick was coming to [Paris]4-paris -- coming not to see [her]0-i but to consult [[his]311-nick lawyer]3063-his lawyer ! It meant , of course , that [he]311-nick had definitely resolved to claim [his]311-nick freedom ; and that , if [he]311-nick had made up [his]311-nick mind to this final step , after more than six months of inaction and seeming indifference , it could be only because something unforeseen and decisive had happened to [him]311-nick . Feverishly , [she]0-i put together again the stray scraps of gossip and the newspaper paragraphs that had reached [her]0-i in the last months . It was evident that [Miss Hicks]196-coral ’s projected marriage with [the Prince of [Teutoburg - Waldhain]149-teutoburg - waldhain]3064-the prince of teutoburg - waldhain had been broken off at the last moment ; and broken off because [she]0-i intended to marry [Nick]311-nick . The announcement of [his]311-nick arrival in [Paris]4-paris and the publication of [Mr.]3065-mr. and [Mrs. Hicks]285-mrs. hicks ’s formal denial of [[their]3065-mr. daughter]647-their daughter ’s betrothal coincided too closely to admit of any other inference . [Susy]159-susy tried to grasp the reality of these assembled facts , to picture to [herself]159-susy their actual tangible results . [She]159-susy thought of [Coral Hicks]196-coral bearing the name of [Mrs. Nick Lansing]3067-mrs. nick lansing -- [her]196-coral name , [Susy]159-susy ’s own!--and entering drawing - rooms with [Nick]311-nick in [her]0-i wake , gaily welcomed by [the very people who , a few months before , had welcomed [Susy]159-susy with the same warmth]3068-the very people who , a few months before , had welcomed susy with the same warmth . In spite of [Nick]311-nick ’s growing dislike of society , and [Coral]196-coral ’s attitude of intellectual superiority , [their]3065-mr. wealth would fatally draw [them]3065-mr. back into [the world to which [Nick]311-nick was attached by all [his]311-nick habits and associations]3069-the world to which nick was attached by all his habits and associations . And no doubt it would amuse [him]311-nick to re - enter [that world]1545-that world as [a dispenser of hospitality]3071-a dispenser of hospitality , to play the part of host where [he]311-nick had so long been [a guest]3072-a guest ; just as [Susy]159-susy had once fancied it would amuse [her]159-susy to re - enter it as [Lady Altringham]271-lady altringham .... But , try as [she]159-susy would , now that the reality was so close on [her]159-susy , [she]159-susy could not visualize it or relate it to [herself]159-susy . The mere juxtaposition of the two names -- [Coral]196-coral , [Nick]311-nick -- which in old times [she]159-susy had so often laughingly coupled , now produced a blur in [her]159-susy brain . [She]159-susy continued to sit helplessly beside the hall - table , the tears running down [her]159-susy cheeks . The appearance of [the bonne]3073-the bonne aroused [her]159-susy . [[Her]159-susy youngest charge]3074-her youngest charge , [Geordie]305-geordie , had been feverish for a day or two ; [he]305-geordie was better , but still confined to [the nursery]3075-the nursery , and [he]305-geordie had heard [Susy]159-susy unlock the house - door , and could not imagine why [she]159-susy had not come straight up to [him]305-geordie . [He]305-geordie now began to manifest [his]305-geordie indignation in a series of racking howls , and [Susy]159-susy , shaken out of [her]159-susy trance , dropped [her]159-susy cloak and umbrella and hurried up . “[2026-that child] Oh , [that child]2026-that child ! ” [she]159-susy groaned . Under the Fulmer roof there was little time or space for the indulgence of private sorrows . From morning till night there was always some immediate practical demand on [one]2186-one ’s attention ; and [Susy]159-susy was beginning to see how , in [contracted households]3077-contracted households , [children]616-children may play a part less romantic but not less useful than that assigned to [them]616-children in fiction , through the mere fact of giving [[their]616-children parents]2972-their parents no leisure to dwell on irremediable grievances . Though [her]159-susy own apprenticeship to family life had been so short , [she]159-susy had already acquired the knack of rapid mental readjustment , and as [she]159-susy hurried up to [the nursery]3075-the nursery [her]159-susy private cares were dispelled by a dozen problems of temperature , diet and medicine . Such readjustment was of course only momentary ; yet each time it happened it seemed to give [her]159-susy more firmness and flexibility of temper . “[2026-that child] What [a child]609-a child [I]0-i was [myself]0-i six months ago ! ” [she]159-susy thought , wondering that [Nick]311-nick ’s influence , and the tragedy of [their]3081-their parting , should have done less to mature and steady [her]159-susy than these few weeks in [a house full of [children]616-children]3082-a house full of children . Pacifying [Geordie]305-geordie was not easy , for [he]305-geordie had long since learned to use [his]305-geordie grievances as a pretext for keeping [the offender]3084-the offender at [his]305-geordie beck with a continuous supply of stories , songs and games . “[2026-that child] [You]0-i ’d better be careful never to put [yourself]0-i in the wrong with [Geordie]305-geordie , ” the astute [Junie]258-junie had warned [Susy]159-susy at the outset , “[0-i] because [he]305-geordie ’s got such a memory , and [he]305-geordie wo n’t make it up with [you]0-i till [you]0-i ’ve told [him]305-geordie every fairy - tale [he]305-geordie ’s ever heard before . ” But on this occasion , as soon as [he]305-geordie saw [her]159-susy , [Geordie]305-geordie ’s indignation melted . [She]159-susy was still in the doorway , compunctious , abject and racking [her]159-susy dazed brain for [his]305-geordie favourite stories , when [she]159-susy saw , by the smoothing out of [his]305-geordie mouth and the sudden serenity of [his]305-geordie eyes , that [he]305-geordie was going to give [her]159-susy the delicious but not wholly reassuring shock of being [a good boy]3085-a good boy . Thoughtfully [he]305-geordie examined [her]159-susy face as [she]159-susy knelt down beside the cot ; then [he]305-geordie poked out a finger and pressed it on [her]159-susy tearful cheek . “[0-i] [Poor Susy]159-susy got a pain too , ” [he]305-geordie said , putting [his]305-geordie arms about [her]159-susy ; and as [she]159-susy hugged [him]305-geordie close , [he]305-geordie added philosophically : “[159-susy] Tell [Geordie]305-geordie a new story , [darling]2329-darling , and [you]2329-darling ’ll forget all about it . ” XXVI . [NICK Lansing]170-nick arrived in [Paris]4-paris two days after [[his]170-nick lawyer]3063-his lawyer had announced [his]170-nick coming to [Mr. Spearman]311-nick . [He]170-nick had left [Rome]23-rome with the definite purpose of freeing [himself]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy ; and though [he]170-nick was not pledged to [Coral Hicks]196-coral [he]170-nick had not concealed from [her]196-coral the object of [his]170-nick journey . In vain had [he]170-nick tried to rouse in [himself]170-nick any sense of interest in [his]170-nick own future . Beyond the need of reaching a definite point in [his]170-nick relation to [Susy]159-susy [his]170-nick imagination could not travel . But [he]170-nick had been moved by [Coral]196-coral ’s confession , and [his]170-nick reason told [him]170-nick that [he]170-nick and [she]196-coral would probably be happy together , with the temperate happiness based on [a community of tastes and an enlargement of opportunities]3087-a community of tastes and an enlargement of opportunities . [He]170-nick meant , on [his]170-nick return to [Rome]23-rome , to ask [her]196-coral to marry [him]170-nick ; and [he]170-nick knew that [she]196-coral knew it . Indeed , if [he]170-nick had not spoken before leaving it was with no idea of evading [his]170-nick fate , or keeping [her]196-coral longer in suspense , but simply because of the strange apathy that had fallen on [him]170-nick since [he]170-nick had received [Susy]159-susy ’s letter . In [his]170-nick incessant self - communings [he]170-nick dressed up this apathy as a discretion which forbade [his]170-nick engaging [Coral]196-coral ’s future till [his]170-nick own was assured . But in truth [he]170-nick knew that [Coral]196-coral ’s future was already engaged , and [his]170-nick with it : in [Rome]23-rome the fact had seemed natural and even inevitable . In [Paris]4-paris , it instantly became the thinnest of unrealities . Not because [Paris]4-paris was not [Rome]23-rome , nor because it was [Paris]4-paris ; but because hidden away somewhere in [that vast unheeding labyrinth]3088-that vast unheeding labyrinth was the half - forgotten part of [himself]170-nick that was [Susy]159-susy .... For weeks , for months past , [his]170-nick mind had been saturated with [Susy]159-susy : [she]159-susy had never seemed more insistently near [him]170-nick than as [their]3089-their separation lengthened , and the chance of reunion became less probable . It was as if a sickness long smouldering in [him]170-nick had broken out and become acute , enveloping [him]170-nick in the Nessus - shirt of [his]170-nick memories . There were moments when , to [his]170-nick memory , [their]3089-their actual embraces seemed perfunctory , accidental , compared with this deep deliberate imprint of [her]159-susy soul on [his]170-nick . Yet now it had become suddenly different . Now that [he]170-nick was in the same place with [her]159-susy , and might at any moment run across [her]159-susy , meet [her]159-susy eyes , hear [her]159-susy voice , avoid [her]159-susy hand -- now that penetrating ghost of [her]159-susy with which [he]170-nick had been living was sucked back into the shadows , and [he]170-nick seemed , for the first time since [their]3089-their parting , to be again in [her]159-susy actual presence . [He]170-nick woke to the fact on the morning of [his]170-nick arrival , staring down from [[his]170-nick hotel]3090-his hotel window on [a street]3091-a street [she]159-susy would perhaps walk through that very day , and over a limitless huddle of [roofs]3092-roofs , one of which covered [her]159-susy at that hour . The abruptness of the transition startled [him]170-nick ; [he]170-nick had not known that [her]159-susy mere geographical nearness would take [him]170-nick by the throat in that way . What would it be , then , if [she]159-susy were to walk into [the room]379-the room ? Thank heaven that need never happen ! [He]170-nick was sufficiently informed as to French divorce proceedings to know that they would not necessitate a confrontation with [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife ; and with ordinary luck , and some precautions , [he]170-nick might escape even a distant glimpse of [her]159-susy . [He]170-nick did not mean to remain in [Paris]4-paris more than a few days ; and during that time it would be easy -- knowing , as [he]170-nick did , [her]159-susy tastes and [Altringham’s]313-altringham’s -- to avoid [the places where [she]159-susy was likely to be met]3095-the places where she was likely to be met . [He]170-nick did not know where [she]159-susy was living , but imagined [her]159-susy to be staying with [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose , or [some other rich friend]3096-some other rich friend , or else lodged , in prospective affluence , at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe , or in [a pretty flat of [her]159-susy own]3098-a pretty flat of her own . Trust [Susy]159-susy -- ah , the pang of it -- to “[305-geordie] manage ” ! [His]170-nick first visit was to [[his]170-nick lawyer]3063-his lawyer ’s ; and as [he]170-nick walked through [the familiar streets]3100-the familiar streets [each approaching face]3101-each approaching face , [each distant figure]3102-each distant figure seemed [hers]159-susy . The obsession was intolerable . It would not last , of course ; but meanwhile [he]170-nick had the exposed sense of [a fugitive in a nightmare]3103-a fugitive in a nightmare , who feels [himself]170-nick [the only creature visible in a ghostly and besetting multitude]3104-the only creature visible in a ghostly and besetting multitude . The eye of [the metropolis]3105-the metropolis seemed fixed on [him]170-nick in an immense unblinking stare . At [the lawyer]1860-the lawyer ’s [he]170-nick was told that , as a first step to freedom , [he]170-nick must secure a domicile in [Paris]4-paris . [He]170-nick had of course known of this necessity : [he]170-nick had seen [too many friends]3107-too many friends through [the Divorce Court]3108-the divorce court , in [one country]3109-one country or another , not to be fairly familiar with the procedure . But the fact presented a different aspect as soon as [he]170-nick tried to relate it to [himself]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy : it was as though [Susy]159-susy ’s personality were a medium through which events still took on a transfiguring colour . [He]170-nick found [the “[159-susy] domicile ”]3110-the “ domicile ” that very day : [a tawdrily furnished rez - de - chaussee]3111-a tawdrily furnished rez - de - chaussee , obviously destined to far different uses . And as [he]170-nick sat there , after [the concierge]3112-the concierge had discreetly withdrawn with the first quarter ’s payment in [her]3112-the concierge pocket , and stared about [him]170-nick at [the vulgar plushy place]3113-the vulgar plushy place , [he]170-nick burst out laughing at what it was about to figure in the eyes of the law : [a Home]3114-a home , and [a Home]3114-a home desecrated by [his]170-nick own act ! [The Home in which [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy]3116-the home in which he and susy had reared [their]3117-their precarious bliss , and seen [it]3116-the home in which he and susy crumble at the brutal touch of [his]170-nick unfaithfulness and [his]170-nick cruelty -- for [he]170-nick had been told that [he]170-nick must be cruel to [her]159-susy as well as unfaithful ! [He]170-nick looked at the walls hung with sentimental photogravures , at the shiny bronze “[159-susy] nudes , ” the moth - eaten animal - skins and the bedizened bed -- and once more the unreality , the impossibility , of all that was happening to [him]170-nick entered like a drug into [his]170-nick veins . To rouse [himself]170-nick [he]170-nick stood up , turned the key on [the hideous place]3118-the hideous place , and returned to [[his]170-nick lawyer]3063-his lawyer ’s . [He]170-nick knew that in the hard dry atmosphere of [the office]3120-the office the act of giving the address of [the flat]3121-the flat would restore some kind of reality to the phantasmal transaction . And with wonder [he]170-nick watched [the lawyer]1860-the lawyer , as a matter of course , pencil [the street]1298-the street and the number on one of the papers enclosed in a folder on which [his]170-nick own name was elaborately engrossed . As [he]170-nick took leave it occurred to [him]170-nick to ask where [Susy]159-susy was living . At least [he]170-nick imagined that it had just occurred to [him]170-nick , and that [he]170-nick was making the enquiry merely as a measure of precaution , in order to know [what quarter of [Paris]4-paris]3124-what quarter of paris to avoid ; but in reality the question had been on [his]170-nick lips since [he]170-nick had first entered [the office]3120-the office , and lurking in [his]170-nick mind since [he]170-nick had emerged from [the railway station]3126-the railway station that morning . The fact of not knowing where [she]159-susy lived made [the whole of [Paris]4-paris]3127-the whole of paris a meaningless unintelligible place , as useless to [him]170-nick as the face of a huge clock that has lost its hour hand . The address in [Passy]144-passy surprised [him]170-nick : [he]170-nick had imagined that [she]159-susy would be somewhere in [the neighborhood of [the Champs Elysees]3129-the champs elysees]3128-the neighborhood of the champs elysees or [the Place de l’Etoile]3130-the place de l’etoile . But probably either [Mrs. Melrose]244-mrs. melrose or [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie had taken [a house at [Passy]144-passy]3131-a house at passy . Well -- it was something of a relief to know that [she]159-susy was so far off . No business called [him]170-nick to [that almost suburban region beyond [the Trocadero]150-the trocadero]3132-that almost suburban region beyond the trocadero , and there was much less chance of meeting [her]159-susy than if [she]159-susy had been in [the centre of [Paris]4-paris]3133-the centre of paris . All day [he]170-nick wandered , avoiding [the fashionable quarters]3134-the fashionable quarters , [the streets in which [private motors]3136-private motors glittered five deep]3135-the streets in which private motors glittered five deep , and furred and feathered silhouettes glided from [them]3134-the fashionable quarters into [tea - rooms]3137-tea - rooms , [picture - galleries]3138-picture - galleries and [[jewellers]1460-jewellers ’ shops]3140-jewellers ’ shops . In some such scenes [Susy]159-susy was no doubt figuring : slenderer , finer , vivider , than the other images of clay , but imitating [their]3134-the fashionable quarters gestures , chattering [their]3134-the fashionable quarters jargon , winding [her]159-susy hand among the same pearls and sables . [He]170-nick struck away across [the Seine]85-the seine , along [the quays]3141-the quays to [the Cite]3142-the cite , the net - work of old [Paris]4-paris , [the great grey vaults of [St. Eustache]151-st. eustache]3143-the great grey vaults of st. eustache , [the swarming streets of [the Marais]152-the marais]3144-the swarming streets of the marais . [He]170-nick gazed at monuments dawdled before [shop]2851-shop - windows , sat in [squares]3146-squares and on [quays]3147-quays , watching [people]421-people bargain , argue , philander , quarrel , [work - girls]3149-work - girls stroll past in linked bands , [beggars]3150-beggars whine on [the bridges]3151-the bridges , [derelicts]3152-derelicts doze in the pale winter sun , [mothers in mourning]3153-mothers in mourning hasten by taking [children]616-children to [school]3155-school , and [street - walkers]3156-street - walkers beat [their]3156-street - walkers weary rounds before [the cafes]3157-the cafes . The day drifted on . Toward evening [he]170-nick began to grow afraid of [his]170-nick solitude , and to think of dining at [the Nouveau Luxe]1517-the nouveau luxe , or [some other fashionable restaurant where [he]170-nick would be fairly sure to meet [acquaintances]3160-acquaintances , and be carried off to [a theatre]3161-a theatre , [a boite]3162-a boite or [a dancing - hall]3163-a dancing - hall]3159-some other fashionable restaurant where he would be fairly sure to meet acquaintances , and be carried off to a theatre , a boite or a dancing - hall . Anything , anything now , to get away from the maddening round of [his]170-nick thoughts . [He]170-nick felt the same blank fear of solitude as months ago in [Genoa]68-genoa .... Even if [he]170-nick were to run across [Susy]159-susy and [Altringham]267-strefford , what of it ? Better get the job over . [People]421-people had long since ceased to take on tragedy airs about divorce : [dividing couples]3165-dividing couples dined together to the last , and met afterward in [[each other]2188-each other ’s houses]3167-each other ’s houses , happy in the consciousness that [their]3165-dividing couples respective remarriages had provided two new centres of entertainment . Yet most of [the couples who took [their]3168-the couples who took their re - matings re - matings]3168-the couples who took their re - matings so philosophically had doubtless had [their]3168-the couples who took their re - matings hour of enchantment , of belief in the immortality of loving ; whereas [he]170-nick and [Susy]159-susy had simply and frankly entered into a business contract for [their]3165-dividing couples mutual advantage . The fact gave the last touch of incongruity to [his]170-nick agonies and exaltations , and made [him]170-nick appear to [himself]170-nick as grotesque and superannuated as [the hero of a romantic novel]3169-the hero of a romantic novel . [He]170-nick stood up from a bench on which [he]170-nick had been lounging in [the Luxembourg gardens]3170-the luxembourg gardens , and hailed [a taxi]1426-a taxi . Dusk had fallen , and [he]170-nick meant to go back to [[his]170-nick hotel]3090-his hotel , take a rest , and then go out to dine . But instead , [he]170-nick threw [Susy]159-susy ’s address to [the driver]3173-the driver , and settled down in [the cab]3174-the cab , resting both hands on the knob of [his]170-nick umbrella and staring straight ahead of [him]170-nick as if [he]170-nick were accomplishing some tiresome duty that had to be got through with before [he]170-nick could turn [his]170-nick mind to more important things . “[159-susy] It ’s the easiest way , ” [he]170-nick heard [himself]170-nick say . At the street - corner -- [[her]159-susy street - corner]3175-her street - corner -- [he]170-nick stopped [the cab]3174-the cab , and stood motionless while it rattled away . It was [a short vague street]3177-a short vague street , much farther off than [he]170-nick had expected , and fading away at the farther end in a dusky blur of hoardings overhung by trees . A thin rain was beginning to fall , and it was already night in [this inadequately lit suburban quarter]3178-this inadequately lit suburban quarter . [Lansing]170-nick walked down [the empty street]3179-the empty street . [The houses]452-the houses stood a few yards apart , with bare - twigged shrubs between , and gates and railings dividing [them]452-the houses from the pavement . [He]170-nick could not , at first , distinguish [their]452-the houses numbers ; but presently , coming abreast of a street - lamp , [he]170-nick discovered that the small shabby facade [it]3174-the cab illuminated was precisely the one [he]170-nick sought . The discovery surprised [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick had imagined that , as frequently happened in [the outlying quarters of [Passy]144-passy and [La Muette]153-la muette]3181-the outlying quarters of passy and la muette , [the mean street]3182-the mean street would lead to [a stately private hotel]3183-a stately private hotel , built upon [some bowery fragment of an old country - place]3184-some bowery fragment of an old country - place .
