Instead , [he]170-nick saw [a six - windowed house , huddled among neighbours of [its]3189-a six - windowed house , huddled among neighbours of its kind , with the family wash fluttering between meagre bushes kind , with the family wash fluttering between meagre bushes]3189-a six - windowed house , huddled among neighbours of its kind , with the family wash fluttering between meagre bushes . The arc - light beat ironically on [its]3189-a six - windowed house , huddled among neighbours of its kind , with the family wash fluttering between meagre bushes front , which had the worn look of [a tired work - woman]3190-a tired work - woman ’s face ; and [Lansing]170-nick , as [he]170-nick leaned against the opposite railing , vainly tried to fit [his]170-nick vision of [Susy]159-susy into so humble a setting . The probable explanation was that [[his]170-nick lawyer]3063-his lawyer had given [him]170-nick the wrong address ; not only the wrong number but [the wrong street]3192-the wrong street . [He]170-nick pulled out the slip of paper , and was crossing over to decipher it under the lamp , when [an errand - boy]3193-an errand - boy appeared out of the obscurity , and approached [the house]342-the house . [Nick]170-nick drew back , and [the boy]1049-the boy , unlatching the gate , ran up the steps and gave the bell a pull . Almost immediately the door opened ; and there stood [Susy]159-susy , the light full upon [her]159-susy , and upon a red - checked child against [her]159-susy shoulder . The space behind [them]3196-them was dark , or so dimly lit that it formed a black background to [her]159-susy vivid figure . [She]159-susy looked at [the errand - boy]3197-the errand - boy without surprise , took [his]3197-the errand - boy parcel , and after [he]3197-the errand - boy had turned away , lingered a moment in the door , glancing down [the empty street]3179-the empty street . That moment , to [[her]159-susy watcher]3199-her watcher , seemed quicker than a flash yet as long as a life - time . There [she]159-susy was , a stone ’s throw away , but utterly unconscious of [his]3197-the errand - boy presence : [[his]3197-the errand - boy [Susy]159-susy]3200-his susy , [the old Susy]3201-the old susy , and yet [a new Susy]3202-a new susy , curiously transformed , transfigured almost , by the new attitude in which [he]3197-the errand - boy beheld [her]159-susy . In the first shock of the vision [he]3197-the errand - boy forgot [his]3197-the errand - boy surprise at [her]159-susy being in such a place , forgot to wonder [whose house [she]159-susy was in]3203-whose house she was in , or whose was [the sleepy child in [her]159-susy arms]3204-the sleepy child in her arms . For an instant [she]159-susy stood out from the blackness behind [her]159-susy , and through the veil of the winter night , a thing apart , an unconditioned vision , the eternal image of [the woman]3205-the woman and [the child]547-the child ; and in that instant everything within [him]3197-the errand - boy was changed and renewed . [His]3197-the errand - boy eyes were still absorbing [her]159-susy , finding again the familiar curves of [her]159-susy light body , noting the thinness of the lifted arm that upheld [the little boy]3207-the little boy , the droop of the shoulder [he]3197-the errand - boy weighed on , the brooding way in which [her]159-susy cheek leaned to [his]3197-the errand - boy even while [she]159-susy looked away ; then [she]159-susy drew back , the door closed , and the street - lamp again shone on blankness . “[159-susy] But [she]2029-she ’s [mine]2030-mine ! ” [Nick]170-nick cried , in a fierce triumph of recovery ... [His]3197-the errand - boy eyes were so full of [her]159-susy that [he]3197-the errand - boy shut them to hold in the crowding vision . [It]3208-it remained with [him]3197-the errand - boy , at first , as a complete picture ; then gradually it broke up into its component parts , [the child]547-the child vanished , [the strange house]3210-the strange house vanished , and [Susy]159-susy alone stood before [him]3197-the errand - boy , [his]3197-the errand - boy own [Susy]159-susy , only [his]3197-the errand - boy Susy , yet changed , worn , tempered -- older , even -- with sharper shadows under the cheek - bones , the brows drawn , the joint of the slim wrist more prominent . It was not thus that [his]3197-the errand - boy memory had evoked [her]159-susy , and [he]3197-the errand - boy recalled , with a remorseful pang , the fact that something in [her]159-susy look , [her]159-susy dress , [her]159-susy tired and drooping attitude , suggested poverty , dependence , seemed to make [her]159-susy after all a part of [the shabby house in which , at first sight , [her]159-susy presence]3211-the shabby house in which , at first sight , her presence had seemed so incongruous . “[2030-mine] But [she]2031-she looks poor ! ” [he]3197-the errand - boy thought , [his]3197-the errand - boy heart tightening . And instantly it occurred to [him]3197-the errand - boy that these must be [the Fulmer children whom [she]159-susy was living with while [[their]3212-the fulmer children whom she was living with while their parents travelled in italy parents]2972-their parents travelled in [Italy]134-italy]3212-the fulmer children whom she was living with while their parents travelled in italy . Rumours of [Nat Fulmer]247-nat ’s sudden ascension had reached [him]3197-the errand - boy , and [he]3197-the errand - boy had heard that [the couple]3214-the couple had lately been seen in [Naples]96-naples and [Palermo]154-palermo . [No one]534-no one had mentioned [Susy]159-susy ’s name in connection with [them]3214-the couple , and [he]3197-the errand - boy could hardly tell why [he]3197-the errand - boy had arrived at this conclusion , except perhaps because it seemed natural that , if [Susy]159-susy were in trouble , [she]159-susy should turn to [[her]159-susy old friend]3216-her old friend [Grace]175-grace . But why in trouble ? What trouble ? What could have happened to check [her]159-susy triumphant career ? “[2030-mine] That ’s what [I]0-i mean to find out ! ” [he]3197-the errand - boy exclaimed . [His]3197-the errand - boy heart was beating with a tumult of new hopes and old memories . The sight of [[his]3197-the errand - boy wife]332-his wife , so remote in mien and manner from the world in which [he]3197-the errand - boy had imagined [her]159-susy to be re - absorbed , changed in a flash [his]3197-the errand - boy own relation to life , and flung a mist of unreality over all that [he]3197-the errand - boy had been trying to think most solid and tangible . Nothing now was substantial to [him]3197-the errand - boy but the stones of [the street in which [he]3197-the errand - boy stood]3218-the street in which he stood , the front of [the house which hid [her]159-susy]3219-the house which hid her , the bell - handle [he]3197-the errand - boy already felt in [his]3197-the errand - boy grasp . [He]3197-the errand - boy started forward , and was halfway to the threshold when a private motor turned the corner , the twin glitter of its lamps carpeting [the wet street]3220-the wet street with gold to [Susy]159-susy ’s door . [Lansing]170-nick drew back into the shadow as [the motor]2222-the motor swept up to [the house]342-the house . [A man]2216-a man jumped out , and the light fell on [Strefford]267-strefford ’s shambling figure , its lazy disjointed movements so unmistakably the same under [his]3197-the errand - boy fur coat , and in the new setting of prosperity . [Lansing]170-nick stood motionless , staring at the door . [Strefford]267-strefford rang , and waited . Would [Susy]159-susy appear again ? Perhaps [she]159-susy had done so before only because [she]159-susy had been on the watch .... But no : after a slight delay [a bonne]3224-a bonne appeared -- [the breathless maid]3225-the breathless maid - of - all - work of [a busy household]3226-a busy household -- and at once effaced [herself]3224-a bonne , letting [the visitor]3227-the visitor in . [Lansing]170-nick was sure that not a word passed between [the two]1444-the two , of enquiry on [Lord Altringham]267-strefford ’s part , or of acquiescence on [the servant]3229-the servant ’s . There could be no doubt that [he]3197-the errand - boy was expected . The door closed on [him]3197-the errand - boy , and a light appeared behind the blind of the adjoining window . [The maid]539-the maid had shown [the visitor]3227-the visitor into [the sitting - room]3232-the sitting - room and lit the lamp . [Upstairs]485-upstairs , meanwhile , [Susy]159-susy was no doubt running skilful fingers through [her]159-susy tumbled hair and daubing [her]159-susy pale lips with red . Ah , how [Lansing]170-nick knew every movement of that familiar rite , even to the pucker of the brow and the pouting thrust - out of the lower lip ! [He]170-nick was seized with a sense of physical sickness as the succession of remembered gestures pressed upon [his]170-nick eyes .... And [the other man]3234-the other man ? [The other man]3234-the other man , inside [the house]342-the house , was perhaps at that very instant smiling over the remembrance of the same scene ! At the thought , [Lansing]170-nick plunged away into the night . XXVII . [SUSY]159-susy and [Lord Altringham]267-strefford sat in [the little drawing - room]3237-the little drawing - room , divided from each other by a table carrying a smoky lamp and heaped with tattered school - books . In another half hour [the bonne]3073-the bonne , despatched to fetch [the children]1312-the children from [[their]1312-the children classes]3240-their classes , would be back with [[her]3073-the bonne flock]3241-her flock ; and at any moment [Geordie]305-geordie ’s imperious cries might summon [[his]305-geordie slave]3242-his slave up to [the nursery]3075-the nursery . In the scant time allotted [them]1312-the children , [the two]1444-the two sat , and visibly wondered what to say . [Strefford]267-strefford , on entering , had glanced about [the dreary room]3245-the dreary room , with [its]3245-the dreary room piano laden with tattered music , [the children]1312-the children ’s toys littering the lame sofa , the bunches of dyed grass and impaled butterflies flanking the cast - bronze clock . Then [he]267-strefford had turned to [Susy]159-susy and asked simply : “[0-i] Why on earth are [you]2032-you here ? ” [She]159-susy had not tried to explain ; from the first , [she]159-susy had understood the impossibility of doing so . And [she]159-susy would not betray [her]159-susy secret longing to return to [Nick]170-nick , now that [she]159-susy knew that [Nick]170-nick had taken definite steps for [his]170-nick release . In dread lest [Strefford]267-strefford should have heard of this , and should announce it to [her]159-susy , coupling it with the news of [Nick]170-nick ’s projected marriage , and lest , hearing [her]159-susy fears thus substantiated , [she]159-susy should lose [her]159-susy self - control , [she]159-susy had preferred to say , in a voice that [she]159-susy tried to make indifferent : “[0-i] The ‘ proceedings , ’ or whatever [the lawyers]1858-the lawyers call them , have begun . While [they]2034-they ’re going on [I]0-i like to stay quite by [myself]0-i .... [I]0-i do n’t know why .... ” [Strefford]267-strefford , at that , had looked at [her]159-susy keenly . “[0-i] Ah , ” [he]267-strefford murmured ; and [his]267-strefford lips were twisted into [their]3247-their old mocking smile . “[0-i] Speaking of proceedings , ” [he]267-strefford went on carelessly , “[0-i] what stage have [Ellie]184-ellie ’s reached , [I]0-i wonder ? [I]0-i saw [her]184-ellie and [Vanderlyn]184-ellie and [Bockheimer]274-algie all lunching cheerfully together to - day at [Larue ’s]155-larue ’s . ” The blood rushed to [Susy]159-susy ’s forehead . [She]159-susy remembered [her]159-susy tragic evening with [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson , only two months earlier , and thought to [herself]159-susy . “[0-i] In time , then , [I]0-i suppose , [Nick]170-nick and [I]0-i .... ” Aloud [she]0-i said : “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t imagine how [Nelson]222-nelson and [Ellie]184-ellie can ever want to see [each other]2188-each other again . And in [a restaurant]2036-a restaurant , of all places ! ” [Strefford]267-strefford continued to smile . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]445-my dear , [you]445-my dear ’re incorrigibly old - fashioned . Why should [two people who ’ve done [each other]2188-each other the best turn [they]2038-two people who ’ve done each other the best turn they could by getting out of each other ’s way at the right moment could by getting out of [each other]2188-each other ’s way at the right moment]2038-two people who ’ve done each other the best turn they could by getting out of each other ’s way at the right moment behave like [sworn enemies]2041-sworn enemies ever afterward ? It ’s too absurd ; the humbug ’s too flagrant . Whatever [[our]2042-our generation]2043-our generation has failed to do , it ’s got rid of humbug ; and that ’s enough to immortalize it . [I]0-i daresay [Nelson]222-nelson and [Ellie]184-ellie never liked [each other]2188-each other better than [they]2038-two people who ’ve done each other the best turn they could by getting out of each other ’s way at the right moment do to - day . Twenty years ago , [they]2038-two people who ’ve done each other the best turn they could by getting out of each other ’s way at the right moment ’d have been afraid to confess it ; but why should n’t [they]2038-two people who ’ve done each other the best turn they could by getting out of each other ’s way at the right moment now ? ” [Susy]159-susy looked at [Strefford]267-strefford , conscious that under [his]267-strefford words was the ache of the disappointment [she]159-susy had caused [him]267-strefford ; and yet conscious also that that very ache was not the overwhelming penetrating emotion [he]267-strefford perhaps wished it to be , but a pang on a par with a dozen others ; and that even while [he]267-strefford felt it [he]267-strefford foresaw the day when [he]267-strefford should cease to feel it . And [she]159-susy thought to [herself]159-susy that this certainty of oblivion must be bitterer than any certainty of pain . A silence had fallen between [them]3248-them . [He]267-strefford broke it by rising from [his]267-strefford seat , and saying with a shrug : “[2045-she] [You]2045-she ’ll end by driving [me]0-i to marry [Joan Senechal]284-joan senechal . ” [Susy]159-susy smiled . “[2045-she] Well , why not ? [She]284-joan senechal ’s lovely . ” “[284-joan senechal] Yes ; but [she]284-joan senechal ’ll bore [me]0-i . ” “[284-joan senechal] [Poor Streff]198-streff ! So should [I--]0-i ” “[0-i] Perhaps . But nothing like as soon-- ” [He]267-strefford grinned sardonically . “[284-joan senechal] There ’d be more margin . ” [He]267-strefford appeared to wait for [her]2045-she to speak . “[284-joan senechal] And what else on earth are [you]2045-she going to do ? ” [he]267-strefford concluded , as [she]2045-she still remained silent . “[2045-she] Oh , [Streff]198-streff , [I]0-i could n’t marry [you]198-streff for a reason like that ! ” [she]2045-she murmured at length . “[0-i] Then marry [me]0-i , and find [your]198-streff reason afterward . ” [Her]2045-she lips made a movement of denial , and still in silence [she]2045-she held out [her]2045-she hand for good - bye . [He]267-strefford clasped it , and then turned away ; but on the threshold [he]267-strefford paused , [his]267-strefford screwed - up eyes fixed on [her]2045-she wistfully . The look moved [her]2045-she , and [she]2045-she added hurriedly : “[198-streff] The only reason [I]0-i can find is one for not marrying [you]198-streff . It ’s because [I]0-i ca n’t yet feel unmarried enough . ” “[0-i] Unmarried enough ? But [I]0-i thought [Nick]170-nick was doing [his]170-nick best to make [you]0-i feel that . ” “[170-nick] Yes . But even when [he]170-nick has -- sometimes [I]0-i think even that wo n’t make any difference . ” [He]267-strefford still scrutinized [her]2045-she hesitatingly , with the gravest eyes [she]2045-she had ever seen in [his]267-strefford careless face . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]445-my dear , that ’s rather the way [I]0-i feel about [you]445-my dear , ” [he]267-strefford said simply as [he]267-strefford turned to go . That evening after [the children]1312-the children had gone to bed [Susy]159-susy sat up late in [the cheerless sitting - room]3250-the cheerless sitting - room . [She]159-susy was not thinking of [Strefford]267-strefford but of [Nick]170-nick . [He]170-nick was coming to [Paris]4-paris -- perhaps [he]170-nick had already arrived . The idea that [he]170-nick might be in the same place with [her]2045-she at that very moment , and without [her]2045-she knowing it , was so strange and painful that [she]2045-she felt a violent revolt of all [her]2045-she strong and joy - loving youth . Why should [she]2045-she go on suffering so unbearably , so abjectly , so miserably ? If only [she]2045-she could see [him]170-nick , hear [his]170-nick voice , even hear [him]170-nick say again such cruel and humiliating words as [he]170-nick had spoken on that dreadful day in [Venice]15-venice when that would be better than this blankness , this utter and final exclusion from [his]170-nick life ! [He]170-nick had been cruel to [her]2045-she , unimaginably cruel : hard , arrogant , unjust ; and had been so , perhaps , deliberately , because [he]170-nick already wanted to be free . But [she]2045-she was ready to face even that possibility , to humble [herself]2045-she still farther than [he]170-nick had humbled [her]2045-she -- [she]2045-she was ready to do anything , if only [she]2045-she might see [him]170-nick once again . [She]2045-she leaned [her]2045-she aching head on [her]2045-she hands and pondered . Do anything ? But what could [she]2045-she do ? Nothing that should hurt [him]170-nick , interfere with [his]170-nick liberty , be false to the spirit of [their]3251-their pact : on that [she]2045-she was more than ever resolved . [She]2045-she had made a bargain , and [she]2045-she meant to stick to it , not for any abstract reason , but simply because [she]2045-she happened to love [him]170-nick in that way . Yes -- but to see [him]170-nick again , only once ! Suddenly [she]2045-she remembered what [Strefford]267-strefford had said about [Nelson Vanderlyn]222-nelson and [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife . “[0-i] Why should [two people who ’ve just done each other]2047-two people who ’ve just done each other the best turn [they]2047-two people who ’ve just done each other could behave like [sworn enemies ever after]2048-sworn enemies ever after ? ” If in offering [Nick]170-nick [his]170-nick freedom [she]2045-she had indeed done [him]170-nick such a service as that , perhaps [he]170-nick no longer hated [her]2045-she , would no longer be unwilling to see [her]2045-she .... At any rate , why should [she]2045-she not write to [him]170-nick on that assumption , write in a spirit of simple friendliness , suggesting that [they]2047-two people who ’ve just done each other should meet and “[0-i] settle things ” ? The business - like word “[0-i] settle ” ( how [she]2045-she hated it ) would prove to [him]170-nick that [she]2045-she had no secret designs upon [his]170-nick liberty ; and besides [he]170-nick was too unprejudiced , too modern , too free from what [Strefford]267-strefford called humbug , not to understand and accept such a suggestion . After all , perhaps [Strefford]267-strefford was right ; it was something to have rid human relations of hypocrisy , even if , in the process , so many exquisite things seemed somehow to have been torn away with it .... [She]2045-she ran up to [[her]2045-she room]664-her room , scribbled a note , and hurried with it through the rain and darkness to the post - box at the corner . As [she]2045-she returned through [the empty street]3179-the empty street [she]2045-she had an odd feeling that [it]3179-the empty street was not empty -- that perhaps [Nick]170-nick was already there , somewhere near [her]2045-she in the night , about to follow [her]2045-she to the door , enter [the house]342-the house , go up with [her]2045-she to [[her]2045-she bedroom]3256-her bedroom in the old way . It was strange how close [he]170-nick had been brought by the mere fact of [her]2045-she having written that little note to [him]170-nick ! In [the bedroom]3257-the bedroom , [Geordie]305-geordie lay in [his]305-geordie crib in ruddy slumber , and [she]2045-she blew out the candle and undressed softly for fear of waking [him]305-geordie . [Nick Lansing]170-nick , the next day , received [Susy]159-susy ’s letter , transmitted to [[his]170-nick hotel]3090-his hotel from [[the lawyer]1860-the lawyer ’s office]3260-the lawyer ’s office . [He]170-nick read it carefully , two or three times over , weighing and scrutinizing the guarded words . [She]159-susy proposed that [they]3261-their should meet to “[0-i] settle things . ” What things ? And why should [he]170-nick accede to such a request ? What secret purpose had prompted [her]159-susy ? It was horrible that nowadays , in thinking of [Susy]159-susy , [he]170-nick should always suspect ulterior motives , be meanly on the watch for some hidden tortuousness . What on earth was [she]2045-she trying to “[0-i] manage ” now , [he]170-nick wondered . A few hours ago , at the sight of [her]2045-she , all [his]170-nick hardness had melted , and [he]170-nick had charged [himself]170-nick with cruelty , with injustice , with every sin of pride against [himself]170-nick and [her]2045-she ; but the appearance of [Strefford]267-strefford , arriving at that late hour , and so evidently expected and welcomed , had driven back the rising tide of tenderness . Yet , after all , what was there to wonder at ? Nothing was changed in [their]3261-their respective situations . [He]170-nick had left [[his]170-nick wife]332-his wife , deliberately , and for reasons which no subsequent experience had caused [him]170-nick to modify . [She]2045-she had apparently acquiesced in [his]170-nick decision , and had utilized it , as [she]2045-she was justified in doing , to assure [her]2045-she own future . In all this , what was there to wail or knock the breast between [two people who prided [themselves]3263-two people who prided themselves on looking facts in the face , and making their grim best of them , without vain repinings on looking facts in the face , and making [their]3263-two people who prided themselves on looking facts in the face , and making their grim best of them , without vain repinings grim best of [them]3263-two people who prided themselves on looking facts in the face , and making their grim best of them , without vain repinings , without vain repinings]3263-two people who prided themselves on looking facts in the face , and making their grim best of them , without vain repinings ? [He]170-nick had been right in thinking [their]3261-their marriage an act of madness . [Her]2045-she charms had overruled [his]170-nick judgment , and [they]3261-their had had [their]3261-their year ... [their]3261-their mad year ... or at least all but two or three months of it . But [his]170-nick first intuition had been right ; and now [they]3261-their must both pay for [their]3261-their madness . [The Fates]314-the fates seldom forget the bargains made with [them]3261-their , or fail to ask for compound interest . Why not , then , now that the time had come , pay up gallantly , and remember of the episode only what had made it seem so supremely worth the cost ? [He]170-nick sent a pneumatic telegram to [Mrs. Nicholas Lansing]3264-mrs. nicholas lansing to say that [he]170-nick would call on [her]2045-she that afternoon at four . “[2050-she] That ought to give [us]2049-us time , ” [he]170-nick reflected drily , “[2050-she] to ‘ settle things , ’ as [she]2050-she calls it , without interfering with [Strefford]267-strefford ’s afternoon visit . ” XXVIII . [[HER]2045-she husband]327-her husband ’s note had briefly said : “[2050-she] To - day at four o’clock . N.L. ” All day [she]2045-she pored over the words in an agony of longing , trying to read into them regret , emotion , memories , some echo of the tumult in [her]2045-she own bosom . But [she]2045-she had signed “[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy , ” and [he]170-nick signed “[159-susy] N.L. ” That seemed to put an abyss between [them]3261-their . After all , [she]2045-she was free and [he]170-nick was not . Perhaps , in view of [his]170-nick situation , [she]2045-she had only increased the distance between [them]3261-their by [her]2045-she unconventional request for a meeting . [She]2045-she sat in [the little drawing - room]3237-the little drawing - room , and the cast - bronze clock ticked out the minutes . [She]2045-she would not look out of the window : it might bring bad luck to watch for [him]170-nick . And it seemed to [her]2045-she that [a thousand invisible spirits , hidden demons of good and evil]3267-a thousand invisible spirits , hidden demons of good and evil , pressed about [her]2045-she , spying out [her]2045-she thoughts , counting [her]2045-she heart - beats , ready to pounce upon the least symptom of over - confidence and turn it deftly to derision . Oh , for an altar on which to pour out propitiatory offerings ! But what sweeter could [they]3267-a thousand invisible spirits , hidden demons of good and evil have than [her]2045-she smothered heart - beats , [her]2045-she choked - back tears ? The bell rang , and [she]2045-she stood up as if a spring had jerked [her]2045-she to [her]2045-she feet . In the mirror between the dried grasses [her]2045-she face looked long pale inanimate . Ah , if [he]170-nick should find [her]2045-she too changed-- ! If there were but time to dash [upstairs]485-upstairs and put on a touch of red .... The door opened ; it shut on [him]170-nick ; [he]170-nick was there . [He]170-nick said : “[2051-you] [You]2051-you wanted to see [me]0-i ? ” [She]2045-she answered : “[2051-you] Yes . ” And [her]2045-she heart seemed to stop beating . At first [she]2045-she could not make out what mysterious change had come over [him]170-nick , and why it was that in looking at [him]170-nick [she]2045-she seemed to be looking at [a stranger]3269-a stranger ; then [she]2045-she perceived that [his]170-nick voice sounded as it used to sound when [he]170-nick was talking to [other people]394-other people ; and [she]2045-she said to [herself]2045-she , with a sick shiver of understanding , that [she]2045-she had become [an “[2051-you] other person ” to [him]170-nick]3271-an “ other person ” to him . There was a deathly pause ; then [she]2045-she faltered out , not knowing what [she]2045-she said : “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick -- you’ll sit down ? ” [He]170-nick said : “[170-nick] Thanks , ” but did not seem to have heard [her]2045-she , for [he]170-nick continued to stand motionless , half [the room between [them]3273-them]3272-the room between them . And slowly the uselessness , the hopelessness of [his]170-nick being there overcame [her]2045-she . A wall of granite seemed to have built itself up between [them]3273-them . [She]2045-she felt as if it hid [her]2045-she from [him]170-nick , as if with those remote new eyes of [his]170-nick [he]170-nick were staring into the wall and not at [her]2045-she . Suddenly [she]2045-she said to [herself]2045-she : “[170-nick] [He]170-nick ’s suffering more than [I]0-i am , because [he]170-nick pities [me]0-i , and is afraid to tell [me]0-i that [he]170-nick is going to be married . ” The thought stung [her]2045-she pride , and [she]2045-she lifted [her]2045-she head and met [his]170-nick eyes with a smile . “[170-nick] Do n’t [you]170-nick think , ” [she]2045-she said , “[170-nick] it ’s more sensible -- with everything so changed in [our]2052-our lives -- that [we]2052-our should meet as [friends]726-friends , in this way ? [I]0-i wanted to tell [you]170-nick that [you]170-nick need n’t feel -- feel in the least unhappy about [me]0-i . ” A deep flush rose to [his]170-nick forehead . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i know -- [I]0-i know that-- ” [he]170-nick declared hastily ; and added , with a factitious animation : “[0-i] But thank [you]0-i for telling [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] There ’s nothing , is there , ” [she]2045-she continued , “[0-i] to make [our]2052-our meeting in this way in the least embarrassing or painful to either of [us]2052-our , when [both]2054-both have found .... ” [She]2045-she broke off , and held [her]2045-she hand out to [him]170-nick . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve heard about [you]170-nick and [Coral]196-coral , ” [she]2045-she ended . [He]170-nick just touched [her]2045-she hand with cold fingers , and let it drop . “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , ” [he]170-nick said for the third time . “[0-i] [You]0-i wo n’t sit down ? ” [He]170-nick sat down . “[0-i] Do n’t [you]170-nick think , ” [she]2045-she continued , “[170-nick] that the new way of ... of meeting as [friends]726-friends ... and talking things over without ill - will ... is much pleasanter and more sensible , after all ? ” [He]170-nick smiled . “[0-i] It ’s immensely kind of [you]0-i to feel that . ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i do feel it ! ” [She]2045-she stopped short , and wondered what on earth [she]2045-she had meant to say next , and why [she]2045-she had so abruptly lost the thread of [her]2045-she discourse . In the pause [she]2045-she heard [him]170-nick cough slightly and clear [his]170-nick throat . “[0-i] Let [me]0-i say , then , ” [he]170-nick began , “[0-i] that [I]0-i ’m glad too -- immensely glad that [your]0-i own future is so satisfactorily settled . ” [She]2045-she lifted [her]2045-she glance again to [his]170-nick walled face , in which not a muscle stirred . “[0-i] Yes : it -- it makes everything easier for [you]170-nick , does n’t it ? ” “[0-i] For [you]0-i too , [I]0-i hope . ” [He]170-nick paused , and then went on : “[0-i] [I]0-i want also to tell [you]0-i that [I]0-i perfectly understand-- ” “[0-i] Oh , ” [she]2045-she interrupted , “[0-i] so do [I]0-i ; [your]0-i point of view , [I]0-i mean . ” [They]2056-they were again silent . “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick , why ca n’t [we]2056-they be [friends]726-friends [real friends]2058-real friends ? Wo n’t it be easier ? ” [she]2045-she broke out at last with twitching lips . “[170-nick] Easier-- ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i mean , about talking things over -- arrangements . There are arrangements to be made , [I]0-i suppose ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so . ” [He]170-nick hesitated . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m doing what [I]0-i ’m told -- simply following out instructions . The business is easy enough , apparently . [I]0-i ’m taking the necessary steps-- ” [She]2045-she reddened a little , and drew a gasping breath . “[0-i] The necessary steps : what are [they]2059-they ? Everything [the lawyers]1858-the lawyers tell one is so confusing .... [I]0-i do n’t yet understand -- how it ’s done . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i share , [you]0-i mean ? Oh , it ’s very simple . ” [He]170-nick paused , and added in a tone of laboured ease : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m going down to [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau to - morrow-- ” [She]2045-she stared , not understanding . “[0-i] To [Fontainebleau--]157-fontainebleau-- ? ” [Her]2045-she bewilderment drew from [him]170-nick [his]170-nick first frank smile . “[0-i] Well -- [I]0-i chose [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau -- [I]0-i do n’t know why ... except that [we]2061-we ’ve never been [there]2229-there together . ” At that [she]2045-she suddenly understood , and the blood rushed to [her]2045-she forehead . [She]2045-she stood up without knowing what [she]2045-she was doing , [her]2045-she heart in [her]2045-she throat . “[0-i] How grotesque -- how utterly disgusting ! ” [He]170-nick gave a slight shrug . “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t make the laws .... ” “[0-i] But is n’t it too stupid and degrading that such things should be necessary when [two people]2063-two people want to part-- ? ” [She]2045-she broke off again , silenced by the echo of that fatal “[0-i] want to part . ” ... [He]170-nick seemed to prefer not to dwell farther on the legal obligations involved . “[0-i] [You]0-i have n’t yet told [me]0-i , ” [he]170-nick suggested , “[0-i] how [you]0-i happen to be living [here]2184-here . ” “[0-i] Here -- with [the Fulmer children]2619-the fulmer children ? ” [She]2045-she roused [herself]2045-she , trying to catch [his]170-nick easier note . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i ’ve simply been governessing [them]2619-the fulmer children for a few weeks , while [Nat]247-nat and [Grace]175-grace are in [Sicily]95-sicily . ” [She]2045-she did not say : “[247-nat] It ’s because [I]0-i ’ve parted with [Strefford]267-strefford . ” Somehow it helped [her]2045-she wounded pride a little to keep from [him]170-nick the secret of [her]2045-she precarious independence . [He]170-nick looked [his]170-nick wonder . “[0-i] All alone with [that bewildered bonne]2066-that bewildered bonne ? But how many of [them]2619-the fulmer children are there ? Five ? [Good Lord]2067-good lord ! ” [He]170-nick contemplated the clock with unseeing eyes , and then turned them again on [her]2045-she face . “[2067-good lord] [I]0-i should have thought [a lot of [children]616-children]2068-a lot of children would rather get on [your]0-i nerves . ” “[616-children] Oh , not [these children]2070-these children . [They]2070-these children ’re so good to [me]0-i . ” “[2070-these children] Ah , well , [I]0-i suppose it wo n’t be for long . ” [He]170-nick sent [his]170-nick eyes again about [the room]379-the room , which [his]170-nick absent - minded gaze seemed to reduce to its dismal constituent elements , and added , with an obvious effort at small talk : “[0-i] [I]0-i hear [the Fulmers]174-nat are not hitting it off very well since [his]2071-he success . Is it true that [he]2071-he ’s going to marry [Violet Melrose]161-violet melrose ? ” The blood rose to [Susy]159-susy ’s face . “[161-violet melrose] Oh , never , never ! [He]2071-he and [Grace]175-grace are travelling together now . ” “[2071-he] Oh , [I]0-i did n’t know . [People]421-people say things .... ” [He]170-nick was visibly embarrassed with the subject , and sorry that [he]170-nick had broached it . “[421-people] Some of the things that [people]421-people say are true . But [Grace]175-grace does n’t mind . [She]175-grace says [she]175-grace and [Nat]174-nat belong to [each other]2188-each other . [They]2075-they ca n’t help it , [she]175-grace thinks , after having been through such a lot together . ” “[175-grace] [Dear old Grace]175-grace ! ” [He]170-nick had risen from [his]170-nick chair , and this time [she]175-grace made no effort to detain [him]170-nick . [He]170-nick seemed to have recovered [his]170-nick self - composure , and it struck [her]175-grace painfully , humiliatingly almost , that [he]170-nick should have spoken in that light way of the expedition to [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau on the morrow .... Well , [men]2437-men were different , [she]175-grace supposed ; [she]175-grace remembered having felt that once before about [Nick]170-nick . It was on the tip of [her]175-grace tongue to cry out : “[175-grace] But wait -- wait ! [I]0-i ’m not going to marry [Strefford]267-strefford after all!”--but to do so would seem like an appeal to [his]170-nick compassion , to [his]170-nick indulgence ; and that was not what [she]175-grace wanted . [She]175-grace could never forget that [he]170-nick had left [her]175-grace because [he]170-nick had not been able to forgive [her]175-grace for “[175-grace] managing”--and not for [the world]2205-the world would [she]175-grace have [him]170-nick think that this meeting had been planned for such a purpose . “[267-strefford] If [he]267-strefford does n’t see that [I]0-i am different , in spite of appearances ... and that [I]0-i never was what [he]267-strefford said [I]0-i was that day -- if in all these months it has n’t come over [him]267-strefford , what ’s the use of trying to make [him]267-strefford see it now ? ” [she]175-grace mused . And then , [her]175-grace thoughts hurrying on : “[267-strefford] Perhaps [he]267-strefford ’s suffering too -- [I]0-i believe [he]267-strefford is suffering -- at any rate , [he]267-strefford ’s suffering for [me]0-i , if not for [himself]267-strefford . But if [he]267-strefford ’s pledged to [Coral]196-coral , what can [he]267-strefford do ? What would [he]267-strefford think of [me]0-i if [I]0-i tried to make [him]267-strefford break [his]267-strefford word to [her]196-coral ? ” There [he]267-strefford stood -- [the man who was “[267-strefford] going to [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau to - morrow ”]3277-the man who was “ going to fontainebleau to - morrow ” ; who called it “[267-strefford] taking the necessary steps ! ” Who could smile as [he]267-strefford made the careless statement ! [A world]1573-a world seemed to divide [them]3279-them already : it was as if [their]3279-them parting were already over . All the words , cries , arguments beating loud wings in [her]196-coral dropped back into silence . The only thought left was : “[267-strefford] How much longer does [he]267-strefford mean to go on standing [there]2229-there ? ” [He]267-strefford may have read the question in [her]196-coral face , for turning back from an absorbed contemplation of the window curtains [he]267-strefford said : “[267-strefford] There ’s nothing else ? ” “[267-strefford] Nothing else ? ” “[267-strefford] [I]0-i mean : [you]267-strefford spoke of things to be settled-- ” [She]196-coral flushed , suddenly remembering the pretext [she]196-coral had used to summon [him]267-strefford . “[267-strefford] Oh , ” [she]196-coral faltered , “[267-strefford] [I]0-i did n’t know ... [I]0-i thought there might be .... But [the lawyers]1858-the lawyers , [I]0-i suppose .... ” [She]196-coral saw the relief on [his]267-strefford contracted face . “[1858-the lawyers] Exactly . [I]0-i ’ve always thought it was best to leave it to [them]1858-the lawyers . [I]0-i assure you”--again for a moment the smile strained [his]267-strefford lips--“I[0-i] shall do nothing to interfere with a quick settlement . ” [She]196-coral stood motionless , feeling [herself]196-coral turn to stone . [He]267-strefford appeared already a long way off , like [a figure vanishing down a remote perspective]3280-a figure vanishing down a remote perspective . “[0-i] Then -- good - bye , ” [she]196-coral heard [him]267-strefford say from its farther end . “[0-i] Oh,--good - bye , ” [she]196-coral faltered , as if [she]196-coral had not had the word ready , and was relieved to have [him]267-strefford supply it . [He]267-strefford stopped again on the threshold , looked back at [her]196-coral , began to speak . “[2078-i’ve--] [I’ve--]2078-i’ve-- ” [he]267-strefford said ; then [he]267-strefford repeated “[2078-i’ve--] Good - bye , ” as though to make sure [he]267-strefford had not forgotten to say it ; and the door closed on [him]267-strefford . It was over ; [she]196-coral had had [her]196-coral last chance and missed it . Now , whatever happened , the one thing [she]196-coral had lived and longed for would never be . [He]267-strefford had come , and [she]196-coral had let [him]267-strefford go again .... How had it come about ? Would [she]196-coral ever be able to explain it to [herself]196-coral ? How was it that [she]196-coral , so fertile in strategy , so practiced in feminine arts , had stood there before [him]267-strefford , helpless , inarticulate , like [a school - girl]3281-a school - girl a - choke with [her]196-coral first love - longing ? If [he]267-strefford was gone , and gone never to return , it was [her]196-coral own fault , and none but [hers]196-coral . What had [she]196-coral done to move [him]267-strefford , detain [him]267-strefford , make [his]267-strefford heart beat and [his]267-strefford head swim as [hers]196-coral were beating and swimming ? [She]196-coral stood aghast at [her]196-coral own inadequacy , [her]196-coral stony inexpressiveness .... And suddenly [she]196-coral lifted [her]196-coral hands to [her]196-coral throbbing forehead and cried out : “[2078-i’ve--] But this is love ! This must be love ! ” [She]196-coral had loved [him]267-strefford before , [she]196-coral supposed ; for what else was [she]196-coral to call the impulse that had drawn [her]196-coral to [him]267-strefford , taught [her]196-coral how to overcome [his]267-strefford scruples , and whirled [him]267-strefford away with [her]196-coral on [their]3282-their mad adventure ? Well , if that was love , this was something so much larger and deeper that the other feeling seemed the mere dancing of [her]196-coral blood in tune with [his]267-strefford .... But , no ! Real love , great love , the love that [poets]3283-poets sang , and [privileged and tortured beings]3284-privileged and tortured beings lived and died of , that love had its own superior expressiveness , and the sure command of its means . The petty arts of coquetry were no farther from it than the numbness of [the untaught girl]3285-the untaught girl . Great love was wise , strong , powerful , like genius , like any other dominant form of human power . [It]3286-it knew [itself]3286-it , and what it wanted , and how to attain its ends . Not great love , then ... but just the common humble average of human love was [hers]196-coral . And it had come to [her]196-coral so newly , so overwhelmingly , with a face so grave , a touch so startling , that [she]196-coral had stood there petrified , humbled at the first look of its eyes , recognizing that what [she]196-coral had once taken for love was merely pleasure and spring - time , and the flavour of youth . “[2078-i’ve--] But how was [I]0-i to know ? And now it ’s too late ! ” [she]196-coral wailed . XXIX . [THE inhabitants of [the little house]2810-the little house in [Passy]144-passy]3287-the inhabitants of the little house in passy were of necessity [early risers]3289-early risers ; but when [Susy]159-susy jumped out of bed the next morning [no one else]2848-no one else was astir , and it lacked nearly an hour of the call of [the bonne]3073-the bonne ’s alarm - clock . For a moment [Susy]159-susy leaned out of [[her]159-susy dark room]3292-her dark room into the darker night . A cold drizzle fell on [her]159-susy face , and [she]159-susy shivered and drew back . Then , lighting a candle , and shading it , as [her]159-susy habit was , from [the sleeping child]3293-the sleeping child , [she]159-susy slipped on [her]159-susy dressing - gown and opened the door . On the threshold [she]159-susy paused to look at [her]159-susy watch . Only half - past five ! [She]159-susy thought with compunction of the unkindness of breaking in on [Junie Fulmer]258-junie ’s slumbers ; but such scruples did not weigh an ounce in the balance of [her]159-susy purpose . [Poor Junie]315-poor junie would have to oversleep [herself]315-poor junie on Sunday , that was all . [Susy]159-susy stole into [the passage]2962-the passage , opened a door , and cast [her]159-susy light on [the girl]1390-the girl ’s face . “[315-poor junie] [Junie]315-poor junie ! [Dearest Junie]258-junie , [you]315-poor junie must wake up ! ” [Junie]258-junie lay in the abandonment of youthful sleep ; but at the sound of [her]1390-the girl name [she]159-susy sat up with the promptness of [a grown person on whom domestic burdens have long weighed]3296-a grown person on whom domestic burdens have long weighed . “[2079-them] Which one of [them]2079-them is it ? ” [she]159-susy asked , one foot already out of bed . “[2079-them] Oh , [Junie]258-junie dear , no ... it ’s nothing wrong with [the children]1312-the children ... or with [anybody]404-anybody , ” [Susy]159-susy stammered , on [her]159-susy knees by the bed . In the candlelight , [she]159-susy saw [Junie]258-junie ’s anxious brow darken reproachfully . “[159-susy] Oh , [Susy]159-susy , then why-- ? [I]0-i was just dreaming [we]2082-we were all driving about [Rome]23-rome in [a great big motor - car]2083-a great big motor - car with [father]2367-father and [mother]2260-mother ! ” “[2260-mother] [I]0-i ’m so sorry , [dear]2236-dear . What a lovely dream ! [I]0-i ’m [a brute]2087-a brute to have interrupted it-- ” [She]159-susy felt [the little girl]540-the little girl ’s awakening scrutiny . “[0-i] If there ’s nothing wrong with [anybody]404-anybody , why are [you]159-susy crying , [Susy]159-susy ? Is it [you]159-susy there ’s something wrong with ? What has happened ? ” “[159-susy] Am [I]0-i crying ? ” [Susy]159-susy rose from [her]159-susy knees and sat down on the counterpane . “[0-i] Yes , it is [me]0-i . And [I]0-i had to disturb [you]159-susy . ” “[0-i] Oh , [Susy]159-susy , [darling]2329-darling , what is it ? ” [Junie]258-junie ’s arms were about [her]159-susy in a flash , and [Susy]159-susy grasped them in burning fingers . “[258-junie] [Junie]258-junie , listen ! [I]0-i ’ve got to go away at once -- to leave [you]258-junie all for the whole day . [I]0-i may not be back till late this evening ; late to - night ; [I]0-i ca n’t tell . [I]0-i promised [[your]258-junie mother]2090-your mother [I]0-i ’d never leave [you]258-junie ; but [I]0-i ’ve got to -- [I’ve]0-i got to . ” [Junie]258-junie considered [her]159-susy agitated face with fully awakened eyes . “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i wo n’t tell , [you]159-susy know , [you]159-susy old brick , ” [she]0-i said with simplicity . [Susy]159-susy hugged [her]159-susy . “[258-junie] [Junie]258-junie , [Junie]258-junie , [[you]258-junie darling]2511-you darling ! But that was n’t what [I]0-i meant . Of course [you]258-junie may tell -- [you]258-junie must tell . [I]0-i shall write to [[your]258-junie mother]2090-your mother [myself]0-i . But what worries [me]0-i is the idea of having to go away -- away from [Paris]4-paris -- for the whole day , with [Geordie]305-geordie still coughing a little , and [no one but that silly Angele]2093-no one but that silly angele to stay with [him]305-geordie while [you]258-junie ’re out -- and [no one]534-no one but [you]258-junie to take [yourself]258-junie and [the others]2262-the others to [school]3155-school . But [Junie]258-junie , [Junie]258-junie , [I]0-i ’ve got to do it ! ” [she]0-i sobbed out , clutching [the child]547-the child tighter . [Junie Fulmer]258-junie , with [her]0-i strangely mature perception of the case , and seemingly of every case that fate might call on [her]0-i to deal with , sat for a moment motionless in [Susy]159-susy ’s hold . Then [she]0-i freed [her]0-i wrists with an adroit twist , and leaning back against the pillows said judiciously : “[258-junie] [You]258-junie ’ll never in [the world]2205-the world bring up [a family]1770-a family of [your]258-junie own if [you]258-junie take on like this over [[other people]394-other people ’s children]2100-other people ’s children . ” Through all [her]0-i turmoil of spirit the observation drew a laugh from [Susy]159-susy . “[258-junie] Oh , [a family of [my]0-i own]2101-a family of my own -- [I]0-i do n’t deserve one , the way [I]0-i ’m behaving to your-- ” [Junie]258-junie still considered [her]159-susy . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]445-my dear , a change will do [you]445-my dear good : [you]445-my dear need it , ” [she]0-i pronounced . [Susy]159-susy rose with a laughing sigh . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m not at all sure it will ! But [I]0-i ’ve got to have it , all the same . Only [I]0-i do feel anxious -- and [I]0-i ca n’t even leave [you]445-my dear [my]0-i address ! ” [Junie]258-junie still seemed to examine the case . “[0-i] Ca n’t [you]0-i even tell [me]0-i where [you]0-i ’re going ? ” [she]0-i ventured , as if not quite sure of the delicacy of asking . “[0-i] Well -- no , [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i can ; not till [I]0-i get back . Besides , even if [I]0-i could it would n’t be much use , because [I]0-i could n’t give [you]0-i [my]0-i address there . [I]0-i do n’t know what it will be . ” “[0-i] But what does it matter , if [you]0-i ’re coming back to - night ? ” “[0-i] Of course [I]0-i ’m coming back ! How could [you]0-i possibly imagine [I]0-i should think of leaving [you]0-i for more than a day ? ” “[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i should n’t be afraid -- not much , that is , with the poker , and [Nat]174-nat ’s water - pistol , ” emended [Junie]258-junie , still judicious . [Susy]159-susy again enfolded [her]0-i vehemently , and then turned to more practical matters . [She]159-susy explained that [she]159-susy wished if possible to catch [an eight - thirty train]3299-an eight - thirty train from [the Gare de [Lyon]158-lyon]3300-the gare de lyon , and that there was not a moment to lose if [the children]1312-the children were to be dressed and fed , and full instructions written out for [Junie]258-junie and [Angele]317-angele , before [she]159-susy rushed for [the underground]3302-the underground . While [she]159-susy bathed [Geordie]305-geordie , and then hurried into [her]159-susy own clothes , [she]159-susy could not help wondering at [her]159-susy own extreme solicitude for [her]159-susy charges . [She]159-susy remembered , with a pang , how often [she]159-susy had deserted [Clarissa Vanderlyn]187-clarissa for the whole day , and even for two or three in succession -- poor little Clarissa , whom [she]159-susy [knew to be so unprotected , so exposed to evil influences]3303-knew to be so unprotected , so exposed to evil influences . [She]159-susy had been too much absorbed in [her]159-susy own greedy bliss to be more than intermittently aware of [the child]547-the child ; but now , [she]159-susy felt , no sorrow however ravaging , no happiness however absorbing , would ever again isolate [her]159-susy from [[her]159-susy kind]1183-her kind . And then [these children]2070-these children were so different ! [The exquisite Clarissa]187-clarissa was already the predestined victim of [her]187-clarissa surroundings : [her]187-clarissa budding soul was divided from [Susy]159-susy ’s by the same barrier of incomprehension that separated [the latter]608-the latter from [Mrs. Vanderlyn]188-mrs. vanderlyn . [Clarissa]187-clarissa had nothing to teach [Susy]159-susy but the horror of [her]187-clarissa own hard little appetites ; whereas the company of [the noisy argumentative Fulmers]3308-the noisy argumentative fulmers had been [a school of wisdom and abnegation]3309-a school of wisdom and abnegation . As [she]159-susy applied the brush to [Geordie]305-geordie ’s shining head and the handkerchief to [his]305-geordie snuffling nose , the sense of what [she]159-susy owed [him]305-geordie was so borne in on [Susy]159-susy that [she]159-susy interrupted the process to catch [him]305-geordie to [her]159-susy bosom . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll have such a story to tell [you]2103-you when [I]0-i get back to - night , if [you]2103-you ’ll promise [me]0-i to be good all day , ” [she]159-susy bargained with [him]305-geordie ; and [Geordie]305-geordie , always astute , bargained back : “[2103-you] Before [I]0-i promise , [I]0-i ’d like to know what story . ” At length all was in order . [Junie]258-junie had been enlightened , and [Angele]317-angele stunned , by the minuteness of [Susy]159-susy ’s instructions ; and [the latter , waterproofed and stoutly shod]3310-the latter , waterproofed and stoutly shod , descended [the doorstep]3311-the doorstep , and paused to wave at the pyramid of heads yearning to [her]159-susy from an upper window . It was hardly light , and still raining , when [she]159-susy turned into [the dismal street]3312-the dismal street . As usual , [it]3312-the dismal street was empty ; but at the corner [she]159-susy perceived [a hesitating taxi]3313-a hesitating taxi , with luggage piled beside [the driver]3173-the driver . Perhaps it was [some early traveller]3315-some early traveller , just arriving , who would release [the carriage]1621-the carriage in time for [her]159-susy to catch it , and thus avoid the walk to [the metro]3317-the metro , and the subsequent strap - hanging ; for it was [the work - people]3318-the work - people ’s hour . [Susy]159-susy raced toward [the vehicle]3319-the vehicle , which , overcoming its hesitation , was beginning to move in [her]159-susy direction . Observing this , [she]159-susy stopped to see where it would discharge its load . Thereupon [the taxi]1620-the taxi stopped also , and the load discharged itself in front of [her]159-susy in the shape of [Nick Lansing]170-nick . [The two]1444-the two stood staring at [each other]2188-each other through the rain till [Nick]170-nick broke out : “[0-i] Where are [you]2104-you going ? [I]0-i came to get [you]2104-you . ” “[0-i] To get [me]0-i ? To get [me]0-i ? ” [she]159-susy repeated . Beside [the driver]3173-the driver [she]159-susy had suddenly remarked the old suit - case from which [[her]159-susy husband]327-her husband had obliged [her]159-susy to extract [Strefford]267-strefford ’s cigars as [they]1444-the two were leaving [Como]5-como ; and everything that had happened since seemed to fall away and vanish in the pang and rapture of that memory . “[0-i] To get [you]2104-you ; yes . Of course . ” [He]170-nick spoke the words peremptorily , almost as if they were an order . “[0-i] Where were [you]2104-you going ? ” [he]170-nick repeated . Without answering , [she]159-susy turned toward [the house]342-the house . [He]170-nick followed [her]159-susy , and [the laden taxi]3326-the laden taxi closed the procession . “[2104-you] Why are [you]2104-you out in such weather without an umbrella ? ” [he]170-nick continued , in the same severe tone , drawing [her]159-susy under the shelter of [his]170-nick . “[2104-you] Oh , because [Junie]258-junie ’s umbrella is in tatters , and [I]0-i had to leave [her]2105-her mine , as [I]0-i was going away for the whole day . ” [She]159-susy spoke the words like [a person in a trance]3327-a person in a trance . “[0-i] For the whole day ? At this hour ? Where ? ” [They]3328-they were on [the doorstep]3311-the doorstep , and [she]159-susy fumbled automatically for [her]159-susy key , let [herself]159-susy in , and led the way to [the sitting - room]3232-the sitting - room . [It]3232-the sitting - room had not been tidied up since the night before . [The children]1312-the children ’s school books lay scattered on the table and sofa , and the empty fireplace was grey with ashes . [She]159-susy turned to [Nick]170-nick in the pallid light . “[0-i] [I]0-i was going to see [you]0-i , ” [she]159-susy stammered , “[0-i] [I]0-i was going to follow [you]0-i to [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau , if necessary , to tell [you]0-i ... to prevent [you]0-i .... ” [He]170-nick repeated in the same aggressive tone : “[0-i] Tell [me]0-i what ? Prevent what ? ” “[0-i] Tell [you]0-i that there must be some other way ... some decent way ... of [our]2106-our separating ... without that horror , that horror of [your]0-i going off with [a woman]467-a woman .... ” [He]170-nick stared , and then burst into a laugh . The blood rushed to [her]159-susy face . [She]159-susy had caught a familiar ring in [his]170-nick laugh , and it wounded [her]159-susy . What business had [he]170-nick , at such a time , to laugh in the old way ? “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry ; but there is no other way , [I]0-i ’m afraid . No other way but one , ” [he]170-nick corrected [himself]170-nick . [She]159-susy raised [her]159-susy head sharply . “[0-i] Well ? ” “[0-i] That [you]0-i should be [the woman.--Oh]2108-the woman.--oh , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear ! ” [He]170-nick had dropped [his]170-nick mocking smile , and was at [her]159-susy side , [her]159-susy hands in [his]170-nick . “[2108-the woman.--oh] Oh , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear , do n’t [you]0-i see that [we]2111-we ’ve both been feeling the same thing , and at the same hour ? [You]0-i lay awake thinking of it all night , did n’t [you]0-i ? So did [I.]0-i Whenever the clock struck , [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : ‘ [She]2112-she ’s hearing it too . ’ And [I]0-i was up before daylight , and packed [my]0-i traps -- for [I]0-i never want to set foot again in [that awful hotel where [I]0-i ’ve lived in hell for the last three days]2113-that awful hotel where i ’ve lived in hell for the last three days . And [I]0-i swore to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i ’d go off with [a woman]467-a woman by [the first train]2115-the first train [I]0-i could catch -- and so [I]0-i mean to , [[my]0-i dear]445-my dear . ” [She]0-i stood before [him]445-my dear numb . Yes , numb : that was the worst of it ! The violence of the reaction had been too great , and [she]0-i could hardly understand what [he]445-my dear was saying . Instead , [she]0-i noticed that the tassel of the window - blind was torn off again ( oh , [those children]3332-those children ! ) , and vaguely wondered if [his]445-my dear luggage were safe on [the waiting taxi]3333-the waiting taxi . [One]2186-one heard such stories .... [His]445-my dear voice came back to [her]0-i . “[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy ! Listen ! ” [he]445-my dear was entreating . “[159-susy] [You]159-susy must see [yourself]159-susy that it ca n’t be . [We]2117-we ’re married -- isn’t that all that matters ? Oh , [I]0-i know -- [I’ve]0-i behaved like [a brute]2087-a brute : [a cursed arrogant ass]2119-a cursed arrogant ass ! [You]159-susy could n’t wish that ass a worse kicking than [I]0-i ’ve given [him]2119-a cursed arrogant ass ! But that ’s not the point , [you]159-susy see . The point is that [we]2117-we ’re married .... Married .... Does n’t it mean something to [you]159-susy , something -- inexorable ? It does to [me]0-i . [I]0-i did n’t dream it would -- in just that way . But all [I]0-i can say is that [I]0-i suppose [the people who do n’t feel it]2120-the people who do n’t feel it are n’t really married -- and [they]2120-the people who do n’t feel it ’d better separate ; much better . As for [us--]2121-us-- ” Through [her]0-i tears [she]0-i gasped out : “[2121-us--] That ’s what [I]0-i felt ... that ’s what [I]0-i said to [Streff]198-streff .... ” [He]2124-he was upon [her]0-i with a great embrace . “[0-i] [[My]0-i darling]2122-my darling ! [[My]0-i darling]2122-my darling ! [You]2122-my darling have told [him]2124-he ? ” “[2122-my darling] Yes , ” [she]0-i panted . “[2122-my darling] That ’s why [I]0-i ’m living [here]2184-here . ” [She]0-i paused . “[0-i] And [you]2122-my darling ’ve told [Coral]196-coral ? ” [She]0-i felt [his]2124-he embrace relax . [He]2124-he drew away a little , still holding [her]0-i , but with lowered head . “[2122-my darling] No ... [I]0-i ... have n’t . ” “[0-i] Oh , [Nick]170-nick ! But then-- ? ” [He]2124-he caught [her]0-i to [him]2124-he again , resentfully . “[170-nick] Well -- then what ? What do [you]2122-my darling mean ? What earthly difference does it make ? ” “[2122-my darling] But if [you]2122-my darling ’ve told [her]196-coral [you]2122-my darling were going to marry [her--]2126-her-- ” ( Try as [she]0-i would , [her]0-i voice was full of silver chimes . ) “[2126-her--] Marry [her]196-coral ? And [I]0-i ca n’t ask [Coral Hicks]196-coral just to come and live with [me]0-i , can [I]0-i ? ” Between crying and laughing [she]0-i lay on [his]2124-he breast , and [his]2124-he hand passed over [her]0-i hair . [They]3335-they were silent for a while ; then [he]2124-he began again : “[0-i] [You]2122-my darling said it [yourself]2122-my darling yesterday , [you]2122-my darling know . ” [She]0-i strayed back from sunlit distances . “[2122-my darling] Yesterday ? ” “[2122-my darling] Yes : that [Grace Fulmer]175-grace says [you]2122-my darling ca n’t separate [two people who ’ve been through a lot of things-- ”]3336-two people who ’ve been through a lot of things-- ” “[175-grace] Ah , been through [them]2127-them together -- it ’s not the things , [you]0-i see , it ’s the togetherness , ” [she]0-i interrupted . “[0-i] The togetherness -- that ’s it ! ” [He]2124-he seized on the word as if it had just been coined to express [their]3335-they case , and [his]2124-he mind could rest in it without farther labour . The door - bell rang , and [they]3335-they started . Through the window [they]3335-they saw [the taxi - driver]3337-the taxi - driver gesticulating enquiries as to the fate of the luggage . “[2128-he] [He]2128-he wants to know if [he]2128-he ’s to leave it here , ” [Susy]159-susy laughed . “[2128-he] No -- no ! [You]2122-my darling ’re to come with [me]0-i , ” [[her]0-i husband]327-her husband declared . “[2122-my darling] Come with [you]2122-my darling ? ” [She]0-i laughed again at the absurdity of the suggestion . “[2122-my darling] Of course : this very instant . What did [you]2122-my darling suppose ? That [I]0-i was going away without [you]2122-my darling ? Why , [you]2122-my darling said [yourself]2122-my darling [you]2122-my darling were going to follow [me]0-i to [Fontainebleau--]157-fontainebleau-- ” [She]0-i reddened again , this time a little painfully “[2122-my darling] [I]0-i did n’t know what [I]0-i was doing .... [I]0-i had to find [you]2122-my darling ... but [I]0-i should have come back this evening , no matter what happened . ” “[0-i] No matter what ? ” [She]0-i nodded , and met [his]2122-my darling gaze resolutely . “[0-i] No ; but really-- ” “[0-i] Really , [I]0-i ca n’t leave [the children]1312-the children till [Nat]174-nat and [Grace]175-grace come back .
