Do [you]2122-my darling know how long [I]0-i ’ve been without [you]2122-my darling ! ” [He]2122-my darling seized [her]2122-my darling by both wrists , and drew them against [his]2122-my darling breast . “[2122-my darling] Come with [me]0-i at least for two days -- [Susy]159-susy ! ” [he]2122-my darling entreated [her]2122-my darling . “[159-susy] Oh , ” [she]2122-my darling cried , “[159-susy] that ’s the very first time [you]0-i ’ve said [my]0-i name ! ” “[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy , [Susy]159-susy , then -- [[my]0-i [Susy]159-susy]2136-my susy -- [Susy]159-susy ! And [you]0-i ’ve only said [mine]0-i once , [you]0-i know . ” “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick ! ” [she]2122-my darling sighed , at peace , as if the one syllable were a magic seed that hung out great branches to envelop them . “[170-nick] Well , then , [Susy]159-susy , be reasonable . Come ! ” “[159-susy] Reasonable -- oh , reasonable ! ” [she]2122-my darling sobbed through laughter . “[159-susy] Unreasonable , then ! That ’s even better . ” [She]2122-my darling freed [herself]2122-my darling , and drew back gently . “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick , [I]0-i swore [I]0-i would n’t leave [them]2137-they ; and [I]0-i ca n’t . It ’s not only [my]0-i promise to [[their]2137-they mother]2138-their mother -- it ’s what [they]2137-they ’ve been to [me]0-i [themselves]2137-they . [You]170-nick do n’t , know ... [You]170-nick ca n’t imagine the things [they]2137-they ’ve taught [me]0-i . [They]2137-they ’re awfully naughty at times , because [they]2137-they ’re so clever ; but when [they]2137-they ’re good [they]2137-they ’re [the wisest people]2139-the wisest people [I]0-i know . ” [She]0-i paused , and a sudden inspiration illuminated [her]0-i . “[2139-the wisest people] But why should n’t [we]2140-we take [them]2137-they with [us]2140-we ? ” [she]0-i exclaimed . [[Her]0-i husband]327-her husband ’s arms fell away from [her]0-i , and [he]327-her husband stood dumfounded . “[2140-we] Take [them]2137-they with [us]2140-we ? ” “[2140-we] Why not ? ” “[2141-all five of them] [All five of [them]2137-they]2141-all five of them ? ” “[2141-all five of them] Of course -- [I]0-i could n’t possibly separate [them]2137-they . And [Junie]258-junie and [Nat]174-nat will help [us]2140-we to look after [the young ones]2142-the young ones . ” “[174-nat] Help [us]2140-we ! ” [he]327-her husband groaned . “[174-nat] Oh , [you]2143-you ’ll see ; [they]2137-they wo n’t bother [you]2143-you . Just leave it to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i ’ll manage-- ” The word stopped [her]0-i short , and an agony of crimson suffused [her]0-i from brow to throat . [Their]2140-we eyes met ; and without a word [he]327-her husband stooped and laid [his]327-her husband lips gently on the stain of red on [her]0-i neck . “[170-nick] [Nick]170-nick , ” [she]0-i breathed , [her]0-i hands in [his]327-her husband . “[170-nick] But those children-- ” Instead of answering , [she]0-i questioned : “[170-nick] Where are [we]2140-we going ? ” [His]327-her husband face lit up . “[170-nick] Anywhere , dearest , that [you]2143-you choose . ” “[2143-you] Well -- [I]0-i choose [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau ! ” [she]0-i exulted . “[0-i] So do [I]0-i ! But [we]2140-we ca n’t take [all those children]2144-all those children to [an hotel at [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau]2145-an hotel at fontainebleau , can [we]2140-we ? ” [he]327-her husband questioned weakly . “[2140-we] [You]2143-you see , [dear]2236-dear , there ’s the mere expense of it-- ” [Her]0-i eyes were already travelling far ahead of [him]327-her husband . “[2140-we] The expense wo n’t amount to much . [I]0-i ’ve just remembered that [Angele]317-angele , [the bonne]3073-the bonne , has [a sister who is cook [there]2229-there in [a nice old - fashioned pension which must be almost empty at this time of year]2150-a nice old - fashioned pension which must be almost empty at this time of year]2148-a sister who is cook there in a nice old - fashioned pension which must be almost empty at this time of year . [I]0-i ’m sure [I]0-i can ma -- arrange easily , ” [she]0-i hurried on , nearly tripping again over the fatal word . “[0-i] And just think of the treat it will be to [them]2144-all those children ! This is Friday , and [I]0-i can get [them]2144-all those children let off from [their]2144-all those children afternoon classes , and keep [them]2144-all those children in [the country]2151-the country till Monday . [Poor darlings]2152-poor darlings , [they]2144-all those children have n’t been out of [Paris]4-paris for months ! And [I]0-i daresay the change will cure [Geordie]305-geordie ’s cough -- [Geordie]305-geordie ’s the youngest , ” [she]0-i explained , surprised to find [herself]0-i , even in the rapture of reunion , so absorbed in the welfare of [the Fulmers]174-nat . [She]0-i was conscious that [[her]0-i husband]327-her husband was surprised also ; but instead of prolonging the argument [he]327-her husband simply questioned : “[305-geordie] Was [Geordie]305-geordie the chap [you]0-i had in [your]0-i arms when [you]0-i opened the front door the night before last ? ” [She]0-i echoed : “[0-i] [I]0-i opened the front door the night before last ? ” “[0-i] To [a boy with a parcel]2153-a boy with a parcel . ” “[0-i] Oh , ” [she]0-i sobbed , “[0-i] [you]0-i were there ? [You]0-i were watching ? ” [He]327-her husband held [her]0-i to [him]327-her husband , and the currents flowed between [them]3341-them warm and full as on the night of [their]3341-them moon over [Como]5-como . In a trice , after that , [she]0-i had the matter in hand and [her]0-i forces marshalled . [The taxi]1620-the taxi was paid , [Nick]170-nick ’s luggage deposited in [the vestibule]3343-the vestibule , and [the children]1312-the children , just piling down to breakfast , were summoned in to hear the news . It was apparent that , seasoned to surprises as [they]3341-them were , [Nick]170-nick ’s presence took [them]3341-them aback . But when , between laughter and embraces , [his]170-nick identity , and [his]170-nick right to be where [he]170-nick was , had been made clear to [them]3341-them , [Junie]258-junie dismissed the matter by asking [him]170-nick in [her]0-i practical way : “[0-i] Then [I]0-i suppose [we]2154-we may talk about [you]2155-you to [Susy]159-susy now?”--and thereafter [all five]3345-all five addressed [themselves]3345-all five to the vision of [their]3345-all five imminent holiday . From that moment [the little house]2810-the little house became [the centre of a whirlwind]3347-the centre of a whirlwind . Treats so unforeseen , and of such magnitude , were rare in [the young Fulmers]174-nat ’ experience , and had it not been for [Junie]258-junie ’s steadying influence [Susy]159-susy ’s charges would have got out of hand . But young [Nat]174-nat , appealed to by [Nick]170-nick on the ground of [their]2154-we common manhood , was induced to forego celebrating the event on [his]170-nick motor horn ( the very same which had tortured [the New Hampshire echoes]3348-the new hampshire echoes ) , and to assert [his]170-nick authority over [his]170-nick juniors ; and finally a plan began to emerge from the chaos , and [each child]2987-each child to fit into it like a bit of a picture puzzle . [Susy]159-susy , riding the whirlwind with [her]159-susy usual firmness , nevertheless felt an undercurrent of anxiety . There had been no time as yet , between [her]159-susy and [Nick]170-nick , to revert to money matters ; and where there was so little money it could not , obviously , much matter . But that was the more reason for being secretly aghast at [her]159-susy intrepid resolve not to separate [herself]159-susy from [[her]159-susy charges]3350-her charges . A three days ’ honey - moon with [five children]3351-five children in the party -- and [children with the Fulmer appetite]3352-children with the fulmer appetite -- could not but be a costly business ; and while [she]159-susy settled details , packed them off to [school]3155-school , and routed out such nondescript receptacles as [the house]342-the house contained in the way of luggage , [her]159-susy thoughts remained fixed on the familiar financial problem . Yes -- it was cruel to have it rear its hated head , even through the bursting boughs of [her]159-susy new spring ; but there it was , the perpetual serpent in [[her]159-susy Eden]3355-her eden , to be bribed , fed , sent to sleep with such scraps as [she]159-susy could beg , borrow or steal for it . And [she]159-susy supposed it was the price that fate meant [her]159-susy to pay for [her]159-susy blessedness , and was surer than ever that the blessedness was worth it . Only , how was [she]159-susy to compound the business with [her]159-susy new principles ? With [the children]1312-the children ’s things to pack , luncheon to be got ready , and the Fontainebleau pension to be telephoned to , there was little time to waste on moral casuistry ; and [Susy]159-susy asked [herself]159-susy with a certain irony if the chronic lack of time to deal with money difficulties had not been the chief cause of [her]159-susy previous lapses . There was no time to deal with this question either ; no time , in short , to do anything but rush forward on a great gale of plans and preparations , in the course of which [she]159-susy whirled [Nick]170-nick forth to buy some charcuterie for luncheon , and telephone to [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau . Once [he]170-nick was gone -- and after watching [him]170-nick safely round the corner -- [she]159-susy too got into [her]159-susy wraps , and transferring a small packet from [her]159-susy dressing - case to [her]159-susy pocket , hastened out in a different direction . XXX . IT took [two brimming taxi - cabs]3357-two brimming taxi - cabs to carry [the Nicholas Lansings]200-nick to [the station]2395-the station on [their]1312-the children second honey - moon . In the first were [Nick]200-nick , [Susy]159-susy and the luggage of [the whole party]658-the whole party ( [little Nat]174-nat ’s motor horn included , as a last concession , and because [he]174-nat had hitherto forborne to play on it ) ; and in the second , [the five Fulmers]3360-the five fulmers , [the bonne , who at the eleventh hour had refused to be left]3361-the bonne , who at the eleventh hour had refused to be left , a cage - full of canaries , and [a foundling kitten who had murderous designs on them]3362-a foundling kitten who had murderous designs on them ; all of which had to be taken because , if [the bonne]3073-the bonne came , there would be [nobody left to look after]3364-nobody left to look after [them]3360-the five fulmers . At the corner [Susy]159-susy tore [herself]159-susy from [Nick]200-nick ’s arms and held up the procession while [she]159-susy ran back to [the second taxi]3365-the second taxi to make sure that [the bonne]3073-the bonne had brought the house - key . It was found of course that [she]159-susy had n’t but that [Junie]258-junie had ; whereupon [the caravan]3367-the caravan got under way again , and reached [the station]2395-the station just as [the train]2221-the train was starting ; and there , by some miracle of good nature on the part of [the guard]3370-the guard , [they]3360-the five fulmers were all packed together into an empty compartment -- no doubt , as [Susy]159-susy remarked , because [train officials]3371-train officials never failed to spot [a newly - married couple]450-a newly - married couple , and treat [them]450-a newly - married couple kindly . [The children]1312-the children , sentinelled by [Junie]258-junie , at first gave promise of superhuman goodness ; but presently [their]1312-the children feelings overflowed , and [they]1312-the children were not to be quieted till it had been agreed that [Nat]174-nat should blow [his]174-nat motor - horn at [each halt]3374-each halt , while [the twins]3022-the twins called out the names of [the stations]3376-the stations , and [Geordie]305-geordie , with the canaries and kitten , affected to change [trains]3377-trains . Luckily the halts were few ; but the excitement of travel , combined with over - indulgence in the chocolates imprudently provided by [Nick]200-nick , overwhelmed [Geordie]305-geordie with a sudden melancholy that could be appeased only by [Susy]159-susy ’s telling [him]200-nick stories till [they]1312-the children arrived at [Fontainebleau]156-fontainebleau . The day was soft , with mild gleams of sunlight on decaying foliage ; and after luggage and livestock had been dropped at [the pension]2605-the pension [Susy]159-susy confessed that [she]159-susy had promised [the children]1312-the children a scamper in [the forest]3380-the forest , and buns in [a tea - shop]3381-a tea - shop afterward . [Nick]200-nick placidly agreed , and darkness had long fallen , and a great many buns been consumed , when at length [the procession]653-the procession turned down [the street]1298-the street toward [the pension]2605-the pension , headed by [Nick]200-nick with [the sleeping Geordie]3385-the sleeping geordie on [his]200-nick shoulder , while [the others , speechless with fatigue and food]3386-the others , speechless with fatigue and food , hung heavily on [Susy]159-susy . It had been decided that , as [the bonne]3073-the bonne was of [the party]648-the party , [the children]1312-the children might be entrusted to [her]159-susy for the night , and [Nick]200-nick and [Susy]159-susy establish [themselves]1312-the children in [an adjacent hotel]3390-an adjacent hotel . [Nick]200-nick had flattered [himself]200-nick that [they]1312-the children might remove [their]1312-the children possessions [there]2229-there when [they]1312-the children returned from [the tea - room]3392-the tea - room ; but [Susy]159-susy , manifestly surprised at the idea , reminded [him]200-nick that [her]159-susy charges must first be given [their]1312-the children supper and put to bed . [She]159-susy suggested that [he]200-nick should meanwhile take the bags to [the hotel]2348-the hotel , and promised to join [him]200-nick as soon as [Geordie]305-geordie was asleep . [She]159-susy was a long time coming , but waiting for [her]159-susy was sweet , even in [a deserted hotel reading - room]3394-a deserted hotel reading - room insufficiently heated by a sulky stove ; and after [he]200-nick had glanced through [his]200-nick morning ’s mail , hurriedly thrust into [his]200-nick pocket as [he]200-nick left [Paris]4-paris , [he]200-nick sank into a state of drowsy beatitude . It was all the maddest business in [the world]2205-the world , yet it did not give [him]200-nick the sense of unreality that had made [their]1312-the children first adventure a mere golden dream ; and [he]200-nick sat and waited with the security of [one in whom dear habits have struck deep roots]3396-one in whom dear habits have struck deep roots . In this mood of acquiescence even the presence of [the five Fulmers]3360-the five fulmers seemed a natural and necessary consequence of all the rest ; and when [Susy]159-susy at length appeared , a little pale and tired , with the brooding inward look that [busy mothers]3398-busy mothers bring from [the nursery]3075-the nursery , that too seemed natural and necessary , and part of the new order of things . [They]1312-the children had wandered out to [a cheap restaurant]3400-a cheap restaurant for dinner ; now , in the damp December night , [they]1312-the children were walking back to [the hotel]2348-the hotel under a sky full of rain - clouds . [They]1312-the children seemed to have said everything to [each other]2188-each other , and yet barely to have begun what [they]1312-the children had to tell ; and at each step [they]1312-the children took , [their]1312-the children heavy feet dragged a great load of bliss . In [the hotel]2348-the hotel almost all the lights were already out ; and [they]1312-the children groped [their]1312-the children way to [the third floor room which was [the only one that [Susy]159-susy had found cheap enough]3405-the only one that susy had found cheap enough]3404-the third floor room which was the only one that susy had found cheap enough . A ray from a street - lamp struck up through the unshuttered windows ; and after [Nick]200-nick had revived the fire [they]1312-the children drew [their]1312-the children chairs close to it , and sat quietly for a while in the dark . [Their]1312-the children silence was so sweet that [Nick]200-nick could not make up [his]200-nick mind to break it ; not to do so gave [his]200-nick tossing spirit such a sense of permanence , of having at last unlimited time before [him]200-nick in which to taste [his]200-nick joy and let its sweetness stream through [him]200-nick . But at length [he]200-nick roused [himself]200-nick to say : “[0-i] It ’s queer how things coincide . [I]0-i ’ve had a little bit of good news in one of the letters [I]0-i got this morning . ” [Susy]159-susy took the announcement serenely . “[0-i] Well , [you]0-i would , [you]0-i know , ” [she]159-susy commented , as if the day had been too obviously designed for bliss to escape the notice of its dispensers . “[0-i] Yes , ” [he]200-nick continued with a thrill of pardonable pride . “[0-i] During the cruise [I]0-i did a couple of articles on [Crete]59-crete -- oh , just travel - impressions , of course ; they could n’t be more . But [the editor of the New Review]2156-the editor of the new review has accepted [them]2157-them , and asks for others . And here ’s [his]2156-the editor of the new review cheque , if [you]2158-you please ! So [you]2158-you see [you]2158-you might have let [me]0-i take [the jolly room]2159-the jolly room [downstairs]2241-downstairs with the pink curtains . And it makes [me]0-i awfully hopeful about [my]0-i book . ” [He]200-nick had expected a rapturous outburst , and perhaps some reassertion of wifely faith in the glorious future that awaited The Pageant of [Alexander]211-alexander ; and deep down under [the lover]3406-the lover ’s well - being [the author]530-the author felt a faint twinge of mortified vanity when [Susy]159-susy , leaping to [her]159-susy feet , cried out , ravenously and without preamble : “[200-nick] Oh , [Nick]200-nick , [Nick]200-nick -- let [me]0-i see how much [they]2161-they ’ve given [you]200-nick ! ” [He]200-nick flourished the cheque before [her]159-susy in the firelight . “[2161-they] A couple of hundred , [you]200-nick [mercenary wretch]2162-mercenary wretch ! ” “[2161-they] Oh , oh-- ” [she]159-susy gasped , as if the good news had been almost too much for [her]159-susy tense nerves ; and then surprised [him]200-nick by dropping to the ground , and burying [her]159-susy face against [his]200-nick knees . “[159-susy] [Susy]159-susy , [[my]0-i [Susy]159-susy]2136-my susy , ” [he]200-nick whispered , [his]200-nick hand on [her]159-susy shaking shoulder . “[159-susy] Why , [dear]2236-dear , what is it ? [You]159-susy ’re not crying ? ” “[159-susy] Oh , [Nick]200-nick , [Nick]200-nick -- two hundred ? Two hundred dollars ? Then [I]0-i ’ve got to tell [you]2236-dear -- oh now , at once ! ” A faint chill ran over [him]200-nick , and involuntarily [his]200-nick hand drew back from [her]159-susy bowed figure . “[0-i] Now ? Oh , why now ? ” [he]200-nick protested . “[0-i] What on earth does it matter now -- whatever it is ? ” “[0-i] But it does matter -- it matters more than [you]200-nick can think ! ” [She]159-susy straightened [herself]159-susy , still kneeling before [him]200-nick , and lifted [her]159-susy head so that the firelight behind [her]159-susy turned [her]159-susy hair into a ruddy halo . “[200-nick] Oh , [Nick]200-nick , the bracelet -- [Ellie]184-ellie ’s bracelet .... [I]0-i ’ve never returned it to [her]184-ellie , ” [she]159-susy faltered out . [He]200-nick felt [himself]200-nick recoiling under the hands with which [she]159-susy clutched [his]200-nick knees . For an instant [he]200-nick did not remember what [she]159-susy alluded to ; it was the mere mention of [Ellie Vanderlyn]184-ellie ’s name that had fallen between [them]3408-them like an icy shadow . What [an incorrigible fool]3409-an incorrigible fool [he]200-nick had been to think [they]3408-them could ever shake off such memories , or cease to be [the slaves of such a past]3410-the slaves of such a past ! “[0-i] The bracelet?--Oh , yes , ” [he]200-nick said , suddenly understanding , and feeling the chill mount slowly to [his]200-nick lips . “[0-i] Yes , the bracelet ... Oh , [Nick]200-nick , [I]0-i meant to give it back at once ; [I]0-i did -- [I]0-i did ; but the day [you]200-nick went away [I]0-i forgot everything else . And when [I]0-i found the thing , in the bottom of [my]0-i bag , weeks afterward , [I]0-i thought everything was over between [you]200-nick and [me]0-i , and [I]0-i had begun to see [Ellie]184-ellie again , and [she]184-ellie was kind to [me]0-i and how could [I]0-i ? ” To save [his]200-nick life [he]200-nick could have found no answer , and [she]0-i pressed on : “[184-ellie] And so this morning , when [I]0-i saw [you]200-nick were frightened by the expense of bringing all [the children]1312-the children with [us]2166-us , and when [I]0-i felt [I]0-i could n’t leave [them]1312-the children , and could n’t leave [you]200-nick either , [I]0-i remembered the bracelet ; and [I]0-i sent [you]200-nick off to telephone while [I]0-i rushed round the corner to [[a little jeweller]2167-a little jeweller ’s where [I]0-i ’d been before]2168-a little jeweller ’s where i ’d been before , and pawned it so that [you]200-nick should n’t have to pay for [the children]1312-the children .... But now , [darling]2329-darling , [you]200-nick see , if [you]200-nick ’ve got all that money , [I]0-i can get it out of pawn at once , ca n’t [I]0-i , and send it back to [her]2171-her ? ” [She]2171-her flung [her]2171-her arms about [him]200-nick , and [he]200-nick held [her]2171-her fast , wondering if the tears [he]200-nick felt were [hers]2171-her or [his]200-nick . Still [he]200-nick did not speak ; but as [he]200-nick clasped [her]2171-her close [she]2171-her added , with an irrepressible flash of [her]2171-her old irony : “[0-i] Not that [Ellie]184-ellie will understand why [I]0-i ’ve done it . [She]184-ellie ’s never yet been able to make out why [you]0-i returned [her]184-ellie scarf - pin . ” For a long time [she]2171-her continued to lean against [him]200-nick , [her]2171-her head on [his]200-nick knees , as [she]2171-her had done on [the terrace of [Como]5-como on the last night of [their]3412-their honeymoon]3411-the terrace of como on the last night of their honeymoon . [She]2171-her had ceased to talk , and [he]200-nick sat silent also , passing [his]200-nick hand quietly to and fro over [her]2171-her hair . The first rapture had been succeeded by soberer feelings . [Her]2171-her confession had broken up the frozen pride about [his]200-nick heart , and humbled [him]200-nick to [the earth]1165-the earth ; but it had also roused forgotten things , memories and scruples swept aside in the first rush of [their]3412-their reunion . [He]200-nick and [she]2171-her belonged to [each other]2188-each other for always : [he]200-nick understood that now . The impulse which had first drawn [them]3412-their together again , in spite of reason , in spite of [themselves]3412-their almost , that deep - seated instinctive need that each had of [the other]475-the other , would never again wholly let [them]3412-their go . Yet as [he]200-nick sat there [he]200-nick thought of [Strefford]267-strefford , [he]200-nick thought of [Coral Hicks]196-coral . [He]200-nick had been [a coward]3416-a coward in regard to [Coral]196-coral , and [Susy]159-susy had been sincere and courageous in regard to [Strefford]267-strefford . Yet [his]200-nick mind dwelt on [Coral]196-coral with tenderness , with compunction , with remorse ; and [he]200-nick was almost sure that [Susy]159-susy had already put [Strefford]267-strefford utterly out of [her]159-susy mind . It was the old contrast between the two ways of loving , [the man]2644-the man ’s way and [the woman]3205-the woman ’s ; and after a moment it seemed to [Nick]200-nick natural enough that [Susy]159-susy , from the very moment of finding [him]267-strefford again , should feel neither pity nor regret , and that [Strefford]267-strefford should already be to [her]2172-her as if [he]267-strefford had never been . After all , there was something Providential in such arrangements . [He]2173-he stooped closer , pressed [her]2172-her dreaming head between [his]2173-he hands , and whispered : “[184-ellie] Wake up ; it ’s bedtime . ” [She]2172-her rose ; but as [she]2172-her moved away to turn on the light [he]2173-he caught [her]2172-her hand and drew [her]2172-her to the window . [They]2174-they leaned on the sill in the darkness , and through the clouds , from which a few drops were already falling , the moon , labouring upward , swam into a space of sky , cast [her]2175-her troubled glory on [them]2174-they , and was again hidden . End of [Project Gutenberg]320-project gutenberg ’s The Glimpses of the Moon , by [Edith Wharton]321-edith wharton * * *
